r9YTKveSmS-3_grrMAiBzQ.text: I am from out of state and was here on yelp looking for a good restaurant. This restaurant came up first on the list. So I decided to go and have dinner.  It was extremely packed! Waited for half hour to give my order. No! I will not give a lower star because they were packed and I had to wait.  I ordered the white fish sandwich, pricey but delicious. Met a young couple. They were extremely nice and allowed me to join them and talk to them. No, this is not Los Angeles, where people are antisocial!  Enough of my rant! Place is awesome, food is tasty, and people and customer were extremely nice!

0SLyrfO2FaYLxFk9wAIckA.text: My new favorite place! Great flavorful food (sausage gravy is peppery and delicious). Drinks were perfect and atmosphere is casual. Perfect for kicking back on the porch and hanging with friends.  Daughter and I shared Mac and cheese (perfect, creamy, tangy) and the grilled cheese (minus the tomato confit). Intimate, unassuming location in a residential corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese and grilled cheese (sans tomato confit). Delicious!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unassuming corner diner in the middle of a residential neighborhood.

NB-3d-FerTZRLCFvJSfYmw.text: My family and I were drawn to this place because of the great reviews and how close it was to the game we just watched & open late. We got there around 9:45 ordered the Poutine fries w/ gravy on the side, Mac and cheese, the carol, big Jim, and the welcome burger.   The seating was spread out and basically just a hangout spot for a bunch of hipsters. We didn't know if they were doing orders in order or just unorganized because we literally waited an hour before we asked when our order was going to be done. No one even asked us how we were doing or if we needed anything during our waiting time. I'm all about customer service and the lack of it turned all of us off.  We got our food at 10:50, probably because we didn't look happy when we asked when our food would be done. The dishes were good but not worth the hour wait, mind you today is just a Wednesday. We will not be back.  What made us even more upset is the fact that one of the employees brought out the couples food next to us, within 20/30 mins of them being there AND gave them free drinks. Maybe it's because we're Asian and we were the minority at the diner.

R49etZB_FTXyGAyODCGiCQ.text: Best spot for late night grub, cool ambiance, and damn good food. Highly recommend when in downtown Phx!!!

A4iFCumrCLaI-SDsIoIGDA.text: solid solid burger and solid fries! the place is awkward but fun! the people are great and well nothing to complain about. price was good too, plenty of parking as well!

ovqPd4kY4lTOca6DeAWrpg.text: fried green tomato sandwich will always have my heart

I3Hyf3dV-avKqI9aci63-Q.text: We came here with my brother and sister in laws they came into town late at night and this place was  the only place open where we could chill and have good food.. everyone loved it my husband and I had the burger it was very unique we definitely will be coming back forget IHOP and come to welcome diner!!

rVYOxfnmX6oHs0bJir9fIQ.text: Cheerful and relaxed ambience, great food, wonderful and friendly service. Backyard neighborhood party feel, with home cooked taste. Recommend making it for happy hour.

l5RyStvabN1N47UXRaN6lA.text: My party and I sat outside. The tables and dish ware were clean and the atmosphere was very fun and pleasant. The staff was kind and helpful. I had the Hurricane cocktail and it was phenomenal. I also had the Fire Bird and the beignets. The Fire Bird was good, but the beignets were amazing. My party also had the mac and cheese and grilled cheese, and they said they were delicious. Definitely coming back to try more. Love that they cater to the late night crowd; one of the few places.

M3CblXDLRPvygCAEubEnkw.text: I think I'm being nice with three stars...but I seriously had high hopes for this place! My friend and I came here so pumped to try this hidden treasure.  Our drinks were on point. I got the Hurricane and my friend got a Whiskey Sour. Then the food came out fast. Maybe too fast.   We both got a burger. One was the one with the jalapeno slaw and the other one with peanut butter. I kid you not, the biggest concern was that the middle of the burger was practically raw. There was no grilled crisp to the burger and even the outside of the burger wasn't very hot at all. I'm hoping they were just busy and this was an off night because that was really disappointing.  To give them the benefit of the doubt, I did order a burger with peanut butter on it and it was the first time I've ever tried something like this but not only did I feel underwhelmed, my friend did also.  To top it off, the bill was over $20 and the food was sub-par. Will I try this place again? Possibly with some liquid courage.

maDPCy5ve7rnteONQRmlXg.text: This is a hidden gem in downtown Phoenix! I had the whitefish sandwich, my husband had the PBB (burger with peanut butter), my mom had the jambalaya. The white fish was very tasty! The burger was surprisingly good. However, I cannot recommend the jambalaya, was dry, not that good. I'll definitely be back to try other things on the menu.

zHMEtUuQQMPJv0e4afqAeg.text: We ordered food at 10:30 and it's 11:15 pm still no food. The company I'm with is highly irritated and has made the entire experience very bad. First and last time here.

hH3HKpuFX9Io6Cdvlnq3qg.text: Love the atmosphere at this place, and the fact that the food is great, too, makes this one of our favorite neighborhood haunts. With just a few counter seats inside the trailer that houses this diner-style joint, you may want to order through the window and post up at one of the many outdoor tables, especially if you're with a group. Try a cocktail to start while you wait for your order - they're strong but delicious, typically served in mason jars or goblets, which matches the laid back vibe of the place.   There are a number of great dishes here, but among the best are the Fried Green Tomato sandwich and the poutine. The tomatoes are perfectly fried, light and crispy, with greasy flavor enhanced by the slightly sweet zest of corn relish and the subtle heat of chipotle sauce. Served on toasted local bread, it's got just the right amount of crunch and flavor. Plus, it's unlike any sandwich you'll see on other menus around town. The poutine is also a must-try. Served with country-style gravy and perfectly distributed melted cheese on top of thin, crispy fries, it's not a traditional poutine but one of the most delicious versions in the Valley. If gravy's not your thing, the fries are just as delicious on their own.   Other highlights include the fried chicken sandwiches, which come in a number of variations featuring ingredients like honey, country gravy, and buffalo sauce. Although the biscuits they're served atop can be a bit dense, the chicken is perfectly moist and flavorful and never too greasy. The side of watermelon completes this southern-themed dish. And, if you're a burger lover, try one here. The meat is well-cooked with great flavor and the patties are perfectly portioned.   The service at Welcome Diner is casual but friendly and efficient. You'll get real attentiveness at the counter and maybe some small talk. Don't expect anything too formal - this is definitely a neighborhood joint, but you can tell the staff takes pride in their place of employment. And why wouldn't they? After all, Welcome Diner is a True neighborhood gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese with Brussels sprouts and bacon.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pbnb (peanut butter burger).

RtmqZSR0Z4Xef5adWkRCLQ.text: Part of the charm of this place is that it is in a poor residential neighborhood in downtown Phoenix, not far from 7th St.  Also, you could easily drive by and not even notice it exists.  So charming and the loveliest of dives you will ever visit (or shizzhoels as I call them).  Now, about the food and experience.  When you walk inside there is only about 8 or so counter seats in what looks like a converted studio home/living room.  The feeling when you walk in however, is that someone beamed you into the 1950's.  Authentic and totally retro.  Now, the best for last... the food is not your typical diner food.  Much more creative and original than any diner I have ever been to.  And being from NY I KNOW diners!  Practically grew up in them.  This diner, while having a VERY limited menu (when compared to any NY diner), each and every dish is incredible.  Try the Big Jim!  It will wow you... Fried Chicken breast  with cheddar, bacon, homemade biscuit buns and gravy.  Wowah!  (Oh, and definitely not the dish or the place to be if you wanna eat healthy!  More the once in a blue moon calorie splurge place... at least for me.)  Oh and order off the menu the "Cannibal Fries".  Simply off the chain.  Fresh cut potato fries with caramelized onions, cheddar and homemade russian dressing.  (Deep Breath!)

g_e42jemME3X2fPoaIMPSA.text: I can't begin to describe how cool this place is. Imagine growing up with your best buds, and you all happen to be amazing cooks. These guys love what they do, and food is their craft. Everything is made from scratch and taste so good. You could literally order anything and you will be mind blown. My girl ordered the bumblebee. I was so happy when she was too full to eat it all lol. Best biscuits ever. Thanks for the great food! They also have really good drinks, their ginger beer is house made and totally worth it.

BrqD8CKlYWL2Jk1WXSscdw.text: If they had a better seating situation (for AZ) and to go containers for drinks, they would get a 5....and maybe if they were open at lunch. But either way, if you don't mind sitting outside and waiting until diner it's more than worth a trip! My fav is the champion!

gzvVE2qnhCc1R6dEDzZbLg.text: Airbnb did not disappoint. This spot was down the street from the spot I rented and oh man, bombest food in town. Their Champion burger with Mac and cheese was pretty dank. Probably the best burger and Mac and cheese I've had. Also their braised pork with fries was good too. I'm definitely coming back to this spot every time I'm in Phoenix! On top of that, their crew here are pretty entertaining. Pretty hip spot!

-CkBtcnES9qSts0ENGjraw.text: Cool diner in the middle of my changing neighborhood. Lots of wild conversations , no space inside and the kitchen is Right in ur face! My friend Olivia was drinkin something sweet lol, and I'm not sure what it was called but good mix! Enjoyed the bumble bee chicken sandwich , dijon mustard and honey on top of the bread was bomb!  I didn't sit outside but it looked nice , but I did dig the inside and enjoyed myself. This place is hipsterific and I'm fine with that, come here for a different taste of Phx...  4 STARS

qiskZGz133Ta6AzhRiJSoA.text: My family was driving through Phoenix and told me they were stopping here. I was confused at first, as I had never seen this place, and it appeared to be I. A neighborhood. Don't let that fool you, just go.   Everything was delicious. We got various different chicken biscuit sandwiches and burgers. Fries were great. Cole slaw was good, and I don't even like cole slaw. Very heaven food, may die after, but worth it at least once.

tA_kWPQonVax3K6O8S7fdg.text: May I just say that the service and food here is awesome?!  I'm in the industry myself and don't like going into a restaurant so close to closing, but we were hungry for good food and they just so happened to be open. The service and food we received was very good quality. They serve burgers provided by Niman Ranch and have an open bar. John Luther (Awesome name, btw!) took our order and was very friendly the entire time. The three of us ordered the No Way Jose Burger which came with a choice of fries or cole slaw. The price is pretty reasonable: $10.75 for the burger and fries. We each also ordered 3 Hess Cream Ales and 3 burgers for a grand total of $55.82.   The atmosphere was very chill and the clientele, for the hour, was very friendly. We will definitely be coming back here again soon! Especially since it's only a few blocks away!  Also, shout out to Dreya(?), our chef for the night. Great job!

99zcI1UTLu1Qlb5B5fx8UA.text: This place is great. Get the Big Jim, it is outstanding. The staff are so laid back and nice.

er7wuVYMyc_2JF27j_JXQA.text: Love the old diner feel. This place was absolutely delicious! I had the welcome burger & fries & my bf had the big jim. Both perfection!! I can't wait until next time so I can get the biscuit ;)

GykN7zSJPb-DVAhSASPZOw.text: After leaving a so-so review of 3 stars due to issues with service, I was contacted by the GM of the restaurant, Wayne, to discuss my experience. He apologized and offered to send a gift card my way. I was totally blown away and impressed! This restaurant and their staff really do care about your experience, and I'm happy to say that I will be coming back and telling my friends to go too. Huge thumbs up to Welcome Diner!   BTW: Fried Green Tomato sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!

tVpR_yXR50LBZbFkN4uNeg.text: Awesome! Mac n cheese with bacon was insane!  Couldn't believe how much bacon they put in it.  Portions are huge!  Had to wrap most of it to go.

zry0qLkvXxrd2OpqBzLY1g.text: This is one of those places that are so good and so small that the idea of giving 5 stars frightens me because it's bound to get busier.  But Welcome Diner unquestionably deserves all of them.    Not sure what to get?  Start with the Welcome Burger your first time there.  They are better than what you want when you're looking for a really great American burger.   Can't wait to try the biscuits next time.  Atmosphere is laid back.  Bathroom is tiny. Food is very tasty, classic honemade yumness.  Experience it!

S93_1qMYk0k8T8sd1vyHfA.text: Came here on the suggestion of a cab driver. It was late, and the place I wanted to go to was closed. I had pulled pork mac and cheese, and it was sooo good. I was gonna try the beignets, but I was in the middle of asking the guy behind the counter about them, and he kind of drifted off and forgot to answer me. The inside is very small with about 8 seats and a small air conditioner that won't reach you if you sit by the door. If I ate here again, I'd order to go. 5 stars for the food.

p_Xu_R42Zv8K41rtXVN5jQ.text: The stars are really for the location, set up and atmosphere. The seating is first come first serve which isn't a lot, they have 3 massive tables that can be shared unless a huge party is there and just sit to chat for a couple of hours. Seemed as though the kitchen was understaffed, took forever for our food. The menu is super small, burgers, salads and every which way for biscuits and gravy. The burger was okay, it was a burger. It wasn't special or even that flavorful. I ordered a side of Brussels instead of fries (I know, who does that) after a long wait they bring out burger & fries, we tell the server and he takes my entire plate, brings back just the burger. 5 minutes later the Brussels come out. They were black. Fully burned.  If I returned it would be to take up seating, wasn't impressed by the food or the fact they take your whole plate back just to return the one piece. Did they reuse the fries?

QvFHA3chdTB6CR9JtkVyFg.text: Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, AND a great staff! Say whaaaaaaaaaat?!?!?    I had a brief, but torrid affair with the grilled cheese, and that delicious SOB left me wanting more!    I HIGHLY recommend this spot!!!

mys3hk0a8twxpCCFhEgF2A.text: The most incredible place to take someone who is visiting. The food never disappoints and service is generally perfect. Never a bad experience here, but it can be pretty packed at times!

jxa-arQKorlZSha79jzPTg.text: Can't give this place enough stars. Granted I live two blocks away so I usually get food togo. The food is always phenomenal!

FHTVpdoVBCHahIOK07y6bQ.text: Seen this place many times decided to give it a try. Cons: all I ordered was a burger with bacon and cheese on it with a bottle of water and they charged me 17.37 for it?? I was in a hurry so didn't check my bag which I usually do but didn't this one time. I know I asked for fries but didn't get them. The burger wasn't anything special, I could have made it  at home. For $17 I was thinking wow I must be getting a big ass burger. Lol it was big but kind of flat and very greasy. There is parking off the street or you can park in the lot next to them next to a water station. Pros: I learned my lesson about looking at what I'm paying for! And the art on the fence was nice. That's about it.

0KtWfk-3s5VEc5_0HI4Ppg.text: Delicious grub. Highly recommended. The Big Jim lives up to the hype. And they sell beer too. Just a half mile away. Good for Cardinal's game day.

jDEjAXqVcjz9EaiswXMLsQ.text: One of my favorite places now. Simple menu but great food with some inventive twists. Mostly burgers, salads, biscuits (biscuit sandwiches), and sides (fries, slaw), few other things. Cool vibe. Mostly outdoor seating, never experienced this place in mid-summer, must be scorching--then again, it's only open at night when it's cooler.  Oh, and yeah, only open after 5pm (typically). I'm there now, surrounded by all college age kids as I type this. EDIT: I felt I must update and drop a star because 1) the outdoor furniture is extremely old and weathered, and not just rustic, and 2) there were quite a few ants on the narrow table/bench where I sat outside.  I can understand these things being "normal" for "normal" situation outdoors, but "normal" doesn't get 5-star ratings. They should get refurbished furniture and go crazy on insect control.

bmpip-lqYe9dOJAjmYZXvA.text: This place is amazing! Went to dinner with a couple friends that have been here and recommended the place. The weather was beautiful so why not enjoy a meal outside. The scenery is beautiful, I love the string lights that hang outside. I ordered the Bumblebee biscuit, it had just the right about of everything on it and the chicken was cooked to perfection. It was phenomenal. I love that the side dish is watermelon, what a great refreshing side. We also got a side of poutine fries that were delicious. It's a little messy and sticky, but totally worth it. I am looking forward to trying more from the menu. The staff is super friendly and great customer service. We got our food in a decent amount of time. I will be returning and recommending this place.

VRlma2_FzVdUy_RcyWCMyw.text: I go to Welcome Diner so much at this point, I feel like making up disguises. It's like, c'mon, I'm JUST trying eat here everyday of my life and not feel embarrassed about it.   The thing is, they make the best everything I've ever had anywhere.  The Bleu Burger? Omg. The Peanut Butter Bacon Burger? Literally so good, I'm pretty sure I lost IQ points. The Biscuit Sandwiches? I want to be in a Facebook-official relationship with one.  Just go here - you will understand and you will not regret it. Actually, you might regret it, because you tend to go.. no where else afterwards. Just start trying your disguises on now.  Real complaint: They only do breakfast on weekends, doesn't start till 10:30am. More real complaint: They won't let me move in.

l708pTdbhf5XF8p_a476FA.text: A True delight with a short and thoughtful menu filled with well prepared grub.

T3nIjj9zKp5fDAn38BAh1g.text: This has got to be one of the coolest places I've been to in Phoenix. It's hidden in the historic district of Garfield in between homes. It is a laid back, chill vibe. Reminds me of some of the hole in the wall places I've found on a tropical vacation out of the country. A perfect place to have some cocktails and spend hours talking with friends while sitting on picnic tables under string lights. I recommend going at night. The food was decent, but the atmosphere and drinks will keep me coming back. Also, they are dog friendly! You've got to check it out if your in the neighborhood.

GXgCnYMkWiMyu9iSYUdxDw.text: Welcome diner is very quaint and incredibly unique, I haven't seen anything else like it in the valley. It's a converted house in the middle of a neighborhood, but it looks like it's straight out of a movie. The food is good and the menu is unique; I love the variety. My favorites on the menu are poutine and the mac and cheese, but I've heard good things about every other menu item! I will say, wait times can become incredibly long. The staff seems incredibly hard working, but they have a small kitchen and are very popular which makes for long wait times. If you're willing to wait, Welcome Diner is worth it!

IYIw-NZE58g7vcP_HxC2Wg.text: I feel I am an expert on fried chicken, and I had the Big Jim today with a side of eggs.  Fresh squeezed oj and LUX coffee.  The biscuit was unbelievable and sliced in half and put on the grill for an extra crisp; the fried chicken breast on the sandwich ... well, watch out LOLO and Mrs. White and f**k Chick Fil-A and the Hate Chicken, I will never EVER miss that again, knowing this place exists.  I can't describe the extra crispy not at all greasy breast - and the bacon and cheese and gravy was amazzzzzing.  Hipster waitress and they kept coming around to refill my coffee on a lovely chilly sunday morning at 1030.   I'll be back, but my waistline will suffer.  GO, puts MATT's big breakfast to shame.   My minus one star- Needs a booster or something for small kids to sit in.

0ZTDTx8IFeOF0mWMsFe0GA.text: You want amazing food try this place. The pulled pork fries are delicious. As is the ginger beer and take the recommendation of the staff you won't be disappointed!

Wndm5-VuyBzBD7hENH2VRg.text: Brussels sprouts are my favorite thing to eat here and the burgers are good too. This place is great for late night dining it's open til 2am maybe later. Great place to nb get food and the new location if a lot bigger you can eat inside now.

V1hhUuSt-WfZV5jZWNGDRQ.text: Went after seeing Taruk at the Talking Stick Resort Arena (America West/US Airways Arena).  Finally in the area while they're open!  Woohoo!  Got there and checked out the menu - interesting assortment of foods.  Everybody's happy!  Got our order in and sat back down...the rain started to move from a drizzle to steady...no cover outside (just shade cloth) and all 9 of the inside seats were taken.  Switched our order to takeout and sent everyone to the car.  Got the order and headed home.  Almost none of the fries survived the drive (we were hungry, and they were really tasty!)  I ordered the Bumblebee - that's a southern fried chicken breast (boneless) biscuit sandwich.  It had dijon mustard, pickles, and honey...not really my flavor profile - not sure if it was the mustard or the pickles, but just missed by a bit for my taste (biscuit was great, chicken was very good).  Everybody enjoyed their orders, and we finished up with beignets - great way to finish off!!!

QHK23DmLHVbw1UBq5yWjww.text: This place is awesome! The food is so good! And the drinks are even better  the hostess/cashier was nice and very welcoming! To dine in it's a small space but the outdoor patio is great...even on cold nights if you get lucky and sit under a warmer, would recommend and come back back again

hZ6X3spY3mRI8_C6MHAbjQ.text: The food here is BOMB. The poutine fries and the fired green tomato! YUM! Also the hibiscus lemonade is great!

qVE8PTwGbNFkw8WnWUJklg.text: I was pleasantly surprised. It has a cute ambiance and very tasty locally sourced food. Even the beer and wine, I noticed, were local. I got the Champion burger and my husband got the No Way Jose and both were delicious. A thick, perfectly cooked patti, with perfect seasoning and compliments. I really loved the bacon jam on the Champion. I'd totally go back!

5Hl3gOm_Trg_43iGSh4efw.text: This place has THE BEST poutine in town. And that means something to me. I mean, all there food is good, but that poutine...

xyTSkOuWI1jXgtGUDcNx9Q.text: This was a gem! I was referred here by a local bar and I loved it!!! I sat at the counter and spent time chatting with Emilio and Fernando, what great guys. Also, Wolfe was stellar. I tried the corn bread and with Wolfe's suggestion, added honey...my gosh how great. I then ordered the chorizo meatloaf, had no idea it would taste so delicious! To say I was pleasantly surprised would be an understatement. I had some of their pie too, as good as everything was. This spot had a great vibe and the staff was terrific. Definitely made me feel like I was a local and more than 2,000 miles from home. What a terrific spot, try anything you won't be disappointed. The chorizo meatloaf still makes me salivate a couple hours after. You'll love Wolfe Emilio and Fernando in the kitchen. Thanks all!!!!

jJfh3Un_KZlBq4yfWRptFA.text: WOW!!   What an amazing location and staff! We came here on a Tuesday night for our first time and couldn't believe how rad and friendly the staff were.   There food was delicious and super affordable! We got the Big Jim with the chipotle ranch and it was to die for.   This place deserves more than 5 stars!

QbWmBIYqwwuULOgPWv-nPw.text: Unique menu and every item we tried was full of flavor. Everything we had was home made... even the ginger beer and fruit punch. I'm a sucker for biscuits and gravy and they did not disappoint. My husband raved about his fried green tomatoes, fried chicken was delish and even my daughter's cheeseburger and fries were awesome. Hipster diner vibe is fun and the mixologists were impressive and friendly.

ZxEC7CU1pc6tWq_o7Ya83g.text: We were waiting to be seated but anothet party who came later than we did, they took a table first. It was horrible service

bVeTrjI7zi4tKY_9tR9msg.text: HOLY MOLY,  ORDER THE FRIED GREEN TOMATO SANDWICH!!!!! This was truly the most DELICIOUS sandwich I have had in Phoenix! It was so DELICIOUS that I really wanted to order a second one to keep the enjoyment going! Unfortunately,  I am now full, so I am just going to have to return!! *YUM*!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomato-best sandwich i&#39;ve had in Phoenix,  &amp; I don&#39;t even like sourdough! I want a 2nd, IT WAS THAT DELICIOUS!

2Z19hf62TmCl22tRO_PZgA.text: The food, the drinks, the cool atmosphere. This place has it all. My group of 6 sat in a cozy corner booth and sipped on hurricanes, palomas, and old fashioneds. We ordered six different burgers or sandwiches and everyone was happy with what we ordered. I had an additional side of brussels and it was a healthy portion AND delicious. This place is out of the way for me, but I would make it a destination spot after any of our downtown adventures. It's perfect that they are open so late. I was afraid that parking would be an issue, but we didn't have any problems even though the place was full and our party arrived in 5 different vehicles. Can't wait to try their brunch menu!

0wzawwwLhTg2ZdNlZaxxpg.text: Well this was a nice surprise. Great food, awesome service, area slightly sketchy, and I definitely wish there was more good seating.   You walk up to order at the little window,  sit down,  and they'll bring your meal out. Takes a good 15+ minutes to make your food , so a nice wait.   The poutine uses cream gravy instead of brown.  Different,  but still good.  The pork bbq fries were great. The pulled pork was heated up on the griddle which gave it a nice crisp. Tasty too!  The beignets were the star of the night. Wow! Outstanding taste and quality.  Make sure to get those.  Good place, try it out!!

MEjreIBo5PKz0qsa3IDvGw.text: The food was good, pricey but good. Not somewhere I'd go often but if I'm looking for a late night spot around downtown. I'd go back. A creative twist on a normal diner is how I'd explain it.

fi4sDnXtzHCELKl8BAuNIQ.text: I was in town staying at the Springhill suites and found this via yelp around 1/2 mile away. Walked toward it through a neighborhood thinking this can't be right. But there it was. Cool setting w/ lots of outdoor seating, some indoor & at the counter. Alone, I sat at the counter and watched the cooks go at it, a lot of hustle. Host recommended the Gumbo and it was great. All staff was very friendly. Had a Key Lime Pie in a cup, very good. A unique find, will definitely come back next time in town.

Gcbs0SCTQx6dbIf8jBNBGw.text: I have this expectation vs reality habit so i check yelp around arizona then i see this restaurant i looked for food then i visit after, i ordered burger etc my expectation is also the reality the food was so delicious i suggest this restaurant guys Thumbs up

H_vAhaUGNcp5p34M9uNlkQ.text: I love the food here. This is one of my favorite places in Phoenix. I've been here multiple times and it has never failed. My favorite is still the "Big Jim". Biscuit, gravy, bacon and a big-o piece of chicken. Fire!!! Today I had a mixed drink too and are always on point. Old fashion, whiskey sour and the Palomas are a must try. Over all good experience and will always recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and good service.

JErdf_zXdcgVPMzn25-S_A.text: I loved the entire experience as a whole! The vegan po'boy was phenomenal and the housemade fruit punch was a stellar refreshment. Fries were perfectly crispy and the dipping sauce was delicious. The staff is super friendly and chill, seems like you have been their friend for years upon first meeting! Great music and munchies!

t23njha3jWV4fPBFfAY79g.text: I will likely never miss a chance to eat here.  Place is just amazing. Amazing Mac and cheese, stellar off the wall items, and great cocktails.  You should definitely check this place out any time you are in the area, and the atmosphere is great as well.

wOTw1XkNKR4kXy1kWYf27Q.text: Had been craving beignets so I looked up to see if anywhere in Phoenix had some and this cute little spot popped up. After a few a months of wanting to come get some we finally did, they have good parking for being in downtown Phoenix. We got greeted right away, I ordered jambalaya which was AMAZING! and the hubs ordered a burger medium but it was more like medium rare but none the less it was delicious as well. My biggest DISAPPOINTMENT was that when i finished my food and after wanting beignets for a few months I asked my very friendly server for some and they stopped making them a year or so ago!!!! Whyyyyy *cries. Amazing atmosphere delicious food, just no beignets!! Would've given them 5 stars except for the fact of no beignets lol definitely will be coming back!

aVcqSmCYQoTDB7JYIzvIPw.text: The food is amazing. The big Jim is awesome and the mac and cheese is so good !! Love it

LMpBi6Vo5DC9c4d_9HYZ1g.text: I've always been more than satisfied every time I eat at Welcome diner except today. I had the Koko and my BF had the no way Jose with a side of fries for take out. Serving was smaller than if we would have had dined in. Chicken was dry. Will make sure to dine in next time instead of getting it to go.

We arrived and feel in love with the atmosphere of the Welcome Diner, the lights were twinkling and the music was perfect. We ordered after asking the nice gentlemen taking orders what was good, sat down and enjoyed the ambiance and out food arrives shortly after that.  Bonus: this place is super dog friendly!!!

jzXi9PfTqvg-hY-GjG23yQ.text: OH MY GOSH  we've been meaning to go here for a few years now and honestly I'm sad we've waited this long. The Welcome is super casual, a little hidden gem in down town Phoenix. There is bar style seating inside but we chose to sit outside, we got there at 7:30 and our wait was super short ! By the time we left, crowds were picking up, and it gets busy fast !! We shared poutine fries ( which were so yum ) my husband had the jambalaya ( talk about flavor town) and I had the Big Jim biscuit which was incredible. I had a drink and my husband had a beer. The food was so fresh and from scratch, and made with lots of love.  We want to come back and brings lots of friends to enjoy the easy going atmosphere.

LI7futP50E_tMyMh-9tqnw.text: LOVE WELCOME DINER. Their food is absolutely amazing. The service is wonderful. I have been there multiple times and have never once had a bad experience. I tell all my friends about it and love to take people there. You truly cannot get better biscuits. Welcome Diner cannot disappoint.

W2XcV4hf7YR3WiIoYfdGHQ.text: Welcome Diner is dead. The new location has lost all of the charm and ambiance that drew people to eat there in the first place. I feel like they should have named it Millennial in a Quarter Life Crisis Diner because this restaurant is having an identity crisis. It seems like the interior decor was designed by a 55 year old who looked at a Buzzfeed list of things millennials like and then just crammed all of them into the building without taking into account that they don't all go together. In the diner there is old milk cartons turned into seats, disco balls, pinatas, plants in hanging macrame holders, and your receipt comes in an old book. And yes while all those things can be neat when used well, that is not the case here. Additionally, I feel the food quality has gone down. The portions seemed smaller and the quality of the meat just wasn't there. Previously, you could taste the high quality meat in the burger. Not anymore. The patio was fine. However, the lightning could be improved. It was too harsh. All in all this now feels like a restaurant you would find in Downtown Gilbert.

QkljqrXAJ3MCrT9RaALHpQ.text: Simply said delicious chicken, I'm in love with their mac n cheese, the biscuits make the sandwiches awesome, I'm going to work my way through the entire menu, it all sounds great eats

PqFDq3bONW_MZODrfn8PHw.text: My family's favorite place to eat in Arizona! The staff is absolutely great and you can really tell they love working there. The host, Todd (I think) was really kind and even had a conversation with us at our table. The food was delicious as always and the overall atmosphere of the place is great. No TV so it is very lovely and everyone is having a good time. If you're reading this Todd, thanks for the free cookie :)- Ryan and the family from El Paso.

j1pVxjhx8nkOyZw00BoXpA.text: The hubby was the one who read the reviews before choosing this place so I didn't really know what to expect. I knew we would be eating outside and the ambiance is really nice- backyard and picnicky. The food is more fancy and upscale. The Mac n cheese is thick and creamy. My daughter wasn't really into it. The brisket on the fries was really good and tender but I didn't care for their slaw.  Yelp mentions it is a good place for kids and maybe it is during the day. We are traveling and are way off our routine. We came around 10 at night with a 4 year old. Don't do that lol. (Don't judge , she was fine, just off a 3 hour "nap" with her daddy who is recovering from night shift Army stuff). Anyway, the crowd is young and language was vulgar from multiple tables.   It really is a nice little place to sit under the stars on a nice night, enjoy a drink or two with your SO or friends. The kiddos can skip this one.

_IA0mzD76CqKOyM7RpNSeg.text: Probably the best burger in the Phoenix valley! No way Jose is so delicious , added bacon to it gives it a good kick ! Will come back again & again

0l33-YDwnXkGn1Ce7Qgqvg.text: Three of us stopped here for a late dinner on a Friday night. This place is right in the middle of a downtown Phoenix residential neighborhood and it doesn't look like much from the outside. There are several communal tables outside as well as 8 or 9 stools in a very small area inside. We found a spot at one of the tables and started chatting with our table mates.  The menu is small but has lots of foodie offerings. Our group had: the PB&B, the fried green tomato sandwich, biscuits and gravy and poutine. Everything was fantastic, although the poutine is untraditional. The gravy on my biscuits and gravy had some of the best, yummy, flavorful, salty gravy I've had. And the biscuit was cut in half and grilled so it was a bit crispy. The tap beer list is also pretty impressive considering the building is pretty much a trailer!   It was a great atmosphere with legit eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A teeny little place with great food.

M0PYiHMjLrvWV0TuwBeZCw.text: We had friends visiting from out of town, and this was their pick for dinner. I have heard so much about it from friends and looked forward to finally trying it out. A nice establishment with outdoor and indoor seating. It was somewhat busy as we waited approx. 10 min to be seated (but we wanted to be indoors) plenty of seating outdoors.  The menu has a nice variety of vegetarian offerings, which was a plus for one of our friends. We ordered: 1. Jackfruit/Pulled Pork Fries: (the description: "carolina bbq, slaw")  A very generous serving of jackfruit atop french fries, with too much pickled cabbage (not traditional slaw). It should be noted that this dish is quite spicy, for those that don't know Carolina BBQ, it's a mustard based sauce. I wasn't a fan of the slaw at all, there was just too much. 2. Jackfruit Po'boy: (description: Kiltlifter braised jackfruit, carolina bbq, slaw on a soft Noble baguette) The friend that ordered this is a vegetarian and was excited for this sandwich. Unfortunately, as previously mentioned, the sauce was far too spicy for her, she ended up trading her meal with her partner and got the...  3. Fried Green Tomato: (the description: corn relish, chipotle ranch, arugula on sour dough) another generous serving, however, the sandwich was too dry so a side of dressing was ordered to help that. Plenty of food though, half of the sandwich was taken home for lunch the next day! 4. Grilled cheese (the description: cheddar, muenster, smoked gouda, smoked Roma tomatoes, on sourdough. They found this sandwich tasty and satisfying. A few people order alcoholic drinks and were happy with what they ordered.  Pros- Generous servings, delicious fries, roasted brussel sprouts are good too   Cons- smaller establishment, you may have a wait

-SGW7USB4OT6iP4uNrYUCQ.text: Hipster divey spot down on Roosevelt. Good vegetarian options but the menu changes so call ahead. The fried green tomato po'boy we had was super tasty. Brussel sprouts were pretty good. There are only 5 or 6 inside seats. Great outdoor patio area, grass, lighted with string lights...gives it charm. It's not the right spot when the weather is iffy...but that's almost never in Phoenix. Smoking can be an issue sometimes.

-ezTApzP0-yrJclFEY10dA.text: Awesome, hip, little diner with drinks, outdoor seating, and friendly staff. Feels out of place in the middle of a residential neighborhood, yet in the perfect place.

tJuOChfVn0srDEdTjdQ0Hw.text: Such a cool hidden spot! The restaurant environment was awesome. Definitely not what I expected when looking from the outside in, but the amazing food and menu options make all your doubts go away for sure. I had the KoKo biscuit and that was very good. The chipotle sauce is what makes it. When seeing "biscuit" I was unsure if it was going to enough to fill me but when it came out it was a big enough biscuit to fill you up! The entrees are greatly portioned. My mom ordered Jambalaya which she loved saying it was a "blast of flavors" and different from what she's had before. She and I also shared the delicious French fries (great size to share!). And to top it all off the beignets were literally fresh out the fryer! Overall amazing place! Wanna go back!

rwRvfS0k-6ipwcE7GwV_lQ.text: If you could imagine going over to your friend's place for dinner if your friend is a chef?  That is the Welcome Diner.  Every time I have been there, the place was full of laughter and the smell of great food cooking.  If you sit at the counter, you could smack the chef on the ass.  Order a hurricane, and everyone in the joint yells, "HURRICANE!"    It is a great time.  My only complaint?  They aren't open enough hours to totally clog my arteries.

J2kH1DFLrCTtCl5W8uLNeA.text: Best place to chill downtown, period. Amazing comfort food and an excellent little cocktail menu. Super dog friendly, too. If you don't eat fried chicken and biscuits, try their fried green tomato sandwich, grilled cheese (which comes with amazing tomato confit), or mac and cheese (with added confit or Brussels sprout).

G9qqIluyct5loTJEWhDC9g.text: I've never had anything I didn't love here but tonight was cold and the patio was still packed. My friend and I shared a Hot Toddy and, by recommendation from the gentleman in the window, mac n cheese with chorizo. I would've gone with fried chicken but he said chorizo was his preference. It was delicious. The Toddy and macaroni was perfect comfort food on a cold night. This is only one experience. I've brought everyone from friends, dates, and clients to my mom, brother and sisters all separately. Let's just say I love this place and I love introducing new people to it. Most people go for the Big Jim fried chicken sandwich and I won't wrong them for it but you have to try their Po Boy, poutines, burgers and jackfruit dishes. You get lucky if you can find room at the counter but the patio is very comfortable and the service outside is exceptional and with a smile. Tell your friends!

V6uDM5G89QYr8KBKHYyv-Q.text: Food was great.  My wife and I had been wanting to try this place and finally made it there a few days ago.  It is in a bit of an odd location wedged in the middle of a neighborhood run-down old homes.  Great place to check out though when weather is nice as it appeared almost all of the seating was outside.  We split the mac and cheese and a fried chicken sandwich with honey.  Both were great.  I am generally not a huge fan of fried chicken but theirs is legit.  Not to greasy and lots of flavor.  Great biscuit as well.  Also thought the mac and cheese was some of the best mac and cheese we have ever had.  Comparable to what you would get at a fine dining restaurant.  Definitely will be back--want to try some of there other things and drinks next time.  Very hipster feel.

gMYWhd-b167nH7PrGMzk-g.text: I love this place! Such an amazing place. Had a basil gimlet, my god!!! And Will, he and the boys behind the bar are such studs.

c0l6Dswx6mBTVhq65FYYGg.text: Went to Welcome Diner for the first time this past Saturday. They had a veggie burger on special that I really wanted to try, but sadly they ran out before we got there. Instead I got the vegan po-boy sandwich with a side of fries (which i'm so happy I chose). It was so yummy, and super filling! The menu has lots of great comfort food items, including some vegetarian/vegan options.   The staff was awesome and super friendly. The place has such a neat vibe as well. There's truly nothing like it!

Our biscuits came out burnt....sent back...good brought back the sandwich was super salty....fries with gravy cold the cheese stuck it all together....tell the waiter he's says....it's you!!!!45.90bill for three biscuit chickens and it's me???!!!! What a bad experience and customer service was less than one star!!!! I'm sorry welcome back diner but me and my friends family won't be back#!!!!! Hire employees that actually care!

125SizhVjvqSS08q917jPA.text: Love love love this place! I can't say enough good things about it. My cousin lives in downtown so whenever I'm in the hood this is where we always choose to go. Food is to die for!

O5zaD5_LuN-H3sxSjrnITw.text: Great place (the summary). I was in PHX to work for a few hours and catch a red-eye flight - of course used Yelp to find a place for dinner.  Welcome Diner - great concept, great execution and great food!  It took me awhile to figure out its location - I drove by it a few times before I realized - oh that's the restaurant and found a parking spot behind the restaurant.  You walk up to the to a window/counter and order from the posted menu and then grab a seat outside in the front yard/deck/patio area.  Had the vegetarian option (vegan po'boy) along with some biscuits and a tea. Great tasting food.    Loved sitting outside (it was around 800p or so) - a big table full of folks across the patio so I just relaxed at one of the counter/stool seats along the sidewalk - nice to just relax and catchup on emails/news/etc.   Crazy but I guess I never noticed that an inside for dining room also - I just assumed it was outdoor dining only.    Customers were walking, biking, and driving to get to the restaurant - which can make a restaurant an interesting people watching experience!   Highly recommended.

iERb9WxeeXAZ5aj-tNAd9Q.text: [Other reviews of Payton Curry's chef-in-residence at Welcome Diner: yelp.com/biz/payton-curr... THE VEGETARIAN ANGLE When you can date a review to the exact day (and with good reason), you know that you're in a special place. We ate at Payton Curry's pop-up restaurant at the Welcome Diner last night, April 19, 2011, and the following is what we ate, but you may have a different menu on Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday evenings from 5pm-close through July 4. Chef, I hear, tries to keep it real and keep it local and fresh when sourcing his menu, so it changes each week. McClendon's Select was mentioned more than once. (PRICE NOTE: On Tuesdays from 10pm-close, the menu is 1/2 price to be sure Curry exhausts his fresh produce and meats.) Welcome Diner was serving about 12 people when we arrived, 6 at the inside counter and three couples outside dotting the front yard, set up with a picnic table, a sawhorse, some two tops, and glass tabletop lanterns. The food came out quickly, and our gracious and knowledgeable server asked if we'd like our dishes as they were prepared or in courses. We opted for the former. My darling dining partner and I shared all four dishes. THOSE DAMN GREEN BEANS We started with green beans, as crisp as they were picked, with just one tip snapped off, just like my grandmother taught me. These were served with a citrus creme fraiche and some recently picked tarragon. I always love dairy with tarragon, and this dish, served cool (not cold) if I remember, was dusted with local bee pollen, granular bits that taste of honey and something else and melt on your tongue. MOZZARELLA The menu insists there's basil in this tangential rendition of caprese -- and there probably is -- but the takeaway message from this panko-encrusted slab of mozzarella with the sweetest tomatoes I've eaten is a sweet-n-sour burst with every olive oily bite. A standout appetizer. GNOCCHI If you're like me, when you've eaten or prepared gnocchi before, you assume they get plopped into the boiling salted water before the plump up and rise to the surface. Not so fast, Barilla Boy. Payton Curry's gnocchi, I believe, are (dry?) pan-seared on both sides, keeping all the doughy, gummy deliciousness often lost in the water. The madeira wine and cream reduction here smothers the pillowy gnocchi and tooth-tender walnuts and squiggly good morel mushrooms in a way that makes you close your eyes, shut off your hearing, and attempt to pour all of your sensory energy into taste and smell. When eating this dish, I more than once covered my face with my hand to shield what may have been unflattering facial pangs of ecstasy. LEMON CURD We struggled to choose this dessert over the Strawberry Olive Oil Cake and Strawberry Malt, but we got our strawberry fix as the second layer in this delectable parfait, topped with the airiest foamy meringue, and served in a mason jar. The macerated strawberries made you want to relive childhood and replace mom's jelly with Payton's strawberries to accompany Laura Scudder in your PB&J sandwich. We clanged spoons at the bottom of the jar for the last bit of bee pollen. $62 with tax and tip. We didn't bring a BYOB wine but would next time. (The $13 corkage fee seems high, but there ought to be an explanation for that.) Everyone working in the tiny dinette and serving the tables outside had huge smiles and loads of enthusiasm for what they were contributing to the Garfield neighborhood and to the downtown culinary scene. Others are taking notice, too. Michelle Laudig (former restaurant critic at Phoenix New Times) and Aaron Chamberlin of St. Francis both dropped in during our dinner. I worry about the AZ heat baking the charm out of patio dining in May, June, and July for Chef Curry, but I hope to return in April...maybe on a Tuesday at 10pm for half-price eats. Other reviews of Payton Curry's chef-in-residence at Welcome Diner: yelp.com/biz/payton-curr...

xXP6ix9IkvqC28sgA8hYGQ.text: I had this place on a list of "gotta try" lunch places near my new job. Today was the day to give it a try and I was blown away. The place is super cute (tiny inside and a nice patio), awesome, unique menu, EXTREMELY friendly service and the food was killer. I chose the Bumble Bee, fried chicken breast, local honey, house made beer mustard and bread &  butter pickles on a huge homemade biscuit. How they got the chicken freakishly crunchy yet completely juicy on the inside is a mystery right up there with the Loch Ness Monster and Bermuda Triangle. For a side, I tried the fried avocado. Oh yes, I said it. Again, crispy beyond belief and soft creamy avocado on the inside. There may be voodoo happening in that tiny kitchen. I will be back to investigate further...maybe for brunch!

cUDEdO6kV5S5CCHCLRjY7A.text: Me and my boyfriend just tried Welcome Diner the other night, we wanted to go to a place that both of us have never been too. It was an awesome choice! It may not look like much from the street but you definitely have to give it a try.   We both had burgers and an appetizer and all the food was great and prepared well. It is nice to go to a place that focuses on buying local food and contributing the the community.   I would recommend this place to everyone and anyone.

HoX78_xep70ojv2XdH4dyw.text: As good as it gets as far as diners go.  I'm not usually considered to be a hipster, but it might rub off on me if I spent more time her.  Great crowd hanging out eating delicious food.  Tiny enough that you HAVE to talk to the staff, they're right next to you.  Unless you sit outside.  That might be fun, too. L40TP2D1i4Q03X7iUuFyOg.text: GRREAT place!  The burgers and fries are great (although as previously stated the burgers are a little small but the quality makes up for it) ... (I've posted a picture)  **** note they don't take credit/debit cards ****  The neighborhood isn't the greatest but no biggie.  I have to say best part was the service!  After ordering and telling them I'd eat outside they asked if I had a dog, I said yes, and he said "I'll get you a bowl of water before anything else."  SOOOOOO cool!  They CLEARLY take GREAT care an food prep ... they wear latex gloves and unlike other like places .... when dealing with the money part they take off the gloves!  Highly recommended!!!

W-IDsLydv5hTSYzpsp0wgQ.text: Wow, this place checks all the boxes! Dropped in on a Tuesday evening following an 8th-grade promotion with sixteen people. No room inside so we found three big tables on the patio. It took a couple of minutes to discover that when on the patio you make your initial order from a window. Absolutely easy. Lots of yummy looking choices on the menu, I was torn between having the "Bumble Bee" chicken sandwich and the "Chorizo Meatloaf" - the guy taking my order suggested the Chorizo and it was fantastic! Well-prepared and just a little spicy, I'll do it again sometime but first I want to check out more of the menu. By the way they have a full bar, wine, and local craft beers too. Almost forgot we missed on the special dessert that night (all gone already) but shared a really yummy lemon-blueberry pie!

8gaWmGG_EQpwg-Wl1oedVQ.text: It was such a cute place!  Yummy veggie sandwich and fries. Paloma was very tasty too.

DPmlePtQmqwZ8wb9rWCXhg.text: This place is cool. It's a late night spot in the hood. Not a dangerous hood but definitely the city hood. It's cute has a city vibe is super eclectic just like the menu. The drinks are good and the service is great. It's overpriced but it's a cool vibe so I stop in occasionally. When I need a late night spot or want to show someone an urban spot in the city this place is on the list. I'll go again but it's not in my top 5.

Can't wait to go back !!!

Zd9cBvNCEbzjqmbcsXHkXg.text: Cute patio seating but the shakshuka that I ordered was underwhelming. It was very watery and needed a little more salt. Hubby ordered the pork shoulder and it was significantly better than my dish. I might give this place a second chance if we are in the neighborhood.

YwNMk4an4GTwozS704sVhA.text: Today has been a downtown hipster kind of day. This was my first time eating here.   Prepare yourself to be outside, the seats are limited so pretend like you're on a cruise. Sit with strangers and make a new friend.  I got the beignets, I'm practicing for my trip to New Orleans, which were super YUMMY. I also got the poultine fries but because of the wait, my friend waited about 30 min for the Bumblebee, the fries came slightly cold.  The people were great and I made new friends. The staff was friendly and apologetic about the wait for our food.  I probably won't come back

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So the beignets are absolutely AMAZING! Didn&#39;t really care for the poutine fries they came out slightly cold which altered the dish.

CJSy4mibA5jGftVpe1yv-A.text: Wish I could base my rating on more than my short experience there. I went in this afternoon to meet a friend for an early dinner. I had seen a picture on IG and the food looks delicious plus I love supporting local businesses, so i was excited to try it.  I went inside and there was 1 table available so I asked the girl cleaning the table If I can seat myself or if they seat the guests, she asked if it was just me & I let her know I was meeting someone.  She said she couldn't give me a table until the whole party was there so I'd have to wait outside -- TOTALLY understandable. No problem with not being able to give me a table. So I said, "oh okay. Is it okay if I wait here?" -- I was standing by the door/server station.  She replied, "sorry, you're going to have to wait outside"   Ummmm okay....? It was 104 outside. Sooo I went outside and saw my friend across the street & decided to just eat at Cafe Gallo instead since I really didn't like that interaction at all. I don't have anything to say about the food because the service was horrible.

LZSc2RPZd_bdA5muL8qo9w.text: So delicious. So good. Such an amazing atmosphere. Great spot for an intimate date night or for weekend brunch with a group of friends. Their chicken sandwiches are the way to go!

t5XGsu89J8SFMcPlaJyWjg.text: Get in Here -  Try the Pork 2 Ways & Brussels Sprouts Thank me later 15 out of 10!!! Ask for Kyle and ENJOY

33EOsj_OJ8fDj5s7T-OD9w.text: This was my first stop once I got to Arizona this morning & it was the best move! I was seated immediately, customer service was great. Marcus was very attentive & helpful when it came to making my order decision. I ended up getting the fried green tomato sando with a side of country potatoes...delicious! I've been taking about the sandwich since I had it lol I'll definitely be back during my next trip to Arizona.

Qkb43eTRYQL00L8bU5ufXg.text: The food was good and the service was good as well but if you come to socialize you would have a hard time because the music is really loud and if you wanted to celebrate a birthday don't bring a cake because they won't let you in with it I'm pretty sure it was just an off night

On-v9ZcXvjiCOUQDZKLymQ.text: Hello, I am so glad to be home in Phoenix for a few days!  Of course I stopped @ Welcome Diner my first night. I haven't had a True burger in about six months so.....I splurged with the Champion plus onions and it did not disappoint!!!  Fresh, juicy, with crunchy bacon jam....HEAVEN!  The side of fries was delicious as well....crispy/hot. This place has literally the best burgers in the Phoenix metro area!  If you are here in Phoenix and you eat meat this is the place to get your burger!!!!  If you do not eat meat, this is the place to get your fried green tomatoes sandwich!   this place!    Sent the husband and my daughter to the new digs for some takeout. Old location was definitely an eat there kind of place. The new location is too!  My dinner was yummy, but my family came home with stories of employees that were a little rude or stressed????  I have alway experienced kindness and respect at the old location. So...I am not sure what happened tonight. Plus, the menu has changed a little. Where is the peanut butter burger???  I love you Welcome Diner. Please get it together!!!  I NEED you to be as good or better than the old location!!!!

eJXL_gnbZO0kPJ2kd2OoRQ.text: Everything I've eaten here has been excellent. Cool, innovative flavors & meat substitutions. Only giving this 4/5 bc of an insane amount of flies last on the patio last time, and also most places can improve.

G5HPRxnL7m-Ua5ZkHzeLXw.text: i originally get the pow boy which is basically like this but instead of fries everything else is on a sub, either way it's sooooo good  the jackfruit takes just like pork and the sauce is spicy but a spice that anyone can handle

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. hibiscus lemonade ($3.50) and vegan jackfruit fries ($8) during happy hour

mrSXjPBXxs1yXbo3O1-lYA.text: What a cool surprise when we pulled onto Pierce Street.  It was like a step back in time, or at least a step into an iconic L.A. diner.  I love the concept of a farm to table diner. We had already eaten, but had to stop in to at least try something. The grilled cheese was  great, as was the custard pie. We sat at the bar and were able to watch the cooks do their thing.  There was a big line outside for window orders to eat outside or take away.  It's nestled in a historic neighborhood between houses and a little community center, and across from another great restaurant and some shops!  There's something great to be said about terrible zoning! :)

DF0PuF2osFQc6haVDXdIAg.text: Welcome Diner is a cozy, vintage inspired diner which seemed to be tucked like a secret in a residential area of Phoenix.    The service was great,  personable and attentive.  We had the honey fried chicken (the bumblebee)  which my boyfriend wanted to order one more of he loved it.  The mac and cheese is a must.  So good.    We took home two pieces of pie and did not regret it.   The are open till 2 which rocks!   Highly recommended!

zTLUvKCQVaWwlhwRvkw1iw.text: Let me cut to the chase: the flavors here are absolutely superb. If you're looking for robust and full-bodied comforting flavors with original pairings at a budget-friendly rate: this is a fantastic choice. I'm in love with this location and their menu and I've barely made a ding in their menu! As an undying sweets foodie, I tried two of their desserts first: the tepary bean spiced custard pie with cornmeal crust and a hibiscus whip, and a salted bourbon caramel chocolate chip pecan pie slice.   ...there's a reason why I don't have photos. I went in for a sample and couldn't stop! I ate both slices in the time it takes to breathe two breaths and they were stunningly good!! The salted caramel chocolate chip pecan pie was really the standout if you like thick, decadent, heavy flavors (so for many, consider sharing with a loved one!) The tepary bean spiced custard pie reminded me a lot of a version of pumpkin pie with both texture and flavor...which has everything to do with the "spiced" component of the pie. There was also included a hibiscus whip which actually separated and added a sweet essence that enhanced the flavor and separated the textures of the slice. Definitely something unique and try-worthy, but maybe not a repeat buy (it isn't for me).  Cons: parking is difficult and all street oriented, and the hours...this is definitely not a location good for pick-up around end-of-work day, it's a commitment to an evening at the restaurant type of place. Heads up of menu changes: sometimes they are last minute (via Instagram posting) and shortly lived (don't always plan on offerings being available multiple days in a row)...for someone driving from Peoria, I appreciate a greater heads up so I can adjust my schedule to drive down for the exciting eats...  Will I be back? Very likely and next time I'm hoping to dig into some savory plates! (Pb&j burger, I got my eye on you!)

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Casual and easy-going, what&#39;s not to like!? Bring friends for a fun time--play card games, or even make new friends by socializing...

1lI7XAp7_d_qVVbWfcHllg.text: It's a good think the Welcome Diner is not my 'neighborhood restaurant' because I'd likely be the several times each week and, while I'd be really happy, I wouldn't fit into any of my clothes. That would be the price of eating Cajun inspired food all the time.  The Diner is a really fun space with lots of outside seating. Dinner this time for us started, as usual, with the Pork French Fries. Yea, it's what you think it is - BBQ pulled pork over fries topped with purple cabbage slaw. As we told Brendan, who was our waiter: the fries are pure evil. My husband had the No Way Jose hamburger which was perfectly cooked and very juicy and delicious. I had the special - a fried shrimp po-boy. Huge shrimp with a very crispy coating. Spicy aioli, baby greens and tomatoes. Incredible. Oh and the have great cocktails and home made ginger beer. We took a piece of their pecan, chocolate and salted caramel pie home. It was unbelievably good, and an incredibly good mix of flavors. And if Brandon reads this, while the pecan pie is pretty spectacular, my grandmother's recipe is still the best. If they made She Crab Soup, the Welcome Diner would be irresistible.

hUm8fL4O5Oz2RxG0_cKvlw.text: Our daughter recommended this spot. And good thing she did, PERFECT BURGER! we will be back again and again.  Plus, it's a super charming, out of place, random, cool & hipster setting/location. Love!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZoJLLfOhwRXatOCiXSLwnw.text: I saw the original location featured on Check Please Arizona...fast forward to now, myself and a group of friends were in the neighborhood and wanted to give it a try. We seated ourselves outside on the patio while reviewing the menu. Once we all decided what to order, we got up and stood in line at the window. I didn't expect this process to take so long, being as though there were only 2 couples ahead of us. 40 minutes later we were able to place our order(I'm assuming they were extremely short staffed). The drinks came extremely quick and were delicious. Next up was the food...the server handed me my plate, and my fingers were immediately stuck to the plate and now covered in some sticky residue(assuming syrup), which is the funny part because none of the 5 plates at our table included that. After a couple more minutes the rest of the plates were delivered to the table, during which time I noticed that the entire rim of my plate was covered in some type of fibers. As of the plate was dirty, and someone wiped it off with a napkin and quickly plated my food. D I S G U S T I N G. My biscuits were burnt to hell, there was a hair under a piece of watermelon on my plate, and I've tasted beige paint chips that have more flavor than the gravy. Another person from our group, also found a hair under the side of bread they ordered at the bottom of the bowl. This place was dirty, nasty gross and I would never go back again. Dine at your own risk!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JFXAv72ES0bHsVEgRTN5cA.text: The Welcome Diner is a welcome experience. Modern meets the past in this old school diner setting with an infusion of handcrafted mixed drinks using unusual ingredients (Creosote, anyone?) and delicious food. My friend and I grabbed two appetizers, including pulled pork french fries (they had a Jackfruit fries option!) and Octopus Masa Balls. Wow! They were kind of like hush puppies, and we giggled a lot about the name. I forget the name of my drink but it was like a ice smoothie with absinthe in it and was so yummy. I had a Big Jim burger on a biscuit smothered in gravy with cheese for $11. Huge! And different, and tasty! I'd love to come back and see how they progress and if the menu changes over time, which the waitress said it probably would.

liBKTSae_GRGEaIMeFKONA.text: We went for the Salted Bourbon Caramel Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie after reading article in PHX New Times. Amazingly delicious!! Pies baked fresh daily. After sharing a slice we shared a cheeseburger and it was also soooo good!! Loved the hip vibe of this diner, great counter service and we took another slice of pie to go! Enjoy

dD4Qf1AWSAf_N7P_15pwaQ.text: Our services was extremely nice and accommodating. I explained how I was Keto and he informed me that he was once Keto and gave me suggestions. The suggestion was amazing and the food was delicious!

u6K8PFGEBCjh5QQiuN50YQ.text: Very good food, friendly customer service, and great atmosphere! All the key ingredients to make for an exceptional experience. Don't hesitate coming here and trying to food! Wife got the "big Jim" and loved it I got the "No way Jose" burger and loved the jalapeno relish they threw on it! House made fruit punch was pretty good and again the atmosphere and people were friendly and fun!

88q_ry75wmnJEBbGDCJJCw.text: Wife and I just flew in to Arizona and stopped here because our flight got in around 10pm and this place was nearby Sky Harbor and open late (kitchen open until 2am).   Ordered the Welcome Burger, medium well, raw onions, no pickles (because they were bread and butter pickles and I don't like those). It came with a choice of side and I picked fries.   The burger was FAN. FRIGGIN. TASTIC. I can say the same for the fries. My wife tried both and agreed with my enthusiasm. In fact, I can say without exaggeration that this was easily one of the top 5 burgers I've ever had in my 30 years of life. Can't speak highly enough of the burger and also the fries. We'll definitely be coming back here on our way to the airport before leaving Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mostly outdoor seating. Was midnight so not terribly hot or buggy.

kIuX40uB9eaTXqTgOuX1Nw.text: So glad I found this place! My friend and I walked over on First Friday after a guy recommended it to us and described it as a place with great "comfort food." It's a few blocks from the more populated, business portion of Roosevelt. Since we were walking at night, it was a little sketchy given it was dark and there were barely any street lights. But the food and service were well worth the 5 minute creepy walk. Plus it made it more of an adventure ;)  This places feels like an outdoor diner, located on a residential block. You order your food at a window and then find a seat outside in the cute little lot. Despite the fact it was First Friday, the wait wasn't long at all. I think this is because, as I mentioned, it's a bit off the main strip of Roosevelt. We were able to easily find a comfortable place to sit and the service was great. I loved how patient the woman taking our order was and her enthusiasm describing their menu :) There's nothing worse than when you're excited to try a new place and the service is lackluster. This woman took her time and even checked on us later once our food arrived.  I tried the crunchy peanut butter, bacon burger with pickles and cheddar cheese. I know, right?! Sounds crazy! It was highly recommended by the person in front of me in line. And just way too weird for me to not try ---and man, am I glad I did! It was SO GOOD! The flavors actually really complimented each other, especially the saltiness of the peanut butter/bacon and sweetness of the peanut butter/pickles. The bun was also fantastic and fresh. Descent beef portion too. It came with a side of fries which were cooked to perfection.   I will definitely be returning. There are a bunch of other delicious sounding items I'd like to try. A place with a cool, hipster vibe to it and the food, service, and unique menu are outstanding!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome Diner. Great vibes and food!

8lhT-rl8dRmcTw_Cbd5YTQ.text: I love the nostalgia of a Valentine Diner having grown up with one next door. This group of chef's make it hard to like overall but some of their inventions are superb. Overpriced, overworked menu ideas are from newbe Chefs, I pray you get over it and think good food for everyone. I had the fried green tomato sandwich which underwhelmed with mushy tomato which the corn relish could not help. Hard to believe $8 for a side of Mac & Cheese but I ordered it. It wasn't the worst I have endured but far from acceptable, no flavor and texture was again, mush. Don't know where all these great Yelp reviews come from but I am losing faith in Yelp.

nlMmgWU7ExrPJ4WjgcURCQ.text: In every good television show, the characters have a local eatery where the ambiance is prime and the characters seem so at ease.   Well, if my life ends up being like The Truman Show, I could see Welcome Diner being that place.   The location and diner evoke an old-school sense of belonging. You feel like you're part of a real community when you sit outside (even in the 100+ degree weather) sipping on a great cocktail amongst old houses and the typical noises of a neighborhood.  The food is a perfect harmony of fresh culinary vision and traditional greasy spoon deliciousness.  So, get here soon; I am sure you'll feel welcomed too.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach Salad

yairthzBlM9JV59JUnzSXw.text: High expectations based on reviews I had read, unfortunately this place did not live up to the hype. It was not bad, in fact, I think there is real potential. The ingredients are clearly top notch fir the Phoenix scene, there just needs to be a bit more focus on proper seasoning and developing more flavor from these ingredients. The pork and grits looked great on the plate but once it was on my mouth it just lacked flavor. A bit of salt would have helped, using some Chile and some type of vinegar to add some acidity also would have helped. Fried chicken was cooked to perfection but the fry batter needs to be seasoned and it then be great chicken. So the potential is there to be great, unfortunately right now it's just ok to good.

WAdqWOsJw2ggfve14nDmEA.text: I told my hubby we absolutely had to stop by welcome diner during our trek to Phoenix.   From downtown we took a short lightrail ride (because he doesn't like to walk recreationally) then ironically still had to walk for what appeared to be forever through the sketchy part of town -- no we didn't take the art district route.  The diner literally is a mobile kitchen. Bigger than a food truck, I mean enough to situate a counter, a line of barstools and the cooking area. The guys on board are super friendly, accommodating and truly love the contribution they've made to the community.  Yes this little kitchen serves cocktails and beer.  We ordered the acclaimed big Jim, two of them, hash browns and beignets.   Our big Jims were delicious. Extremely hearty with extra gravy. Unfortunately, however, without the gravy, the biscuit would be just thirst inducingly dry.  I suppose that would be one way to get you to drink more!    Again loved the gravy. They even gave me a ramikin of their mushroom gravy cause they felt I had to try it..also quite delicious.   The hash browns and beignets were alright but didn't contribute to this diner's stars.  We were impressed with our main entrees and by the guys who run this little miracle on wheels.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

83hRUE45JtoW7y-WM9m6Pg.text: Good late-night spot in a residential neighborhood. Came here after the Suns v Warriors game and had ourselves the poutine fries, Mac and cheese with chorizo and I got the Big Jim and my gf got the Bumblebee. The poutine fries were decent. We both loved the Mac and cheese with chorizo! You can usually add any toppings you want to the Mac and cheese. My gf didn't like her bumblebee. She said there was too much seeded mustard and too much honey. But she did say the chicken was moist and tender. My big Jim was pretty good although I wish it had more gravy. Gravy was delicious, chicken was tender but overall I felt it was a little too "dry". But then again I like sauces with my food and in this case if I'm getting gravy, the more the better. Some might disagree and say too much takes away from the flavor of other ingredients. True. But IMO I wish it had more gravy. Without it, the biscuit was good but a little dry. Overall, food, service and ambience was good. Cool, hip place. Would definitely come back for Mac and cheese and maybe try a different biscuit "sandwich"

G9b6VOeoKsIZZ3ETdLAPyQ.text: My 16 year-old son and I were already downtown and starving, so we decided to give WD a try. It was only 4:30 on a Friday, and they don't open until 5 pm, so we just cruised around the neighborhood for a little while to kill time. We walked up right as they opened (in fact, we were the first people there, other than a young lady ordering take out from the window). I wasn't sure how it all worked, not having been before, and didn't know that there is indoor seating, so we were prepared to sit at one of the tables out front. The cheery guy sticking his head out of the take-out window invited us in, to our relief (It was kind of chilly outside). We took the bar stools at the farthest end from the door. But with the music speaker directly behind our heads and in the path of a vigorously blowing fan, we weren't in the most comfortable spot. But before we could decide whether or not to move (I mean a couple of minutes!), every seat was taken and a long line of people was queuing up out front at the take-out window. So we stayed put and waited to order.  As I noted, we were the first people to arrive, so I was a tad annoyed that it took so long to place my drink order (two other customers' orders were  taken before mine, so I also had a bit of a wait for my Manhattan, which was delicious; still, the bartender needs to work on his speed of execution--I tended bar for several years, and besides not paying attention to taking orders in order of the customers' arrival, he was slow and a bit fumbly).  While we were sitting there waiting to order food, Mr. Cheerful came over to show us diners the evening's special: chicken and sausage gumbo. He explained that it had a southwest twist--nopalitas instead of okra, which makes sense, because getting fresh okra right now is not an option (which is why gumbo made in the winter traditionally includes file powder--or if it's a seafood gumbo, roux. Nowadays, though, you're likely to find any combination of okra, file, and/or roux. I was told that WD's gumbo just used a roux.). The little squares of nopalitas added a delicious flavor and texture, and if you didn't tell someone otherwise, they'd never guess they were eating cactus paddles.  Anyway, I was intrigued. I grew up in the South and have spent a fair amount of time in Louisiana, so I consider myself well-versed on this dish that I often make myself--although during this season of Lent, one is more apt to find gumbo z'erbes on home tables than the version with meat). Plus, I was freezing because of the fan, so a steaming bowl of gumbo sounded perfect.  And it was, although I had to ask for a spoon so I could eat it.  A  couple of dashes of  hot sauce,  and it was so, so good. I could've easily eaten a second serving! Speaking of seconds, my son loved his Little Birdy biscuit sandwich so much that when he finished it, he asked if he could have another. Hah! Well, it was that good. The biscuit is tender and crumbly (and huge), and we are a biscuit-crazy family, but the chicken was the real star. Seriously addictive stuff. We also ordered a bowl of the mac 'n cheese, which was a very generous portion of pasta drenched in a sauce containing a hint of smokiness (from smoked Gouda, I suspect). I found it a bit flat (underseasoned) and disappointing. The "herbs" seemed to amount to a sad sprinkling of chives that did nothing except add a dash of color, and the cheese sauce tasted more of bechamel than cheese. As my son commented, "This can't hold a candle to your friend Bernie's mac and cheese at Citizen." Agreed. One more note about the dish: while it's definitely fun to watch someone in the tiny kitchen whip out a blow torch and pass it over a dish, it doesn't really add anything to this one (at least not ours). The result was a scattering of blackened spots across the top, rather than creating a bubbly, browned top. If there'd been a sprinkling of cheese to torch, then I'd see the point. But as it is? Nope.  We wound up taking most of it home, and I'll doctor the leftovers up myself. After we stuffed ourselves on dinner, my son unbelievably still had room for dessert. Of course, we ordered beignets. Ok, bear with this picky foodie for a second: these fried donuts served in a pool of really, really good honey and powdered sugar were delicious. But beignets? They looked like beignets. They smelled like beignets. But these little fried gems are dense rather than the slightly chewy, airy pillows I expected. I don't think they used a choux pastry or let it rise long enough.  In any case, don't expect real beignets and you'll happily enjoy them!  We look forward to returning to WD, although we plan to hit their sister joint Welcome CHICKEN + DONUTS first. I'll post something here when we do.

LdROf3oX7dG_u-WAGZ7kng.text: I've been a vegetarian for just over 3 years now and the jackfruit poboy was the best "meat substitute" meal I've ever had. I appreciated all the options I had too. They are willing to sub jackfruit for any of the non-vegetarian dishes. On top of that, the service was great even with it being full for happy hour. We will be back!

MgPbt9UBJuKeMfYe77W7vw.text: My cute bartender Jesse was the best  The food was amazing as well, get the fish Po'boy!

QpTDqtL-8uyTKe-EN24r1Q.text: What can I say....you must check it out. Friendly staff, great food and fun outdoor eating area.

LGs2U312zrfJ4NRJBSBRJA.text: This is my favorite spot near downtown the food is sooo good the atmosphere is so cool everyone there is super nice and did I mention the food? Their friend green tomato sandwich is To die for and their pulled pork fries are addicting!
