dNvY5YVjr0CetCoQHV2thw.text: First time at Welcome Diner. Really good looking menu but the execution really failed.   I arrived at 7:30 on a Friday night with my daughter and her husband. We were 15th in line yet didn't get a table for an hour. With one window taking all of the orders, it was painfully slow.   Our food didn't arrive for another 40 minutes. Yes, an hour and forty total. Brutal. I ordered a burger with poutine fries as a side, along with water. My daughter got the fried green tomato sandwich and water while her husband got the jambalaya and a coke.  After ordering you have to 'fight' for a table, which are few. We sat with two other couples at the family style seating.   My burger was good but the fries were awful. I'd never had poutine before but it was cold. I grabbed my first fry and got a mass of 15 fries welded together. Poorly done. The fried green tomato sandwich was another fail, as the toast was thick, hard and cold. She ended up eating it open faced. The jambalaya was okay.   Service was non-existent so we were ignored.   I may try Welcome Diner again, based on the clever menu but I am hesitant.

dEjncrRZmXCmLtpUmVtUJw.text: whenever we are in the area, we love to visit the Welcome Diner. Great Food. Great atmosphere. Some of our favorites are the Mac & Cheese, the sunrise biscuit, cheeseburger and the jambalaya. yum, yum, yum!!

WQgoR8I47H4__B_xDshJ-Q.text: What can I say? Mostly EVERYTHING here is housemade, and to die for. Its some seriously unhealthy southern diner food but my oh my, it is delicious. The only caviot is that the hurricanes and other drinks don't seem near as strong as they used to.

IMYNDjI4YY4ABI4VweXPUw.text: Greasy spoons unite!  Great menu, cool vibe, good service and good beers.  I was amazed at how efficient these guys are - they must lead the restaurant world in ratio of patrons served / grill square footage.    A great spot.  Don't come here on a diet though - my meal soaked through the paper plate and left a visible grease puddle on the counter top.  Psst ... the grit cakes are tasty and absorb the flavors of the meal but they are extremely greasy.

aq4SVn6c_EMklQACmC4Yyg.text: Food is great. Food is 5 stars. Service is meh. 3 stars for service. The gripe on the service is probably more to my personal taste. The place is very hipster, customers and servers. I think it would be difficult to be an apathetic hipster and provide quality customer service. Nobody was rude or anything, just blah. It certainly isn't going to stop me from being a repeat customer.

TzDtC62_Opd1KayT9Mv5Hw.text: This place is unanimously beloved by my friends and I. If I ever have friends visiting from out of town, I always take them here for great drinks and delicious food. My go-to drink is Whisky Sour and my go-to food item is the Little Birdy- MUST TRY! Either the Litte Birdy, or the Big Jim if you are extra hungry.

Zvwer-gkZDj8o__CFEwafQ.text: When we got there it was late at night.(almost their close) and they were out of everything. No problem they asked us what we wanted and they made substitutes and the food was delicious. Wow. I mean yes it was late night eats but I wouls get this at any time of the day.  Looove it.

zIQNrlBrMU6smBRncTU2Fw.text: Unique dishes, with quality ingredients. Great laid back atmosphere. Had a great time!

7vdX7yXZ8OR8aeWMjs1ZUQ.text: We went to the Welcome Diner on "First Friday" earlier this month.  We'll be back for sure.  It's a very casual atmosphere with some limited indoor seating along a counter and more seating outside.  We each enjoyed our meals.  I eat vegan and loved the Vegan Po'Boy; my son is a vegetarian and he loved the grilled cheese sandwich; and my wife, the carnivore of the family, really liked her fried chicken sandwich.  They try to use local foods.  The staff was great, as was the music they were playing.

OY8Hjv8WGpzw82C_BpkeBA.text: Came here based on the reviews and we weren't disappointed. The staff was very friendly and attentive, the food was excellent and the drinks were tasty. Topping it off was the outdoor seating and the crowd, a perfect Arizona night on our road trip through the area.

qKgm8Zz-TnAHzVukY-SGrA.text: Perfect hole in the wall Diner with awesome friendly service and some awesome soul food to back it up. everything on the menu is amazing! go see it and experiance it for yourself. it's truly unique.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KNye4BAj3vF1JNJVomytfQ.text: The best place I have been with all of my roommates. Definitely as good as they say! This is such a perfect, unique place.

A-syTonTRN39Zm8_601LVA.text: Got there at around midnight. Waited patiently to order the famous chicken biscuit sandwiches and poutin fries.  Unfortunately they were completely out of fried chicken and gravy.  Our bad luck turned into good luck because we had to go with other options.  Turns out the po boys and burgers are amazing!  Don't be afraid to go outside of your ordering comfort zone here.  Don't guzzle your drink too quickly,  it takes a while to get your food after you order.  It's well worth the wait though, and the people watching & music make the time go by faster.  We will return!  Now we're craving that fried chicken and gravy even more.  We will get there earlier on future visits.  Btw open till 2am with full bar.  Btw don't fear sitting next to strangers,  picnic style table seating on a first come first serve basis.

Ec8IwlcLO4oodgRUW6PHbw.text: This little diner is so beautiful at night. Love the service and the food here!

IHGQ_zC0um-qDyh8qX6wUg.text: I'm obsessed!! Me and my two girlfriends came by here for a late night dinner and we were blown away! What amazing hospitality and food! The pineapple beer is flawless and the fried green tomato sandwich was to die for. Thank you for taking care of us so well, can't wait to come back!!

1MNSRPRvglv4GXUGZwjURw.text: I ate here after reading the reviews on yelp. It was just OK, I got the big Jim. What aburger has gravy and biscuits that's just as good.  Looked like a bunch of goth skater cooks trying to serve some home style food. My friend ate with me and he wasn't very impressed either. I had a QT cup because QT ice tea is bomb and one of the skater workers said because of the liqueur license I had to throw it away. It was ok, I went, I probably wouldn't go back.

gnzX1Su1P7Z9_Ie5Wc6hsg.text: Oh my very favorite!  Poutine! Not at all like the traditional, but oh-so-good and imo, so much better! Sandwiches served on biscuits?!? Heaven! I only wish this place was open for breakfast.  Oh yes, and service? Top notch!

kbNoK48tCG5hUcsW775ysw.text: Great little diner. I've lived right down the block and never stopped in. When I found out they had food until 2am I stopped it. Love everything about this place!

CTsaEIhyZ4O3lutTTXDriw.text: great place! love the food and the employees are accommodating! The No Way Jose is amazing!

GEcapy4etlISkBKWn9zLrQ.text: Delicious food, great drinks, and wonderful service. Not a lot of seating inside, though. Makes it mostly a non-summer place.

wCR4WLZaCH4c6KkLTXHDiw.text: This place is great but the food etc, but I will say the customer service is pretty bad. Not friendly and they walk around with attitudes. I have been here multiple times and the people are just not friendly. Other than that good food!

go-Yh5ZJutciONDMOwU3Eg.text: I had a great time dining at this place. Loved the casualness of the establishment. Order from the walk up window and the food gets delivered to your outdoor patio table. The food was comfort, with a twist for the better.  Opens late and serves beer & spirits. I can see why this is a local spot that's gone mainstream.  No doubt, a great hidden gem of Phoenix.

-X24gakYLNwRiSo0VQaeUQ.text: Out with my two boys,who, like me, enjoy exploring for great eats. Based on Yelp suggestions, I decided to give this place a shot. It was close to the art museum we were at, reasonable prices, and great food!  It is hard to find food that has great flavor, and makes you feel like you are eating a meal made by momma.  Staff was courteous and ambiance was hip. Thanks for the experience, we are definitely excited to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not too young to try new eats!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim...it&#39;s what&#39;s for brunch!

yYPFrVmcmgoPJmtJJ7dmRQ.text: Great little place... Let me start by saying, they make their own tonic water for their gin (or vodka) & tonic. They have a small menu of really exceptional dishes, beverages and a couple deserts.  Great atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Definitely try the beignets, with either traditional powdered sugar, honey or "dirty" with peanut butter and their own preserves.

KUUTX7bGr8frxmBHcSNaeQ.text: Nestled in a residential area, you will find the "Welcome Diner"not only do they welcome guests, They are all super friendly and passionate about what they do! The food is incredible, especially the fried green tomatoes ! Can't wait to visit downtown Phoenix again and the Welcome Diner!

v85Ob2yeBA2DvY89HwoLQQ.text: The pulled Jack Fruit was magnificent! Super convenient and a nice home feel.

nIIGA0etoVLJFJfwB1n6pA.text: Wow what amazing food and fantastic service. My group got 2 big jims, a bumblebee, poutine, and the welcome burger along with 3 old fashions. The drinks were served right away with the food very shortly after. All of the items were amazing and we will definitely be back many many many times.

XFNIrRgc1kV6eqvsyhXG4g.text: I have been going here for years... And this is my first review ever and it had to be for my favorite place in Phoenix. Everything on the menu is fabulous!! Even the PB&B burger that I never thought I would try... Amazing. Their slaw and Brussels sprouts are on point!!!

lAL4Bgdknn-zxvJTbTPCzg.text: They don't believe in customer service at the Welcome Diner.  Just hipster beards and mediocre cheeseburgers.  Sitting at an 8 top and the food runners can't take an order for us at the table and want us to wait in line?  This place is a hell hole.

k6UOoingniFGpyVCJWAdYA.text: Love this place. Somewhere you can grab a bite in the evening or late night and the quality is always the best. Top notch people and top notch food.

wrrlMUIqT7ydq39FsbEsew.text: DUDE. Gnarliest food. EVER. We stopped here on our way back from phoenix to California. Hubs had the carol, coleslaw, and fries and I had the watermelon,  tomato and arugula salad. OMG. Every BITE had flavor. Wayne. .is it wayne? Dude, I don't even know but he was super hospitable and welcoming and great all around. The food was out of this world.yum.dude. LOVE.

gzfo_oNFknw-gdDhofy-Qw.text: This is the homiest  most delicious place to visit. You won't be disappointed in the chicken, biscuit & gravy combo. I had to try chorizo, also delic! Nicest and friendliest guys around!

8Le5cbVlabY3jch4MIh8lg.text: I wish I could pack this place up and take it back to Lawrence with me!! Love it. -Maisie. Cousin of Joe from Jayhawk Country.

sY_U7UAowXB1Z_eG6TfPjw.text: Down home southern style cooking in downtown Phx. The fried green tomato sandwich is a home run. Also recommend the mac n' cheese as a side to share with your friends, it's a large tasty portion. There's a bartender inside that makes great a great old fashioned. The seating is first come first server and there's no table service (unless you sit inside at the bar which seats about 8 people). Have one person wait in line to place your order an another hold down some spots during busy hours.

AyAP8DYvMqjP_jmytLbYQg.text: Food was delicious. Got the sunrise with chorizo, and my husband got a burger that he really liked. It took a while (45 min) to get the food, but I was understanding considering how small their kitchen and cooktop were.. And how busy they were (always a good sign). We also ordered a dessert at the same time we ordered dinner, and FORTY minutes AFTER we finished our dinner (a total of an hour and a half of waiting), still nothing. I pulled our waiter aside and asked him about them, he nicely said, " they're the next order up." Ok.. I was Pissed off, but I let it go. Another 15 minutes goes by, 4 OTHER orders to different tables that got there an hour after we did... NOTHING. Got up and left. He watched us leave and said nothing. A lot of distractions happening, and with the prices they have, they need to deliver not only with taste (which I will say, they did) but with service also. Just because you serve good food does not mean you can make people wait for over an hour and a half for it. Not that worth it.

Gbss-7EcQi7Tft1nYX2spg.text: Some of the best food in downtown! The poutine was wonderful, great ambience, the bumble bee biscuit was out of this world! If you've never been here, you're cheating yourself

NcptE85GtytrGPgCrmSCqA.text: This is my favorite place to come sit outside. Really delicious food. Love coming late night for whiskey sours too. Staff is always awesome.

etGPWS5PKlz5IwqhwgDAwg.text: Absolutely DELICIOUS. The food did take a little while but the quality of the food and the taste of the food made up for the wait. I had the Pb&B burger... it was heaven inside of a bun, it had peanut butter on it with pickles, this would normally be an odd combination but the sweetness of the pickles and the salt from the peanut butter made for a great duo. The atmosphere was very lively and happy. The service was good but when you order there is a small window that you order through and the woman/man who takes your order sticks you drink through this tiny window. This is a great Establishment and I will definitely be coming back.

jX-nviEfSLFye21r8FCaLw.text: 8/10 on the hipster-o-meter. Really friendly staff. I had the big jim and my friend had the watermelon salad. Both were really good. 2 minor negatives would be the price ($9 for chicken bacon biscuit sandwich) and lack of seating.

8humv_3uGTYBR1lqYfeJdQ.text: The ambiance at Welcome Diner is excellent for the location and neighborhood it is in.  Nestled on the Northwest corner of 10th St. and Roosevelt, it is a perfect fit for this Garfield gem!  The service is always great, consistent and on point.  I would call the overall genre of  the food to be southern, comfort food with a modern twist.  The standouts that I've tried thus far are the PB&B Burger and the Big Jim.  The handcrafted libations are all done very well and they are not shy with their pours!  It comes as no surprise to me that this business is thriving and growing!  All day happy hour on Tuesdays.  Check it out when you're in the hood or downtown!

8hSrI_PULvr63Mj4M22seQ.text: This place is awesome! Drinks and food were delicious. We had the little birdy and the pork fries. Yummy! Their hurricane drinks are the best. We also had an old fashioned and whisky sour. Bartender (Zack) was very friendly. Very small inside diner type seating and lots of outdoor tables. Highly recommend this place!

-gwwCiNYrGNbCKdbGX20rg.text: Get a grapefruit Paloma and a burger to split; our favorite place when we visited Phoenix

TJHAe38czYY6I6jRdA7YFg.text: You know that place you always say you want to go to, but never get around to actually going? Welcome Diner was that place for me. Someone would mention it and, mentally, I'd make a note to make it over there but that swiftly slipped my mind. Until recently, when my buddy Paul wanted to get out for dinner. And enter Welcome Diner.  The weather was great for our meal, maybe a little chilly. Paul ordered the fish po'boy and a side of poutine (the latter we shared), I ordered the Garfield (which was previously on the menu, then taken off, because it was announced on the board as such) with an over-easy egg. The spicy fried kale was fantastic. However, eating this as a sandwich was messy--I had yolk and juices dripping which resulted in me licking my hands and arms like the dog in the corner. There was a dog in the corner; we were on the patio. So, I took the top biscuit off and finished it with a fork and knife.   Paul said he enjoyed the po'boy, but we both agreed what they called poutine wasn't poutine. It was fries with shredded cheese melted over it and white gravy. Not bad, really, but not the poutine we've had.  So now that I've *finally* made it here, I know now I'll be back again and again. Thx, Paul!

k2YRhw4LR6oP9F45q0NaVA.text: I've tried Welcome Diner more than once and every time has been amazing. The food, the service, the atmosphere is always wonderful. If you don't know what to order I recommend the jambalaya! Can't go wrong with it.

ycPQZ946W6eZDU-c25jr5Q.text: This is my go to spot for a casual hang out. There usually is a line, but it's always a pleasant wait. You order at the counter and find a seat. There is counter seating inside, but not much. I've ordered mixed drinks inside. Not sure if they are available on the outside deck/yard area. Check their Instagram to keep up with whatever new creations they have to munch on.

mLsCTK2yN97kv5RmJITa1g.text: Probably my new favorite place ever. No seriously   1) I would come here purely because it's such a comfortable atmosphere, this place has an eclectic vibe that makes any person feel comfortable in their own skin  2) I have no words for the service. It's been so long since anyone in a restaurant has treated me like a person, given honest recommendations and put time and effort into their craft.    3) The food is decadent in moderation, creative without being threatening and amazing in my mouth.    The only disclaimer I have is that you need to remember that good things come to those who wait, this place gets really busy and has a tiny prep area and bar but they make it work with grace and expertise. Just enjoy the scenery and your patience will pay off .

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zf97tGsEChWCN1rWy3YC9A.text: I used to go to the old location before I moved. I love the welcome burger. It was my introduction to aioli sauce and now I am on a constant lookout for burgers with it. The staff was always pleasant and fun.

T_KlozwBZTkzRZXftFuAYg.text: Very fun and laid back diner vibe. Love the food and can't wait to try out everything on the menu.  Very well made drinks. Good happy hour on food and drinks. Can't wait for the weather to cool down so we can enjoy the cute patio.

a8heHbcRHTREnyda9iRGlA.text: The best grilled cheese I ever had and service was excellent. Welcome Diner was recommended by a close friend and even though I believe the sandwich was a little pricey(10.00)  it was well worth it.

hCD7Jifcw8NjWxUQsvbFwg.text: The first time we attempted to come here we were unable to eat inside and it was raining so we didn't eat. The second time it was nice enough to sit outside. The server recommended a honey chicken biscuit sandwich, which I ordered with a side of brussle sprouts. It was pretty good, the honey on it made it messy to eat and the biscuit was a bit much in ration to the chicken. I would probably order something else next time.  My  husband ordered a burger, which he said was good, nothing over the top. I would come back and try something different, their patio is cute and the staff was really friendly.

QpXWk1AQFZzH8A9EGlAKXA.text: Super good. Took a midnight trip to flavor town. This place is always really good with a fun environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midnight trip to flavor town
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midnight trip to flavor town

HJdp2ZXtKDB9rDbHanGHZQ.text: Vegan Po'Boy. Oh my gosh!  Fried avocado! Everything here is a yes! My mom still talks about this place years later!

Gzp9mpKowGYbA1iccJdpUQ.text: I'd like to preface with the fact that we came here after First Friday. My partner and I had just finished vending and were looking for a way to celebrate the end of the night. We're old birds that don't stay up very late, so late night dining is fairly foreign to us, especially in Phoenix. We yelped and found Welcome Diner. Our company was delighted that I had mentioned it as she had been here previously. An antsy me took that as a good sign and didn't even think about needing to wait in line.   When we first walked up to the diner, we noticed a huge amount of people sitting outside, a very long line, and a few groups standing around. My partner and I joined the groups of people standing around trying to look for somewhere else to go. We really didn't feel like waiting in line. We couldn't get ahold of our company to switch gears, so we ended up just standing in line. When they arrived, we were reassured that the wait would be worth it. We waited 56 minutes in line... FIFTY SIX MINUTES. There had to be approximately ~13 people in front of us. When we finally got to the front of the line, we had to wait another 10 before the guy that was just sitting there took out order. The kitchen looked really busy, but definitely the long line was a little more than they can handle it seemed. I'm not one to wait too long for food, so this was just a miserable experience for me. I promise I'll move on from the wait times soon...but we literally waited another 48 minutes for out food to come out.   Moving on...  Pulled Jackfruit Po'Boy - 3.5/5 - Jackfruit was WAY too saucy and salty. Just a reminder to everyone and anyone that makes pulled jackfruit with BBQ...a little bit of BBQ goes a long way. You don't need to drench it. This made the "toasted" much too soggy for my liking. I was told that this would be the best pulled jackfruit I'd ever had... and I believed it because of the line, but I was sorta disappointed.   Mac & Cheese - 5/5 - okay, this was really damn delicious, enough said.  Jackfruit Fries - 4/5 I think I would've preferred this as my choice dish over the Po'boy. The fries just went better than the baguette   All in all- I really hated that I had to wait so long for this meal. If I had not been with good company and company that I had not seen for ages...I wouldn't have waited. I wasn't amazed with the food, but I'd give it another try, so long as I did not have to wait two hours.

QI4tmOVdI2xVqzKmhkWZTg.text: I don't like to give negative reviews to restaurants.  I really try not to I'd at all possible.  I'm doing this in hopes that it will get the attention of the owners.  I've always LOVED welcome diner and over the years have recommended it to many people.  That being said I have been back twice since the move, and I must say, improvement is needed.  Something happened to the food quality, the charm and most of all the service.  I am giving an overall 3 star review in hopes of change. However food right now would get about a 2, service (including host stand would get a 2 as well. Without those two main things it's hard to feel the charm.  Please do something about your biscuits, once lovely, they are now dense & salty.  Table side service is decent, hosts are down right rude.  Just remember, I still want to love it, but it's just as easy to dine across the street at Gallo Blanco.  I don't think I'm alone here in my thinking.  Cheers and good day

FEdliiRQGmdWRn1J1IMnsQ.text: My husband and I have driven past this place many a night on our way home from King's Convenience and it was always so full, we never thought to park the car and stroll on in. Last Friday night we got lucky and got a seat inside - yay! After enjoying the food from Welcome Chicken and Donuts on Broadway oh so much, I knew Welcome Diner wasn't going to disappoint. Our server, Taylor, was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable about every dish and all of its ingredients - it's such a joy to see someone take pride in their work and I haven't even gotten to the food yet. We started off with the roasted brussell sprouts - yummy charred goodness plus it was a vegetable which buffered the other stuff I'm about to mention .... We both got chicken and biscuit masterpieces - The Bumblebee for me with its delicious pickles and honey mustard - all scratch made. My husband got the Big Jim - all I can say is "wow" - everything you could ever want in your life from the chicken, the bacon, the biscuit and the gravy. Oh, and did I mention their gorgeous, craft cocktails? They have those too. Now on to dessert - chocolate chunk. pecan. sea salt. pie - and believe me you get gorgeous chunks of everything in every bite! Their coffee is pretty darn fantastic too - from Piexoto in Chandler.  All in all, a damn perfect experience.

L76sKk63cAgCH7mS7hK4SA.text: I've been here a couple of times with some buddies of mine. The menu is pretty small but Its something you kind of deal with. It'd be nice if they expanded menu options but I still come back because it's a nice little hang out spot when you just want some fresh air.. somewhere to just sit, relax, and chat in a nice setting with a friend. Love the vibe that's set here. Whether it's the restaurant it's self, or the variety of different ppl that enjoy this establishment it's definitely so intriguing. I still want to give this place 5 stars because the food is still very flavor filled and the staff is SO SO nice. Will be back again soon

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T9gSSmssWXYh3dT2Z9JFIA.text: Do yourself a favor and eat here. Pick any item on the menu. Have a drink. You will not be disappointed. I don't care what kind of food you like, if you are picky or not, this place is amazing  and will leave you always wondering what the next item on the menu tastes like. Not only is the food stupid good, but every member of the staff is friendly and attentive. Matt is a master behind the bar and if you can't make up your mind he will help you choose something that will change how you view food.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Second home
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A whiskey sour that will bring out your &#34;20s gangster&#34;

c0L1of2mQ8aEaNYHkMs36w.text: I adore Welcome Diner. There's so much to love about this restaurant. I absolutely adore the outdoor seating, especially during the cooler months in Arizona, with the gorgeous overhead lights. The service is always excellent; everyone that works here genuinely looks like they enjoy their job. Brace yourselves for long lines, and a long wait for your food. Don't worry, the food is worth the wait!   My favorite items on the menu are Bumblebee and Koko. I love the taste of salty and sweet together; if you are the same way then you would certainly enjoy Bumblebee. The delicious crispy chicken pairs well with the honey. I am not usually a fan of biscuits but they do it so well at Welcome Diner. Koko is also my favorite. This is what I order when I prefer something less tasty but equally as good as Bumblebee. I always pair my sandwiches with their delicious french fries, paired with their (garlic?) sauce. My boyfriend always get their burger (No Way Jose) and he loves it. Welcome Diner is not just perfect for brunch or dinner. It is the perfect place to just hang out and have a drink with friends.

Pb7RhWqqM_uo0QOIY5Kw_Q.text: Everything is amazing. Really one of the best all-around meals I've ever had. The burger was one of the best I've ever had, or maybe the best.. . Just the quality of the beef was so tasty. Even the pain fries were notably delicious. Portions are good, they serve the full menu until closing, and like... How can plain fries be so delicious??   Husband unit and I had Mac and cheese (plain, but still amazing). He had the welcome burger, I had a koko chicken and biscuit (good, but his burger was better), plain fries, coleslaw (vinegar based), and bignets. All. Amazing. So amazing that we're coming back here before we fly home, which is saying something because we typically like to try everying new on vacation.   There's 90% outdoor seating. It's definitely chill. Service is really friendly and casual... Like you're at an outdoor bbq kind of. Cokes are by the bottle, and there's fileted water self-serve from a cooler.   Working on crunchy, sweet, hot bignets right now... Must stop reviewing before husband eats them all.   COME HERE NOW.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almost no inside seating, but the outside is better. Very unique vibe.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

coUF3KP4zd59CguYdGW5Fw.text: I tried Welcome Diner after a co-worker recommended it. It's definitely one of my favorite spots to go to now if it's cool out at night or if I'm in the downtown area.  FOOD: I had the Big Jim Fried Chicken Biscuit Sandwich which was heavenly perfect comfort food. Biscuit was perfect and so was everything really. The side of watermelon is unique yet complimenting to most of their dishes. My friend got a side of fries and one of the burgers. I helped destroy the fries, they are seasoned and fantastic, especially with their special dipping sauce! On a second occasion, I tried a Coconut beer they had which sounded weird, but they give tasters and it was actually really good.  SERVER: No server really. Just go up to the window after reviewing the menu and order. They've always been friendly when I've asked questions and after you seat, someone will bring your food and condiments as needed. Pick your beer up at the window, though, the server can't do refills apparently.  HOSTING: No hosting, just sit yourself down outside where most of the seating is at, under the night sky. There is space inside but it's very tiny -- maybe 6-8 people max.  AMBIANCE: Outdoor seating mostly that's fenced off with patio / outdoor style tables. It fits perfectly with the trailer-diner vibe. Also, the string lights above are perfect. Excellent for chilling with friends or for a casual romantic date.  PARKING: I usually park on the East side across the street; There's a Water Mill station with some parking and late at night, that seems to be where other people park as well. Otherwise, down one of the side streets works too.  Albeit a bit of a hipster crowd every time I've gone (to be expected in the Downtown Phoenix area), it's still a pretty awesome neighborhood spot. Love the overall vibe of the place. Reminds me a lot of what they have in New York City -- a small place on the corner amongst a residential area.   Best to come here when it's cooler out at night! I'm only giving 4 stars because it's primarily outdoor seating, which poses a problem if it unexpectedly rains or if it's summertime because even at night, anywhere from May-September it's still 100+ degrees out and can ruin a date night. Otherwise, this is highly recommended as a unique restaurant in Phoenix.

zMsuKftJJrLU7N6sjyrIoA.text: Stopped here after a Suns game. Great location off of the busy streets. Nice little spot but dont let it fool you. The food is more on the gourmet side, they have a nice selection of alcoholic drinks. Not much room inside the diner but plenty of room outside. They have heat lamps if its that time of year. Service was very friendly and the person who took our order was very informative and was talking about where they get their bacon from AMAT ngst other details.  I ordered the PoBoy fish sandwich and friend got the Big Jim chicken biscuit. No sides came with our food except some watermelon. I didnt taste the big jim but looked good and my friend said it was great. PoBoy was very good and whatever sauce they use in it was outstanding   I would def come back again for the price i wish they included some kind if side besides the watermelon but overall excellent experience and food. Check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Out front
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poboy
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BigJim biscuit sandwich

H3uOHHGWukE-RkEPu84SvQ.text: Nice late night spot. Had the chicken and biscuit sandwich with honey. It's pretty good. Tried the Mac and cheese... it wasn't my favorite but it wasn't the worst. I'd recommend this place when options are limited late night.

_RQv6C_0fNY_bpTShj1zJw.text: I have a gluten allergy and called in advance to see if there were gluten free breakfast options.  They assured me that were choices.    What I expected was GF bread options for toast that I could enjoy with eggs but I was not specific.  It was not on the menu when I arrived so I asked and was told they did not carry GF bread.   I responded that many people are allergic to gluten and that it is sold in all grocery stories at the same price as regular bread, the response was shockingly, "we choose not to carry it."   If I was alone, I would have left, however since I was with someone I did not.    At some point they will be more accommodating to a growing segment of the population but until they do, if you have a gluten allergy or celiac avoid the Welcome Diner.

D3nrRvJe5oROXjUB1NJ4Fw.text: First time in after eying this spit for months. Was absolutely CRAVING a burger and I have not found a decent burger in PHX in the year I've lived here. And I've tried them all...  The Champion is just that, super juicy & flavorful & cooked to perfection. This is my pick for the BEST BURGER IN PHOENIX HANDS DOWN. This is where you go when you actually appreciate a good burger, and by good burger I mean; medium rare, savory, and not overloaded with toppings like hopdoddy & zinburger... the focus is on the meat & that my friends is how a good burger turns into a great burger. Gtfo with the double well done patties & fancy toppings. Roomate even said it was better than Gordan Ramsays. Cannot wait to try the poutine & the biscuit sammys

Drinks were solid but the food left a lot to be desired. I won't be back.

NZSohPDN6iEqTHeStpcK_Q.text: It's a cute little trailer/hipster restaurant in Phoenix (walking distance from ASU campus.)   My friend took us here for a late dinner when I was visiting and I'm glad he did.   The cashier was really nice and helpful especially when I asked what she recommended for food/to drink.  I ended up ordering a beer with the Carol which was a biscuit sandwich with pulled pork. It was a really big portion (ended up taking half home). The biscuit was nice and fluffy - a little too thick for me personally. The coleslaw was surprisingly good (I normally don't like it but found myself liking this one). Good place for a quick meal/to hang out outside.

FghQ16wvuXnQaeWftU-q9Q.text: When my wife suggested going to a diner for dinner, my mind immediately went to comfort food. You know, those culinary staples that we all need in good times and bad. Needless to say, I was looking forward to it.  When we arrived at Welcome Diner, my first observation was the location. A somewhat rundown neighborhood undergoing changes of gentrification. The diner itself sits on the corner directly across from what looked like an old market that had been turned into a cafe/bar. Overall, a very intriguing location within a very positive and vibrant community.   You don't order your food at Welcome Diner like you would at your normal greasy spoon. There isn't the smell of fried potatoes and stale coffee or a waitress with big Texas hair brining you biscuits and gravy. You actually order your food from a small window in front of the diner. Once you order, you can sit inside if there is room or sit outside. The weather last night was really nice. Not hell hot, so we sat outside. FYI, finding seating outside can be a little hairy. There are several tables and some counter type seating, but all of the outside seating is first come, first serve.  The menu is simple, but take comfort food to a whole new level. To give you an example, when I think about a diner, I think about meatloaf. So I ordered Welcome's version. A Chorizo Meatloaf covered in a Chipotle and white wine cream sauce, picked vegetables, and Brahbant potatoes. Very innovative in my book. When you cut into the meatloaf you get an incredible burst of flavor with the sauce and pickled veg. The potatoes added the salty flavor to the sweetness of the pickled veg. My wife ordered the Koko, which was a sandwich consisting of a pieces fried chicken, covered in Chipotle ranch dressing topped with tomato and arugula. Then all of the aforementioned is stuff between a sliced biscuit. I only sampled the chicken, but it was full of flavor an tender. My daughter ordered the bacon Mac N' Cheese. She at a little more than half of it, which told me it was off the charts. I tried it and loved it. The bacon in the Mac N' Cheese wasn't just your average, tiny bacon bits. It was actual small pieces of bacon. As a side, we ordered the roasted Brussels sprouts. they weren't roasted as much as I do them at home, but they were still good. I also ordered a Manhattan off of their cocktail menu.  No complaints on the service or wait staff. Everyone we interacted with was very friendly. Especially the gentleman who took our order at the window. He wasn't rushing people and chatting with them a bit. Basically, making you feel.....Welcome. Parking was easy for us to find. In fact, we got a spot right in front of the diner itself. I noticed a lot of people were Ubering to the diner as well.  If I'm ever in the Phoenix area again, I'm definitely going back to the Welcome Diner.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko and Brussels sprouts
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Mac N&#39; Cheese

uXDBZ7UkwNlWSv0ebXr60g.text: First time at Welcome Diner today for brunch and it was love at first bite. (Late to the game finding Welcome but this place lives up to the reviews... our new Saturday breakfast jam for sure.) Sat at the counter and had the best service from Marcus (what a cool dude). I had the French omelette which was absolutely to-die-for-good (rich and decadent) and the coffee (regular black coffee) is something I'll crave until next visit. Hubby had the Welcome Breakfast with house sausage which was the size of a burger patty (massive) and seasoned to perfection. Run, don't walk.

ggb4LazE5XRf41Fiw_KgYw.text: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly  Really really wanted to love this place. My favorite Phoenix Bloggers come to this place weekly. Seen all their great pics and thought we would give it a shot this morning..wished I had passed  The Good The breakfast burger is by far the best I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, bacon jam..do I need to say more?! Mexican Coke yes please! The Bad The servers just think they are too cool for school. Little annoying. Also really...you don't open until 10am?! Must be because the servers are too cool to be open before then  The Ugly When my hubs orders the bumble bee and it's literally chicken and a biscuit it better be f'n fantastic and unfortunately it missed the mark big time in the biscuit department. It was so dry! When we asked for a replacement, the server set it down never said wow man sorry about that or hope this one is better. Nada just ignored the fact that they served a biscuit that if thrown at a small child would have knocked them out  Thanks for the experience..meh

OBHRe9gdOC0FJ99IJvtz7w.text: I did give this restaurant a high five star. Great with the community, good food, etc. then they moved, expanded, and hired new people. This is the new community relations with their employees on our neighborhood Facebook page from a Nick Todd referring to the Mexican children in our neighborhood:   "Jamie Ritchey you're a real piece of shit.  Those little punks are antagonistic pieces of shit, they've started shit with me and Welcome Diner has had all kinds of problems with them antagonizing customers. I can't believe you'd defend that and attack someone's grammar, what a fucking lowlife you are!!  There wasn't any race baiting in Sammy's post, but those kids are Mexican and only seem to bother white people, so who's REALLY being racist?   Fuck those kids, fuck their shitty parents, and fuck you for saying they are "good kids"."  The community doesn't dine here and we recommend you don't either.

s1EaqerqgUdm2XC-0p8Hjw.text: One of my favorite spots in the Phoenix Valley! Perfect date spot. Mac n Cheese is killer.

G35o7UZ6w7AEHNTm9xPcoQ.text: Love this place my go to place in Phoenix perfect for any occasion. Burgers, mac and cheese, poboys, desserts you name it anything they do they do it right and as someone who has eaten at close to a thousand places all around the world it means a lot when I say this place is one of my favorites.

c44iBW5-1XGDqCfy6hqEXQ.text: I had seen this place being advertised on Welcome Chicken and Donuts' Instagram many times so I started following WD on Instagram as well. What made me come here was the many pictures of biscuit-y type foods and decadent sandwiches, and also that they're open from 5 p.m.- 2 a.m. 7 days a week!   I came here tonight with a friend last night (Sunday). I scrolled through the Yelp food photos to make a decision on what to order and the Mac N' Cheese caught my eye.  Vibes: Very hipster-y, there are seating indoors surrounding the kitchen, and outdoor patio seating as well with family-style picnic tables and round, metal tables with chairs. We sat outside at a table because the weather was pleasantly cooler than normal...a whooping 90 degrees!  Food:   The food menu consists of several options of biscuits- biscuits and gravy, fried chicken and biscuits, etc., also  I like that the prices of the meals here are pretty great.   *Mac N' Cheese* $8 for a decently sized portion of amazing macaroni and cheese is more than I could ask for. The macaroni is baked and has more sauce on the bottom so after mixing the noodles around, this dish is sooo yummy. The macaroni isn't too salty or way too cheesy, it's just perfect.  *Fried Green Onion Sandwich* I also tried a bite of the fried green onion sandwich and it satisfied my tastebuds. I was impressed!   *Berry and Ginger Pie* This pie has the one of the best crusts I've ever tasted! No "soggy bottom" as Paul Hollywood says. The flavors meld so well together and there is not too much sugar in this dessert. Lovely.  I didn't get to try the drinks, but I will definitely be back here soon and try different items on the menu, including the drinks.

v3BgdSIqRurrBLa-F0WEPQ.text: One of my favorite places in Phoenix, Welcome Diner offers a modern twist on comfort foods like chicken and biscuits, fries, etc.  Their servings were very generous and our food came out pretty quickly -especially considering we visited on a Friday night during prime dinner hours.   I particularly love that they offer veggie-friendly options.. their bbq jackfruit burgers and fries are amazing!! It can be hard to find restaurants that accommodate vegetarians, which makes this place even more special.  Just a heads up tho, the majority of seating here is outdoors. Aka. be prepared during the winter months for the cold/ during the summer months for the heat.. I think there are like 5 seats inside near the kitchen, but otherwise everything else is picnic benches or tables :) I'll definitely be back here once it's a little warmer again outside!

6i4IQK8uWwkGlcCpzMf83A.text: This place was a very interesting experience for me just because it is kind of off of my usual food radar. I tend to like the more traditional restaurant experience so diners haven't really been in my wheelhouse thus far.   The location is in an interesting little area, you are driving down some residential streets and then bam there's a little clutch of restaurants.   I had the Welcome burger with fries and the food was great. I had no complaints about food at all.   For me this got a 4 out of 5 just because it was pure chaos when we were there. Instead of having one server we had 3 or 4 different people checking on us so there were some small miscommunications. It also felt a little hurried. It was a fairly busy night so I felt a little rushed to get out the door when we were eating which is not something I generally enjoy.   Other than that, great food, nice spot.

7CEvUwPEmZYer9IbBXYa7g.text: By time my food arrives my friends are done eating wack services . I was the first one to order too lol had get my money back

slachA6FRsXLwXIcdhH4yA.text: My husband and I loved this place! It has a laid back ambiance and is so unique! The food is a mix of New Orleans style and is so tasty! I'd recommend the poutine fries and the fried green tomato sandwich.  Also they make pretty good cocktails, and even make their own tonic! You need to check this place out!

izDSyUcFULZ-oRLOh7uoZA.text: Best diner I've been to. Nothing in Cali compares to this. Great service, intimate charming space with emphasis on out door seating. We order 2 drinks that they recommended, a stout beer on tap that tasted like coffee (yummy), and a wheat citrus beer . The food was on point, we had the Big Jim biscuit  (I think that's what it's called) and the bbq jackfruit fries ( amazing entree for vegans and non-vegan  taste better than pulled pork and it's cruelty free). This place is worth checking out!

k82uHtCOqknJVkEspe48Mg.text: I love this place. I am fairly certain that I would give it 5 stars if I wasn't a vegetarian.  My meat loving pals are obsessed with the Big Jim (best fried chicken sandwich smothered in gravy, topped with bacon and cheese)--even makes me want to give up morals for a bite!    The folks behind the counter are always super friendly and chill.  They have drink specials and daily food specials that are mouthwatering!  I love the vegan poboy.  Fried avocado like no other!    I think I might be biased, but I do love me some Welcome Diner (but I can't eat here too much or I'll end up as big as a house!)

isgfBAVjTIcRm4zlUJDHag.text: My kids and I love this place! The chicken biscuits are out of this world. So far I have tried the Captain Fantasy (talk about a kick) and the Bumble Bee (made with locally sourced honey) both have been fantastic. I have also had the Carol which is Kilt Lifter braised pulled pork on a biscuit, smoked in the back of course.   The service has always been really friendly. The atmosphere is really laid back.  You will want to eat outside, as the inside is really small.  Pretty much the opposite of the Tardis (a little geek joke, nod if you get it).  My Step son recently got one of their burgers, and he said it was one of the best burgers he has ever had.  Definitely on my list to try soon.  All in all, its a place you have to try. You will not be disappointed in any way. oh did I mention that they are locally owned and locally sourced? So not only can you get good food, but feel good about it to.

-N7fLz_2BWh95TP7fFQT9Q.text: Great food with custom cocktails.  Family friendly and good local people who are friendly running the place.

5HSo2F985o13fHosZfi7pg.text: My family and I went to Welcome Diner last night. So, there were several different items ordered and EVERYTHING was so good!  I had the fried avocado po'boy. The bread was toasted the perfect amount. There was a great pico de gallo and kale topping the fried avocado. That fried avocado was amazing! It was so creamy yet crunchy! Yum! My husband had the champion burger. He said it was really good, especially the bacon jam. My brother in-law has the big Jim. It was huge! A biscuit, giant piece of fried chicken and the thickest gravy ever! I tried some and it was so good! Creamy and sinful! The last thing I tasted was the Brussels sprouts. Omg! Goooood! They were crispy and tasty! Only downside was the fries were a little salty. I would definitely go back. The atmosphere is exactly what downtown Phoenix is all about! I loved it!

EXmB7fvsXMnIwpw2wU0oUg.text: Welcome Diner has made me rethink fries with toppings. Someone (chef) tell me the secret of layering your already tasty fries with savory pork and somehow keeping the fries crispy underneath?! It's one of life's greatest mysteries but I am okay with it. Can't wait to return for a homemade whiskey sour- the mix is tangy and tart and just plain yummy.

o37mdLn1ZfqaYej4slHuIQ.text: Best place in phx! I love the jack fruit sandwich! It's a fun atmosphere with great people.

GmEKSkUaHPiwLpdCZ2efbA.text: I have to give this place 5 stars, due to the delicious, unusual food options, as well as the ambiance that made me jump through time to yesteryear and relive memories that never happened but that I always wished had happened.

_Zb54kUoe_OUUYr9vuEwOw.text: I ordered the Welcome burger with the mac and cheese (highly recommend the mac&cheese!!!!!!) Also had the dessert biscuits with the goat cheese and jam - amazing! Def worth it for my first time in Phoenix.

zPXjobM5Mz-qCgORjXS8tQ.text: I'm TORN. Between writing this review for the staff an owners of welcome and the potential influx of customers. This diner has been an very meaningful and influential part of my Arizona life. From meeting some of my best friends to my roommate that allowed me to move just two blocks away from this amazing place. To late night burger runs to a disappointed Monday bike ride, I've loved it all. If I had my Monday back for every welcome burger I've had I might actually be able to afford a car but I regret nothing. I feel for the staff that deals with the question of alterations on their already perfect menu. (Written while listening to the dumbest of request)   I may move onto other states of employment and residency but I hope to forever return to a place that has meant so much to me.

iJ82obVMCKmHJZ4G7ATcTw.text: I love everything about this place. Great food, great music jams on the speakers, outdoor patio, late hours, beer... Immensely satisfying biscuits and gravy. Cute Art Deco store front. Everything is perfect in the modern diner way as far as I can tell

b9avNHcUIIGLxp-stYgV8g.text: Welcome Diner has become one of my Phoenix favorites.   It's hard to tell which stands out the most, their amazing food preparations or their welcoming staff.   1st patronage: we were able to sit inside the tiny trailer and the guys who were working that day were awesome. Great customer service, made us feel known and welcomed! That day I enjoyed the Welcome Burger with no regrets! Husband got the Big Jim & was very satisfied!   2nd patronage: I popped by for an iced coffee (they serve Lux brew) , and the gal working (can't remember her name now, but she's got blue hair ;) was super friendly! She even hooked me up with a refill for the price of free, I was like wow, these folks are nice :)  3rd patronage: we weren't feeling meat, so we tried the Vegan Po' Boy...was surprised at what a delicious sandwich it was, nothing poor about it!   Their fries are the best around. Their coleslaw is distinct. Their service is appreciated. I'm looking forward to enjoying more meals here.   I'm busy and really don't have time to write reviews, but I'll type one up for a local business I want to support! They also use all local AZ grown ingredients folks.   Don't be intimidated by the humble surroundings from the outdoor seating area. It's comfortable and unpretentious, a sweet little spot to enjoy some real good food.

SceSebzax-i0CosxRWyJTA.text: Great comfort food...happy hour Tuesday is awesome.  Go hungry and then don't eat the next day to make up for it.  Pork fries were just awesome.

The food I ordered, fried green tomato sandwich and the big Jim, were very flavorful and tasty!  Con's: Big Jim needed more gravy!  It was so good but after 2 bites the gravy was gone and I was left with dry biscuit on awesome fried chicken. So the two bites I had...great!  The rest....a little dry.  And I hate to say it, but it took 45 minutes to get our food, 30 to get a single drink order.  This killlllss me!! Buuut it is a small place.    Verdict:  Glad I went and had a great time!  Will I be back?  Nope.  Once was enough

5bTaIz1H_d8giT2dEPDApQ.text: Such a cool atmosphere! Small diner-car walk up with lighted outdoor seating. The PB&B burger was amazing, and my wife had a sort of fried chicken biscuit sandwich that she loved. Our cocktails were yummy too! Pretty pricey though! Be prepared to drop at least $40 for 2 people, $50 with booze.

On_6Q8BPkRTibShq7cQmsg.text: I went here a while ago when they were selling food out of a small trailer and it was delicious then. Now they've upgraded and their food is still amazing! We sat at the kitchen side bar by the cooks and I was thoroughly impressed with their organization and communication skills. The chefs cooking right in front of you showed more professionalism then some top restaurants I've been to. They moved around their space like a dance and cook the food perfectly! I sat and was mesmerized by the three cooks technique! They communicated so well with each other about cooking times and were just nailed every dish I watched them make. We ate Friday night after the nine inch nails concert on 9-14-18 and just so you know Welcome Diner, the three chefs you had working that night impressed my boyfriend and I so much! It was two males and one female. Kudos to those three especially and the rest of the staff was amazing as well! I ate the Gumbo and it had nopales (cactus) in it, which was marvelous! The flavor was amazing and I was so impressed with the presentation. My boyfriend had the chorizo meatloaf and he was very satisfied! Both dishes had unique Hispanic flare to them but kept the classic flavor your expecting. Chorizo Meatloaf! Such a great idea! Thank you Welcome Diner for having such unique and delicious food!

G6Jkiac8BDilWXilb-cBSw.text: The atmosphere and food is amazing! We did wait a little too long for our food to come out but this place is one of the cutest diners in Phoenix!
