gOreV1o0IWUtaMX35PuWAg.text: Love at first bite! The food(I ordered burgers and fries) was very delicious. The place is easy to found. Outdoor seating was available. Went to the restaurant by myself. And will come with my friends next time.

oh1Z8cTqn-dpImNEW9odNg.text: This was definitely a fun place to check out! It felt very unique and what I imagined to be representative of the community.  It was fun that all the seating was outside. I wasn't very interested in their drink options... but they did have a great selection of food items. I got the fish po'boy sandwich. The main problem I had with this was how much liquid came out. Once I picked it up a puddle soon developed on my plate and if I put my sandwich down it would get soggy. Well after holding it for a extended period of time with the juices running down my arms, and watching my husband eat all the fries, I finally put it down to grab a few. So then the bottom of my sandwich became extremely soggy. But the fish was still very good. And the sauce they gave us for the fries was also very good! I just wish their cups had been bigger.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good vibes

kBowdX5OyKrixH9W0MVpcQ.text: Incredible place. You can tell the owners put a lot of care into their recipes. Seems like they opened it on a budget, since the restaurant is an old, small diner trailer put on a lot in a not-so-great part of town (area has improved dramatically since they started, it's now a decent area). There are some bar seats inside, but the main dining area is a patio. I love the character of this diner. It's unique and friendly.  My biggest complaint is that it could take up to 45 minutes for your food come out depending on how busy they are. However, the patio is a nice place to wait and enjoy drinks while you're waiting. Guessing this is a result of their tiny kitchen in the trailer and I hesitate to mention this complaint, since without that tiny kitchen Welcome Diner wouldn't be what it is.

Zy57meQQT5RJOgcouQqetQ.text: I've never actually eaten here, but this place is the best because once a year they put on a local 24 hour movie festival where they challenge local film makers to go out and make a movie in 24 hours. The have to use a line of the organizer choosing the script as well as a prop of some kind. It's so much fun when they have the viewing and awards party the following weekend. I highly recommend this place.

B16lwNeMLW_UyRCg0JDutw.text: Really great food and an amazingly cute spot. Staff is friendly and seated us right away on a busy Sunday morning. It offers a cozy charm with yummy options for any group. Will be back. :)

1SvsYtLpqZYPoq7HI-PfmA.text: Such a great find! Cute, heart warming diner with an amazing menu! Food was out of the world! Can't wait to go back and try more things. It made for a fun Friday night adventure into downtown. Thanks to the chef for his inspiration and creativity! So delicious

AX102nxGFFoOBO0K4te6fw.text: 17.38 for a plate.. not a bowl. Of shrimp and grits is a little crazy.   Don't get me wrong the flavor was good. But, for nearly 18 dollars I should have had a whole bowl of grits. Mind you, this is the second time I've been disappoint here.  The first time was with flavorless fried green tomatoes, which broke my heart. I really wish I could say I loved this place. The idea is great, but i feel for the price, the menu needs to be reworked.

RfMvvqwl72RvzQA4mKZ68g.text: I haven't been to the new location yet but wanted to express my admiration for Welcome Diner! Their food is very creative and the atmosphere is very.... welcoming! Check it out!!

EdvAmSCOOqXvFvCHZHHETQ.text: I've been a big fan since the original location of this place. I REALLY love the Tucson location as well so make sure to check it out if you are in that area! I love that Welcome Diner was able to expand into a bigger location with more seating, because this place is boss! The staff is always very friendly and helpful, which means a lot in this day and age. The food is consistantly perfect and always leaves me satisfied. Their jackfruit alone is enough of a reason to keep me coming, but luckily they have so many more badass options than just that! Everything I've ever had has been delicious over the years (when I was a carnivore and now as a vegetarian), they have options for everyone!

FLB1WsJhj47D3xpLsCwpTA.text: There is not really a bad time to go to welcome dinner (unless you dont like big crowds) I find it fits so many different situations perfectly . this little gem has some of the best food in phoenix . and will for sure fill up even the most hungry of you out there. They don't mess around. Must try spot in down town

A2JxEUD3F3QYB5VaLOFHlg.text: Love it here !!! Love the environment super chill and payed back, and the food it's always fresh . One of my favorite places at the moment!!

MNhyz8raNp8C4Q_qUbFabw.text: Super hip outdoor eatery. Headed down at 12:30 to try their food. Had people coming and going the whole time with a great patio area and lots of seating    We ordered the Big Jim with an egg, the PB&BB, poutine and mac and cheese with bacon.  They have great sausage gravy.  The mac and cheese was amazing and portion was very large as was all the food.   Great friendly staff and a wonderful experience. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mc and cheese with pork

5clJCkymSPc-Ex2w2-3mow.text: Great diner just few minutes from downtown. They balance a good variety of vegan, vegetarian, and omni options at good prices. Patio is dog friendly too which is awesome. I'd reccomend their jackfruit po'boy.

VCq713xkgnPkGWvCz5eDCw.text: Welcome Diner is by far my favorite place to eat. The atmosphere is relaxed and laid back. EVERYTHING I've ever ordered has been delicious, but I particularly recommend the pulled pork (or jackfruit) fries. Love the Welcome brand!

7wgg6SGS3cpnBJpM_cYKow.text: I ate a hamburger from there last night it was amazing am about too go today & get fried tomatoes sandwich

93-OOykh2Xl3XaB4dzMnqA.text: This place is out of this world. Everything was cooked to perfection. 4 thumbs up to the chef/kitchen and whoever sources ingredients.

eeAkiAaLCmDIA_sZf9XjIQ.text: I was nervous when my friend told me our spot moved from the little eclectic spot on the corner, where all but maybe 5 seats were outdoors,  to an indoor spot around the corner. I was thinking that the move probably changed the whole vibe. Guess what?!?! It didn't. They still serve funky craft cocktails and downright delicious food with their signature twists to some pretty traditional meals. Please and Thank you, Welcome Diner!

eo-JMsG3hJukcaKL1TR9Dg.text: This place is killer! The location is cool! Somehow it's cooler than the old location which I loved too! The food is smashing! Meaning I'll smash almost anything in the menu and be happy! Can't go wrong and open late! Pulled pork fires.. any burger on the menu, especially the no way Jose.. the grilled cheese.. Brussel Sprouts! Super chill vibe and cool staff! Can get busy but they also have a huge patio now with more seating!

MaI0MxnN_oAiiycT4ksIUg.text: I have had this place bookmarked forever and ever and was very excited to finally have the opportunity to try it out. As we all know, that can lead to much disappointment but that just was not the case. The food here is as legit as my fellow yelpers have given it credit. For dinner, my wife and I tried to Poutine, the Big Jim, and the PO Boy Sandwich. Here our my thoughts:  Poutine-fries, gravy, and cheese....enough said. The gravy here is amazingly good. My only regret is not having my daughter with me to try it, as she loves a good gravy.   Big Jim-This dish is what one would expect from a five star dish. It was so dang good!!!!!!! Homemade biscuit, gravy, fried chicken, bacon, and cheese. Come on, how could it be better? It couldn't.....this thing was awesome. If you check out my wife's future review, I guarantee she will mention wanting this dish as her last supper. Perfect in every way!!!!  PO Boy- Good dish but not the Big Jim kind of good. My wife liked her sandwich and it was good, but not great. The fish and bread were very fresh. Our only thought, and what do we know, but thinking a dipping sauce of some kind would make this dish so much better. Solid four star item.  Staff here were very outgoing and friendly. The outside seating was comfortable. We were fortunate to have an outside heater near us to keep us cozy.   The diner was all I was hoping it would be and glad I finally had the chance to go. Just wish the hours were more accommodating for their new west valley fans. Will go back for sure if in the area when they are open. A must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sun Up White Russian Stout was so good. Small for $7 in my opinion.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. There mac and cheese competes with my wife&#39;s. Don&#39;t tell her I said that :)

sMzr8B01kSoL21pcSKQEJw.text: This is mine and my girlfriends favorite new spot! There happy hour specials are on point. There food is delicious and the scenery is a perk as well. We enjoy eating outside especially at night. It's lit up like an old school diner. I cannot wait to go again.

1KH8ctrgq1jBWphDDZ2b8g.text: Finally a great restaurant with excellent vibes and service. And its open late?! Me and wifey will be coming here a lot more often.

8gAoU9mUlrM_tzeewocn7g.text: Amazing I ordered the fried green tomatoes crispy tasty probably the best ones I've ever had. The macaroni and cheese with the brussels sprouts was heavenly. And the meatloaf was to die for. The staff was awesome I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Wct-3MCdMlLEs2Q6mY3U3w.text: The new location is a nice, clean diner with a good size outdoor area. On our first time, we only had drinks. We tried the tonic 929. It would be better if it had more lemongrass flavor. Then we tried the old fashion. The luxardo cherry and orange peel made it very tasty. On our second visit, we tried the little bird, seafood etouffe and peanut cook. The biscuit and fried chicken were moist. We would get this again. The seafood etouffee was good but it lacked protein. The cookie had bitter chocolate on top. Together, it was just right, not too sweet or rich. It was still good if you didn't eat it with the chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Etouffee
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Little Bird with watermelon

yGpmA-qerrRD-ESIsGdhfw.text: Service was decent at midnight.  They have some shaws if you're cold outside and far from a heat lamp. Was recommended the pork and grits. It was decent, but not worth $16. $8-10 at best. But not alot open at this time.

oeEflXA4euoK6OBcLqRdUA.text: Just finished having dinner here with my girlfriend. The environment is very hipster, small area, not crowded, and clean. Price was fair, just like any other restaurant.   The service was outstanding. Very friendly and very courteous. I've worked in customer service for many years, and these guys sure know how to deliver quality service.  Will definitely be returning.

VzS_vVj6wYV6Uy0OC9XivQ.text: This place puts out some darn good quality food and in BIG portions for the price! I got the pulled pork bbq biscuit which was huge and so flavorful. My husband got the bumblebee which was a biscuit sandwich with extra crispy fried chicken, honey, and mustard. He said he loved it, but not before he finished it because he didn't want to let me have a taste. We also shared the macaroni and cheese, sooooo creamy with great texture and crunch factor on top! Plus, we got to add chorizo which made that dish my husband's all time fave. My favorite was the pouting fries that we shared. Gaahhhhhh lee that is comfort food at BEST! I'm a ketchup girl but these fries hit all the right notes without any added condiments. The only con about this place is that seating is outdoors. The entire time my husband and I were fighting off flies and picking out debris falling from the tree from our food (it got really windy.) I'm sure the ambiance is much better when the weather isn't so annoying, but this was kind of a turn off for us. However, the food was SO worth fighting a fly army. Would visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork bbq biscuit
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese with chorizo
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken biscuit with honey and mustard

JzJvHF9lkh4AW_ooF8b-kA.text: This place is a darn GEM!!!!  Went here last night as I was told they have amazing burgers, and I'm a burger and beer kinda gal, and OH MAN!!  Literally the best burger I have ever had,  finally somewhere in AZ that actually cooks the burger how you order it. Plus they have brewed in az beers to top it all off. It's hidden in a kinda sketchy neighborhood  but the decor within the restaurant makes you feel comfy and the food is so worth it!  I will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VCzsywR5BFVufoTViWaWYg.text: This place is pretty awesome. Poutin  is great! Very hipster style atmosphere. Mostly outside seating. Located in a little neighborhood. Rough to sit outside during summer months. Friendly staff.

3uhIIM5pWKQnW9RqSSlKZw.text: SO delicious. my husband and i stopped by last night for dinner (after months of talking about coming down). first of all, the place is adorable. it was not insanely hot last night (finally!), so we were excited to sit outside and enjoy some awesome food. i ordered the pulled jackfruit po'boy, my husband ordered the chicken parm special, and we shared a side of fries.  wow. just... awesome. as a vegetarian, it's sometimes a bummer to eat a veggie burger or vegetable sandwich over and over again. nothing makes me happier than to find a menu that has something really cool (and vegan) that i can eat. the po'boy was not easy to eat (my only gripe!), but i definitely did my best and ended up using a fork to scoop up the jackfruit that didn't make it in the sandwich. the bbq sauce is awesome, just the right amount of salty, sweet, spicy, and tangy. the coleslaw was fantastic as well, and the baguette it came on was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. so yummy.  my husband really liked the chicken parm, but can't wait to come back to try the bumblebee biscuit. the fries were also awesome, nice and crispy with a really yummy herbed aioli.  service was great. beer was local and delicious. food was wonderful. music was fun and super loud. all in all, definitely worth five stars.

NPieDAqRp5IpbaWiasE1qA.text: Fun and delicious dinner spot. Get the home made ginger beer. Good for vegetarians. Great atmosphere and friendly people.

4APkcwMhPlHeXzBknESbYA.text: This tiny neighborhood spot virtually looks like either a converted food truck or a small food trailer. Outside on the front lawn are many tables and chairs, as inside you will find only 9 seats at the very retro counter.  The menu is southern comfort food. Super greasy, generous portions, all cooked grilled and prepared in what is probably the smallest kitchen in the valley.  This is the spot for a behemoth burger, biscuits smothered in gravy, and even fried green tomatoes.  With a "biscuits" menu, featuring fried chicken drowning in country gravy, cheddar, and bacon - it is a bypass waiting to happen.  However, there are lighter healthier biscuit choices that come topped with sauteed Kale and fried egg...but this place truly is a destination for abandoning healthy choices and diving head first into fat and calories.

jarwEUztwC4yEcjHp_VL8Q.text: Best comfort food in the Valley! Absolutely nothing fancy and the wait is sometimes long, but WELL worth it. I've tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Reasonable prices and a friendly hard working staff. Hate to share this and risk more people going but this place deserves every bit of great exposure it can get.

3uPW_fHN8lpUoXRw8jjnnQ.text: Enticed by the rave reviews, we decided to try this place out. It was ridiculously expensive for what you get. Not great for kids as there are no kids menu options and they wouldn't serve a smaller portion of the $8 mac and cheese "snack" when I asked. Also no high chairs or booster seats. My husband had the biscuits and gravy which he said were tasty, but nothing special to warrant the high price. I had a cheeseburger ordered medium rare and fries. The fries were shoestring. Not my favorite, but fries are fries. First bite into the burger and bloody juices exploded in my face and all over. The burger was rare, at best. It was dropping and the bun got instantly soggy. Absolutely disgusting and a turnoff!

r3OfHJIWzwa6Eq_XUPxBoQ.text: Great service!! Very friendly!! We came on a Friday night so the kitchen was a little backed up but it was worth the wait. Definitely recommend!!

XbTUgFuLEm-ZiqdAerVmMg.text: A great spot to come to for some late night dining. The food isn't amazing, it's greasy and certainly not healthy, but at 1am who cares. Definately not the cleanest joint in town, but character makes up for it. I reccomend it if you've got no other options.

oCjQEVb-KlFwcWOhZmVYew.text: Had to update my review to share that I had dinner here last weekend for the final day of Arizona Cocktail Week. Of course, I couldn't pass up half priced hurricanes!  I tried the Vegan Po'boy (fried avocado, kale, pico de gallo and chipotle remoulade on french bread) and it was magical...but left me wondering how the heck do you fry avocados? No, seriously??? I'm sure google will tell me later which will lead to fun experiments in the kitchen....   Customer service is top notch--everyone that works here is super friendly and the wait time for food wasn't too shabby. I really love the vibe of this place and predict many visits in the future. Day or night, this place is one of the top restaurants in Phoenix.

--k-_y2ESr1sJuxokk5UaQ.text: Hearty diner food with good flavors. Nothing extraordinary. Limited menu. Was hoping for an Acai bowl or green drink but that's not this type of place. The real downer was the small dining space which was super noisy and not cozy. Hipster place with a rustic industrial/farm decor. Overhyped but super popular with college crowd.  Friendly service:)

mFCHo3PY6EVM3qb5eBxMaw.text: Honestly, what can I say about this quaint spot that hasn't already been said? Hubby DEVOURED the Big Jim and I enjoyed the PB&B. We had the fries and holy cannoli, everything was cooked to perfection and oh so yummy. Wayne was attentive and friendly and even though the place was packed with millennials and hipsters, we felt very much at ease and WELCOME. We are looking forward to visiting their new spot in Tucson next week when we visit relatives.  Thanks guys for making this middle aged couple feel at home! Your name certainly is appropriate :)

KetX1ukfncIJjnMsAKJLBA.text: Amazing food and a quaint little spot.  Can be confusing to order, but we figured it out.  The food was delicious!  After a concert it hit the spot!  My only dislike was bottled soda...I just love a glass of ice.  If I'm in the neighborhood I will come back here for sure!!!

P2e6x0b0dDIfMlojuMAeGA.text: This place has amazing food.  I had the fish and it was so good.  Spicy!   The drinks are really good too.  Check out the Ginger beer.   Come for happy hour and enjoy

_TFjoYxXZNOInDMtOjMpog.text: Such a cute and delicious place! Perfect for date night! Great drink list and the food was amazing.

OQtgFi0DbnGXg_KhrzH-0A.text: We have been waiting for more than an hour for our food on a Sunday night... I hope that it is worth this ridiculously long wait!

M0LxwuqCV_8FU4m4xXbyyw.text: Food is great. Brunch is a time I go regularly on the weekends.  Bloody Mary's? Yes please!! Some of the best in town. Dining al fresco?  Yes please!! Picnic benches and people watching. Wonderful southern style grub? Yes please!! Food is GREAT! Just perfectly greasy and flavorful. That's a compliment!!  Service? Excellent, friendly and knowledgeable. Prices....? A tad high, but sooooooooo worth it!!

Cw9CpqmQqd6FcSSGf8sJog.text: Whhhhaaaat?! I have not reviewed these guys?! It's possibly because I was hoping to keep them my little secret. These guys took their Old Dixie food truck and took over this unique and eclectic location that has been home to other popups over the last couple of years. Inside seating is VERY limited 8 built in stools against a small counter. I love sitting inside but I often enjoy their out door seating during the summer and especially on these beautiful Phx winter nights. [They do lunch and brunch as well.]   The Food: I have enjoyed everything I have tried here. They are known  for their biscuits, which are fairly large, sturdy enough to be used in their biscuit sandwiches but tender enough to enjoy with their homemade honey butter (the honey sourced from a small apiary in the neighborhood) or house made jelly/preserves or apple butter. Many of their veggies are often sourced out of the community garden when possible. They source locally as much as possible, and their menu adjusts seasonally, while keeping some of their popular favorites. They always offer vegetarian options and occasionally even vegan. [Skip the goat cheese on the beet tureen salad and that is a yummy vegan option]   They make all food to order and honor substitutions or additions within reason.  Heck, for dinner one night I ordered their biscuit with goat cheese and smoked apple butter (found on the dessert menu) and asked if they could add bacon.  They gave me a bit of a raised eyebrow as they found the request unique and gladly served it up (and it was SOOO good)   My favorites: Anything with their fried chicken.  Anything with their biscuits.  Their french fries are  hand cut and fabulous.  They smoke their own meats  (and sometimes apples for their smoked Apple butter) so try the Carolina or any smoked  sausage, pork chop, etc. that shows up on the specials board.  Their burgers rock! (YOU HAVE to try the PB&B, well unless you have a peanut allergy).  Their salads are lovely and tasty.   They offer some select cocktails and a limited choice of liquor. But this doesn't matter because all you need to know is get a HURRICANE (or 3). You'll thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hermosa...mimosa with their signature hurricane juice blend. #YesPlease #Bottomless
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Jim. Fried chicken breast, bacon, cheddar &amp; country gravy (sausage or mushroom) on one of their famous biscuits.

ME_RpFpQsj_bYmNxeRbUgg.text: This place was the only Thing within walking distance of where we stayed. It is mostly outdoor seating and the menu is pretty limited. The $4 whiskey sours were pretty good. The sandwiches were original. Fried green tomato for instance but they were 9-$10 and not all that filling.  The pulled pork fries fro $8 was a large portion but my girlfriend and I had indigestion all night, something that hasn't happened since I was a kid...just too much fat.

0ftfqrYbWE4JYoxi8TrZrA.text: OMG this spot was the best! My bf and I went and got chicken biscuits, I can't remember the name of the sandwiches but they were fire!

Pazq-hEKAbW6Kb1D8viCSQ.text: Outstanding food, friendly and cool wait staff. The fried green tomato sandwich was unbelievably awesome. Never had anything like it. Drinks are good and reasonable. They actually make their own tonic for the gin and tonic drink. How cool is that? I will be back to try everything else on their menu as it all looked outstanding when other customers were served. The burger and Mac n cheese combo looked pretty good- will try that next time.

rCKRIJyPUVtTx3a3_UBv9A.text: What a treat! The Welcome Diner really encompasses the Downtown Phoenix "feel". They had the actual old, historic diner building shipped from the east coast, completely renovated, and plopped right in Downtown!  Come here for the righteous chicken sandwiches and greasy burgers! A PBR will sweeten the deal, if the laid back, back-yard ambiance doesn't do it for ya.

2J-CY676ia3-_H37Hjq8uw.text: How cool is this place? It's definitely in a 'transitional' area of town, but the clientele when we were there was fully gentrified: skinny jeans, back tattoos, and beards all around. We didn't get any food, but the drink menu is awesome and seriously affordable ($6 for specialty cocktails?!). I love how you order at the window and they bring your order out to you. I'm all for a good-tasting drink over a booze-y one, but these actually seemed to venture to the weak side - FYI.

3BHSzHDHLIQYA2loun52aw.text: Super cool, eclectic, very old diner from the 1940's. I did not like the burger I got but to be fair I knew it was just me and not them. I got the PB Burger which I am guessing is an acquired taste that I have not yet acquired. Ha! So I wiped off the PB and devoured all the ingredients separately for this review. I was pretty happy with the results. All the ingredients were delish. The burger juicy and tasty. For some reason I was nuts about their pickles. lol. I love pickles but these were extra wonderful to me. I also liked their Brussel Sprouts. Super cool and friendly staff too.

1cy-nMXsmsEb2hvSD0F3Tg.text: Just get the Welcome Burger...I've had me a lot of burgers in Phoenix.  This one takes the cake!  Also, I recommend giving their homebrewed ginger beer a shot!  I promise you won't regret it.  I can't stop thinking about that burger!

NNayFhITG-6Lfbc4pCLr0A.text: I received an invite from a co-worker to meet here for dinner and had no idea what to expect. Having "Diner" in the name is misleading. It is an old diner and has lots of character. But the name is more appropriate if it references the patrons.  The food is amazing and creative. I am not the kind of person who seeks out locally sourced anything, but it really sets this place apart! They make their own ginger beer for crying out loud...  If you're near downtown and not afraid to go a little off the beaten path, you will not be disappointed!

uqxHkaMmophQoExIvuLYrg.text: The Little Bird was amazing! I prefer my Mac n Cheese baked, but the portion size exceeded my expectations. Louisiana Pure Crystal Hot Sauce makes everything taste better tho! The Hurricane was perfect and the Wiskey Sour meh. Will be back to taste the jackfruit fries, a burger and beignets!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dUrJnwAD4XGYMATTZ9WE1g.text: Great atmosphere to be in, especially when it's late and you're wanting to eat a nice meal! I always get the macaroni with bacon and its so delicious  :) Wonderful people here!

8mL7fa1pkSN7OxqBmrapcQ.text: This quaint diner is set in downtown Phoenix in a residential area. They do not have much for children, thus may not be the best place for family with toddlers. Because it's outside seating, it's best to go in the evening when weather is cooler. I had the no way Jose burger  which was very tasty, and my 11 yr old had the Mac&cheese; she loves it! They cool to order so you may have to wait awhile before your food is served. We waited about 25mins. I will definitely go back again and try some of their biscuits and gravy dishes.

MUWvrOOCNbj-lOKet7NgyQ.text: I had the bumblebee biscuit with the brussel sprouts - both were phenomenal! We placed our order and the waiter told us that everything is made homemade and has won awards. It was hard to choose!   We ended with the begniets which were not great - they were giant and heavy and had a lemon aftertaste that I wasn't a fan of.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Welcome Diner!

Lz0EEQ3IqzbiEHPfUpknRQ.text: I went here on a Saturday night. Everything was great, especially the food, except for how long we had to wait. It felt like an hour. I had to cancel my after dinner plans because it took so long.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UpQoPCp128HNGcZLEiGd1g.text: After having lunch at 4pm and being super hungry after leaving a concert, the Welcome Diner was just what I needed at 11pm.  I asked for the sunrise biscuit but subbed Brussels sprouts for the biscuit.  Chorizo, fried egg, aioli deliciousness.  They also had a yellow watermelon ginger beer that was phenomenal.  Open late, eclectic, unique, and scrumptious.  What a treat, Phoenix!

0b07-oTnd8M80tHqKvQsYQ.text: Great food. Great drinks. Open late so if ya do go put and still want to get food ya can. Check out the sluricane. It's a very tasty potent drink.

cM1CTSDU4oxqHIMVVKeaZg.text: We are from Oakland, the land of hipster restaurants. This one is super cool and the nighttime weather in Phoenix makes sitting outside that much better than the cold nights of Oakland. The food was amazing. I had their bumblebee biscuit, watermelon salad, and homemade fruit punch. It was all more than delicious and was extremely fresh. The ambiance really sets it apart and makes the whole experience worth it. Theres something about eating good food on a warm evening, sitting at a picnic table under twinkie lights, an catching up with friends that really makes an verage night special and memorable. Thanks Welcome Diner. The staff are very friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Carol biscuit. Yum!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon salad and Bumblebee biscuit. Yum!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ambiance? Check!

N1FwCcFpni0gqO-Kb8VPDQ.text: Amazing food, great drinks, and serves food till 2 am. Definitely recommend the jambalaya, sooo bomb!

ySYjJHNyKHailBl_l2-x3g.text: This is my favorite place in town. Their food is out of this world. Im a vegetarian and they have so many options for me. My favorite things on the menu are: Mac n cheese with Brussel sprouts and the jack fries. Their fried green tomato sandwich is phenomenal as well.  I highly recommend this place to anyone.

7cDh9a2m5vOFCBWwmEtgfw.text: I would have given 4.5 stars, but, you get it.  Loved my experience at Welcome. The casual nature was inviting and the food was outstanding. The cocktails were slightly underwhelming, but overall, I can't wait to come back for a second visit!

I3c5KKcCzgHwmOlRXLl_4g.text: This is the first restaurant I have eaten at in Phoenix, at the recommendation of a local, and it really set the tone of the rest of our food-ventures here in Phoenix.  the ATMOSPHERE is amazing. You drive up to this old, tiny diner with a variety of seating in front of it, and strings of lights hung up around the eating area. The vibe is very chill and feels like a funky neighborhood joint. You definitely feel at home, and I love that everyone feels welcome.   When ordering your FOOD you go up to a tiny window of the trailer and after find a seat. Once your food is ready, they call your name and bring your food over to your table. I was deciding between the Bumblebee biscuit sandwich and the Fried Green tomato sandwich. The guy at the counter said I should try the green tomato sandwich, so I did. AND IT WAS AWESOME.  It is seriously  a perfect combination of the crispy battered tomato plus the sweet corn and the savory spread and the crunchy sourdough bringing it all together. Such a genius sandwich! We also shared a poutine which was just gravy and yellow cheese (just different than other poutine that I have had). The gravy tasted really homemade and delicious.  The SERVICE was great. Everyone was friendly and very laid back and they really made you feel at ease.  I would say that the ONLY NEGATIVE is that once you get your food, the flies immediately sense it and are all over it. It just gets annoying, but it's not like anyone can control mother nature.

CYt5-g2_F53lIzNyojrojw.text: If I was on death row and had one last meal... this would have to be it. Welcome Diner offers hands down the most hearty, homey, savory, authentic food in Phoenix. My favorites include the Big Jim (chicken biscuit w/ gravy + bacon) and the PB&B. But everything is great. Awesome atmosphere and employees, can't ask for anything more. O4o9ETrFUeFauIOmuUuQIQ.text: Oh my diner oh my diner oh my Diii-ner on Roosevelt--  So I usually don't eat at diners because food ain't all that great.  But where there is jackfruit I will follow.  Welcome Diner on Roosevelt and 10th Streets sells a lot of burgers and booze but they also offer a jackfruit po'boy ($8) and several other interesting veggie dishes.  Even though I fancy the taste of sweet, juicy, ripe jackfruit, it's also scrumptious when cooked and used like a vegetable.  This is the fourth spot where I've had jackfruit in a sandwich (or taco) and 'twas delicious.    Paired with a cabbage slaw that adds crunch to the 'wich, the flavor was mild and hearty.  I requested no BBQ sauce because that sickly sweetness would have disturbed the taste of the fruit.  My only regret is no side was included in the price.  Welcome Diner also sells a fried green tomato sammich. ($8.5)  Doesn't that sound delicious?   [crickets]  Doesn't it?  Okay, well maybe it's just me.  And lesson learned:   "Sounding" delicious and tasting delicious are two entirely different senses.  The sourdough was oily, toasted with a few slices of breaded fried tomatoes laid in-between.  And a fried tomato is...well...it tastes...uhhhh...urrrr...well...well, at least it's a vegetable, damn it Janet.    No side either.   If it wasn't for the arugula, corn relish, and ranch dressing on the sandwich, it would have been a complete disappointment.  Ya' hurd meh?  Complete. Disappointment.     And so TOMATO gets added to the list of things that should not be fried and passed off as food.  (That list is quite long, but let me not diverge from the review.)     Anyway, I will return someday for another jackfruit po'boy, but at $8 bucks with no side, my next visit won't be too soon.

n47d7neT3MSRSddT9hR00g.text: Came here bcuz of the reviews on Yelp. I have had some amaaazing chicken in my life. I can honestly say, I'll always remember this place! The food is simply some of the best I've had-period. It's local, hipster, retro, and just that good!

rEkT3tDsNSIxZP8aX_Z1TQ.text: Found out about this place via a Yelp email that was advertising places in my area. After checking out the reviews and the menu, my wife and I decided to grab a late dinner here on a Friday night. As soon as we arrived I noticed this place just had an awesome vibe to it. Friendly staff, laid back patio seating, and the food is beyond amazing. We had the Fried Green Tomato sandwich, Little Birdy fried chicken biscuit, Fries, and a glass bottle Coke (the kind sweetened with real sugar).   In a nutshell: Love this place. fq0dng4V41KIE4Pj2wsm8Q.text: The Big Jim (apparently their best-selling item) is a deep-fried breaded chicken patty with two biscuits and some other toppings. Along with a small amount of sausage gravy. Unfortunately, it doesn't work. It's too much bread and not enough flavor. Sausage gravy is tasteless. Only two hot sauces are offered. Tabasco and Crystal. Even with that, food needs more flavor. From what I can gather, very little nuance or spice is used in their food. unfortunately, it's all very pricey for above average diner food.   Very limited beer selection (4 taps - nothing special). More focus on cocktails.  Great space, they're all working very hard, super friendly service.  The bathroom is smaller than an airplane bathroom. You are literally in a mobile home restaurant. Not much they can do about that, but it's very cramped.  Great patio!  3 1/2 stars.

vd-ivN_VBwhddyjQF5evDw.text: Came here for happy hour on Friday evening. Their happy hour ran from 5pm (when they open) until 7pm. They have a good mix of drink deals (like $1 off draft beer and $6 cocktails) and food specials. I had the little birdie and the pork fries. The little birdie sandwich was very good, but I wish the batter in the fried chicken had a little more seasoning to it. The biscuit was great though,  nice and soft. The pork fries were great, the cabbage slaw on top of them was just the right topping. Overall, this place is definitely worth checking out. It has a great trendy atmosphere and their menu items are wonderful!

zVZ9qBTk4WSH4LZm_-tMdg.text: The place is...quirky (hipster?) And it's mostly outside so remember that in the summer! Everyone we talked to was really nice and the food was great. You can tell they really put passion into the food, even if they're just making you a biscuit sandwich (the guy even pointed out how he hand-made everything on the plate).    A good place to hang when the weather is cooler but I wouldn't take a girl there on a first date.

q3SF1fwndphe_AVZLIoQ7g.text: I got a burger here and it was absolutely amazing. So good that I just had to return a week later to try the other burger on the menu. I also got a few bites of the fried chicken biscuit, the mac and cheese, and the gumbo. All very good (but the burger totally wins).

5b1Wx5JCSirJT4nGeqnqZA.text: Wow. WOW. WOWWWWW!  Man. THIS PLACE. Fantastic. Utterly awesome inside and out.   The patio scene here is great. The food is great. The jams are great. The people are great. This is an all around great spot to grab some delicious food. I tried the fish po'boy, the PB burger (name?), and the fries with pulled pork. All were choice. Hell, even the coleslaw is pretty damn tasty. Check this place out, sit back, take it all in (the neighborhood adds a little bit of sketch to the whole thing, but it makes it feel kinda quaint), and get stuffed. Oh, and be sure to put hot sauce on everything.   Jesus, I am still in a food coma...

wIyCA6cwbpTBMntYmIrLPA.text: Oh wow! Found this lil' gem by tapping around the Yelp map after arriving at Sky Harbor, and not wanting Mexican. Feels pretty sketchy en route, like there's no way there's a 5 star diner around this corner, couldn't be more wrong! Hands down, best joint in all of Phoenix. Quaint outdoor seating and the most incredible home cooked southern style dinning. Every single thing was delicious.

ztBjnwcS68su-BPNgji3UA.text: The outdoor scenery is very elegant. the food was really enjoyable and pleasant. I really enjoy the fun feeling it has to it. very classy to go to and have a great dinner and drinks!

degX39Mb7SZdV6n_SgS5Fg.text: Amidst a dusty, but up and coming neighborhood, there's a corner of red paint and light which is Welcome Diner. Love the quaintness and the neighborhood feel (I'm worried they will lose some of their charm when they move locations). Arrived on a Saturday night and there was such limited seating; the place was packed! Ordered their arugula and watermelon salad: fresh and tasty, but honestly, not worth the hype. Also tried the "Koko" and the "Carol". The Koko is a fried chicken sandwich with a chipotle ranch sauce-good and a bit spicy! The Carol was better; pulled pork topped with somewhat spicy coleslaw--this dish was a great, complexity of flavors that melded well together. Will have to return to try more of their dishes!

iKF6pRSbGInSAJJUiQMrrQ.text: Great people and amazing food.   A cute place with a great patio.   Indoor seating is very limited with only about 10 seats at the counter.   We had the fried green tomato sandwich and loaded Mac n cheese.   Food was exceptional.    We will return!

-bsS76ec3Q0AoWqTJ8rxVg.text: I love love love this place! Old Diner turned modern with a retro vibe! Super super super nice employees. Everyone was so helpful, friendly, sweet and passionate about this place and their jobs here. It's not just a job it's a community of people. I felt like I was picnicking in the south on a hot summer night in downtown Phoenix! Farm to table delicious food and drinks.

-LiKGdgQ92zsx6R-Vu1Yzw.text: Although a little pricier than I'd prefer, I'm giving Welcome Diner 5 stars for the delicious locally-produced food, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, and the outgoing people who work there. You know a restaurant has something good going when a college student is willing to pay $10 for a watermelon salad. Or $5 for french fries with an egg on top (seriously, you have to try it. So delicious.) Welcome Diner has a unique operation--in the warm Arizona months, Welcome Diner operates from 5pm to midnight, and during the cool Arizona months, it's open for brunch and lunch. Whenever you happen to visit, you'll be greeted warmly, offered delicious food, and given a wonderful starry opportunity to enjoy the night (or morning) with dear friends.

nhh4DsLtlx018-MoMqnr7w.text: Finally! A brand new Welcome Diner location where you can actually sit inside during the blistering Phoenix heat!   Well, that's if you're lucky. Show up on the weekends after 6pm and you can forget about it.  Anyway, what I've always liked about "Welcome" is the simplicity of their menu. The options are not overwhelming, the quality is extremely high, and the food is sourced from all the right places. While not everything I've had here is perfect, it's very difficult to go wrong with most of their options.  Once I point out a handful of hipster cliches to my girlfriend, I always feel a little more at ease once I see that we're not the only people in our thirties dining here. Everyone can come here - even if you're not wearing a beanie or have a beard.   As for the food, classic staples are all found here, carried over from their old location, such as my all-time favorite grilled cheese sandwich in all of its smokiness. The spectacular chicken biscuit sandwiches, burgers that put most places to shame, and those damned poutine fries that everyone seems to crave.  Desserts are tough. You might find yourself thrilled with something, but might end up damning other customers to hell for depleting their inventory of something you were hoping to try. I've tried a variety of their pies, which are all just fine - but not really anything that I feel stands out.   Anyway, I still give Welcome Diner high praise for proving that not all diner food has to be greasy, disgusting, low-grade crap. When the right people are running the show, Welcome's loyal fanbase is very much deserved.   Highly recommended!

_vL70LGhYAO5GXxr2lyvBg.text: I very much wanted to like this place.  The reviews were great and I liked the against the grain atmosphere they seem to have.  Unfortunately, the hostess was very rude and dismissive of us so first impressions were negative.  As the evening continued I realized that she was treating everyone that way so at least it wasn't just us.    We ordered a few different things from the menu so we could try a lot and while I don't have any gripes about the food I wasn't impressed enough to want to go back.

GHKjQmtSyeseZq2Jk-vdrQ.text: Open late which is a plus. Eclectic menu. Translate: there might not be something that appeals. We got the pulled pork on fries.  Beware the BBQ sauce is mustard-based. Fries were good but wasn't in the mood for the mustard taste.  Ordered the mac n cheese and Brussels sprouts instead but they were just out (obviously liked/ordered by other patrons!).   Our awesome waiter gave us a break on a slice of pie and drink.  Would go back and try their bar drinks.

P160rWtuf0rKeVMKDp_OgA.text: The diner is cute more outdoor seating, then indoor seating. We (4 of us) had to wait about 45 minutes to be seated that wasn't horrible but we asked to see a menu while we waited and the hostess said she would see if she could find one... We watched the two servers scramble around really not paying attention to customers one customer was ready to pay and it took 15 minutes for the server to take their payment which meant we had to wait an additional 15 minutes. Service was s-l-o-w finally after 20 minutes someone came over and took our order we ordered the poutine fries first but got them the same time we got our food also note getting a water filter would be great Arizona water is horrible and not filtering it makes it undrinkable. The food was different we had the Seafood etoufee, Jambalaya, Gumbo and Burger. It was tasty but nothing really special...Please note both servers were very nice just not as attentive as one would like.

1QJAO8qxvDDWKgWlQAzuwQ.text: The first time I saw this place, I felt so curious and decided to give it  a try. This place is a labor of love, from the mountains of delicious comfort food to the impressively functional bar squeezed next to the griddle. I love this place and it loves me back. You must check this out!

F3qlDsUGcAI6e2AmrhBNWg.text: The new location is so much better. The counter seats kept the diner feel but much more space. The food was on point. The patio is still the best seat in the Garfield area. Definitely stop in if you are downtown.  Hidden Gem!!

WuXfifr7xy1qQjbIGYhkaw.text: Welcome to AHHH-mazing.. at this cozy Welcome Diner! My exact words as I tried my first bite was, "Ok.. this would be my last meal on earth if I had to pick one."  That is saying a lot considering my love for good food.  I'm not sure if I truly meant it or I was in a food coma  Either way, it's on a top favorite list now.   This place has charm and is sure to impress your tastebuds.  We sat outside on a rustic picnic table with white lights, heat lamps and ate some seriously good grub. The hubby got the "Big Jim" which I'm not sure I can find words to describe. A home made biscuit with the best gravy you could ever ask for, fried chicken and bacon under it all. One bite of this thing and you will be hooked.  I can't say enough about this dish.. just GET IT.  I went for the healthier grilled fish sandwich, which was loaded with flavor.  An extremely well seasoned piece of fish and some slaw on top.  We also got a side of fries smothered in the famous, fabulous, unforgettable gravy. This Diner also serves mixed drinks if you'd like to visit and kick back a while.   The Welcome Diner should be bookmarked on everyone's Yelp!  I'm not sure about the other items on the menu but I imagine they are outstanding.

ENjpdTGdLOGa0jXkdjjY7Q.text: Went in Wednesday night for my first time, and I'll definitely be back. That kitchen holds it down !

_07zsDPQ_5tJzRKCupQghg.text: I think  most importantly to note is their music choice. Plus there wasnt a single grumpy old person in sight. My girlfriend (@julia) liked the gravy from the poutine so much she quite literally licked the plate clean and asked to get a trough of it later that night. The burger was pretty cool. The bacon jam was super sick. I fully support everything about this establishment.

t0uAtB01G6w_RsWzzIPIHQ.text: REVIEWER #667th:   Well first of all I want to start this review off by saying that I'm honored to be The one to move us past the 666th review. I would like to thank all my in-laws for bringing me to the welcome dinner to make this all possible.  This place is actually pretty nice and the food is actually pretty good. I'll be honest I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. Their homemade ginger beer is a must. I pretty much ordered half the menu all the items on the menu were super solid:  Luxardo Salad 5/5: They did a great job on this one the go cheese was not overwhelming and it was balanced out by the apples they offer a dressing on the side which there really was no need for and I never used.  Jumbayala 5/5: probably the best jambalaya I have ever had. My only qualm about this one is I asked if it was spicy he said no. I'm kind of a wimp when it comes to spicy food and it was in my opinion decently spicy. But the texture was amazing perfect balance of chicken.  BIG JIM 5/5: The key to this being so good is 100% the biscuit. The biscuit is moist and a perfect complement to the gravy and chicken. The portion is definitely enough to fill a person.   Beignets 4/5: The beignets  are pretty good but they are pretty deep fried as well. I like my Beignets  a little bit softer on the inside.   Goat cheese and preserves 2/5: this was probably the only downside to my meal. I think they should've made the preserves a little bit sweeter as it is a dessert. The goat cheese overwhelmed the taste and made it kind of sour.     Summary: we went there around 10 PM, outside seating was nice nice ambience to the place the table we sat at had not been cleared and we had to go ask somebody to clear it, or we could've played it ourselves but they didn't have a place for that. There was a drunk lady that was smoking next to us that I had to ask her to put our cigarette, but she was fairly kind about it. But then 20 minutes later another guy lit one up a feet away from us.   The smoking is the primary reason I gave it 4/5 stars. I would've liked to of seen management be a little bit stricter on that. Nobody wants to breathe in your nasty smoke when they're trying to enjoy a meal with their family. They do have bicycle parking, and you can rent some on the street as well. They're open late which is nice as well. Overall I really enjoyed it and would go back! :)

djq-S_z10O0KBgDjXsPGSw.text: This place was a nice neighbourhood diner. We had breakfast stuff and everything tasted really good. (French toast, eggs and a fried chicken sandwich) We sat at the bar and were able to watch the chefs cook all the food which was pretty cool, especially for my 10 year old... it was good entertainment for her! If you want to have a bite to eat at a local diner this is the place for you.

mpwfqDTzTvcj2Ue7TaTsuQ.text: The Welcome Diner was super WELCOMING, living up to its name! It was our first stop after landing in Phoenix. They treated us like old friends and made sure we knew the best spots to enjoy on our stay here.   The BBQ Jackfruit sandwich was bomb (NY slang for AMAZING!)   Really wish I could take the whole staff and restaurant back to New York with me. Thanks guys =D

RLNUUn22IFCEyFIxIgV9Pg.text: This place rocks!! Definitely a great spot for a comfort food fix...with a twist. We tried the happy hour menu and were impressed that the portions were huge! On our list to try was the "Little Birdy," "poutine fries," and "jackfruit BBQ fries." That hit crunchy, hearty and unusually delicious - really though we accidentally got an order of the regular pork BBQ fries when we tried the jackfruit. The service was fast and friendly. We loved the laid back atmosphere accented by the neon light of the diner. You HAVE TO check this spot out!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tasB8lLK6wZtGx9n2WoggA.text: amazing vegan mac!! and the cook is fine AF!!  oh and the whiskey sour is crazy good!!

USHJ-hqaEeMeBiE1qFvTog.text: I felt truly welcomed the moment I walked in the door. Jesse sat us quickly and had the best personality. He also provided quick service to get drinks going for us while our server was helping another table. All around great experience!

HG-71ea8UpCotd-rraPLxg.text: My expectations got dumped on after I came to Welcome Diner. We came for some passable late night grub. Instead we got kickass grub and some really nice drinks.  Of course we come on a Tuesday - clearly the best day because it was happy hour all day. Between my group we had a Hurricane, Gin and Tonic, Whiskey Sour, a Little Birdy, and an order of Poutine.  Happy hour drinks at $5-6, you don't expect much. But these staples actually hold their own against bars that would sell theirs for $10+. The gin and tonic was refreshing with the addition of lime juice. The Whiskey Sour had a nice balanced tart flavor from the fruit. And the Hurricane was basically alcoholic juicy goodness.  From the food, literally comfort food at its finest. The Little Birdy - that in house biscuit, plus that awesome succulent fried chicken and slice of cheese - some of the best $5 I've ever spent. And the Poutine is glorious. Probably some of the most conservative, it's close to the traditional sense of just gravy and cheese, but they opt to use a peppery country style gravy and cheddar cheese. It's makes you feel a little worse and better at the same time.  The fact that this place is basically in the middle of a sketchy neighborhood actually added to the appeal for me. It's a bright spot with outdoor seating that makes you want to have a good time. Can't wait to come back.

hj3a20QNKo3b5sTOlM4nzA.text: OMG best biscuit sandwich I've ever had!!! You don't need anything to go with this sandwich!! I had to take a piece of pie to go I was so stuffed!! Great ambiance & met some great people while I was there!! The staff was awesome & there's seating outside & limited seating inside. I was able to grab a stool inside!! When I come back to Phoenix this will be my first stop!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omg this was the BEST sandwich I&#39;ve ever had!!!

Jzf0MvRl_juYTnGmpwugnw.text: Been there several times. They won't get anymore money from me. I got biscuits and crazy one time, the gravy looked like mashed potatoes. Another time I got a grilled cheese and I asked for no tomatoes. The guy said "really?" And then proceeded to argue with me about how good the tomatoes were. I don't like tomatoes. They put tomatoes on it. The peanut butter burger is pretty good. The biscuits have been inconsistent.   The staff can be good or horrible. Depends on the day they are having. It seems to have gone down hill since it opened.  Also it is expensive.

fDepp5tjai2lANhVn3_tDQ.text: Everyone has their go to places, and this happens to be mine, especially late night when no one else is open.    Every dish I have ever ordered is great, but my favorite thus far happens to be "The Champion" which is a burger, with BACON JAM!  Everything about this burger is amazing, but adding a fried egg to it makes it that much better! Another one of my favorites is their, Poutine, fries smothered in gravy. You have to try them.  I often hear people complain about the prices, but I don't mind paying that, as long as the food and staff is amazing, which they are.

w0dOzw4CF4wBlhXq6ShjbA.text: Amazing place, cozy and sweet, I was visiting Phoenix and this place and food is stunning. I loved the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XSTuTizpI2zu_F0vq4SWeA.text: I've been a couple times.  The food is ok, but isn't anything out of the ordinary.  The service is hit or miss.  Last time, the server was argumentative, she got mad that I brought in a water bottle (a Phoenician who carries in a water bottle in the heat of summer, what a concept). Their burgers were just alright, wasn't a fan of the cornbread or Mac and cheese.  It's cool that they served poutine, but they used white gravy, and skipped on the cheese curds and the meaty bits.  There was a fried chicken sand which that was pretty good.

FkYX5n5mGKKdY836JPt4iA.text: A unique spot with great food!  I had heard good things about Welcome Diner, so I was pretty pumped to try it out. Went with my wife for dinner on a cool evening, and we LOVED the feel and environment of the place! So cute and sweet. I love that they have unique comfort food, and aren't afraid of butter or red meat. I got the Big Jim Fried Chicken Biscuit, and it was seriously fantastic. I'm a big guy, and I couldn't even finish it, but every bite was awesome. Would definitely recommend going, and we will be back for sure!

T8aLKFug4p0-uJZXmmbPEw.text: This place is not my type of place to dine but a friend invited me so I went. The food was so-so to me. It was crowded and the service was a bit slow. All seating is mostly outside which made for fun people watching.  I would go back again but won't be a first choice.

IaN6HlqFM78y3yaoq0DRmQ.text: Every time I stop by the experience exceeds my expectations. The food is quality, unique flavor pairings and the customer service is genuine, groovy and welcoming. When I have guests flying in town this is always my first stop after the airport! Welcome diner is life!

6Ldteel0T5cZ9ya-ZwNDCg.text: Coolest place downtown! I'm sure them staying open for food until 2am has something to do with it. My sister and I shared a burger after a concert and it was so good we wanted more! Next time we will not share, that's for sure! Thanks guys for working so hard at 2am at night while everyone else is having a good time! We were so thankful you were open because we were starving! Awesome place and great food, will recommend to everyone and can't wait to go back and try the fries with gravy!

dPeOhA1Wowxfgplng0-tYg.text: I hesitate to write this review because as much as I want success for some of these culinarily perfect grub spots out in Phoenix, I also don't want it to get any busier than it does. I like that they're placed in a neighborhood, it's just a little diner that seems like it's always been there. With the community dining, eclectic patio furniture and the always engaging staff this place really exemplifies what food should be. Good, local and comfortable. It's one of the few...actually ONLY respectable restaurants that I can walk into on a Friday and Saturday at 7pm without a 2 hour wait or calling ahead for a reservation. I hope welcome diner is preserved forever, it's definitely my favorite part of Arizona food culture.

sC3t8UZr5VQ_u9FiEQDkMg.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere! We had the veggie burger and the Welcome Burger. Both were amazing! The fried avocado was out of this world.   We will definitely be going back. I highly recommend this unique little gem in Downtown Phoenix.

euBoCBrjOkTtL6wUYH8KJg.text: Don't really see what all of the buzz is about. Decent atmosphere, but the menu items are majorly overpriced in light of the quality on the day of my visit. Plain biscuit was $4 and about the same quality as a Waffle House biscuit that sells for 1/3 of that.

ILPtT8TkPnp3wzDPHAJO_A.text: Oh my, I just have to say that this place is a knock your socks kind of meal.  I had the Big Jim, the flavor and and taste is insane..... This reminds me of one of those spots you run into in California.  Trust me, you will not be disappointed....

IqpaEhRktHtVwyrGZwT6gg.text: Really amazing food and generous portions! I used to come to here with my boyfriend for burgers since it's right next to my house, but then we decided to go vegetarian because of pollution, cruelty, health ect. and had to stop eating here because their were hardly any veggie options and we were never given a straight answer about whether any of the products were local. Vegetables aside, this place is definitely worth going to if you want good food and want to meet great people.

jJFiOCi_rkmSnuUpEbpGog.text: Their idea of $8+ poutine is white gravy on a sad amount of fries? Pathetic. Don't waste your time.

g8iLpgqS0SlI-34b0MpkLQ.text: I love my Mac and cheese with extra sauce and Brussels sprouts and don't forget the second generation. It's phenomenal. For the most part the staff is super inviting and "welcoming". I've only had a couple experiences where I've felt like an inconvenience to them. Definitely not everybody there is like that!

Enyo7awwenZSZtswAqlnUg.text: Grew up in Canada and Poutine was a staple. This was different with southern gravy instead of brown gravy, but it works especially on their fries. Wed. has a happy hour featuring those same fries with pulled pork and a very special Cole slaw. Add a burger and a beer and you've got more than enough for two for dinner at under $25. This is serious food, done by m who really care about doing it right.

ZXspZDCo_MgWRJXlSIgdGA.text: FUN! FUN! FUN! GOOD! GOOD! GOOD! Need I say more? OPEN late 2am even during the week. Good food and low prices. Really can't beat that combination! A little bit of a sketchy neighborhood, but safe enough. Give it a try.

OcIK57aCvIfWYkpoqaoFoA.text: This place is freaking awesome. Burger is on point. It's outside and you will probably have to wait a little bit, but trust me, it is worth the wait!

5M7WA25g5eALPi59CvgUtw.text: Holy shit!! You must eat here!! I live in the Bay Area and I still get cravings for that sandwich with buffalo sauce and blue cheese on it!! Why can't they be here in CA?! And that front porch tho!!! So sunny and warm! The staff and the customers who come here are awsome!

kHsHd0DgVXFAUGc0-r7spg.text: Awesome! Great home cooked food. The watermelon salad with pickled rind and goats cheese is a gluten free DELIGHT!

BRzEsRJbNXpmxPVyrljCKw.text: Back in 2005 I came to Welcome Diner and would enjoy really tasty breakfast sandwiches.  I loved the husband/wife team who took care of the customers and made the place pretty darn awesome.  I know in the past few years there've been a few different concepts that hit Welcome Diner... I didn't patronize the place since back in 2005/2006, but went back last night at about 9pm to check it out.  I took some of the pictures that are up on this Yelp review back then when I was DowntownGirl.  With my man and a friend of ours, we stopped over to the same quaint trailer that seemed to be a bit more polished up with a more bold "Welcome Diner" painted on the front, but pretty much looked the same from back when I used to go.  There was a special on the board and they had menus with some eclectic items.  Two of us chose the South Carolina-style pork sandwich on a biscuit and a side of fries while our friend grabbed the peanut butter bacon burger and some Sweet Republic ice cream.   We sat outside instead of in.  We also grabbed some wine and beer.  Local WINES!  So glad to be able to go to an establishment in downtown Phoenix where they offer local wine.   We got our food after a short wait and dove in.  Top notch delicious foods all around.  I know they have a brunch menu... guess we'll have to ride down some Saturday or Sunday morning.  Tasty food, friendly staff... we'll be back.

9s_ZFHfIzL_fXNIGA45Gyg.text: I don't normally write reviews... But this place is an exception!!!!! (I actually created an account just to review this place)  The atmosphere is worth the trip alone, cool set up with outdoor seating (nice lights at night) and a rad mural on the fence. Super cool staff, real friendly!  Anyway, THE FOOD, The food is amazing, I have been traveling the U.S for 2 months and I haven't tasted anything that would come close to this! I had the fried avocado po'boy and a side of Brussels sprouts. The Brussels sprouts were delicious, I think they were pan fried with oil and some herb, and the po'boy was probably the BEST THING I HAVE EVER EATEN! But seriously, it was delicious, And it's served with diced watermelon on the side, blends nicely, and whoever thought of deep fried avocado is a god dam genius!!!!    I wasn't sure what to expect when I got there, I was just going from the reviews on yelp. And they were right!  So do yourself a favor and head on down to welcome diner and hook in to some of there great food!!!   My only regret is that I leave tomorrow and only got to visit once :(

lfHFN7whEmcFs4LL0XJXsg.text: This is my late night joint. Fire biscuit selection. Staff is fantastic and loving. Top 5 pics In Phoenix handdddds down.

gB9xdlmQNMGbN59j_cv87g.text: Good Food, fun atmosphere. Happy Hour is great, Love to come here late at night

SXklMYxzsHw8UDROQmoTug.text: First let me say that all the boys working here are super cute. So that was a bonus!! I had The Big Jim and it was delicious! Next time I will get the fried egg on top!! Oh and I also had an orange drink, can't remember the name but it ruled!

E8TxZDCH0MNcxjs68Y7mNQ.text: Great burgers, but we waited 45 minutes to get our food ... That's crazy.  Kitchen is way too small, and service people were friendly but clueless.

gXuL8IbOjChVmsaOOZetfw.text: The old Welcome Diner is closed, but it is now (temporarily) inhabited by Chef Payton Curry. Check out the reviews here: yelp.com/biz/payton-curr...

62T5HDYT_6fl1_N5e2sM9g.text: I will say I was a little surprised to drive up to this place and see it is in a neighborhood on the corner as if it was previously someone's house (pretty sure it may have been). As for seating there are two options either outside on their "patio" (felt like someones front yard with chairs) or inside which gave you more of an old school dining car feel. I ordered there PB + B burger and my husband had their shrimp Po'boy special. I had heard eating Peanut butter on your burger was good so of course I had to give it a try. I must say it was a bit odd but very good, the burger was very juicy and flavorful, the bacon and cheese gave it that salty taste that went great along side the crunchy peanut butter. I would say it probably isn't for everyone and fair warning it is very heavy on the stomach... about half way through it just hits you and realize just how full you are lol. My husband's Shrimp Po'Boy was very good, the bread was super fresh and the tomato base spread gave it amazing flavor, I would say it was more of a "Prawn" Po'boy because the shrimp were so big. Overall the food was very good, I am a bit skeptical about the outdoor seating it was just a little too weird for me, I would definitely go back but would prefer to sit inside if there is room. I hope they continue to do well and maybe they'll be able to expand.

z7ZFDatlM37EY5ylLYpTGQ.text: In Phoenix for a few days and wanted to find a unique, good place to eat.  Found both in Welcome Diner.  It's in the middle of a fairly residential area near downtown.  Very informal and looks almost like a Foster's Freeze type place with mostly outdoor seating.  I sat at the counter.  The three young guys working were having a great time cooking, talking to guests and listening to, oddly enough, late-60's rock music.  Had the Big Jim and Poutine.  Ate about 2/3 of the first and 1/4 of the second only because it's an incredible amount of food.  Great tasting comfort food at great prices.  Would recommend.

YY4-_wR5eE1I24zw-m6-4Q.text: Retro setting, organic food, and friendly service.  FOOD Well, it's a diner so you have burgers, fries, grilled cheese, etc to choose from. The burgers have always been cooked as I like them (whatever your preference is...) The fries are organic potatoes, cut daily- sometimes a little on the brown side in appearance but they always taste good.  Grilled cheese is great- not too greasy like some places.  There are sodas and iced tea to drink- both organic.  ENVIRONMENT 8  seats inside and outdoor seating availible. I would recommend eating outside if it is nice- sometimes inside is crowded and everyone can hear everyone else's business.   OTHER Bring cash, no cards accepted. If your service is good- tip them. They are really nice!

Sm8GLdNgkwPsTv3ChR7YOw.text: My favorite burger in phoenix. unless you're at the bar, there is only outside seating, but in good weather it's great. Parking can be dodgey depending on the time of day but never too bad. The place itself has charming decor and great staff. I recommend going at night because the lights are great ambiance.

mIlDVQEpTwNWoPS1r33CoQ.text: Their red bean and rice are fabulous and the portion is super generous!  I also had the Kentucky Thoroughbred cocktail and it was amazing.  There's something about sitting knee to knee with strangers at a nine-person diner counter talking about food and life and watching the chef's work in the teensy-tiny kitchen.  But don't worry - if you need some space and want to enjoy the amazing AZ weather there's a HUGE patio and fun little order window... something for everyone!  For dessert I got the homemade biscuit with goat cheese and apple butter.  The biscuit was warm but the cheese was cold and that was a weird combination.  But overall everything was delicious and I will totally be back!!!

9sjs85gDhRZbKfVVSSOWcg.text: Peanut Butter Burger.  An event of world-historical importance.

lGZGycYKu5YXgj8v4MLQYg.text: My fiance came here for a late anniversary dinner around midnight. I ordered a special burger they had called the Jose I believe and my fiance ordered the Carol. We both absolutely LOVED our food. The burger I ordered had a jalapeno relish with onions and it was just amazing. The Carol was also really delicious and unlike any other pulled pork sandwich we had ever eaten. The staff was very friendly and it was lit cutely with string lights. We are so happy to have a late night spot to dine in Phoenix that's not a fast food restaurant. I absolutely love this place and we will definitely be back!

3352cKn2HwsRnioFMlMaCQ.text: Great neighborhood location, great laid back environment (outdoor seating only), extremely friendly staff, and a deliciously unique menu. We'll be coming here often!

ZzFSL9sWoRxOOhKa0XbWGg.text: One of my favorite spots in town. This place is amazing from the staff to the food ist incredible. The Po'boy Fish sandwich is really really good I get that and the Kiko i think... something along those lines is a breat burger.

aSU9YDFFnUoHkYPcteyN6A.text: This place rocked. We were a little hesitant at first to try it bit it worked out. The location is right smack dab in the middle of a residential area and the diner literally sticks out of a house or possibly used to be a house but the food was phenomenal. All the seating is outdoor with a walk up window to order. The staff and the food choices definitely had a little hipster vibe. The collard greens were freaking amazing and the rest of the food was up to par for sure. Only complaint probably is that the drinks were a bit on the pricy side, $3.50 for a tall can of Pabsts. All in all, I would definitely visit again and again.

FGmjAhSzevOq3gjW5Yn-DA.text: Visiting from LA, looked for a place to eat late at night and found this place. Would recommend the Champion burger, pulled pork fries, sunrise biscuit, and beignets

XmokxlmbdN_jwOkAdmI9xg.text: Just went back for another Tuesday night dinner...  Romesco Cauliflower Gnocchi Soft Shell Crab Goat Terrine Lamb Loin Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie Olive Oil Cake Butterscotch Brownie Brioche Pudding  Ridiculous. Top five best dinners in Phoenix.

UsY1mImj4-2gUZOpvtnCNw.text: We visited Welcome Diner on a Thursday evening and, in all, had a good experience but I can't say I plan to return. Though on the pricey side, the food was good (I had a BBQ pork plate and my guest a burger) and the menu selection seemed adequate. We sat outside and enjoyed our meals, sipping on hurricanes, while appreciating that Welcome Diner is, for lack of a better explanation, a hipsters diner done absolutely right. The food, the service, the facility...all are within a clear and well executed vision. And while I respect that vision, I think that, for me, it was just too much. Specifically, the outdoor seating is more stylish than properly relaxing as their comfort food is. Sitting at a picnic table or some old outdoor furniture that looks like it just came from the back of an old shed is too hipster for me. I get it. I get the theme. I get the execution. It just doesn't work for me. But I would definitely eat their grub if I were in the area looking for take out.

9FU-ZiH_6tsNfCFK66Wzqg.text: The people are really cool.  Excellent food made from local ingredients. The chicken biscuit sandwich is yummy. Also, must indulge in the poutine. Fun place with lots of misters running over the picnic tables outside which kept us cool. Must check this place out for yourself.

gYAfBmLRtGZENgh66fP8uQ.text: First time in Phoenix, and we ate all of our meals at one restaurant - The Welcome Diner. The service is ridiculously pleasant, with various servers casually checking in with you and chatting you up during the meal. Dinner was probably one of the best meals we have ever had- to start: pulled pork fries smothered in tangy BBQ sauce and topped with homemade cool coleslaw. Then the Welcome Burger, which was moan inducing and gone in about 4 bites. We followed this with their summer salad of watermelon, tomato, ginger pickled rinds, and arugula surrounded by a delicious basil cashew pesto. Unbelievably refreshing. To finish we went with the honey drizzled beignets and basically licked the plate clean. Oh and also the cocktails here are amazing - heaven on earth. And we spent about $60 on all of it. Such a ridiculous bargain. Writing this from the lovely shaded patio waiting for our eggs and biscuits to arrive. We might never leave!

D4URe_8kfttDQAjpee3Nig.text: Looking for a place that is so off the beaten path that you need to drive down a neighborhood road to get to it. Well this is the place. Great food, friendly owners and a diner you will want to come back to.

tGb9SULgjRPLbiLGUO4wdg.text: I finally get a chance to taste "the bumble bee" that I've seen on the yelp tease pics. Why did it have to be so good? I'm supposed to be 80% gluten free gosh darn! I'm going to have to increase my weekly indulgences to 2 1/2 because Phoenix makes being good very difficult. I'll say the mustard competes with the pickles, but doesn't mess up the sandwich. Oh do these people know exactly what they are doing with the honey on top! Honey and pickles on one sandwich together in perfect harmony (swoon). Chik-fool-a can kiss my diversity after this sandwich. Not that I've eaten there since --you know-- but it was something to miss. My sister had the "big Jim" and man is that a lot of gravy. Nothing was wrong in that sandwich other than ordering it with a side which would make you glutton of the year. (She ordered the Mac n'cheese with it and I hope she never reads this).  Don't do it, your stomach can only expand so much! To conclude: yum.

FDwuYpW4uS04oFGEDguXOA.text: Amazing, been twice and would go every week if I lived downtown. The food is incredible, the environment is chill, and the proprietors are super friendly. It's only open Sun.-Tuesday and will close for good 4th of July. Go while you can!!

KftAFCQqYBYvlT7i1xX4ig.text: this is probably the coolest diner in downtown phoenix. all organic ingredients, a kickass interior (it's super small, but totally rad), and great people working. say hi to the bearded jewish cook, andy, and he will make your food just the way you want it, and also, with love.  the food is totally cheap and tastes exquisite. you can also eat outside, if you want.   it's located on a nondescript corner in a residential area, so it's easy to miss, but this place is definitely worth checking out if you're downtown.  also, the hours up there ^^ say it's open until 5, but i am pretty sure they close at 3.

KI7AynX9ftOjW0BhVpZWDg.text: This place was off the hook!! As I say, "hella good"! Like hella gooooooooooooood! I strongly recommend this place especially with a group of friends around sunset to kick back at this chill establishment with cool outdoor lighting and throw back some drinks before your meal.   By the way, if you gotta whizz...prepare to step into an airplane sized bathroom literally right next to the kitchen...so hopefully you will not need to DO anything else there...haha  Great eats tho, everyone in my party loved their dishes. Cheers.  JP@

2YQ834lLzT9dU0vhsg2kgA.text: Best Restaurant in Phoenix! Even if this establishment wasn't within walking distance from my house I would drive 50 miles for the Chicken biscuit sandwiches and amazing burgers they serve. The service is outstanding, the ambiance is mellow, friendly, and casual. A perfect place for a first date, group gathering, or drinks with friends. The hours are phenomenal (they are open super late or super early). Check them out!

nvY4X_l5u5alqWM_8ZWONw.text: Welcome diner was very satisfying! We pulled up and I was like crap this place is either gonna be really good or really bad. We got the bumblebee and big jack with a side of Mac and cheese (added bacon). Wasn't a huge fan of Mac and cheese... It tasted a bit strange. The bumblebee was amazing with added hot sauce. I didn't try the big Jack because he finished it in two bites which meant it was pretty good! Best cheat meal there ever was - minus the Mac and cheese. It was a bit more expensive than I thought it would be... 47 with tip.

gdrvqQLUEX6k48bBigklsA.text: Came here for dinner with my boyfriend and the food was so delicious! Everyone that worked there was extremely friendly and outgoing. Only downside is the restaurant is outside and very minimal seating inside. Other than that, it's a great place to eat in downtown phoenix!

8Mvb488yPTEuEub_K7EJrg.text: Got in late on a flight and was famished. It was either the Welcome Diner or a fast food joint. This place was amazing! So many awesome dishes to choose from biscuits to burgers to the specials of the day. Definitely a place to frequent - you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Super Bowl - tenders, gravy, potatoes, corn, and buffalo sauce!

fRjLSac0Gz0x0TAVpOYMqQ.text: Went here with some friends on Saturday for brunch. Ordered the Big Jim and sunrise. The big JIM was a little salty and the sunrise just didn't hit the mark. The chorizo was excellent.  The holy puerco was the best dish, I highly recommend.   I will return for lunch and dinner to see if it gets better. I would recommend going at least once, don't be afraid of the neighborhood.
