QU8h5_obLFJwGlg-FzJ-NA.text: Been here two times now for comic con rest place to chill and yummy food ! Burgers and smothered frys

1SQGkOlfuGjG9XROtuAFEQ.text: This place is great atmosphere and delicious food!  Bring a coat in the fall/winter if you are eating outside because it can get fairly cold.  Also, if you go there on First Friday be expected to wait about an hour for you food.   The Blue Sky burger is off the chain.

QpvLBky4ysL7Fp_UWo1z6g.text: A very neat and little place!! Awesome fried chicken sandwich!!! and a cool staff. I will try again when I am downtown.

mh10goEWnSnjRhamy3vA4g.text: Everyone who works here LoveS their job and it shows. The friend green tomato sandwich is my favorite. Pulled pork fries are a must and a whisky sour to tie it together.

8HdOgC5VNdrvpfGUsDwX3A.text: Was delicious ! Big Jim, poutine fries,  beignets... now I need to try some more items!!

Nbf_LHiHTMB0CLsKw6xCTA.text: I've been coming here for years and I haven't had the chance to actually distill on the crowds of Phoenix and beyond how wonderful this place is.  The menu depending on how hungry you are is accommodating to any appetite whether you're just looking to munch or full out grub.  If you can beat the 2AM cutoff the drinks here are prepared with care, precision and outright thought to the discerning palate.  In this day and age just utilize your smartphone to find this place or jump on a bike from the many rent a bikes in the DT PHX area to get here on a pub crawl or meander on through the colorful and eclectic neighborhood.  If you have a chance to sit inside and chat up the staff they are welcoming as the name implies, humorous and always accommodating!!!  A go to spot for me for sure!

Tp-gDQVCPXf_DYETreBsvg.text: I'm beyond impressed with my experience at Welcome Diner. The food and service was impeccable! If you haven't been I would highly recommend trying it! Thanks Aaron, Zach and Jose!

r2z-0peFk0EacSnjC593ZA.text: They source local food and try to find non-GMO the people that work here are also really cool beans; as is the crowd usually.  This place has a bit of a laid-back hipster vibe if you.

A1tE_cqXLe-n8gQidoWWLQ.text: I love the atmosphere more than anything else.  As a visitor to Phoenix, I am not use to this heat but the calm warm nights are the perfect setting for outdoor seating (though there is a small indoor diner bar). There are plenty of tables, lights and a gatorade water cooler to satisfy that thirst.  I got the Big Jim and a side of Brussels sprouts ($14 total).  Brussels Sprouts are cut large and I felt they could have been cooked down a bit more or cut smaller for my liking.  The Big Jim on the other hand was quite tasty.  Fried Chicken, Biscuit and Gravy.  How good is that?  Oh, there is bacon and cheese too....damn. I would ask for extra gravy on the side next time.  Watermelon on the side was a perfect pairing to this rich dish.  Compostable cup, +1

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim in it&#39;s glory; partially in my stomach.

U-zn8OBcYC6rvFXMujqsYg.text: If you need a cheat day, take a cheat day here and get their Mac N Cheese! It is to die for!! All their food is amazing!!

32B3u-wR2TuF-Myvm8wcPw.text: I just love everything about this place. The location, the outside seating, the vibe, the food ... everything.  The kitchen is very small. This vintage diner car was meant for one cook. So the two guys in there really have to hustle and work around each other. The food is top quality as well. My boyfriend and I split a PB&B Burger and the Bumblebee chicken sandwich on a biscuit. The chicken was probably my favorite, but it was impossible to eat like a lady. It's stacked so high that in order to get some in your mouth, you have to get some on your face. I gave up and just started stabbing at it with my fork.   The best part of Welcome Diner is the atmosphere: twinkling lights, picnic style seating, and friendly staff. I'm not sure who was working this last Saturday night, but he was so friendly and knowledgeable. We had a good little conversation about the history of the diner car.   This would be a great date place ... if that's something you're looking for. This is also a good place for a group of around 6 friends to take over a picnic table.

6UBW16BfJ1gwETWIl90rSg.text: What a disappointment. Hipster place trying to appeal to people that have no children and plenty of time. They took way too long to make a grilled cheese sandwich.  We ordered at 10:10 pm according to my receipt, and the food finally arrived at 11:10pm, 1 hour later.  Very disappointing to see all the customers that were in line after myself getting their orders ahead of us.  Our friends were finishing their plates when my order finally arrived, small, burnt and nuclear hot on the inside.  What really capped the disappointment was when the waiter came by to ask how all the food was tasting and I told him I don't know because we have no food to taste, it had been 50 minutes on a 30 min promise and our food still was not here.  He asked what our name was and went back to check, then came back and said they have started working on it now, to which I replied, "What were they doing for the last 45 minutes if not making our order?" to which he had no reply.  The Welcome burger looked big and nice and I was really excited to see what I was going to get for a grilled cheese with 3 different cheeses.  When it finally did arrive, it was burnt on the outside and cool to the touch, but Scorching hot on the inside.  They must have used a microwave to re-heat the sandwich, because I can still feel the burn on my mouth the next day.  Not only was the grilled cheese hot, it was also extremely small.  I was thinking something substantial after seeing the mac and cheese on the "Snack" menu the size of a small child's head, but the grilled cheese sandwich was more like an appetizer for one, not an entree.  If only I could give them 1/2 a star for the unlimited cold ice water, and the outdoor patio dining room, which were the only good things about the restaurant.

sGfKIaA3-NM8wqBNV10cjg.text: Too little food for the price. Not really worth it. I wouldn't recommend the biscuit cause it split so easily that I don't think it's good with fried chicken ( I got Bumblebee) . But it's just my opinion. PB&B was good but still a bit too pricey for the amount we got.

S6INq4XBcqsdC8u3Zgi4Tw.text: I've only been here for brunch once....it's the shit.   They had me with the "ATTENTION BALLERS, no $50 or $100 BILLS, PLEASE"  (I'll post a picture)  Basically my kind of place already.   It's a tiny place inside thus the 4 stars but they have a nice patio area with benches, tables and ect.   Food is like some concoction of amazingness. I can't even remember what I had, but it was tasty and full of god knows what, pretty much everything and anything one can think of. They also sell beers and stuff.   It's located in the garfield district right off roosevelt.   I heard it was once a food truck that parked and now it rests.   Go here for something awesome and different.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They had me at this sign.....

Y556Ou4omnpXvBNWYfvdGQ.text: This is my favorite place to take friends and family that are in town. It's my to go spot for late night food. Try some basil on your hurricane, that's my jam. Love the people and the food. Always good vibes.

LRYNdeOwrryVyBqf6Uy-OA.text: First off, the food is incredible. The menu is very simple and to the point. Don't let that fool you.   I got the sausage corn dogs. YUMMY. A must try. Also the fried green tomato sandwich. The bread they use is quality and so tasty.   I gave it 4 stars because I feel like the staff could be friendlier. And eventually, I'd love a bigger beer selection.   Try. This. Place.

79knpgH4iQWHTl_1ac3NiA.text: Love this place!  Great biscuits and gravy sandwiches.  I wish that they had more indoor seating for the summertime, but that is the only thing I would change.  Pro tip: come hungry

-Pab1L6GwsxWGMl_loCuvA.text: I have no idea how such a tiny place is able to churn out such an enormous amount of quality food.  The patio is large and eclectic with an array of mismatching tables, chairs, and lights. It's hard not to immediately feel at home here. Food has been exceptional on every visit, my favorite item being the fried green tomato sandwich. Cocktails have also been superb. It's a good bet that whatever you decide on will be both surprising and just what you were hoping for.  My husband and I had our wedding dinner at Welcome Diner and it was absolutely perfect. Before friends arrived I warned the staff that there was a sizable group coming by and if we were in the way or too loud to please let me know and I'd deal with it. The staff's response was, "That's just the vibe here. You're fine." They handled the crowd that night so well, and with such great and friendly energy.

lHCuUOezBi9UlqxfCRYbrw.text: Cool hang. Killer food. Gives a whole new twist to what diner food can be. Totally playing to the strengths of Phoenix. One of the best burgers I've had in town. Killing it here!

QvCp08wR_zUHUSHf1BM5YQ.text: Amazing diner, great locally sourced selections that change out daily/weekly. Small location with limited seating, but great if you get there early. Try their alcoholic special drinks, love the selection and it changes often. Ask about the history of the place, awesome story!

RRE7uiVUEpBx8Gqeweu5EQ.text: Perfect late night spot. Reminds me of grabbing dinner at a roadside stand in a small town.   Portions are big, food is greasy but fresh, and prices aren't that bad.   I love old valentine diners, and this is a great example. A real gem in Phoenix.

jlaSU7OMYwN7nww6OK1Bpg.text: The closer I move to Welcome, the fatter I'll get. Everything is that good. I reminds me of little food bars in New Orleans' Irish Channel. And save room for a cocktail or punch.   Indoor seating is super limited, so be careful in arizona summers

gvjnMzhd3l053n7Ny8mL5Q.text: Love welcome diner!  The PB&B (Peanut Butter and Bacon) burger is absolutely delicious (if you like Peanut butter of course). The meat is always cooked very well, the ingredients fresh, and a great mix of flavors.  Also on my favorite list is Poutine Fries. Fries, topped with Gravy.

2TZdesNtIl1z6f6Md8yYHw.text: This place is both fun, hip and cool to be at AND the food is just phenomenal. I can't wait to go back again and again to try everything!!

n4gfPOA_r16eApPcNwadaA.text: Absolutely love this place. Great vibe, phenomenal food, vegan friendly, amazing burgers, good beers.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1 dollar PBR tall boys all the time
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best outdoor seating ever.

fWyV9-KiPUUtyp2ja6pHyQ.text: Lurvvv this place and their artichoke mac. Also cute and quaint with a hip vibe.

Vg5-EpKc3xRGIh1z4uZMNw.text: We were looking for a late nite bite. Although nobody called us dude (sir) it was only because we were old enough to be everyone's parents. No matter, the service was enthusiastic and personal, the food delicious, the atmosphere authentically hipster. I had the fried green (red) tomato sandwich which was positively nuclear, the way I like it. Health food no doubt. What a great place. Wish we could have had some drinks because they had interesting ones, but my companion had Hurricane Juice and said it was the best juice he ever had. A mix of fresh juices would definitely benefit from rum.

sNSM3m0EnoQ-PmApt84xsw.text: My boyfriend and I are so utterly in love with this place.  Their menu is genius and you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.  The poutine and the mac n' cheese are my go to's whenever we go here.    The seating is open and we love sitting in the 6-seater counter top in the old trailer they work out of.  Being practically an arm's reach away from the kitchen stove is awesome because you get to hear and smell the food cooking which is phenomenal. This is exactly what comfort food should be; greasy and flavorful and rich!  Another draw of coming here is where it is located.  Sitting on the street corner in the midst of older craftsman style historic homes and strung lights about their patio is so charming.  I love coming to this part of Phoenix, always great people-watching and fun atmosphere.   The staff here are so awesome and friendly and make the experience here that much greater!  I highly highly recommend this place if you are looking for amazing, local, FRESH food.   Just come here, period. You won't regret it.

tnrCx_PjWHkFbDlrrBYoow.text: What a great little find. A little oasis in the middle of a foreboding neighborhood. Have been a few times (once twice in the same day) and not yet disappointed. Except, once when i came on a monday and they were closed.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome Diner at twilight

Rsb3Igy1uIdeFA6tNG-hfA.text: Went to celebrate with family and friends and had Delicious Bloody Mary's and feasted on some good ole homemade food for the Soul!  Holy Puerco is The headliner followed by the Bumble bee !  Had a bite of the  peanut butter burger and it was delicious!   Come check them out!   Cool spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GJ1pgdOqlKoZ-XdkJwuRMg.text: I drive by this place all the time and I never stopped cuz all the hipsters, but so glad I took a nice stroll from mi amigas casa to do so bcus this place is super. I got the eggplant parm special. The breading for the eggplant was on point but I realized I'm not a fan of soggy bread so that kills it cuz you need the sauce. Supper yummy sandy though! I also tried the Bumble Bee. It is served on a biscuit (so warm/so soft) fried chix w/a bourbon mustard sauce, mmmm bread and butter pickles and sits in honey all fancy. This is a tasty eat....although be warned the mustard saucy is a tad kicky w/the bourbon, was a suprise for me! Anyways so worth going, open late and I love eating outside picnic table style.

-SCv5Y_s1YHEdAqTvp9bPA.text: There was a little blurb of a review in the Arizona Republic newspaper over the Thanksgiving weekend about the Big Jim Sandwich and the Beignets here. Beignets, you say? Yes please.  I thought it would be a good place to take dear papa for lunch; turns out they open at 5 pm. So we made our way through rush hour traffic from north Phoenix to this "middle of nowhere" place on a Tuesday night. I expected small but I didn't expect teeny tiny. However, the warm and genuinely friendly service- YEP we felt WELCOME - more than made up for the close quarters. Our fish po'boys  and beignets in local honey were SUPERB! Totally worth the adventure.

-CsITtbPRXElhDxrFZZcuw.text: I've never had anything here that wasn't amazing. If you want a burger, there's is by far the best. You can't go wrong with any options. Vegetarians (and carnivores) will love the Jackfruit. Plus it's got a laid back atmosphere that's perfect when you want a low key dinner without compromising for low quality food.

BV2LMa51-ehBaT_IaNpQyw.text: Incredible. I traveled to pheonix for the weekend and ate here late-night twice. Maybe it was the condition I was in after a concert, but I believe this is the best burger I've ever had. Excellent patio too-- a real hipster's delight. GO HERE NOW

JnMCr7lKKObvRwg3uBnw4w.text: The big Jim and the Carol are both fantastic. It is also a really nice place to sit outside in the evening.

9yA80I01zsi4rAeixxBwTA.text: Amazing amazing melt in your mouth food,  affordable, funny down to earth staff, fun visits! Go here now!

HD3OAHbBADXm9muM4xP23w.text: Amazing food, amazing staff. Only one time did I go where I wasn't impressed. Top of biscuit burnt and chicken dry. Other than that food and service has been superb. Great comfort food and a nod to the south with the fried green tomato sandwich!!

_qj_6_Qq9ifGKSrEjONSdA.text: This is a great little spot with awesome food, awesome employees who treat everyone like they're friends. The menu is not of the normal run of the mill type but yet a delicious combination that should be tried. As a local business owner and supporter of independent non-chain places to eat, this is a must try! And don't forget that they serve booze! Try the bloody mary or the hurricane!

JtpxoH71b0Cy_ORWsxzMmQ.text: Bravo! This place aced it for me. I always like to read what people order at places to help me decide. I guarantee that anything you order here will be amazing and delicious. Great job guys!! Makes me happy to see a spot like this in Phoenix. Reminds me of Portland. Things are lookin up for the foodie scene.

xRGZgjLoH9YHRUjJDghv0A.text: I trekked all the way to this place from the Convention Center.  I was a little unsure if I was headed to the right place, since Welcome Diner is located in a neighborhood, but I'm so glad that I found it.  My food was delicious and the staff seemed genuinely friendly and interested in how I thought that the food was, which is always the sign of a good chef.  I did have to wait a little bit, but I didn't mind too much, since it's a small establishment.  People should be forewarned that there is very limited seating indoors and that most of the seating is outdoors on the patio.  I personally thought that it was nice to sit outside, especially with the mural on painted on the fence/wall, but I understand that it might not be so comfortable to sit outside at the picnic tables in extremely hot Phoenix weather, especially if it was a busy day and you had to share a bench/table with a bunch of people you don't know.  I got a fried green tomato sandwich on sourdough with house-made corn salsa and arugula.  It was fantastically delicious.  The ingredients were fresh and everything from the toasting of the bread to the battering of the tomatoes was well-executed.  Although the sandwich was filling and came with a slice of cantaloupe, I wish that it had come with some sort of side, like home-made potato chips, for the price.  Alongside my sandwich, I had a tasty Four Peaks stout.

GhWlpnTFMdNBYAAgLBwxLQ.text: While driving around town my friend and I came across the welcome diner. I've seen it before during an art festival but never had the chance to eat there. Remember that day I told my friend we should try it. When we arrived to the window where you order food the customer service was horrible and very unfriendly. The guy that was taking our order was just rude and not happy at all. It seem like he was upset about something and was taking it on us. It was our first time being there and I would of thought that the guy would of mention the daily special or even recommend he's favorite dish but instead was so commanding and rude. To make matters worse; we did not get our food until an hour later. The burger was dry and not tasty. There was no love to the burger. I don't think I'll go back or recommend this place to my friends or family.

YOwlVHgaPV03Q9Q2h9sfRg.text: THIS PLACE is great. I love this joint. The staff is awesome and the food is great. Their grilled cheese is so good. I also love their beer selection and their full bar. I have a hard time decided what to order when I go here because everything looks so good. This place is tucked away and can easily be passed up, but don't make that mistake. I love it here.

KNyps3qA09lKdiCimmGZfA.text: Went there again today with family from OOT, they loved the food and the atmosphere. Just a fun, cool place, come on down.

6RyDwsW_IqytoGrRjfIVxg.text: This place makes me wish it was mine! The best home made biscuits, juicy off the bone fried chicken, great collard greens, and amazing catfish po boy.

IzS2YH1BDBDSDo2-AHIh7g.text: We actually came here through Yelp's help, looking for a diner or a brunch place close to the Az Science Center. Dont be deceived or be scared by the neighborhood, it is not the suburbs, it is within a residential area in Downtown Phoenix. This place is a cross between a food truck that mutated into a tiny diner: the inside has 9 seats and a bar and their kitchen and outside has this "picnic" feel which has tables with umbrellas and chairs. Our family of 5 (with kids ages 8, 7 and 5) chose to sit inside. We were there upon opening, the waiter and cook (Wayne and Clay, if I remember correctly) were very attentive to our family's needs. My hubby got the Big Jim. He said he loved his food except for the biscuit, but he said hes not really into biscuits. But the chicken and gravy were tasty and well-seasoned. Had the fish po' boy and it was juicy! My kids and I were passing our plates, stuffing our faces with each bite of their grilled cheese with rustic tomatoes sandwich, sunrise and my po boy. My 5 year old son whos a really picky eater almost finished his sanwich and thats a lot for him! Im giving Welcome Diner 4 stars, I wish you have more beverage choices for kids like freshly squeezed OJ? Nevertheless, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We loved our first time here! We will definitely be back.

m2QR5rUmKxjyb3Cz-PMUHQ.text: I highly recommend this place...the food is mostly locally sourced...it's fresh...tasty...reasonably priced...outdoor seating available...a laid back vibe...started by 5 friends with varying artistic talents...very friendly and accommodating...

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko...fried chicken on a biscuit with fresh arugula, tomato and chipotle aioli...side of fresh watermelon

kxeN8GBxaNg-O03Vs4vfig.text: Do you love good food? Duh. Do you love good drinks? Of course. Do you love good people? Who doesn't?! If you've answered yes to any of these questions (and we both know you did), you need to get down to The Welcome Diner. The cozy quarters and kitchy decor make it easy to fall in love with, and the staff makes you comfortable enough to stay for hours. AND THE FOOD! I have yet to try something that didn't make me smile. It's hard to pick a favorite dish but personally, I love the Kiltlifter braised pork biscuit. The carolina mustard sauce that's made in house, is probably the best thing I've ever tasted. And the made from scratch biscuit it comes with, is too good for words.  Beyond a fantastic, locally driven food concept, they also make one of the greatest cocktails I've ever enjoyed; the Hurricane. And even though you clearly hear the bell dinging from the kitchen and everyone inside scream, "HURRICANE!" each time you order one, you just can't seem to figure out how you got so tipsy; they're sneaky little guys.  So, next time you're out and about downtown Phoenix on a weekend, you should go say hi, and then eat your face off. You'll be glad you did.

n8fT6ko8kw1S-tDBdXuI9g.text: Great little place with fantastic food and drinks. The local hipsters seem to dig it, but it's a family-friendly neighborhood joint too. Small bar inside and picnic tables on the outside patio encourage a community atmosphere. We ended up having a nice conversation with a guy who sat down at our table. :)

HfY9gzwdH-EQZeDUJj_uPw.text: When you see the building you might be like ew gross but then once you try the food you're like yummmm! I've been here a few times and always like my food! Drinks are good too! I would use the restroom before coming here though, the restrooms are somewhat hidden and I have heard they're not the best.

cE1bOeY2dwnOAapuqcSyDg.text: The Big Jim and the beignets have been on my foodie bucket list for some time and I finally stopped by last Sat.  The food was good (not great) but the ambiance was totally unacceptable.  They had a DJ playing music at an obnoxious volume. Not only was it at an unneighborly volume for being in a residential setting, but it was larded with the most objectionable vulgarities.  If I were a neighbor we would have a real problem.  As it is, I will most definitely NOT be a return customer.

Uit37RJ81uVXIrjJaJ1RhQ.text: I feel like I need a cardiologist on call after my delicious and greasy meal indulgence at Welcome Diner. The burger, fried chicken sandwich on a biscuit, fries with gravy on top and fries with bacon and cheese on top are all heavenly. Fried avocado Po' boy was also divine. Add a few hurricanes and I was a happy camper.

l8sNYCXLSsbeaEl3yN31Tg.text: I loved this spot! I was in town from the midwest and crave Welcome Diner! We indulged in their vegan options. They are def slam packed non stop which is great for them but obviously causes a wait for us. Obviously we ALL wait for this amazing food with no complaints. The staff is friendly, hip and WANTS TO BE THERE! Very chill environment. Huge fan.

2_5UtT_pR5L2-zcC74LwNg.text: Beignets to die for! We happened onto this place after flying in at 11:00 pm from Philadelphia and what a find. Friendly, chill vibe, authentic diner experience with a twist. The fried green tomato sandwich delicious and tangy-chewy, biscuits with gravy just the right amount of creamy and spicy, comfort food at its best.

KMe90eJiTkPCmMBwIMMAEg.text: What a positive experience, two for two. Ask for the Jack Fruit po-boy, you won't believe it. No it's not pulled pork it's pure veggie. The drinks are marvelous, they make their own ginger beer, it's not on the menu but ask for a dark and stormy.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Browning that Mac and cheese, Arizona style.

V_0nsVC3Rs5_zMjjoynabg.text: Great food, great people. Highly recommended for  community oriented, easy going individuals who also enjoy good a Americana meal.

xr0a9i-xJrgViYregsEwgA.text: Ahhhh! The best burger I think I've had! (the champion?) This place has redeemed my first impression of Phoenix! My beloved and I were just passing through. Phoenix was hot (really hot), congested, and filled with erratic drivers, leading to stress and grumpiness. The Welcome Cafe took us in with open arms. Awesome food, awesome drinks, awesome people. We laughed and joked with everyone at the bar like they were family. We'd be here at least once a week if we lived here. Well Done!!

IPUVKqwQ6NH-RPPF0aGE9w.text: Tried the fried tomato sandwich, jackfruit sandwich, fries, and squash blossoms... all absolutely fantastic! We also really enjoyed the biscuit with jam for dessert. Everything about this place was great, there was plenty of parking and it wasn't crowded on a Saturday night. The chef and staff were friendly, funny, and so much fun. The diner lived up to its name and if I had one last/first/only meal in Phoenix it would be here.

bKmGfa_wfaQAYoFukBvIzA.text: Wow my friend found them on yelp what amazing food had welcome burger excellent.   Also had the corn dog appetizers wow the ladies I was with said it's the best hurricane they have ever had.  Great job guys a definite go to location for everyone. ..

8ZaSkubm63bGI2-AQmfA-A.text: Went back for dinner the other night.  Party of four for drinks and food. It was great ... We had The Koko, Fried Green Tomato sandwich, Avacado Po'Boy and Little Birdy. Rounded out with Carol Fries and Brussels Sprouts. Mmmmmm, Mmmmmm Good.  Added some drinks and friendly banter from Morgan and a good night was had by all!    Thanks Welcome Diner for a great night!

2TFZ_2cQ1BiLyVX7Y9nRKA.text: great place for a hipster and off-beat dinner. be prepared to wait a while if busy, because the service is slow. it has amazing comfort food though, and the experience and meal is well-worth the wait!! definitely recommended.

txSMwVlX79dPpfyZIShMTQ.text: Nom Nom Nom.  The food here is so delicious!  My personal favorite is the fried green tomato sandwich and next would be the carol.  Of course my all time favorite is no longer on the menu, i am told if requested when not slammed, if all ingredients are there, they will make that too!  Goodness I love this place.  If you haven't eaten here, what are you waiting for?

RBukvkn2efn2PMbyHtfNsw.text: The BFD isn't Payton Curry. its not the food, either, its the floorshow. Payton and his wife manage to make this tiny space feel cavernous and fabulous. Their banter is hysterical, and Payton somehow manages to hear everything said on the floor from his outpost cooking. The words fly fast, but you'll laugh hysterically.   And the food? Inventive, fresh, reasonable and fast.

uHb5I51i-1F5t7qUIuU_4w.text: Delicious. The food is bomb. It's tiny but you can make friends. I throughly recommend the big Jim. The chicken is the best. The greens are traditional and great. I bring everyone here to eat. Do yourself a favor and get in here.

tzF8qsCoMkhbTv_zEvTAlA.text: Went here during first friday and it was a madhouse. I'm assuming things run a little smoother when the line isn't out the door so I give them the benefit of the doubt. Food is amazing all the way!

2GPzRgVLYC-3yjDVB-QsYg.text: This place is so cute! I can't get enough of it! They make their own ginger beer! Chicken and waffles! Biscuits! PBR! Huzzah! The poutine is a must try. The atmosphere is casual and friendly, not too hipster (but juuuust hipster enough to make people watching great), and the cocktails are tasty.

PDjBF5aPhjoKv-jUTEweGQ.text: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful! The ambiance was perfect and the company was even better. I only had a beer, but the staff made it an awesome experience. They were all very knowledgable and took the time to give us a background on the diner and what their thoughts and inspirations were for the Welcome Diner going forward. I am so excited to come back this weekend and try out some of the grub, because it looked and smelled amazing! If you are looking for a cool vibe, amazingly gracious staff and a chill place to have a beer (or 7), you should absolutely check this place out! Congrats guys, you are off to a great start!

113zXMk-iab8ia4EbHpB9A.text: Good food! good fun! Shout out to the ladies jumping rope late hours!

2T7jB4wkBmiWXTm62VtL1w.text: This place is amazing!  I had the whitefish po-boy and ice tea.  My friends had biscuit sandwiches And a couple cocktails, rave reviews all around!

QMA-swEiXksn9BdgB14dWw.text: Geez, I love love love this place. Love the hurricanes, the pulled pork, the fried chicken, the biscuits, the burgers, the gravy, the 'dining in a trailer park' atmosphere.  The only thing I don't like is that rave reviews are going to make it impossible for us to stroll in on a Saturday night and get a seat at the counter. But they deserve them.

8ibw2Bsykl-x_cuBWE5zYQ.text: Not your ordinary diner food , but with a great twist on food and drinks. A culinary find.  They use only the best and freshest local ingredients. Daily salads are a work of art.  Great people serving great food.

Xdtv3Rgrzx9lhh8kA0ZiEg.text: OMG! Their food is friggin' delicious! Ordered some sort of breakfast biscuit which entailed an entire fried breast of chicken, tons of bacon and topped off with cheddar cheese. Since it was my first time (and I was starving) I also order a side of sausage gravy and the grit cake. This wasn't a cheap lunch at about $20 with a sweet tea, but it did knock me on my a$$. I ended up splitting the entire sandwich with a friend and we were both stuffed to the gills. My only complaint (very minor) was that the grit cake could have been a teensy weensy bit larger. Other than that I was totally satisfied with the meal, setting and staff.  Thanks Welcome Diner! Happy to have you in the neighborhood!

8wD7TJ5tjS7uhLItBNiZVA.text: If you avoid the chain restaurants in downtown Phoenix, you won't have a bad meal.  Welcome Diner is no exception.  The burgers are amazing, and they have great cocktails to boot.  I really wish I could get food like this in my hometown.

7hJn9X0uY8VyGYn04KNL2A.text: Great little funky place.  Unique food done very well.  Inexpensive place to chill out open late.

fu3dRThTGPyR_ggji466lg.text: I have been here twice and liked both experiences.  It's a cool little hip little diner: nothing fancy.  I have not been on the inside, but I like the outside tables a lot because I brought my dog both times.  I had the chicken sandwich with honey (it's name escapes me, but it had something to do with bees), and the buffalo chicken sandwich on my second visit.  My sister had some kind of a grit cake that was awesome and my mom had pulled pork with slaw - all were on a home made biscuit.  Unless you are really hungry, you might choose to share.  we also had house made ginger beer (delightful) and lemonade.  Great little place.

R7Q2yT20OQggM9kDkp7R3A.text: This place was amazing! Excellent service! Superb food! I see myself spending lots of time here with friends and/or family. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome Diner!

2FCUP3TJ9IiTglSD1PP6jQ.text: I was right, coming back more has made this place grow on me. The hurricanes are so much better than they were before and the food is amazing. The staff is all great and I've become friends with several of them.   Try the jackfruit fries, O.M.G.

JYDBRxBD2LARnwEFBvuXmg.text: Like everyone else, I loved this place. There's qualifiers as to why we liked it so much,so hold your horses and read on.   We shared the chicken honey mustard biscuit. I thought it was good but would try something else next time. My husband ordered beignets. They were good and the closest thing to NOLA I've had outside of the real thing. I probably would've liked them more if the honey was served on the side instead of under the beignet.   Before you think I'm crazy, trust me on this-the Brussels sprouts were awesome! They're not your mamas Brussels sprouts! My husband, not a big fan typically, thought they were great too. Every meal since then when we discuss what veggie to have with our home meals I ask for Brussel sprouts. Not any but THEIRS. I could probably go vegetarian on these things. Flat out YUMMY!  5 stars for just the brussel sprouts? While they deserved it, the 5 stars comes because it's a seriously cool business. Everyone who works there is incredibly friendly.   Basically it's a bunch of really cute guys, most in bands, who not only have great personalities but they are awesome cooks. They are very aware of local (when possible), quality, natural/organic (when possible) food and are creative with their dishes. I'll be back and I'm bringing some GFs next time. ;-)

LfVIR9hc5Re11o3xCKoX8Q.text: Great find!!! The food is very good with a welcome unique flare!! The atmosphere is chill and comfortable! The staff is very friendly and really tries to get to know its patrons. I've had the Big Jim, Fried green tomatoes sandwich, and "back by popular demand" The Champion. All very tasty! It's my goal to try everything on the menu! Love, love, love this place. It belongs on a food network channel show, but because I don't want to have to wait in a line down the road to order food, I hope it doesn't...haha!!!

bBuDeqHUxar8AGcyvMePmw.text: Still the best place! I had the jackfruit po-boy and it was awesome! also, the dirty beignets were Delish. In fact, I wanted to take a picture but we ate them too fast. Just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super cool bar-only seating. Everyone feels like they&#39;re here together....in a good way
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super cool bar-only seating. Everyone feels like they&#39;re here together....in a good way

SfzTNU0H1mnkoennm2vblQ.text: Love this place..i love the casual outdoor setting that is especially nice as the temperature dips. The menu is full of great items but I'm a sucker for the bumblebee biscuit. The mac and cheese is always a hit and the added options like chorizo can give it more kick. Great beverages and my preferred cocktail would be the hurricane drink. Can't wait to go again and again

lxmOkObwuVRvX9oHQYkTwQ.text: Awesome spot! It's like a permanent food truck/ diner combo with plenty of outdoor seating. Strung up lights and eclectic furniture help create a cozy, relaxed atmosphere. Most important, however, is the fact that everyone working here is nice, attentive, and helpful in providing drink & food recommendations. I can personally recommend their old fashioned, house made ginger beer, biscuits, poutine or pulled pork fries, and watermelon salad. Oh and the slaw on the pulled pork fries and some of the biscuits is amazing! Come check this place out!

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine fries
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An old fashioned- Luxardo  cherry and all

ah9e_tYnhb5RPn_QkalBaQ.text: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE WELCOME DINER. Their food and drinks are amazing. They have one of the best hamburgers I have ever had and their Hurricane is ON POINT.  Love spending happy hour on their awesome patio :)

bwU9LJX_3_S87difi9BlKA.text: Definitely off the beaten path! Loved the big joe so much I had to try the carol. Then the no way Jose burger, then the grilled cheese and fried green tomato sandwich! Loved everything but the AZ heat. Go inside! ALL the staff is friendly. A must visit in Phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dirty beignets

b_uKxpC5ecJJ1G6KYfA5Gw.text: What an awesome place! Hidden in a neighborhood, we would have never found it without our friends recommendation. We had the Peanut butter and bacon burger. It was delish! My husband also had the ginger beer, was very gingerly. The location was really cool. Outside seating mainly. I was in awe. Food was great. Somehow I felt it would have been even better with milk shakes on their menu. We will be back! Give it a try! You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4gv8KUJL4-FWCB2TCE22WQ.text: I'm so glad I tried this place after a friend recommended it to me. I ordered the Champion burger with fries. The burger was so good. It was perfectly juicy and the bacon jam was JAMMIN!  there is mostly outside seating. When we went the inside seating was all taken. They have really friendly staff, too! I can't wait to come back and try more of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great atmosphere. We love the outside seating especially this time of year!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The champion burger with fries. Cooked medium and it was perfect!

w5nnMez33TH1v1Te4-Hi2g.text: Just an awesome place to eat and chill with friends or  bring your family for a late dinner for outdoor seating :) all food choices are unique and absolutely delicious. You have to try the biscuit sandwiches!! Their gravy is like no other! I loved it and I'm not a big gravy fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Out door seating

vyRWrg6Qt4W2Kd8n1kPJrA.text: Amazing place! The atmosphere is just phenomenal! It's very quaint and charming. When you're done taking in the awesomeness of the outdoor seating strategically placed around beautiful trees and string lighting, you get to the walk up window where you check out their ever changing specials menu board or the regular menu with a wide variety of fun dishes to choose from. They also have a full bar with a drink menu which I was pretty happy about! The food is all made in house with the very freshest local ingredients, even down to the Chipotle ranch dressing (which was to die for) the staff was fun, friendly and charismatic and the price was fantastic for the quality! And to top it all off, they were easily able to accommodate our large birthday group!  I will definitely be going back with as many people as I can drag with me to show off this hidden gem in downtown Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wqaWfYA_L_s6vgT0v9psRA.text: I love this place and am proud to support their business. I feel the love and hard work they put into everything they do when I eat there; it comes through in the consistent and soul-satisfying food because of they people they hire and continue to empower. So proud to have this little, amazing place representing the culinary culture in Phoenix and Arizona.

ITihR9ew1_J0s8ZdDZFl-A.text: Back when Welcome Diner was just burgers, hot dogs, and giant chocolate chip cookies served on greasy paper plates speckled with ants (or "protein sprinkles" as momma called 'em) it was simply a welcome diner. Now it's so much more than that.  Have you ever watched someone hand you a glass of local red wine blend through a trailer window? How about a Sazerac? Well, it's time to change that. (Here I am assuming you said no. If you said yes, please un-see this section and continue.) When you start your meal with a southern throwback cocktail and finish it with homemade beignets, you best believe that whatever comes in between is going to knock your socks off. This is fine because you're probably sitting outside, so the dress code is pretty nonexistent, anyway.  My crew ordered the three most talked-about items on the menu. The peanut butter burger is the safe option + a bit of "flare" that is essentially peanut sauce. The meat is delicious, as is the bun and everything else between it. We also had the Carol, which was a unique BBQ pulled pork & biscuit sandwich with slaw... a mustard-y spin on a stack of down-home delicious. Last but DON'T YOU EVER THINK LEAST, the Bumblebee fried chicken & biscuit sandwich with honey and amazing b&b pickles. Us Southerners opted to scoot the mustard to the side and let the honey shine, but you could probably do anything to this fried chicken and it would still be incr-edible. Just get it. Get a bucket of it.  Now let's talk beignets. (Don't you wish people said that to you more often? You're welcome.) You can get them with powdered sugar & honey or peanut butter & jam. The waitress literally said the pb&j beignets were her favorite thing in the world, and then quickly added her daughter as a frontrunner to the favorites list. Not knowing her taste in dessert, or daughters for that matter, I trusted her immediately and was thrilled with the combination of light, lemony fried dough juxtaposed with fresh berries and creamy peanut butter. Ain't nothing wrong with the classic, but damn it, it's 2014. The matrimony between pb&j and beignet shouldn't even be questioned.  TL;DR - The Welcome Diner isn't just tasty, it's soulful and lovely. Bring an insatiable appetite and leave with a permasmile.

-pM1b8lNG6Xxb4B6quuiOA.text: "If it's savory, throw an egg on it." -Guy w/ the galaxy hat. Also I highly recommend trying the Kentucky Thorough Bred drink #Superb

EpFf5PqVn4BaY5_PxcqKXQ.text: This place is AWESOME!!! It's a laid back, casual, hole in the wall, neighborhood gem.  LOVE that there is this historic looking little diner in the middle of what appears to be a residential area.  Reminds me of the historic district back home.   I picked my husband up from the airport at 11pm and thought, "Hey...why not?! Let's try it!".  I'm SO glad we did.    It was PACKED.  I asked if they were always that busy and he said "Yep.  Often busier.  We use fresh ingredients and make good food.  It makes a big difference."   I felt like a newbie ordering, asking for a receipt, etc. (because they were so busy), but they were as patient as they could be.  My husband and I both ordered biscuits and gravy to go.  He ordered his with two over-medium fried eggs and I ordered mine with a side of brussel sprouts.   While we were waiting, he had a soda and I had the Ginger Beer.  The Ginger Beer was knock your socks off spicy, but I'm sure it's what saved me from a night full of tummy troubles (eating rich biscuits and gravy right before bed is probably not a good idea).  It was definitely homemade and packed a TON of ginger punch. It will make your throat burn in a good way.  The food was outstanding.  The biscuits were sliced in half, toasted, and accompanied by the super thick, rich sausage gravy.  For us, the gravy had a bit too much heat (excessive black pepper, perhaps cayenne...not sure), but...it was still VERY tasty and we both ate every bit. His eggs were perfect and my sprouts were fantastic with just the right amount of caramelization and oil/butter.   We will definitely be back and often.  :)

v3qIPh6kwL9Sr3SDQyfqTQ.text: I love food, and this is my favorite food in the Valley.   Always fresh, with creative salad options and the BEST vegetarian options.   They make some "Pulled Jackfruit Fries" which are bomb. They cook the jackfruit the same way they cook their pulled pork... beer marinated and what not. It's totally divine.   The late-night hours are great and the outdoor seating lets me take advantage of one of my favorite things about living here - the cool Phoenix nights. So in to it.

9xZZuBTIXfzEfei857k4nw.text: I've been here before but missed the point. Who would've thought a truck stop -looking place with po' boys and fried green tomatoes would serve organic veggies, grass fed beef burgers, free range organic chicken?  All well disguised as post-soul food.  Wow. Gin and tonic made with their homemade lemongrass infused soda water-- oh yes

eGH9QWBhysTAcewUEXLQdQ.text: everyone employee was super personable. very nice, very laid back. great drinks, great food. dinner for 2 was like $30 + tip. my partner and i are new to the area. we felt very welcomed here at the welcome diner!

rlOkyYo8i27OhhdSvTdumw.text: Absolutely delightful. The overall set up is slightly small but it gives it a homey feel. The cocktails were to die for. Love the homemade tonic. I enjoyed the Paloma and The Last Word. We sat at the bar top inside since it was so crowded, and it was awesome to watch the chefs and staff work. Whole team seemed extremely stoked to serve us and be at work which is always a positive. This was last Saturday btw, and there was a line out the door.   I got the Honeybee sandwich and the Brussels sprouts. I tried my friend's jackfruit Po Boy and regular Po Boy. The food was perfect. The exact right amount of home style food with a bit of a twist.   My friends and I also shared a bottle of Provisioner white. We sell it at my work for $12 and I was pleased that they sold it by the bottle for $15. Paired deliciously with the food.   I will definitely be back on Tuesday for all night happy hour. Being in the industry, it's hard to find a spot with amazing drinks and food late, but Welcome Diner pleasantly surprised me!

6bsut7KlpiOmxQz9fncFcQ.text: Stopped by here late sat night (thanks Yelp fam)and the place was buzzing. However we loved the vibe and the whole concept. It was a perfect night to sit outside. They do have indoor seating but very limited. The crowd was very hipster/bohemian/eclectic, I think that covers it. We even sat with a table full of complete strangers (cause that's what I do) they were a fun group of folks.   We decided on the Mac and cheese along with the biscuits and gravy. They were both delicious and the biscuits were sooooo good. Oh and the homemade ginger beer (non alch) was really good too. Unfortunately we were to full to try the beignets, but will def try next time.  Overall this is a place I would go out of my way to go enjoy some good food and some good people. Staff was very personable and great at making suggestions on what to try!  Neighborhood is def sketch as some Yelpers have commented on... But we no scared..lol

icpiO3m1SjQd36BlmjcDdA.text: For some reason, when I think of iconic parts of Phoenix, Welcome Diner comes to mind. The place itself for me feels nostalgic. Anyone visiting downtown Phoenix has got to stop by.

TZ9YvcJuxA9Ba5bKhNlTSQ.text: Discovered this place yesterday night for a late dinner(1am), and was amazingly surprise. The ambiance, the decoration, the friendly staff. It was happy hour and we had the pork fries ($7) the portion was huge and it was really tasty. It's also a full bar and they make great cocktails!  We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork fries on Happy Hour $7

y6VGqTu2wRZz7pq_tTV_Sg.text: You just landed at the Phoenix airport.  The desert sun is beating down your neck, you're feeling hungry, and all of a sudden, your stomach starts growling!  Well, thanks to yelp, good food isn't too far from the airport.    3.1 miles away from the airport is a piece of heaven called Welcome Diner.  So don't be confused that you are driving in the middle of a residential area, and bam, you see this red and white building and bright red umbrellas everywhere!  Next to the building is another bright red object (aka the fence), but this time it's a red painting of a little boy eating what looks like bread.  I'm a bit confused but I'm already getting a good vibe from this place!  So now unto the food.  Mini-me is a sucker for orange juice, and luckily they had freshly squeezed OJ.  This is a minor detail for some folks, but I'm a sucker for freshly squeezed OJ.  I had the holy puerco, and it was sinfully fantastic.  Imagine a layer of sliced polenta, a layer of carnitas, and then a layer of eggs over medium, and finally it's sprinkled with crunchy chicharones.  Yes, it was a stack of deliciousness!  The hubby had the burger with a bacon jam, and I think he enjoyed it since he had no crumbs left at the end of the meal.  Honestly, I was so pleased with my holy puerco that I ignored the entire family.      Phoenix peeps, check this place out.  Don't forget to check out their daily specials and drinks and desserts.  I will definitely stop by the next time I'm in PHX.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t worry Breaking Bad fans, this Stevia is safe.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome to Phoenix!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their fence with the painting!

NB7HkRCH2U8gcps_XkLkNA.text: Saw photos and reviews on yelp and we had to try it out. It was amazing! The employees were really really nice, they made us feel at home. I love the atmosphere. Would defiantly recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MTbl8M8BmP1p-fiFFXM-Pw.text: I love Big Jim! I mean, I love the sandwich Big Jim here at Welcome Diner. Gravy, Fried Chicken, biscuit, glorious.  Nearly all of the food here will clog your arteries, but it tastes so damn good who really cares about that.  I don't know what the hell a Jackfruit is but it tastes as good as any bbq meat sandwich I've had. The drinks are made to order too and are quite tasty.  Only real complaint is I think it's a tad overpriced for the amount of food you get with certain sandwiches.  Sometimes the line can be ridiculously long especially on first friday so just, ya know, prepare to wait for that Big Jim.

KA-d49MXVz0kVCtDrQ7Wcw.text: Probably one of the neatest places I've been to, from food to atmosphere! Been here several times with friends and my fiance, and we haven't been disappointed. My go-to item on the menu has been the fried green tomato sandwich (a waiter suggested I added bacon to make it a BLT, and I LOVE it)! Crispy bread, zesty corn relish... it's awesome!  Last night, we tried a new menu item: the jambalaya.  I've been to New Orleans a few times and tried cajun restaurants across Phoenix (unfortunately, few can get those flavor profiles right). But this jambalaya? Damn! I think cajun-foodies will be extremely pleased! The taste is like homemade New Orleans cooking, yet the dish is still unique. It's a lil smokey, a lil spicy, and super flavorful. I hope they keep it on the menu, because I'll be coming back for more!

ezm3EEQfUoZ6dpfIu9_UIQ.text: Seems like everyone working here cares about what they do. That's a wonderful recipe for deliciousness and a great time. :-)  And they drink Fernet to celebrate milestones. That's a very good sign.  Oh, and everything I ate and smelled was insanely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The scene. Deliciousness in action.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bumblebee... So good.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The awesomeness happening.

uXR7i1Nxw6ghqbLBr7Nz0g.text: Food is delicious!! We were not aware there was an inside until halfway through our visit, but sitting outside under the misters was just fine!  I had the pulled pork fries and some poutine! Both were delicious!! The pulled pork has somes mustardy type sauce on it that is quite unusual but good!  The poutine is made with a white gravy and American cheese instead of the traditional brown gravy and cheese curds but very delicious and american dinerish.  Would definitely order again! I also had a hurricane, omg, sooo good! Loved it, really fruity and refreshing!!  My friend had the burger that he said was very good!! I look forward to going back and trying more things!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled Pork Fries, Poutine, and Welcome Burger!

6Nz1MJm1R2vLf6WIhYl5xA.text: The burgers are delish fries are so good and the staff is friendly and helpful the spot is very hip and the vibe is chill I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ui0FSvjWAPj2brJ5FtefXg.text: Visiting from Tucson and found this diner, here on Yelp. Driving to this place was interesting as it is in an old section just east of downtown Phoenix, could describe it as 'The 'hood', but as we drove up and saw the place and patrons lined up to order outside, I told my wife, 'we gotta do this' and it was very good! Try the 'Big Jim', it's delicious, my wife had the 'Welcome Burger' and she said it was one of the best burgers anywhere. They do have Craft beers and a bar, but you better like it 'kozy' 'cause that bar is inside this little trailer-like restaurant; seating for eating is outside. You really  should try this place, it's a cool, little place that will surprise you! Oh, save room for the Beignets!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View of &#39;kozy&#39; little inside bar of the diner, outside tables and counters in the front yard for eating.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Walk-up order window and beers on tap board with the day&#39;s brew offerings.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from the street as you drive up to to The Welcome Diner.

vvTwaB5DvureRJB3tVfc5Q.text: This place is the Real McCoy!!! Most items are made in house and you can tell when you eat their food. The fried chicken that comes in any of their chicken n biscuit sandos is on par w the best Ive had anywhere. Its white meat but soooooo moist w perfectly crunchy breading. It is served w their biscuit that matches up w some of the best Ive had,  even in the Carolinas.  We also had the poutine, the PBB burger, the grilled cheese, mac&cheese (you can choose toppings; we had brussel sprouts and confit tomato), and the beignets(served in a dish of honey and powdered sugar). They were all outstanding you can taste the love thats put into making this food.  Its picnic/family style seating in an outdoor patio that lights up nicely at night. If youre travelling to this place to eat, we already have something in common so i dont mind sitting w strangers.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko chicken sandy w chipotle ranch w arugula and tomato on a f#$kn delicious biscuit 10/10
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine, mac n cheese, beignets

se2H8XNTteM88U7BxTUPdg.text: Great ambiance.  Outdoor seating under stringed lights was neat.  Food was ok.  If you are in the mood for unhealthy food, go for it.

TAtB-jWjruki2SQIg3T-xg.text: My fav diner hands down. I just love the hospitality and service. The food is delicious. Every time I have a cheat meal welcome is a must. I recommend this place to everyone. I always bring friends to try it.  Keep it up welcome!

Z7Fhgw4v3rWLWsyUsf-HtA.text: First time eating here late one evening on a whim with my work peeps. Delicious, unique, delicious. We sat outside in august- only downfall. Looking fwd to going back in the fall.

ODHO3Ntw5S4mTgqshbjW6g.text: Loved it! You should try it! It's a dining experience unlike any other!   Nice job Welcome Diner!

Bd-MGV9BuE_bu8lJpqmpEA.text: Went on late night and had THE MOST AMAZING BISCUIT AND CHICKEN. Do yourself a favor a visit this place.  It's super hipster and people are really nice.  That all being said,  the poutine fries were weird.  It was fries with white gravy.  Not at all what I thought I was going to be getting when ordering poutine.

Xznt-oeJP0KmA8rEWZ8uTw.text: The biscuits are delicious and made for giants. Like always Welcome Diner kills it again.

V4hUZi8CHO6hmWILtuC2Qw.text: Quaint little place. My hipster friends love it, and I thought it was good, though it didn't quite live up to the hype. I do dig the look and locale, but the was a major bee issue the day I ate there. It was very hard to enjoy the juicy burger they cooked up for me while I was constantly ducking and dodging the damn bees. Though good, I felt it wasn't a lot of bang for my buck. $10 and some change for a burger and a side of hashbrowns (plus they ask for a tip on the tablet from which you order before you get served, which is kinda out of order). I'll still give it a 4 because this little place has heart...and character.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A little birdy told me.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good food, minus the bees.

FWVCsewEP-ux2tkyQGuAjQ.text: Sort of a novelty, very unique, very small...this place does burgers and a quick lunch very well.  Not suggesting bring all your friends becaue the space is limited but for a quick bite to eat, this place is suitable.

mhfiw-d1lrD5GhGNPP1YBA.text: Since bringing the magic of Old Dixie's food truck into their kitchen a couple months ago, The Welcome Diner has been hands-down my favorite spot in Phoenix. The food here is incredible. Their burgers are better than what you would get at Deluxe, and the vibe is way cooler. But forget burgers - if you go there, you've gotta get the fried chicken, bacon, cheddar, and gravy biscuit sandwich. It will blow your mind. Everything is sourced locally and made fresh in the vein of Matt's Big Breakfast. The staff is awesome, and it's the most relaxed atmosphere you could find. I love this place!

moprbnJTybF_byfwf9t4ug.text: I live a couple blocks from this place and I would literally eat here every day if I could afford to.  Though I'd probably end up with a few extra pounds to go with my empty bank account.  But every day when they post their daily special up on their Facebook page, I just sit and drool over it.  I've eaten here a handful of times and everything is so freaking good.  Its comfort food at its best.  And the staff is super friendly and helpful.  They treat you like a regular even if its your first time.  I love the fact that they source all their ingredients from local farmers and purveyors.  I initially thought the prices were a bit on the high side, but once I realized just how well the locally sourced ingredients were prepared, I now feel like its a bargain.  And I also love that they are open until midnight every day (except Monday).  This is just the coolest little place to grab some great food, a good drink, and chill with really friendly people.  I hope this place is around for a very long time.

_tT69XvnQ60UkBtyh1sHdg.text: Our first time to Welcome Diner we opted to go for brunch. I had the Big Jim and my husband had the Holy Puerco and a Brass Monkey (yep, that's served as a brunch cocktail). It was all freakin' delicious! The Big Jim is definitely big, stacked with fried chicken, melted cheddar, bacon and delicious gravy on a homemade biscuit. I was in hog heaven! The Holy Puerco was fried grits layered with pulled pork, house-made, tangy South Carolina BBQ sauce, a fried egg, chicharrones and a side of hash browns. Holy Puerco indeed!!! It was sooo good. That sauce was the very best part. I was happy to see their ingredients were locally sourced and just about everything was made in-house. Quality! We definitley want to come back to try dinner one night and we will absolutely be bringing friends here in the future. The staff was awesome (and very entertaining) and the ambiance was very laid back. Can't wait to come back! Thanks Welcome Diner!

LRBYIYQW11OA-AUQDtIhfg.text: *nom nom nom!*  Mm, this place is the perfect eatery for a lazy Sunday, or if you are skipping school or work as it's quite naughty.  One of those mimosas and bloody marys in the morning kind of days.  The Garfield is extremely satisfying and the french toast in a cup is genius, if a bit sticky.  But since we are being naughty eating here a little stickiness is probably appropriate!  It is tiny tiny, but I find it amusing rather than annoying.

fV2NNJLXL2LDa0CG5K9UKw.text: My husband and I live a couple of blocks away from this charming piece of history. The menu is very limited (hamburgers and hot dogs) but everything that can be gotten from a local grower or manufacturer is. They have a great variety of Southwestern toppings that they will chop and grill freshly for every burger and dog. The fries are freshly cut and delicious. The guys that run the diner are friendly and the prices are reasonable. The hours are from 11 am to 3 pm Monday through Saturday and it is a cash only operation (my only complaints!). The counter inside is tiny and seats less than 10. There are some tables outside, and a take-out window. When we were there, Matt, the owner of Matt's Big Breakfast, was also getting lunch, and it was great to hear how a number of the owners of the downtown small restaurants and shops are long time friends and all support each other. Quaint places with young, hip owners, offering high quality food and goods make us feel positively about living in an often maligned part of town. We'll be back often to support the Welcome Diner.

ijwwctuZx5H2HTV36PI8rw.text: WOW! Great experience! I am new to AZ, so I am enjoying trying new places. Welcome diner is all around awesome.  I would like to see more vegetarian options, but aside from that, everything was amazing. We chose to eat inside the diner at the counter, good call on our part. The staff served up great service, delicious food, with a side dish of humor to make the evening even more fun. Looking forward to my next visit and bringing friends to experience this fabulous establishment.

Jq50ommC5xIM5dlwCNTi4Q.text: This place is no joke. The biscuits are to die for. Pork Fries are unreal. I wish I had more room in my stomach to try everything on the menu. The service is top notch as well.

AmAOpmYReIO-JVCytyuwCg.text: The food is outstanding. I saw this place on the local news TV station. And wanted to try it out. I went with my sister. It's located in the middle of a residential neighborhood. It's a quirky place with outdoor seating only. The small building looks like a diner. The employees were really pleasant and helpful. I ordered the Big Jim, my sister had the Fried Green Tomatoe Sandwich. We had fries on the side. The fries and dip that went with them were fantastic. Something in the dip gave it a tangy flavor. The fries were nice and crisp. As soon as I bit into the Big Jim, I thought how heavenly it was. The chicken was so tender and juicy. The combination of fried chicken , bacon, and gravy on a biscuit was fulfilling and scrumptious. The Big Jim was almost too big. I could barely finish it. My sister said her sandwich was fantastic and tasty. I would highly recommend this diner to anyone. My only beef with this place is it doesn't open until 5 pm.

56sizH-QdEvxhhpoAYBAMg.text: I love this place. IDK what Brentski is talking about. lol, I love the hurricanes and the pork fries.

jlKN4TifiSbZEUaArtIGjQ.text: First time here and I have no problem giving them five stars.   We had wonderful service provided by Mikey and Drea.  Clayton was the chef and man can he cook. Wonderful food, fun and personality.  Highly recommend the big Jim!

UT9UZVjXc_hxlmVe3379rw.text: Came here for brunch with my girlfriend. First time in Phoenix , she wanted to take me to Braggs since she lives downtown but the wait was crazy. I had the welcome breakfast and it was the best breakfast I've had in a long time. The biscuit, hash browns and bacon were amazing, my girlfriend got the grilled cheese w the tomato confit and inhaled it .. guess it was pretty good! Loved it! Perfect new years day brunch!

hI-lDhOICcXGFUqg48RoxQ.text: This place is great local diner open late good beer on tap great service usually and perfect ambiance especially the bathroom. All the food is good. I am partially vegetarian, yet I will  eats me some fried chicken here mm m m m mmmmmm

bRcH5kIk-DRjYh1DwHNHeg.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Phoenix, and you literally get to eat outside at a picnic table.  I came here due to extrinsic circumstances, and would not have ordinarily tried it based on it's location/outward appearance; but, after eating here, I realize I would have been a fool to avoid it.  This is a must eat restaurant!

d387QayqHhmFnIg2o4Eefg.text: A friend of mine introduced me to this gem last week, and I can't believe I didn't know about it! Welcome Diner is adorable, with friendly staff and a cool atmosphere. We went after work for happy hour, and it was a great experience. Highly recommend the koko biscuit and the hurricane! Will be back soon :)

bk6VqPrwlJZZx--e3nbKKg.text: This place is amazing! Went for some late night chow after a show. Service was great food was soooooooo good! I had the delicious best ever vegetarian jackfruit sandwich and my friend had the Mac n cheese. Recommend!

Pt4RFVxBSsS8aR7zUeHROA.text: My husband and I stopped in this restaurant this evening. The looks of the place was quaint and nothing like we had expected. It was better! It's the smallest diner I have ever been to,yet pleasant and clean. Even the outside tables and chairs were very clean. The young man who waited on us was friendly and helpful, and very cute, looks a bit like John Mayer. Anyway...the food is outstanding! I had a burger with mushrooms, cooked to my order. Came with the right amount of fries. The burger was delicious and plenty. My husband had the chicken sandwich, never had one so good. And for you single gals out there, the cook was as hot as the grill!  The cole slaw was different but very good. My husband ordered coffee and apple pie,the coffee was made fresh. The pie was a huge slice and worth trying..... YUMMO! The staff there was friendly,service was great. Welcome Diner is a must try.

U4C9Vv-_2eFQDdN0de6nAw.text: My new favorite late night food spot. The cocktails were outstanding (do yourself a favor and get the whiskey sour) and the portions were large and delicious. My girlfriend and I split the Jim Bob and it was plenty for a late night snack. My only disappointment was that it took me almost 8 months living here to find the place.

TqSRF5X5mRhatc7eWRuviA.text: Chose this diner because of all the rave reviews and wasn't disappointed! Five stars for atmosphere, five stars for the awesomeness of food, and five stars for the friendliness of staff. Try it out for yourself, you will not regret it.

RxI6aM4wQYiX6EheX8jRLg.text: Great little place. In a nice neighborhood, the best garlic chicken sandwich I've ever had. love the fries too. nice people.

BMq8xWWGJXGkh6jOIJF5AQ.text: If in Phoenix eat here. Fried Chicken and a Champaign-a-cane. Fucking fabulous on a Sunday morn.

AUrh9s0tWFECzUqmFFQk-w.text: Drinks are amazing and the jackfruit dishes are wonderful. I wish they had more vegan options and more inside seating but this is a super tiny diner so you have to take this into consideration. They make their own tonic water for gin and tonics, oh myyy!

1TBf48DaOd6pLJHrs2p-EA.text: Let me start by saying from the time I pulled up to the place, walked in the courtyard, stepped into the diner and took a seat on one of the 9 stools at the corner of the counter, I was a fan. This tiny place packs a big punch. The employees are super friendly and upbeat. There is a sense that they want you to have a great experience while you enjoy eating. It's got some super items on the menu and they are working on creating a full bar. They have large multi seat tables that look similar to picnic tables outside under umbrellas so there is more seating of the weather is good. There are several items on the menu I will return to try but on this particular trip, our first, we had the Holy Puerco & the Peanut butter Bacon Cheddar Burger. Both were amazing. I felt a bit like I was back in New Orleans with the fried cheddar grit cake, cracklins, & Crystal sauce. Not to mention the burger reminds me of one of my favorite burger joints in NOLA, Yo Mama's Bar & Grill. They also have a Peanut butter Bacon burger. I like the list they have on the wall behind the counter that names all the local businesses they purchase there produce, meat, and goods. It shows the intent to buy local and support other local businesses. I will be back, I witnesses the making and devouring of a sandwich named Big Jim, a fried chicken breast, country gravy, bacon & cheddar on a large homemade biscuit. I have got to try that for myself. So my recommendation to you is to go, eat, experience this little diner for yourselves. There is soul in the food they serve. Here is a link to the diner's website: marthaandmary.net/welcom...

qSng-yES6C88tVlx-vTbgA.text: First off don't get nervous trying out this place because of it's location. It's an outdoor diner. You can sit inside but there's only a few seats available. They play old school songs, which is nice to listen to. I loved the fries that we got and the corn dog. Big Jim was very delicious too! It was perfect with the gravy! I wasn't a big fan of koko and only had a bite out of it. It had an unusual taste to it.

eR5466AN1-CMosA5_8C-nA.text: After an action packed Sunday Funday, Welcome Diner was just what was needed.  The unique food makes you wonder, at first,  if it's actually going to be good.  This is one place where not just the food speaks for itself...the service was great and the best part is how they actually bring the food out to you even though you order a food truck window.

_PWBWi6yGvlNV1LD6Go8HA.text: Great staff, great food. I get takeout from WD at least once a week.

NJbvW6ZW5opWjX1BWkbE9A.text: Awesome place good food good people drinks are swell.  Service is great food was awesome and drinks so we stayed a bit.  Out of towners looking for good food.  Thx

CzNoO9rA6UYdKZsri7FPDw.text: Welcome Diner will for sure be a regular place for my fiance and I to visit from now on. Beautiful people working here, they respected pronouns and were overall awesome with the way they treated their customers. Feels like home the price is a little up there but I'd say it's worth it for the overall experience.

fawqFxgupdbI85ykCHvByw.text: One of my favorite spots. The food, drinks, and atmosphere are all wonderful. Their new location still maintains the charm of the old diner, but expands on it in every way possible. Highly recommended!

Arxke_RIhEb7GIkp6LY20w.text: Words cannot express how good the food is here!! I had the fried chicken biscuit. The various flavors of this dish was amazing! The portions are just right and you can tell real effort was put into this dish. My table shared the pork fries. We nearly lost our minds it was so good!

AUwAdthljcivJ9iJpA_j6Q.text: So good, I'll eat on a patio when it's 35 degrees out.   Gone are the days of diners as restaurants with incredibly greasy food and questionable cleanliness. The future of diners is here, with its eclectic flavors that appeal to carnivores and vegans alike. You're going to find the dish for you here, I guarantee it.   There's a small trailer with indoor bar seating. Good luck getting in there, as the space is obviously limited. For everyone else, you're gonna walk up to a window and swiftly have your order placed. They take cash and credit, as long as you're not too much of a "baller" carrying above $20 bills. I think some RoRo newcomers might have trouble with that. ;-)   A little birdie on my shoulder told me to keep it simple and go with, well, the Little Birdie. With simply fried chicken and cheddar on a biscuit, it's great to test the waters and see how welcome really shines. My chicken was perfect! I would seem it took a little dip in buttermilk before being introduced to a tasty batter. I can really tell these cooks know their chicken. The biscuit was amazing as well--I'd go as far as to say it's the best I've had on this side of the Mississippi. My vegetarian dining companion went with the jackfruit fries. I'd only had the fruit once before, and I'm not an expert on preparation, but I will say it was definitely tasty and a great meat substitute.   Everything was washed down with a pint of PBR, but if you want something a little fancier, there are a few craft beers, and a generous cocktail list. For a very small price, I walked away happy and eager to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The essentials.

FJMCFB6s89KUyX4mWUhm4w.text: Updating my review for Welcome Diner after having been there a few times now! I will admit that if it weren't for my boyfriend who decided after the first time that he loved it, I probably wouldn't have gone back.  Anyways - I'm a huge fan of their fries, first and foremost. I get them every time. They're the thinner shoestring variety & come with a different kind of delicious creamy dipping sauce, rather than just ketchup. You can get them topped with jackfruit, pulled pork, or poutine. With one of the toppings, it's basically the size of a meal.  I also really like the bumblebee sandwich. The fried chicken is one of the best and it tastes great on their biscuit with some honey!  My boyfriend swears by the jackfruit po'boy & for good reason. It's really a tasty vegetarian option, which is commonly difficult to find at most places. While he's not vegetarian, it's his go-to option, and the first time he had it, he said that it tasted very similar to pulled pork!  Also, if you're a fan of fish, try out the fish po'boy. The tarter sauce that comes on it is smooth & creamy and balances out the tart coleslaw. My favorite part about it is that it's much lighter than the fried chicken.  They open later on in the day and are open until 2am. It's our #1 choice for a late night bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beignets!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Po&#39;Boy.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ginger beer!

5WR1_pB7xTWBPDzPtkbB8g.text: Welcome Diner, there is a reason why you're so loved! The food, its delish!  I had asked the boys to join me many many times at Welcome Diner and each time just poop pooped on the idea, but this time I had them both in the car and they were hungry, so down the street we went and before they knew it I had already parked near WD!    They went kicking and screaming as I lead them to the order line, I shoved menus in there hand and soon the fighting was subsiding, and before I knew it they were already giving their orders....  I went with the Koko. It's a biscuit sandwich that has fried chicken topped with chipotle ranch, arugula and tomato, I bet your thinking this must be a small sandwich, but you would be wrong, the biscuits are almost bun size, they are cut in half and grilled in the middle, they have the perfect texture of a biscuit and hold of a bun, oh and that fried chicken, oh sweet lord, this was a great sandwich!  One ordered the PB&B (Peanut Butter & Burger) it was crunchy peanut butter, B&B pickles, bacon, cheddar on a burger, dude this was delish as well, don't think about it, just order it and try it out, I promise you wont be disappointed.  The other ordered Mac & Cheese, and well I can not personally testify for it I can say it was a hit, before I knew it, the bowl was empty and the kid had a smile.  We also ordered 2 orders of Beignets drizzled in local honey and powder sugar, 2 orders split among 3 gave each of us 2 perfectly fried pieces of dough heaven. This was the perfect way to end a great meal!  The boys are already hitting me up wanting to go again, since it's their area I'm sure we will be back before you know it!
