LJdDPUlcj0Z9cPUkTaJZiA.text: Amazing diner! My family picked me up from Sky Harbor and took me to this place at night to grab a bite. It was my first time in Arizona and the Welcome Diner was a very good impression. The outside dining is really great and welcoming. They have the sweetest watermelons, I ever had. I highly recommend the Az Mule drink because they make their own ginger beer which makes their Mule stand out from everyone else.

09Ju4UAXFDoHodgyITJ51g.text: Great environment, service and food.  Everyone was very friendly.  Especially appreciated they were open late and had outdoor seating!

63b55ZD_EO2jf6rJpJc4ig.text: Just flew into Phoenix and found this on Yelp. Let me tell you...haven't had a burger this delicious in years!!! Add Brussels sprouts on the side and you won't be disappointed. Great spot!

fRVJAWaLbFjt0fmKfXNqKQ.text: I really wanted to love this place. Cute outdoor area and vibe but so many little things just made us leave with a little sour taste in our mouths. First, it's super confusing that for outdoor seating you seat yourself and order at the window but indoor seating (but not at the bar inside) is served by a waitress. Not too bad if you've been there before but for newbies they should do a better job of communicating how it works. Because of this confusion, I stood in line at the window for ~10 minutes while an older couple fumbled through ordering and then tried to sit inside. Did not help that the staff member running this window was probably high. Whatever. On to food. Everything we had was pretty excellently made and tasty. However, we ordered the omelette and added sausage (per the menu) but the sausage came on the side??? Very weird. And the portion sizes were weird - we ordered a side of bacon for $3.50 which came with 2 strips. Seems pricey to me. And Brussels sprouts was like a half full bowl that looked like someone had already started chowing down. Finally, getting a refill on our tiny cups of coffee was an unnecessary burden that I feel like every other brunch place has a handle on.

0uprbypBJ4-kma-LjWJgJw.text: Meh.  As someone who lives in Louisiana, I'm very Leary of any place that sells "Louisiana" foods. The food lacked seasoning/flavor. Very underwhelming. Atmosphere was nice with pretty lights and outdoor seating. Staff was kind.

CuULOhajTRt644VyiAn7HA.text: One of the best meal Is have ever had in AZ... and simply the best Mac and cheese Ive ever had in my life. Like seriously that good. I am a pretty good cook myself and can out cook most places I visit, but the Welcome Diner blows my food away at every turn. I bow to their superior talent.

5tJ1IQNcaOmFKyzF-U-Tww.text: I usually never give low stars but couldn't finish my meal. I got the Koko, chicken on a biscuit, with a chipotle ranch. The biscuit was wayyy to salty. I normally love salty food but I couldn't eat this. It also made me sick to my stomach. Giving it stars because my boyfriend loves to eat here goes at least twice a month. So maybe I picked the wrong menu item, but in my opinion everything should be quality. Additionally the price was $11! No sides or anything, just a biscuit with chicken and a chipotle ranch with a tomato and some greens on it. I will most likely give it another try and will update my review if it improves.

1VL2t9jOjOofBxqmJMQKrg.text: Was looking for the best burger in Phoenix.  Found this place tucked away in a residential neighborhood.  Had the No Way Jose burger.  I saw on the menu that the burger was only 6 oz!  That's a little light for burgers.  Told the waiter while waiting for my meal.  He said we can make it a double burger.  I didn't know that this was an option, but didn't upgrade since the first patty was on the grill cooking already.  The fries came back crispy as ordered.  Ordered some dipping mayo for the fries.  I went back to my Airbnb and spoke to my host about the Welcome Diner.  They have lived in Phoenix for several years and never heard of it!  Just goes to show you, most people don't know what's in their backyards!

sRq1ZTYJMGsVTh9Oges4WA.text: Cool place, I really like the atmosphere of a diner.  By no means is this a normal diner.  I will tell you what not to get though. The meatloaf is super hot because of the sauce they use and the chorizo in it.  I wont order that again.  Mac and cheese is pretty good along with the pimento cheese plate. The roasted okra is hot as well.  I love okra but that is not for me.  Id come back again for sure but id order other items.

avVYBRxV4kT8OcyDTQzPsA.text: This place is such a great little gem located in central Phoenix. I have been here numerous times and the food is outstanding. My favorite is the PB&J burger, it's not something I would normally order but sometimes you have to take chances on food.   If you are looking to sit inside the tiny trailer that only fits about 10 make sure to get there when they first open. The place gets really packed, but there is additional seating outside. If you a first timer I would recommend sitting inside because the staff is great along with their drinks.

v0LSF_vgTMAVmAPXMwWDeg.text: Laid back atmosphere with outdoor seating next to patio heaters. They sell alcohol and poutine. I got the mac and cheese with jalapeno relish for $10 and some change. I don't think I liked the jalapeno relish much since it had a burnt taste and more of a lemon taste instead of a jalapeno taste. I feel like I was lied to by the lady at the window when I was ordering when it came to what was in the jalapeno relish. The mac and cheese seemed to be missing one of it's key ingredients, cheese. It had some type of cheese sauce instead of actual cheese melted into it. I did not like it at all. It wasn't even heated up, it was straight up cold. I felt like I wasted my money here. Don't think I'll be coming back unless it's to drink some alcohol. I'll give it 2 stars for the outdoor seating and heaters but the food deserves zero stars. My girl wanted to try the poutine but wasn't able to cause they only make gravy with saugage in it and she doesn't eat pork. We both had the mac and cheese and let's just say her review would have been harsher than mine. Go somewhere else if you're hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese with jalapeno relish for $10

RXB-d3ANw1zn9Ev9IQPwdg.text: Great food and great prices. Had the burger and it was amazing. It was a quick stop before my flight to Michigan so I was in a hurry. The food came out quick and delicious. I would highly recommend if you are in the area.

WWtprBkBqtJCWYCYvJBWfw.text: My husband and I visited this spot sometime ago.  I still crave the macaroni and cheese with bacon. It was delicious!

QaUK0498OsHpGND_RRhpbw.text: We tried chicken and donuts before and wanted to try out this place when we heard about it opening. This place has great atmosphere and has an old school diner feel with a relaxed vibe. We tried one of the chicken biscuit sandwiches recommended to us with the gravy on the side. The chicken was cooked perfectly and was so good. The gravy had awesome flavor, but the bacon was ok it was too tough which made it hard to eat with the sandwich. The burger had jalapenos and it was one of the best burgers we've had. Then we had to try the Mac and cheese which is my favorite, and this is a 9 out of 10 for me. This place is amazing, the service was great and we will definitely be back.

xUp3c_abWjIue4p9UtCxFg.text: Came here late night because we heard the fried chicken sandwich was bomb. Alas..it was only alright. In all honesty, I wouldn't go out of my way,our breakthe speed limit to grab a table or stool at the counter. It seems to be a hipster hangout, with no super tasty food to enjoy. Maybe we came on an off night, but my chicken sandwich was..meh. My drink..the lavender something had more ice than anything else. I should have stuck with the glass of water they brought. My friend ordered old fashioneds. At least someone really enjoyed something they ordered.  Not my cuppa tea. Don't think I'll be back.

esONdMjMIWe4JtOLXqtbnQ.text: I wanted to like this place so bad because of many great reviews but didn't happen for me. The place looks cute with the outdoor seating but the food and drink of what I ordered just didn't meet my expectations. I had the sunrise and the super watered down hibiscus lemonade. The  Sunrise biscuit texture was so dry and not tasty. The Canadian bacon was also dry. This sandwich needed major sauce or something to compliment the dryness. The 3 cubes of watermelon tasted like it's been sitting out for hours. The lemonade didn't taste like lemonade nor hibiscus. So bummed that I didn't get a great experience. I don't think I will come back.

fLGDSPEaGdRVGtgn3gMuXQ.text: This place was okayyy. You can sit inside or outside. If you want to sit inside, proceed inside instead of waiting in the line that will form outside.  My husband and I found the food pretty dry and flavorless. It was great quality but lacking flavor. The staff and chefs are sooo kind though!  Loved the good vibes of this small diner.

5EBsWFyJTl_4ofV5Mfxqgg.text: Welcome Diner is apparently pretty famous around downtown, but I hadn't heard of it until my friends dragged me here on a weekend night around 11pm. I think the open from dinner until 2am is a great concept (especially with its proximity to ASU and UA), and I find the menu options interesting. The open seating is fine, but it gets really full really fast. The service was friendly, and parking is street.   Hibiscus lemonade: Gorgeous color and amazing tartness. This was super refreshing and not too sweet, which I appreciated. If it were me, I'd have loved a slight more floral flavor from the hibiscus, but I'd have this any hot, sweltering, typical Phoenix summer day.  Macaroni and cheese: The "secret blend" looked like a mixture of pale cheeses to me, and the cheesiness was mediocre. I thought the top was toasty and had that nice cheesy crust with the breadcrumbs, but the overall dish just erred on the side of under salted to me.   Pulled "pork" fries made with jackfruit and cabbage slaw: These pulled pork fries were pretty good! The sauce was tangy and rich, and I thought the texture was pretty similar to slightly dry pork. It's definitely an interesting alternative to meat, and when paired with the tangy slaw, the combination definitely had a nice kick. The fries were fine, mostly just a starchy vessel for the other ingredients.  Cornbread with butter: This was unfortunately pretty disappointing. The cornbread was served in a cute cast iron pan, but it was definitely over cooked and bone dry. I could taste some of the caramely corn flavor, but it was stuck on the bottom of the pan and a pain to get off. The butter was also light in flavor, and I couldn't really distinguish what it was flavored with. Overall a miss for me.  I might stop by Welcome Diner again for some late night munchies, but I might try other dishes next time. Maybe the shrimp toast?

iZFuhSBN-AJzFkYDjJJQuw.text: So, I usually rave about this place, but I'm leaving here at 1AM on Saturday early morning, June 29th and I can honestly say that everything was terrible. The service was poor, our server/cooks forgot our order so we were given complimentary over cooked fries that were dry and cold, and then everything came out crappy. Finally, after an hour, our peanut butter burgers instead of medium, came out well done, the grilled cheese had tomatoes (which we said no thank you to) and the poutine had fries that tasted like they were a week old! My brother in law couldn't even eat them.   I've been to this restaurant in the past, when they were a dive on Roosevelt, when they first opened up on Pierce. But, I can honestly say there are much better venues downtown to choose from. I'm so sad write that this was an awful experience. At this time, I would no longer recommend one of my long time favorite restaurants. How embarrassing that I brought my sister here to wrap up her birthday night.  I'm heartbroken.

U6ye3O7FPVrhywOKGlGmew.text: What a cute 'lil place! It's so nice to see a restaurant open late that isn't an iHop. This place has a really cool vibe. Probably one of the best food combinations ever is honey and biscuits, and add fried chicken to that, and you're in heaven. Everything was delicious!

4OWBccC0M4cp_S6hduKtgg.text: I've been here twice now and both times, I've had a great experience. It's a pretty laid back spot with a retro vibe. There are plenty of seats inside and outside. The staff were super friendly, great customer service! This time I tried their fried green tomatoes sandwich and jackfruit fries. Both were outstanding. But the sandwich...was the best thing I've eaten at Welcome diner. The flavor and texture was the perfect combination you want in a sandwich. 10/10! I would highly recommend this item.

CF0muBbPq3k4ScqjSOvA-Q.text: I took my coworkers to the new location last night before a comedy show. We live on the northwest side so aren't able to get downtown often. I was actually worried that the new location would not have the same character as the old location....well it absolutely does. When we arrived the place was full besides the bar, so we sat at the bar which is actually an open kitchen and we were able to watch the cooking of all of the food which we enjoyed. The Paloma cocktail was so good! I love tequila and grapefruit so it was a great combination. I ordered the big Jim for my meal. It was a biscuit with fried chicken, gravy and cheddar aka heart attack on a plate but so well worth it.  I feel like the service was much better this time around and the food came out fresh andMy coworkers and I really enjoyed our meal and will go back when downtown again.

nq31-gPDDE6CNYYmzWpBvA.text: LOVED IT!  From the ambiance, service, and food, everything was divine.  I love how "warm" and welcome the diner feels, as the name does the diner justice. The decorations are cute and I was quickly brought back to the 1960's, even though I wasn't born until the 1990's, but still- a great feel!  Take a seat at the counter!   It's nice watching the chefs prepare unique dishes. The fried green tomatoes on sourdough was crispy, juicy, and filling. The fresh corn and arugula cut the grease from the tomatoes and balanced the meal.  The jackfruit BBQ fries were "meaty". Tangy and a good portion The only tiny suggestion was that there was too much slaw on the fries, as it made the dish too sour.  A great place in the outskirts of downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jackfruit BBQ fries with slaw
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes Sandwich

qXyUpNd_miOWGvG5yeDbFg.text: We came here for dessert late on a weekend night. We tried BOTH types of pie and WOW so good! Layers of flavor in every bite! We sat at the counter and loved the vintage feel of watching the chefs cook up the food! Everyone was so nice and the front girl was super helpful in helping us order. Retro atmosphere, clean, and family friendly outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HfbvGtr73W1G9bezvOYZpg.text: Finally made it here and not disappointed! Super cute spot, fits in very well with downtown Phoenix. We sat at the counter indoors. Service was awesome! Our server was friendly, prompt and very knowledgeable. Started with an old fashioned. I'm usually not a fan of the muddled fruit type of old fashioned but this one was very tasty. The doctors orders was my second drink which was much less boozy but also very tasty.  As anticipated the food was fantastic! We started with the cornbread which was different from most cornbread I've had but great. I had the chorizo meatloaf at the recommendation of our server and it was so super delicious. The SO had the shrimp po' boy special which was also really good (especially the sauce). I have to admit though, my favorite bite of the evening was the pie. I don't remember exactly what it was called, but it included all of the delicious ingredients. It was something like salted bourbon carmel pecan pie with chocolate chips. It was so good we got another piece to go. No wonder this place has turned into a Phoenix staple. We will definitely be back!

OdTUvVkTR3S9ZXWKGr13Fg.text: Met some girls for Galentine's and tried a few different things on the menu.  Jackfruit fries were a little sour and savory and must try. The burger was delicious and so was the home made Ginger beer.   The three ladies and I didn't order alcohol drinks, but I loved the fact that we were each served different glasses like they would with cocktails. It's the little things :)  Great big patio and really cool servers makes me feel right at home.

CjXfEpSr84RCH6xRr6zJgw.text: The expanded menu and customer service are exceptional.  Only downside at all is that the seating inside is not fat friendly. Only booths, and uncomfortable tall stools at the bar. We'll be back when the weather cools down and we can enjoy a table on the patio.

JYnY0NG9-XGuKyZ7jadiiw.text: Ordered the fried chicken and biscuit sandwich. It was flavorful and fresh. Could have been a bit bigger considering it was not served with any sides other than a few pieces of watermelon and our bill came out to $12. Service was good and everyone was very friendly. Very interesting vibe in the restaurant, you get 1970s feels mixed with diner/home cooking vibes so Definitely somewhere to check out for late night drinks and eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken &amp; biscuit

TcP9gu1h3-dNeUi7h3vXqA.text: We found this place on Yelp and decided to try it too!  This isn't your typical diner.  Their food highly upgraded from your regular diner.  We've been here a couple of times now and when we are near, this is now the first place we think about going to!

yB1nbY9o6nyEgfVGmK0Uxg.text: Okay so I was super excited to try this place...they had some yummy looking vegan and vegitarian options...we ordered mac and cheese and the Fried green tomatoe sandwich. He added bacon to the mac so I didn't try it...he said it was "powdery" and the bacon could have been crisper. I had the Fried green tomatoe sandwich but considering I just came from South Carolina I may be a little bias....but there were good well seasoned the bread was so good however some component of the sandwich causes the bottom bun to be wet...which made it kinda messy. Also the sandwich came with watermelon and there were 3 little pieces...so we added fries on the side. The fries where the then hand cut ones so still has skin on them which I love! All in all it was good and I would love to try some of the other options!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qbgPvVFgm05HfArsq0i7mw.text: This place is amazing! We love sitting at the bar and talking to the chefs! The food is beyond amazing (we try and always get the special). I really don't think there is anything you can get there that isn't mouth watering!

H_Pw2BBtXfKPNnYEpzc93A.text: Overall, this place offers some fantastic and unique dishes. The chorizo meatloaf is quite good, but not very filling and I recommend you pair it with an appetizer. The Champion burger with bacon jam is outstanding.  The bacon jam provides even coverage of the burger, so you have the bacon flavor with every bite.

eZ17A9gSyVZIT2qyQz3twg.text: Dog friendly patio is False. My dog and I sat on the patio and received no service. Should I bring my dog into the resteraunts to be served?

oeeHwZADMceQFh_fB9qR8Q.text: Was very happy here . I travel a bunch for work, so I haven't been able to check our many new places . This place is a hidden gem that I don't believe will remain hidden for very long . I can't believe I was able to get one of the best classic margaritas I've ever had for $7 at happy hour . Food service was a little slow but I expect that will improve in time . Food was tasty and simple with classics.

ORO_DVSFF0OK4o3GaorJhg.text: I have never been disappointed with the food at Welcome Diner.  The food is locally sourced.  The salads are better than any other I have come across and the burgers are rated in the top 3 by my husband and myself.  As per usual in Phoenix, you don't get good food without paying a fair chunk of change, but I would take Welcome Diner over 90% of the places in Phoenix for the quality, Organic, locally sourced items and the chill atmosphere.

-dw0XlPDRyzUlvipFw-y5w.text: Literally the best Mac and cheese in town. I journey from very far just for that! I'd write more, but I'm too busy eating it right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8MO5DnBdGaHAC9w8rHA2JQ.text: Favorite place in the valley. Hands down. I really wish they were closer to where I live so I could indulge more. I'm a total weirdo and LOVED their PB&J burger. It satisfied every pregnancy craving I could imagine. After I had my baby I enjoyed their wonderfully strong hurricane...so good! This place is best to be enjoyed on a hot monsoon night! Sticky air with the smell of rain and an ice cold hurricane..so much yes.

SJ6b3gFn6gEnR1l75D32wQ.text: Amazing.... had big Jim. Dope! The hurricanes are awesome too. Could have used little more rum.  Finished it off with beignets with honey and powder sugar...  I'm in coma now! :)

fZVdOnc7K_GP1BNt4KdqdA.text: Food was on point. Only a half dozen seats inside,  but plenty of seating outside! The food is creative and delicious.

GcDUJjaS2UcDi0J34mPhyg.text: Not exactly in a good appealing neighborhood. It was like a house in a corner converted into a small diner with tables set up in the yard... however the food was great and affordable. I ordered a jambalaya while my friend had the little birdy, fried chicken with cheddar... we both enjoyed the food and will be back for more

1KMy3g-9qKR96H60ZSskjA.text: fun place--l wish they served lunch when the weather is cool--great fries

qgY1d0M0a6GVLfqMGRXIsw.text: This is a food truck experience but the food truck doesn't move. The ambience is very causal, perhaps a few bar style seating inside and a picnic style outside dining area in a downtown neighborhood. Expect to wait 20 minutes or longer waiting in line to order at the window, it's worth it! We ordered the pulled pork biscuit and the fried chicken biscuit with honey and pickles, Poutine, and beignets. The hurricane(house made fruit punch) was delish! The biscuits are huge, fresh, and the perfect compliment to the fried chicken and pulled pork! The Poutine had the right amount of gravy and cheese and a very nice portion. The beignets were hot, moist, crisp and a great end to the meal. We are looking forward to going back and trying more awesome food, including the burgers that looked very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carol
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bumblebee
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine

E6odOUXAK6GLWz5xegClNQ.text: I've been a regular at Welcome for some years now and I can't get enough! Everything on the menu is amazing and so are the drinks. Hurricaaaaane! I like to sit inside at the bar. It's a nice cozy spot for a date night. I only wish they were still open for brunch on the weekends!!!

lN9PBOReh8h4d1-H7TvPlw.text: Cool place! Great vibe and nice people working there! Ginger beer was REALLY good! Will be coming back and bringing friends!

9vqabuPC3cIeIH1_n_Ub9Q.text: The seating here is mostly outdoors. Be prepared for that. It ends up being preferable though because of the misters and the fact that Phoenix evenings are actually really beautiful, if you're looking. Along with the combination of string lights and decorations, you'll feel happy to be there, experiencing it.   I don't eat meat so I can't attest to their fried chicken (although when I come with friends they always enjoy it), but their fried green tomato sandwich is better than most things in life. And I will happily come back for that over and over. I don't think I'll get tired of it, but if I do, they also have a vegan sandwich with pulled jackfruit that tastes good as well.

s-IoBEqn78lTCYTqi5ktfg.text: This place is darling. The patio is gorgeous with lots of comfy, welcoming, and uplifting touches. The service is always upbeat, fun, and inviting and the food... holy moly. I'll gladly gain a few pounds for you Welcome Diner.   If you want to go somewhere different, escape this silly life for a moment, and enjoy a delicious beverage I highly recommend you stroll over to this diner, order yourself a "Hurricane" and find a seat on the patio where you can relax while the desert sun sets. In fact, I just might head over there all by my onsies tonight. Yes, I'm going to drink alone. I'm ok with it.   Everything I've ever ordered off their menu has been delicious. They have lots of southern food options and they change up their specials menu about once a week. Anything you order will be divine. I promise you. Don't question me, I have the pounds to prove it.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1kcUYGeb9x_kLyYuHNCIgQ.text: Both chicken and donuts and the diner are two of my favorite places to eat in the world. Food makes you feel so good and service is always very kind. Try the jack fruit fries, they're my favorite. They make me sooooo gassy but I don't even care it's worth farting all night long to eat them.

CAfLhF_NXCSCfasLp578cQ.text: Both Welcome restaurants are delightful. It's a little hip, very trendy, and super delicious. It's a little off of the main Roosevelt Row social areas, but is worth making it there. Thumbs up.

0zhVxvIzsF57NbHjoxplCQ.text: Such a cute place! Perfect hang out spot with friends they close at 2am! Even cute for a first date! Not many vegetarian/vegan options though. I loved the feeling of being at home, the customer service was excellent they even gave us a little down town history! Will deff go back! Thank you welcome dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomato sandwich
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super cute

LVKRcGtYrIxbK5dCLIDoTA.text: I can't say enough great things about Welcome Diner.  It has my type of feel. I've been a few times and I love bringing guests from out of town here. The counter service outside is outstanding. The guy, I forgot his name, generally works the window and is patient and helpful. He's cool. Like the hip friend that knows about good and drink and can guide you around a really fun menu to get you what you want.  Went with the peanut butter burger, one of the fried chicken biscuit plates and a jackfruit French fry dish that just murdered my expectations.  There's a cool inside spot but it's always full when I get there. I have sitting inside at welcome on my bucket list. The bartender is always entertaining a fun crowd.  Keep opening up fun places and turning around Phoenixs food culture!

Z0adWB7Uq3OWS1EsiBLxxg.text: Authentic, quaint location. Best spot for burgers in all of Maricopa. Homemade ginger beer (non alcoholic) and  FLAVORFUL vegan options. Cute,Dog-friendly, outdoor setting! My only complaint is that it opens at 5..I've caught myself on multiple occasions auto piloting to Welcome Diner just to knock myself in the head for forgetting its not open during lunch hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BumbleBee
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

19QYg7y1EorntLHaSetzew.text: Wow. This place is amazing. Full disclosure, I'd had a few beers before stopping in, but I stand by my statement. I was expecting the usual greasy 1am fare and was blown away. A friend and I shared the fried green tomato sandwich and the grilled cheese. Both were outstanding, but I'd have to say the tomato was the standout. The sourdough bread they were served on was a treat in itself. We finished up with the beignets with local honey and powdered sugar which were also insanely delicious. A little different than what I've had in New Orleans, but c'mon, deep fried dough and sugar. You can't go wrong. The honey gave it kind of an Arizona twist. The staff was really friendly and came by twice to ask us how our food was. I'll definitely be back!! Gotta have some biscuits next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beignets with local honey and powdered sugar.

LwN-C4z73FFKOqKZosthwQ.text: I'm giving it 4 solid stars for the unique and delicious food.  The chicken, gravy and biscuit was on point.  My girlfriend got a vegan sandwich that had a good acidity to it.  Know going in that the stereotypical hipster/dramacool crowd following is strong here and act entitled.  The guys taking orders and cooking, however moved with urgency and provided good customer service.  All in all a great late night spot with food options for everyone.

J7i0gAKhz2m4mn-I8Jw5JQ.text: Great little spot with wonderful fries and biscuit sandwiches. Yummy!

R0UUXyrcdTWKqoUZr7Q6Yg.text: Legit burger! I had paradise valley burger earlier in the day and the burger here was better in my opinion. I had the peanut butter burger with bacon and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Much better value compared to PVB. I also had a biscuit with honey and it was delicious also. Great place, really enjoyed the overall experience. Wish they were open for lunch too.

dS7VJcefNFfB3O-9jOK4Bg.text: The wife and I ate dinner here tonight and we got the veggie sandwich.  It was amazing we were both blown away.  Will you please put this on the menu?

8BQ18hrjwCn_EQVmmg84YQ.text: Love love love this place!! I've been here for brunch and dinner and everything was amazing!! My bf says their burger is the best burger he has ever had and I have to agree. Super juicy!! The bumblebee is on point too!! I can't wait to go back and try the bacon cheddar fries :) I recommend this place to all my friends when they ask for a awesome place to eat downtown. And they are open late!!!

u2G-8jYcEiX3wi6uMgSBmQ.text: This place is AWESOME. Seriously a gem in the area. I was taken here last night and returned tonight because it was a no brainier. This is the perfect spot for a late date night. Great food and awesome drinks. I am a huge fan of the ginger beer(added it to a old fashion). They have a really awesome staff that really work hard. They have great customer service skills and seem to really like working there. All around this is a great business and I will be back many more times in the future.

wTdtuh1D4gorYsL4Mtv2AQ.text: Peanut butter, BBQ and burger. Who knew? Treat yourself to this fun little diner and you will find yourself laughing and talking to the other guests like we did. Great food with a great staff.

m7jd0QKUR1fcB0O-0zkT2g.text: The food here was great, and the servers were attentive.  We were visiting from out of town and the location was not all what we expected; kind of back in a local neighborhood.  But the place itself is lovely.  If we had had more time we would have visited again during our trip, the food was so good :)

E0gtNRb2vioGJjNtz72cTQ.text: I almost never write reviews,  but this needed one. There used to be a vegan ace in LA called pure luck. Had this bbq jackfruit sandwich that I loved. It went out of business a while ago and I haven't found one like it since. Until last night. That jackfruit po'boy was amazing. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. My hat is off.  Honestly, might even be worth a drive from la, just for the sandwich.

D4cdjCM8FfkdqjHqLMr17Q.text: some of the best food in downtown phoenix hands down & fantastic customer service!! i love the consistency of this place, and i constantly crave the pulled pork fries. keep up the good work! :)

BP0CmvYRDWRTL1ZH27LpQQ.text: Just left an awesome dinner at Welcome Diner. Staff is beyond friendly, and the food was delicious. We're new to Phoenix, and we'll definitely be back often. Thanks yall!

hPLkQtWW7J3vASO9eMDYag.text: Love, love, love Welcome Diner. Solid food and solid service make this a favorite. Just had the PB&B burger with real deal THICK cut bacon, bread and butter pickles and my favorite chunky peanut butter. Cooked to perfection and delivered promptly, it went down quick with an ice cold PBR. Before dinner I had their version of Sazerac, made with a rye whiskey in lieu of cognac. Delish. Probably my new favorite summer whiskey drink! Also to die for is the bumblebee, imagine an amazing chicken sandwich on a top notch biscuit drizzled with honey. Yum! I'm full as I write this waiting on beignets that were comped because our side of fries didn't make it out, but I could eat a bumblebee because it's that good. So great food, great drinks and a great al fresco dining experience make Welcome Diner one of my favorite spots in Phoenix. If you come at night sit at the big round table on the 10th street side for great views of downtown.

dCezdjcYVAvJw_CpE0GsLA.text: Simple review. I will definitely be back... Tomorrow! Just look at the pictures. Phenomenal.

3mMIw5NCleoU1nEq41webg.text: A couple friends took me there Saturday.  It was very tasty and affordable.  It's a very small place and they cook right in front of you, if you sit inside (like waffle house but not as greasy and more delicious) and very friendly staff and atmosphere.  We had beer and mimosas with biscuits and gravy (comes with bacon/sausage or mushrooms and an egg), blackberry ricotta lemon pancakes, and a chicken sammich with cheddar, apple butter, on a homemade biscuit.

iivRvbZ9DcMU39A_lH6o1w.text: Remember to suck in your gut when entering and exiting this place. It doesn't bode the largest establishment around, and if you show up at the wrong time you might be sitting outside in the sun in anticipation.   I have been to this place several times and have not been disappointed once. I would suggest something for you to try, but I can't decide on any specific thing that is better than the other. The cup of sweet toast is a must try. My face literally melted off in delight. The burgers and fresh-cut fries are in my personal epic category. The egg sandwich is ridiculous. Really the only knock to this place is it's size. If I didn't need a crowbar to get myself out of the building each time I go, then it might be better.   Seriously people, go here. Eat here. Revel in your trip to the land of gluttony. I love this little cramped trailer and it's treasure trove of goodness.

H1rwRr87YIW6-DfOMTVNAA.text: Man but this place kicks ass.  Incredible, inventive, decadent food.  BITCHING cocktails (try one and you'll see).  Open til 12 on Sunday night.  (Yes!)  Totally savvy musical selections, always. Straight up & personable folks making and serving everything.  The real locals deal.  Feel like I need to go here as much as possible, before it totally blows up and there's no getting a seat.  Big love.

YOulJQZZSbL_USH47MSsEg.text: This little gem is tucked away in a quiet neighborhood near downtown Phoenix. We happened to be driving through on the I10 and I am so glad that we stopped. The service was friendly and had some awesome recommendations as it was our first time. Everyone loved their orders, their homemade biscuits were AMAZING. The fried green tomato sandwich on a biscuit, out of this world. It was a quick detour for some of the most memorable flavors on our trip!

btzGjUKxKwfigh8jd7B7BQ.text: Solid 5. Totally chill attitude from the guys behind the counter serving up killer food. To start: an Old Fashion for me and a Candy Corn signature for the wife. We split not one but two orders of the bacon and cheese fries, and had the biscuit w chicken, gravy, and bacon. All fantastic. Go here anytime if you got a hankering for comfort food after a hangover or just because. We'll be back soon. And we're bringing friends.

K0vfgGocY5Nkqv3HfaydPA.text: So a couple of months ago my co-worker and I were on a dangerous mission to find the one great burger in town. After months of search and going into some of the seediest joints in town, we arrived at Welcome Diner, I was a bit skeptical that this place could produce a burger  that my co-worker and I were so desperately seeking, but oh how rad being wrong is, they knocked the shit out of my taste buds with there burger, I got a double with cheese with a fried egg on top (old school son), I literally finished the burger before my co-worker got his (which was like 5 seconds later) , a True delight.   If you go bring cash money thats all they take, also its a small joint so don't go brining like 40 of your office buddies you'll look like a tool.

gg74qv-pDKd1-YsL85Qq9Q.text: I have been here 3 times. 2 times to eat and once I forgot cash. The first time was not great the fryer was down and the fry's sucked.   The 2nd time was a little better. Except the food inspector was there. Normally this is a non-issue but in a diner car that serves 9 you hear and see everything.   We ordered 2 doubles and 1 fry and a bottle of coke. One burger was made incorrectly as they added grilled onions to both. I was feeling generous and did not ask for a new one. (I should have though, I do not care for onions on the burger) The fry's were good, in fact I could have eaten another order.   The cook Andy and the waitress were so frazzled by the inspector they kept forgetting things like opening the bottle of coke, ketchup, other peoples meals, the "regular" got a double when he ordered 2 singles and made sure Andy knew it was 2 singles...  The other "regular" looked as if she rolled out of bed, smoked a J, slapped her over sized headphones and Ipod in her PJ pocket and rode her bike here. She totally dumped her bike in the front, like she owned the place. Andy asked several times for her to move it but pot head didn't get it.   Andy asked the other regular to do something for him discreetly since the city guy was there, not sure what but he was outside for a while.    I like Welcome but with 2 issues in 2 visits I dunno If I will be back.

utX_hKDwXoe26lQQkdz97Q.text: Dirty.  So dirty.  Hair in the french fries dirty.  Cook sitting on the counter dirty.    Undercoooked hamburger meat, and the server's fingers in my food dirty.  Flies on the lip of the water pitcher dirty.  Somehow these guys think that if you wear gloves you are spared from all contamination.  As if scratching your ass with your gloves on will keep the ass germs from getting in your food.    I've been there before, and have tried to look past all these things, when eating such delicious food, but really, it's not worth it anymore.

gVcd0wEb8bTAAp_FDKU-Fg.text: OH!  MY!  GOD!  I don't understand how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars... Food is incredible, staff are friendly and welcoming, and the drinks are delicious, especially the Hurricane. I had the Carrie pulled pork sandwich and I can honestly say it was one of the best meals I have ever had. EVER!  Don't listen to these winey bitches who give three stars... They obviously don't understand good food and good service. Would eat here every day if I didn't live so far away. Wow

2uyAE1bQLtBppVTDf2JgmQ.text: I love this place. All items on the menu are worthy to try them. My favorite one is the Koko (biscuit with fried chicken). The service is a bit slow but they are so sweet and cool that who cares?

kw7Tm4hKMPmfBMQaYxcVLA.text: This place is awesome! It totally remind me of hole in wall joint in San Diego. The vibe is great and the food is amazing. You know it's a great place to eat when the line is hitting the street.

yn9PlTTpqf85RUaRnI54Bw.text: Got the Carol, brussel sprouts, and insanely delicious mac. Melted with different kinds of cheese and blow torched to a perfect crisp. Deeeeeeelish

s-7gSFuS1RQnyZrRZL9Tiw.text: Wonderful brunch today! I had the Sunrise sandwich and my husband had the Holy Puerco - they were both delicious. I loved the homemade biscuit - light and fluffy and not dry at all. Everyone in the staff is extremely friendly - very positive and relaxing environment. Highly recommend it!

nkf9YrmmLXpDdj6Nu5STVw.text: My wife, the picky vegetarian had some bizarre avocado sandwich and a side of brussel sprouts.  If we end up moving to Phoenix, this restaurant may be the reason why.

Rc1DStaWs7HdF9FSSGUu6Q.text: Great food, great drinks, great price, and great service. The patio is fun and people watching the neighbors as they walk by just adds to the uniqueness of this food truck turned restaurant. What more do you need?

joIKEk98PRKbnETQSnpbrQ.text: The Welcome Diner was a difficult place to write a review about and you'll see why in a second. In order to capture my whole experience here, I'll interview myself (not at great detail or this post will be too long). Here it goes: WHAT DID YOU THINK ABOUT THE APPEARANCE OF THIS PLACE? When we pulled up to the restaurant at 9:00pm on Tuesday night, I was somewhat perplexed. There were about 20 people in the "patio," which was comprised of various picnic tables, patio furniture, and what appeared to be a bar table that sat atop the fence that enclosed half the perimeter of the dining area. There was an eclectic mix of people. I noticed people of all ages and walks of life. Included in the mixture were some nurses, kids that looked like they were on probation (one of which was spitting tobacco), and one guy who kept alluding to his belief that he made his living doing stand-up comedy. As I started parking my rental car, I noticed this place is in the middle of a somewhat shady neighborhood. Not too comforting when I had to park a block away and walk past a house with a man smoking some substance on his porch. HOW WAS THE FOOD? The food was awesome! We ordered the Fish Po' Boy, the mac and cheese with chorizo, and the beignets. The sandwich was perfect. The whitefish was grilled nicely and the slaw was great. The mac and cheese was fantastic. I couldn't stop eating it. And the beignets? Those were a good end to a delicious meal. WOULD YOU GO BACK? Well, given the nature of the location and layout of the restaurant, I would typically say no. But the food was so good, I am interested in trying everything else on the menu. I guarantee we will come back. Specifically to try the poutine fries and the Champion burger. And the biscuit sandwiches. And sausage gravy. I would ask more questions of myself but I think I'd end up writing too much about food on the menu I didn't get an opportunity to eat...

Pk-iRP8QuSgmQcge0SQQ1w.text: Both our plates were wonderful and the staff was friendly. Solid biscuits, chorizo, and a well-cooked egg. My gin and tonic (ordered on a whim) was a bit weak for my taste. 5 stars for a better drink and a cleaner bathroom.

gOv28e78r_WDaAL6-Xg7Jg.text: Good food, attentive service, great ambiance. Hip but not unwelcoming to middle-agers like me. It was a little more pricey than I was expecting but the food is locally-grown. The "Carolina" BBQ sauce on the pulled pork is mustard-based. Pretty good but not what I (or most people familiar with the typical Carolina red sauce) would have expected. Maybe the mustard-based sauce is more common in SC. Hamburger and lemon meringue pie were yummy. All around pretty good.

0cNp8o0N17jfLfb_8l0rjQ.text: This place had some pretty spot on food! The atmosphere was pretty quaint and enjoyable. Nice little joint. Only downside was the limited hours...it'd be nice to be able to grab lunch during the week here, but the hours won't allow for that option.

D23_fu86A_dSXZjP2uNoWQ.text: Great food, beautiful ambiance. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes to eat local food outdoor in Downtown Phoenix.

Gz6-kGv-Xa7RU4YS6Z96xg.text: Oh my Lordy, this place is great! The cocktails with fresh ingredients and yummy!! The food is awesome and the staff is so much fun, professional and great! The fried green tomato sandwich, the mac & cheese with chorizo AND bacon and the Carol - yum!!! We are coming back! The drive from Cave Creek is worth it!!!

gOEoRaVWCxlwxdG62YOYpw.text: I finally have a great late night place. Perfect for late summer nights hanging out outside! I don't even live nearby and its still worth the drive.

5z2vOsjbWJErNMISjcm_4Q.text: This place is great! The burgers are amazing and the coleslaw is fantastic. 4 stars because it's pretty pricey, but worth it for a fabulous meal.

Fwr8WV2W2LgrvdB5ID-6hQ.text: Loved this quirky place! Between the 3 of us we ordered the grilled cheese on a biscuit, the Carol (BBQ pork) and the Big Jim (for especially hearty appetites.  The flavors were amazing! Loved the mustard BBQ sauce on my Carol.  Really wanted to try the Beignets but they were out f them already. Cest la vie...a reason to come back for sure.

ZZMk0pDf10H8IdLGUwCu1g.text: I really wish that I had never eaten here because I can't stop thinking about it!  I constantly think about the amazing earthy flavor of the peanut butter burger!  And the bbq is the most legit bbq sauce I have had since I moved here from Memphis!  Try this place out before the prices soar and it gets inundated with hipsters and yuppies!

2LYqLZp5ApspoHg5qSj27Q.text: What a great place. The food is amazing, the portions are huge, and the atmosphere is friendly. I really enjoyed having the carol over fries, with slaw... yum.

AZ0hbAAwjJP8t57yoISKZA.text: Ordered a grilled cheese at 5:15 pm with 6 people there.  Took a longer than expected, but was super tasty by the time we got it at 5:45.  The whole menu looks really good.

Rbi4E8rlvXatC7Lxsl5YXQ.text: Excellent burgers and house made ginger ale.  Dinner came along with entertainment - police raid next door.

aoV5MBHru6nfUm3_3F9Vrg.text: On a recent trip to Sedona Az from LA Ca, stopped by in Phoenix to grab a bite. Came across the Welcome diner on yelp & was intrigued by the retro / hipster look & did my food research . Definitely recommend the Champion burger   like many others on here. You will not be disappointed! My lady bug ordered the Mac n cheese & loved it. Overall an amazing spot to get a quick bite and just hangout outdoors. Would come back when in Phoenix for sure.   Oh & all staff were masters of their crafts without a doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NQhQpXsSwSJqNC8wN4KWgQ.text: The food was beyond excellent. I was traveling with my parents and between the three of us we have a lot of dietary restrictions. Welcome Diner had enough options without being overwhelming and accomodated to our needs. I had the sunrise sandwich with jackfruit, my mom had the apple cobb  salad which she added chicken to, and my dad had the bumblebee fried chicken sandwich. Everything was excellent and everyone working at the Diner was so, so nice.

k2p0ju67-0n8AmsCwfszpA.text: Pretty good brunch spot. Their biscuits are top notch and the fried chicken is very good as well.

eXuTiT8fZbki1LTdEV6JAg.text: A colleague highly recommended this place. Its a gem of a place. There is a full bar along with the menu. I tried the fish po boy and let me tell you it was very good. The fish was not breaded but grilled and cole slaw was added to it. This place is open till 2am. You need to give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very good fish po boy.

zEz43vRWjXyqSLDBbuCdoQ.text: First time today and overall impressed. This is apparently their new location and it really nice. Good amount of indoor and outdoor seating and the decor is nice. The staff was friendly and the waiter, Marcus, was very informative about the menu. He recommended the burgers/sandwiches but since it was late was looking for a something a bit lighter so I ended up getting the jambalaya. My bf ordered the Big Jim which is a biscuit sandwich and he really enjoyed that. My jambalaya was ok, I was expecting something more runny. BUT what really blew me away and the reason I did 5 stars is their house made ginger beer!! SUPERB  I could sip on this all day. Next time, I will try their hamburger/sandwich since that's what they are more know for and skip the jambalaya. That ginger beer tho  can't wait for next time!

mGW4aTOXBuikC4RXUFPPWg.text: Everything we ordered was great, biscuits and gravy is best in the world. Brussells and okra/tomatoes excellent, macaroni & cheese - wow! Wait staff was fantastic.

62V_K9NW_BxLnozgmB3KKw.text: Decided to walk over to Welcome Diner from Chase field after a Diamondbacks game last night.  I personally would not recommend that walk late at night, but my fiancee and I made it just fine. No frills and kind of odd is the way I would describe this place. I got the Big Jim and it was legit. Pair that with my favorite beer from the brewery I used to live next to in Tucson (Dragoon)? Win win and win. Anyway back to the Big Jim, it was really good, especially considering my sobriety level, the gravy and chicken was just what I needed to carry on last night. The wife to be got herself a Bumble Bee which she deemed quite delicious. You'll have to take her word on that, as I was not able to procure any samples for my taste laboratory. It's a really strange place in the middle of a neighborhood, in the middle of Phoenix. Some people will really love this place and some won't get it.

hY_4ywq1mvTKNguYmznLFQ.text: Awesome cool place...great place to hangout at night....I got the burger...medium...was yum toasted bun...the fries a little small but I ate everyone they were so good...cool relaxing place super friendly helping staff...a go to for relaxing hangout

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum...first time here

qP9WsuK5Rc2KbtzkhopMzA.text: Came here for a late dinner and absolutely loved their food. I got the Big Jim (fried chicken on a biscuit with gravy and bacon), added an egg and split some of their pulled pork fries. It was excellent. I would highly recommend.   I've also been to their sister location, welcome chicken + donuts. I have to say I enjoy their fare here much more.   The location has odd hours, 5pm-2am and is strictly outside patio seating on a sandy yard in the arts suburbs in downtown Phoenix. It's got an incredibly hipster vibe to it which may or may not be your cup of tea. The friend I was with described it as "A bunch of stoners setting up shop in a run down house making really good food". His assessment may or may not reflect my own.   I wouldn't go before 9pm personally unless the temp is under 90 degrees because of the seating and how heavy the food is. But this is definitely one of the best fried chicken and biscuits I've had in Phoenix so I definitely recommend checking this place out when the weather is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork fries
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can&#39;t even see the chicken but it&#39;s in there. It&#39;s a pretty generous portion as well

_34Y9szAQrQqiRajiFupBg.text: I stopped in for a late night meal because everything was closed except Welcome Diner. Compliments to the Chef for making one of the best burgers I've had in awhile. I'm a pretty harsh judge when it comes to burgers, so trust me when I say the Champion Burger lives up to its name! If you're reading this it's too late, everything is closed, so go to the Welcome Diner and order the Champion Burger. You're welcome!

ZRqj6pyS7fPq2As_HSu_Rg.text: Oh lord this place is really good. I'm sitting here at 1:23 am on 11/2/18 with my buddy and we got seated immediately. The host/waiter is so friendly and helpful. The restaurant itself has this wicked cool vibe with really great music playing. The chefs are so dedicated to their work, and as I'm typing this sentence, I'm consuming some really really good Mac n cheese. Maybe a lil pricier than other places, but it's worth it because they're open until 2:00 am and they're super freakin nice. My buddy loves his poutine and I'm loving the slick atmosphere in here. 10/10 will be coming back!!

uLHTXdMyllFLUIEVMAhvvQ.text: This place has delicious food AND drinks! My favorite is their classic Paloma. I love sitting at the bar, because you can watch the cooks do their magic. I will continue coming back. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because our server, while he was cool, was extremely pushy with selling us items. I know up-selling is apart of the job, but not to the point where you get uncomfortable. Still am a fan of this place, though!

yLpdjNwMa1QGAiGxXY_hGA.text: My friends and I came here to celebrate a birthday. Once 7pm rolls around, more people start to arrive - available seating and parking reduces dramatically. Also, I would come before 7 on a Wednesday to take advantage of happy hour 5-7pm.   Our orders took a while to come out. I ordered the Big Jim [$11], which was great. Fried chicken, bacon, gravy, biscuits, cheese. With random pieces of watermelon. The poutine [$9] just with the  gravy on top was meh ahahah. The fries weren't that great.   The beignets were pretty good, except all of the honey sauce pooled into the bottom so the bottom beignets were overly drenched and way too sweet.   The neighborhood is kind of sketchy, but Welcome Diner is on the same street as JoBot and Melt, so you can walk down and enjoy your time there.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim [$11]
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine [$9]

sAyXKRZcQMHSOrG74szW3A.text: Food took wayyyyyy too long. Takes forever to get food and is not worth it. Spend your late baker dollars at McDonald's

UecsHQC-y-BcCf-yssc6iw.text: Visited Welcome Diner last week during their happy hour and got a few dishes and a couple of drinks. My wife got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork fries. Chicken sandwich was really good. Nice texture on the piece of fried chicken and a really fully biscuit. Great job on this sandwich guys. Add a little bit of Crystal hot sauce and that makes it even better. Pulled pork fries were good. The fries are smothered in pulled pork and then dressed with some kind of mustard based sauce which gives it a really nice tang. I think the fries could have been a little more crispy since they have to hold up to so much stuff. Also, the coleslaw on the fries give it an extra layer of texture. I wasn't too crazy about the old fashioned. It was way to sweet for me. Other then that, great food and I will return for that chicken sandwich especially.

YMRjYMN3IYafbHppDiqoPQ.text: Food was delicious and had a cool hipster vibe. The portions are decent but the drinks are small portioned but still very delicious! I would definitely recommend and eat here again but if you plan on eating here you better bring your hydro.

rDF8Ujucx15cv7twtzZVWA.text: Came here after an evening shift and loved it.  I didn't even know this place existed!  Such a cool idea... an old-fashioned diner serving late-night comfort food and cocktails.  It was super refreshing sitting outside in the air sipping a Paloma (grapefruit jarritos combined with tequila and some sort of juice) and munching on a side of fries.  Some of the other people in my group got biscuits, which looked incredible.  We hung out until closing-time, at which point a waiter wandered out to give us a few "hey, closing soon" friendly reminders.  We told him he should probably change the sign to "UNwelcome diner" at closing time every night.  He decided "nah man, that's not our vibe."  Too funny.  Love the service.  This is definitely going to be one of my late-night post-shift haunts.

YZvjfXdDU8uBank0GYu8oQ.text: Beef and eggroll vermicelli was superb, great size, very fresh veggies and very flavorful beef cooked just right. As good or better than Pho places I'm used to in California.

UfMmu-BJk032dbGLnb4kFA.text: The Koko Biscuit deserves an award. Whenever we're out in Phoenix, we always have to drop by for a bite.  Many reasons make this place so great and always packed. 1. Their food. They don't serve anything here that isn't noteworthy. They just GET IT. Comfort food with a modern twist and yummy drinks. I'm always in. 2. The atmosphere is very welcoming and homey. Definitely embodies the "Welcome" part in their name. Their dining area inside is tiny. Basically a bar top and that's it. Most of the seating is outdoors, but they made it a cozy spot with the decor. This is quite a nice social/dining spot. 3. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They're very casual as if they're your friends lol. Again, treating you welcomingly with none of that extra restaurant server etiquette.  4. THE KOKO BISCUIT ALONE  Just come. If you're in the area, you might as well. I really wish we had one of these in LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko biscuit

qSssf6FvZpaF3XLA1j-RxA.text: This place is so awesome!  What an appropriately named restaurant.  We were warmly welcomed, and then met locals from the colorful house nearby.  They masterfully created an atmosphere of community.  But what's even better is the food.  The biscuits and gravy are a must try.  I didn't even know I liked them until I had them here.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VLa9Sct4ca-e0Ht4rdIVNg.text: This place is so fun and cute! Love their decorations here and there.  Went for their breakfast/brunch. It is conveniently located near Roosevelt row in downtown Phenix. Good to start your meal here before you head down for the art walk.  I had Fried Green Tomato Sando. I was really good! It is a great veggie option if you are craving for something deep fried but not oily. I really like the combination of crispy batting on the outside with juice fresh green tomato inside.  I sat on the open kitchen area and oh boy, such temptation to order more dishes as I look at the mouthwatering breakfast plates they are preparing. The chicken, biscuit and gravy looked really good. I am definitely coming back for more.
