Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open kitchen
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seating Booth

73o_8Iogu_j27YvYZAhPOA.text: I was so disappointed to pull up and realize they must have moved locations. There was no more funky dining car with character. I'm glad that they have more room to serve everyone in the a/c, but the car was half the reason I wanted to visit again.   My boyfriend loved that they had jackfruit. Getting to eat something that isn't some pretend meat was great for him. His sandwich was kind of spicy and tangy from the slaw. Very tasty.  I had the Bumble Bee and... meh. I would have preferred it be open faced. Just slice a biscuit in half, smear mustard on it, drizzle honey, top with chicken, little more honey, and pickles. It'll take up more of the plate and trick me into thinking I got my money's worth. Served as is, I didn't get nearly enough honey. This whole thing ends up being fairly dry.

AZidhPw-H9mYziN5nrmJaQ.text: Lately I haven't been out for many meals , so I was excited for this one. Looking online at the menu I saw the Big Jim sandwich and thought "heck yes!" Sadly it didn't meet my expectations :( It was okay, not great. My sons girl had the Chorizo Meatloaf with chipotle sauce and that was pretty delicious :) My son enjoyed a gorgeous grilled cheese sandwich ;) The place is cute, the people were very sweet and the location is pure Phoenix baby ;-* The prices are about right for today's food game. Thanks Welcome diner! You can trust me, I'm in the business ;D

7Ti1IgBP_8eR3uvfv2iF-Q.text: I ordered the Big Jim which is a fried chicken biscuit sandwich with egg and some white gravy. I also got the poutine fries which is fries with cheese and white gravy. The food is decent. Chicken was pretty good but overall, the food doesn't blow me away. I wouldn't come back.  The server was a bit rude. I asked for a fork and he said isn't there one right there on my plate. I said it was dirty. He gave me the fork but c'mon, don't give attitude and give the customer what they want.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken biscuit

kZXeCjtMP5OwNu4Dq5SioQ.text: Walk into this place and you are greeted by a giant disco ball shining over the host stand.  Staff is super friendly and dressed in vintage clothing, almost a Cuba circa 1957 vibe.   I informed them of my gluten allergy and they were able to accommodate. So appreciative of places that do- eating out is hard.   Tried the "painkiller" a fancy Pina Colada, it was yummy and a mimosa.   For food: I opted for the "Sunrise Sando" gluten free- over a bed of arugula with a over medium fried egg, and breakfast sausage.  My husband had the " big Jim" fried chicken Sando.  It was loaded with gravy and looked delicious. Both dishes served with a small  side of watermelon.   Reason for 4 stars, no gluten free items or menu items indicated as such.   Wanted to get a piece of blueberry pie to go, but they were out.   Glad we checked the place out. Loved the decor and mixed matched picnic tables and chairs outside. Loved the plant stands and vintage vibe throughout.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close to Bathroom
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim sando
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog friendly patio

yDdp5CZFQCQcLN1GvTBWIQ.text: This place is so cute and different from a ton of the Phoenix style places I've seen. It looks like an old school diner on the outside.  Kinda not near a bunch of stuff but the place itself is super cute and good food.  They have the cutest outdoor patio with multiple bench & tables and fun seating.  The inside is booths and is pretty simplistic but unique decor and murals on the wall.  We sat by the bar which was a ton of fun to watch the bartenders make drinks and ask for recommendations while visiting.  The food was great, fried chicken 10/5. SO GOOD!!! So juicy and not greasy. Just pure fried yummy hot chicken. We also got the poutine and it was MASSIVE so definitely plan on sharing with 2-4 people.  I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of fried chicken
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside seating area

M170o4DKp4DCjgyBwUxeMQ.text: Welcome dinner is super cute! Classic diner trailer that is well decorated! They have lots of adorable decor and cute blinking lights. I loved the retro vibe. There is a few booths but most of the indoor seating is at the diner bar, either overlooking the open kitchen or the cocktail bar. They also have a huge patio with lots of seating. Overall it's adorable!   But I'm a foodie at heart and the food didn't wow me. We ordered the big Jim biscuit, which is topped with fried chicken and gravy. The gravy was just okay, there wasn't enough of it. The chicken was seemed like it was prepared ahead of time. I get that fried chicken is hard but made to order is always best. We also order the Mac and cheese. I appreciated that it wasn't too cheesy or overly rich. But something was funky with the taste. My companion had a totally different take on the food though. He loved it all!

fWjjdHbUUXpVGbKpRSWJRw.text: Had checked into our hotel late after a football game and were so hungry. The front desk guy suggested the Welcome Diner, So glad he did! Everything from the lemonades to the champion burger, Mac and Cheese and Big Jim were delicious. The whole vibe was very welcoming and low key. We will definitely be coming back next time we visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim Biscuit

EGGgKqqOy6uUvuXW4GU2vA.text: A very hip diner you will find along with hospitable service. Welcome Diner is situated in a casual neighborhood. A ton of seating is available in their outside patio, otherwise there are some booths and bar seating inside as well. I did not like how closely some of the booths were lined up though; the very drunk, ratchet girl sitting directly behind me basically kept whipping her long blonde hair at me. :/   Other than that, comfort food seemed to make up most of the menu, some more Vegan friendly. We opted for a version each of their biscuit sandwiches. I had the *Koko Biscuit* which included more lighter ingredients than the *Big Jim* biscuit. The former had arugula and tomatoes along with their very crunchy and juicy fried chicken. The helping of sauce was a chipotle ranch which offered a nice kick to the meal. Biscuit we both felt could have been more fluffy and perhaps milkier in texture; these were a bit too crumbly. I did like the helping of watermelon on the side as a sweet finish to a very hearty meal.   I'm a sucker for cornbread so I did also order the *Heirloom Cornbread*. I immediately could taste how Vegan friendly this was; it definitely was missing butter, so the texture was a bit more airy and ultimately dried out. On that note, the butter offered on the side was a sweet addition (literally). I think it was an apple butter of some sort.  An eclectic menu and I did love how they sourced their ingredients from local businesses and farms. A worthy spot to visit while in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heirloom cornbread ($8; Ramona Farms cornmeal, butter was like apple butter)
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Koko biscuit ($11; fried chicken, tomato, chipotle ranch, arugula) and Big Jim ($12, add egg +1.5)

ssz1NP4IOsvQN4dZkAgFWQ.text: Food was great. Long wait but if you want to be seated inside just walk inside. Small area and kind of confusing if you've never been there but again the food and the drinks were amazing

BxGIsjqhHtOpcKx5hBaFhA.text: Finding a chicken biscuit in Phoenix is just about as hard as finding a nice cool spot in the summer! But welcome diner has exceeded my expectations. First they not only have a chicken biscuit, but it is smothered and covered in a creamy sausage gravy. Can you say I'll take several? This meal definitely requires fork and knife and maybe even a partner to share it with. Although the chicken was covered in gravy, it still remained a bit crispy and was definitely juicy. I saw grits on the menu and also decided I needed those. They are made with pimento cheese. OMG. They were cheesy and creamy, everything grits should be. They come in a small cup but if they offered a large bowl I would gladly choose that size as they were pretty tasty. Besides the delicious food the employees were friendly and the neighborhood is pretty hip. There is street parking and plenty of it which is always nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken biscuit sandwich with pimento grits

Q0TQED-8fOyGqYLOF0Gwvw.text: Everything works about Welcome Diner.    The dining space:  Gorgeous, unique, well-lit, cute, comfortable, clean.  The service:  Solid service from a friendly "hipsterish" wait staff.  Was checked on by numerous individuals throughout our meal.  Each had a smile on their face and just seemed to be genuinely happy people who were content to be at work.  I appreciated that the wait staff were just being themselves, and were not being fake nice in order to receive a better tip.  Authenticity is underrated.  The food:  Fantastic.  Great execution with high quality ingredients. We arrived for brunch.  I had a "Bumblebee" (fried chicken, honey, biscuit) and country potatoes, which were both perfect.  My wife had the "Big Jim", which was fried chicken, cheddar, bacon, and sausage gravy on a biscuit.  I'm not sure if I heard her say two words after her food was delivered - she was concentrating intently on the culinary work of art before her.  My son had the Biscuit Eggs Benedict and loved it as well.  Price was a little high.  Over $40, tip and taxes not included, for some potatoes and three breakfast sandwiches is high.  It WAS certainly worth the money though, and we plan to return when we visit the area again this winter.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Bumblebee&#34; up close and personal
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Big Jim&#34;
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit Eggs Benedict

8R6RlT5V-Nt5pYiQqfvE8w.text: When it comes to service, atmosphere, and menu breadth, Welcome Diner is tough to beat and I totally get their Yelpy popularity. Those three things alone bring Welcome Diner firmly into four star territory in my book, but my biscuit sandwich was a tad bit disappointing to the point where I'm shying away from the full gravity of the hype surrounding this place.  Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  Welcome Diner crushes I when it comes to their service and atmosphere. This is a step right into the past but with some refreshing progressive flair that's executed upon by genuinely kind and caring folks. I had a full fledged conversation with my server and bartender that was memorable even though I'd spent the rainy evening restaurant hopping all over DTPHX. Star.       Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  $10.00 is a logical price point for a premium biscuit sandwich, and that's exactly what I paid for a rather large Bumblebee sandwich. Star.      Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  This bumblebee sandwich was good, but it didn't blow me away for a few reasons. For starters, my bar for biscuit sandwiches has been placed impossibly high thanks to Pine State Biscuits in Portland, Denver Biscuit Company, and Biscuit Bitch in Seattle.  While my biscuit here at Welcome Diner was fine, I wouldn't have been impressed with it if I were eating it by itself, but such is life when you're creating (slightly overcooked) biscuits to serve the purpose of sandwiching an sandwich. From there, the cut of chicken was fine and the honey and mustard a nice touch, but there was simply something missing here the kept this from being a truly A-Class sandwich. Single Star.      Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  Imperfect biscuit aside, Welcome Diner is fantastic and is worthy of your visit in Phoenix. Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bumblebee: $10.00

PmkCqGOU-0LsxFqhf9UFyA.text: First visit and was pleasantly pleased. I've been missing out bc I haven't heard of or been told about Welcome Diner.   We were welcomed immediately and invited in. Service was on point!   Loved the retro look inside of the diner. Ample seating available with a pet friendly patio. If you sit outside orders are placed at the walk-up window and a server brings out the food to you.   I wish we hadn't had breakfast before bc the plates looked delicious. We did have some non alcoholic drinks which were very refreshing. The lemonade was our favorite. The fruit bowl was a good size for $5 but they were all out of strawberries. I would've like to have some pineapple in the mix but fruit is fruit and I ate it all.   Cute spot. I def want to try the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FSh3eqDAdH3hEFrq3ViU4A.text: Welcome Diner has been on my to-eat list for awhile. I've heard good things about it, but never really had an opportunity to drop in for a meal or drinks. My boyfriend used to live literally down the street from the original and current location, so the menu is imprinted on his mind. Nothing has changed since then with the exception of a few new additions.   I. Love. This. Neighborhood. It is totally reminiscent of my old stomping grounds in hipster downtown Indy - I could see myself living in this Phoenix hood. Welcome Diner fits in with the area. It wasn't terribly busy the evening he took me there so we were able to grab seats at our choosing. The girl taking window orders was so sweet when he mentioned I'd never been- she shook my hand, introduced herself gave and a warm welcome.   He has told me over and again about how awesome the house hurricanes are so we each got one... and second for myself! I figured the jackfruit sandwich would be sufficient for a meal, but it wasn't. I feel if you're paying $10 for a sandwich, there should be more meat & slaw than bread and be dripping in sauce (or some extra on the side). But it wasn't. The flavor was there but the portion size wasn't. So we got poutine which made up for the lacking sandwich. His chorizo meatloaf was delicious.   Hopefully another we'll have another dinner date there in the future, those hurricanes have me hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine! Best dessert ever.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thought I was eating meat- BBQ jackfruit. Think again!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. World famous hurricane!

2Ezj4Kqo7vsS6Dnn1MryJA.text: Went here for the vegan options and it was pretty spot on. I ordered the Carolina BBQ Jackfruit Fries the flavors were AHMAZING! The only recommendation I would make is for them to not over cook the fries to where they are too crispy to enjoy. Stabbed my mouth a couple of times with the fries, but I was hungry. Would definitely go back and order the Jackfruit Po'Boy next.  Thanks Welcome Diner for having vegan friendly options.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carolina bbq Jackfruit Fries

3CqwvH-bfq9O2UpfVX5Epw.text: In all fairness, I feel like if it was 12 AM on a Saturday and I wrote this review after I went to have a drink and have anything but Jack N the Box, I would have given it 4 stars ( atleast) ... but it was Saturday at 5 PM and I was sober as F&#^.   Went with the kid trying to try new spots. First, and foremost the menu is specific  and limited. Had I ordered a simple burger or something, I may have given them a 2, as they seemed to know what they were doing back there when It comes to hamburgers. Perhaps , that's what they should just stick to.. burgers. Ya know , having a limited and specific menu isnt bad. It gives you just enough room to make food your amazing at making. My son ordered a burger and fries... no complaints.   I ordered some type of strange soup.... its wasnt a soup...at all! It was more like a bowl of...stuff with over cooked rice. It tasted like gravy! ( seriously)   My old fashion, wasnt.   We sat out side at first.... and we were attacked by flies. The whole outside is a bug/ fly haven, it was gross. went inside, and flies were just buzzing around with no cares or worries in the world. That napkin and fork in the pic...is covering my drink from the flies!  I would like to suggest the employees all dress in at least the same shirt. One waitress had gym attire, the other a black tee , looked like he just rolled out of bed.   I wouldn't return, unless it was 12 am and i wanted a burger..and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cp-FCLz2Hp5d88T5P6JEtg.text: The food is very good.  Southern style with an island influence.  Yes, that sounds wierd; try the Jackfruit fries and you will see what I mean.  The plate is fries and very spicy Jackfruit drizzled in a Carolina mustard style BBQ sauce. We had biscuits and gravy and Jambalaya.  Both were very good.  The cook likes things on the spicy side and that's fine with me. The venue is also open until 2 AM - one of the few places to eat downtown after about 9 most nights. I am deducting one star for the house management.  Inside seating is very limited.  There are about 8 tables and 8 barstools.  They have outside seating with window service...no outside wait staff.  On a hot night, you want to be inside.  The problem, from my point of view, is that the management let's patrons linger - for hours.  In a less crowded restaurant, I enjoy the opportunity to take my time and eat my meal.  It is nice to not have the staff trying to turn the table as quickly as possible.  It does not work here.  We watched and waited while groups sat at the tables long after their meals had concluded and just talked.  The host said, "People like to just sit in the A/C so they don't have to go outside." Fair enough. I will go back but, if I can't get an inside seat, I won't wait around.  A simple policy like, you have to order food to sit inside would go a long way to relieve the situation and would make the place more profitable too.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jackfruit Fries
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cTS3mMQfHNTW61O2wfK_BQ.text: Great food, service, and atmosphere. We sat at the bar with Jet as our bartender/server. He was super friendly and social. We enjoyed our self 100%. No complaints at all. Highly recommend.

6WW0fg2_PoIgY1zPydcfuQ.text: Wow, such a cool place! Came here for a late night snack and drink and a late flight.   Drink: Manhattan. I would definitely get it again, and would recommend it if you like bourbon.   Food: Champion. This is one of the best burgers I've had in a while. Definitely mouth watering even thinking about it haha.   Service: Our waitress was super nice and helpful. She was very pleasant and friendly as well.   I wish they had a place like this where I live.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-lQUDlBrzq76TX8lFVc5Zw.text: We went to the Vig first for them to tell us that the kitchen was closed. One of the waiters came out to tell us that there was a restaurant close by with five star food, but not five star appearance. He also told us about a few more in the area, but we decided to try Welcome Diner. Omg, the food was amazingly great, the service was impeccable and the music was awesome, I am so glad we came here I ate everything on my plate

wSmfnq8oJeCX6isqcLMJNQ.text: Came here after work for a drink and a biscuit. The food is great, but it's the setting that makes this place awesome! It's very low key with limited seating and Christmas lights hanging in the trees. It's the perfect place to chill in a small group!

HXLLEabU_liFU9hmQeY2xg.text: I love this place. What a neat little local gem in the Garfield Historic District.  The food is delicious and the drinks are made with love and real juices. This is my favorite brunch spot downtown, and any day this is the best place to eat latenight. They'll give you the best comfort food you could possibly need, and serve your friend the best lovingly-created vegan food simultaneously.  The staff is amazing and their product is flawless, quality , and local. Love love love!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dria is a wonderful cook. Let her make you dinner.

uuiZKi0rJt0c0PHHs354DQ.text: Had a great meal with the wife and kids. It would have been a great night to sit out on the patio, but we were happy we chose to take up 4 of the 9 seats inside this charming old and very small diner.   The staff were very friendly and we all enjoyed watching their team get the food out of that tiny kitchen. We were made to feel very welcome and in speaking to the staff it was obvious that they had great pride in the restaurant. They passed along some history on the building, formerly from Winslow. We loved the fact that we were sitting in a piece of genuine Americana.   Ordered the andouille corn dogs and pulled pork topped fries for a starter, they were great! The Mac n cheese, burgers and chicken biscuit that followed were also excellent. We washed them down with pumpkin porters and bottled cokes. And the beignets we were served for dessert were equally delicious.   Bottom line. We left stuffed and happy. A very memorable meal produced by a great team. We will be back.

83Uxt8Ga9Zs2bbFqO-M2dA.text: I tried the pull jackfruits po' boy(vegan) the first time, loved it! and the fish po' boy the second time and oh boy was I happy  with the fish po' boy since I'm a  pescatarian, it was probably the best fish sandwich I've had. I want to go again and try everything I can eat. Also please try the honey soaked beignets they serve so you can die happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Most underrated place ever.

J3Pf3OCgDzKnBh1T0bvOKQ.text: I never write reviews but welcome diner gave me every reason to start. I bartend and serve at another local restaurant and have to give it to them for their excellent service. The guy behind the counter was so enthusiastic about the food, and was patient with us since it was our first time.   I got the champion burger and shared the pork fries. WOW, definitely the best burger I've had in a while. Cooke perfectly med-rare and the flavors were perfect.   They also had a great beer and cocktail list..   It's a must try, and I'm looking forward to coming back to try the fried chicken.   YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork fries.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The champion burger.

AfCg8XwPFWzor9GzI3sfJg.text: Great food!!!!!!!! I work at he hospital right next to it and love this Place!!

o7QOCtHDCXfh8BumIpzgCw.text: Be ready for yum. These guys hit all the right notes - quality food with no pretense. This is what diner food should be. Get a nice drink to start, then order the special. Whatever it is, it is what you should have that day. Scratch made tomatillo gravy, brunch burger with spicy ketchup, etc. Cool staff are eager to please, chef that knows his stuff - works the flattop like the pro he is.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch Burger. Medium Rare with Over-Easy oozy goodness!!!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool art.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chef&#39;s Scramble on a Biscuit w/ a Virgin Kentucky Thoroughbred

-fW0A_YbviLvadFcDQ0DUg.text: Favorite place in Phoenix,  looking forward to the new location for more seating in the Garfield. The entire crew who make up welcome are truly wonderful and know how to make you feel at home. And obviously the food and drinks are the best in Phoenix.

uiCbpxGiolTIqCyQgdOtOQ.text: This place is amazing!!!! It is so quaint and delicious. Southern cooking in downtown Phoenix. Everything I have ordered was fantastic. They have the friendliest people that work there. I also feel like I am just eatting at a friends house when I am there.

hlPxOfEgVSevJsXdzOcSeQ.text: I don't know why it took me so long to find this place but I'm so full of regret that I've missed out.  I don't know how they make their fries but I know it's the best fries I've ever had. I also loved the ginger beer that is house made. It really spicy but that's what makes it so delicious. I also had a perfectly cooked burger that was so juicy. The staff are equally quirky  and cool as the menu as I found myself dancing in my seat at the bar.  I will definitely be back and I am so mad I've been here so long and never knew this amazingness was here

uQ5HOoXCT-ddQSk8y6Bp-w.text: What a great dive! Welcome Diner has a Happy Hour. I got Carolina BBQ fries and a homemade ginger beer.  That beer had so much ginger it tasted peppery and it is strong! So delicious! The fries were a touch too salty with the mustard based BBQ and vinegar slaw. John got a Big Jim with was a huge biscuit with fries chicken, bacon, and covered in a yummy peppered sausage gravy. We also got sausage gravy and biscuits. For dessert we got beignets. Foods not perfect but VERY freshly prepared and pretty darn yummy!  This place is definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade Ginger Beer
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beignet... yum.

PYeT--x1M7PpOdPnoOQ3Yw.text: I give a 4.5. This place is just plain cool. Here are the 2 things you need to change:  1) Open earlier than 5 2) Sell glasses of wine instead of just bottles  Other than that, it's always an enjoyable experience. The drinks are good. The hurricane is a sweet and refreshing cocktail, but my favorite is the floricita. I imagine the whiskey-based drinks are just as delicious.  For the food - the biscuit plates are always good, but it's sometimes hard to get myself in the mood for a biscuit plate. When there were rillettes on the menu I was a happy camper - the fat melts on your tongue and the pickled watermelon was the perfect yang to that yin. I have eaten a lot of rillettes and you guys do them well. I would personally like to see more entrees on the menu, and since you serve breakfast, open for breakfast? Or at least lunch... It's the perfect day spot.  Nevertheless, the food is amazing. Great job in the kitchen. Drinks are awesome. Prices great. Fun and social atmosphere, and good walkable location.

VUhJ_C1HMvx2Rg3-kOmojw.text: Best night out possible! Cocktails are all hand crafted perfectly.  Staff is super passionate and proud of the product.  My boyfriend loves the peanut butter burger and I had the fried green tomato sandwich.  The corn relish with the fried tomato made me wish for a jar to take home and have at with a spoon.

5Dblyapt2jtIFLRRrOySBg.text: Amazing food!!! The best burger I've ever had. Everything thing here is amazing. Super fun ambiance & place to hang out. It has very reasonable prices for the quality you get. The staff are all super nice. You have to come here!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beinets
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GSzPWTIWQLhpMCiqWTp7_Q.text: Welcome Diner in its latest incarnation is a gem. Their new hours make them far more accessible for dinner service, but you'll still want to plan on showing up relatively late, at least during the summer, as most of their seating is outside.  The food here is the star, but the workers and cooks are all having a great time, really genuine and fun, and overall make the experience even better.   The Port of Call burger is exactly what you want: perfectly cooked, coated in cheese and onions and whatever else, and the type of meal that will leave you just barely too full.  The fried chicken sandwich is a thing of beauty, if you can unhinge your jaw to take it on. Get it with melted cheese, and go even further by tacking on gravy and bacon, if you think your heart can handle it.  The fries are fantastic as well. It's a bit pricey, but the quality of ingredients loads the food with flavor and makes it well worth it. They also have some amazing specials, and: their biscuits. Their biscuits are a thing of beauty, either with honey on them, or as part of the chicken sandwiches; they're simply perfect.  They're just a hop-skip off the 7th St. I-10 exit, and well worth trying out.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffalo chicken biscuit sandwich

QAoZmeKtH2k7T0zFDMLkTQ.text: OMG. A must visit when in Phoenix !!! Maybe it is just because I love real food and of course real drink. So my second visit to the Welcome Diner was much delayed with conflicting travel schedules that did not bring me here in time for a masterful dinner sooner. My loss... Check out the pics this time around. Biscuits Gravy - Fried chicken - Yes FRIED EGGS (2)- Brussels Sprouts with Bacon and of course red slaw. Well cardiologists you must be jealous. Drink order:   "Black Cat" = Bourbon rocks +  splash of Absinthe. Drink of the Kentucky Gods.     Only request would be that they stock some Old Smokey Shine in a Mason Jar of course.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YoF_71zOKnsBIE38CZ5HVg.text: Fabulous jack fruit po boy, and fried green tomato sandwich. This is also one of my favorite spots for cocktails!

1UvCLWww28XvZgYTuuJJOQ.text: This place is INCREDIBLE. Any time I have friends visiting from out of town, I bring them here - the atmosphere, staff, and food are absolutely amazing. My favorite thing on the menu is definitely the PB&B Burger. UGH so weird and so perfect.   It's wonderful that such a unique place exists in the neighborhood - love having cool places to show people to prove that Phoenix really is a fun place to live.

8Hfiy7R6fevVi6zwwJ0Ghg.text: The 'No way Jose' burger was one of the best burgers I have had. I would say in the list of top 5 burgers in my life. When I ordered medium rare they explained "our medium rare is warm to the touch in the middle, mostly red on the inside and a little bloody". That's exactly how it came out and it tasted amazing.

xBawm09Q-YSxSTvz8NUvuA.text: I love the Welcome Diner  Most of what we had was awesome. I'd been having day dreams of the PB + B burger (no cheese), and it was everything I hoped for. Nice burger cooked a perfect medium rare. So glad they went with chunky PB, and loads of it  We split the Welcome fries topped with Kiltlifter braised pulled pork and housemade Carolina BBQ sauce. Was exactly what you'd expect, nothing fancy, but really tasty  The only miss was the Fried Avacado. Plain and flavorless, really just a vehicle for a nice dipping sauce. Now, if they did a fried chunky spicy onion heavy guacamole, they might have something  Also have been in for brunch, and the Holy Puerco is amazing

H8m6-zJeWl4RrJFg3yJD2g.text: Great late night spot.  Food is awesome!  Staff is chill and personable.  Drinks are yummy!  Only bummer is the longer ticket times.  BUT it's well worth the wait.  Always coming back to this spot.

wzqjKUqiRAgeE__WNca7WQ.text: Good service and yummy food. I had the PB&B burger and my boyfriend had the No Way Jose burger. Both were good and we both enjoyed the fries. We plan to eat there regularly now! I do recommend to get there early or prepare to stand in line and wait by the fence for an available table.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Vsi-ao0u5UGo7bDSDndPUw.text: I have been dying to try out this unique place after all the amazing photos I have seen on Instagram.  First of all I love the hours, even through the mid week they are open late!  Driving through the downtown neighborhood to get here is kinda sketchy in the middle of not so decent area. So don't be scared your going the right way haha  Walking up to the Welcome diner it was so sweet how it's all set up! You can sit inside but only if there's room, it a bar top for 3 people. However, outside is where the fun is, the hanging lights, the awesome community tables are everywhere. The menu is short and to the point. I ordered the fried green tomato sandwich and the Sunrise. The fried green sandwich was a little hit to bite for the first few minutes but wow, how amazing it was! The sunrise was so delicious  with the chorizo, I will have to try the other choices next time. To wash it down I got the house made ginger beer which was so refreshing I wanted more!  If you come here and don't mind waiting for a few extra long minutes for your food it won't disappoint!

cOBkFPezjU1WLLLE43NeeQ.text: The only bad thing about Welcome Diner is that I always crave it on Mondays when they are closed! This is our go-to late night spot when we need some comfort food. But Welcome takes comfort food to another level. They use local QUALITY ingredients and I am a firm believer that this makes ALL the difference in food. We have tried lots of things on their menu: all of their biscuits and gravy. The Big Jim with fried chicken is my favorite. ALWAYS add a fried egg. Burgers. Poutine. The shredded pork fries and jackfruit meat vegan fries. We've tried a number of their specials. I ALWAYS get an order of their brussel sprouts. Beignets. I have never ever been disappointed here. Thank you for being you, Welcome Diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BEIGNETS! Served with honey. Oh so good but so sweet
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Social bike stop
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ptWhD0DurcTANPbGlGhTPQ.text: This is one if my new favorite places. Great little patio/outdoor area. Small menu of great dinner food done well. Cool cocktails. Near neighborhood.

1C8W1mX928YiN4yZyLvM_Q.text: We met our daughter and her wife on the patio on a beautiful January night. The actual restaurant is very small, but plenty of space outside. Great vibe, very community oriented. Not a huge beer selection, but had a number of good craft beers available, and wine and some interesting sounding mixed drinks. The burgers we ordered were excellent. Everything on the menu sounded great. Looking forward to our next visit to try something different. Maybe one of the Jack fruit entrees.

jed20F_n0TNHeuuto8Sn5Q.text: Here in Phoenix for business and since eating by yourself is not fun....I wanted a local spot to enjoy dinner.  And oh boy did I find a GREAT spot.  Welcome Diner provides a unique atmosphere and the weather was awesome.    I highly recommend the KoKo - Chicken Biscuit Sandwich with a creamy spicy sauce, fried chicken, arugula, tomato and some other stuff with a side of watermelon.  Absolutely delicious!!!  I also treated myself to the Beignets which were so good and I wish I could have finished them all but I was stuffed.  And get a Hurricane; fresh and perfect too!  Staff was great, friendly and if I am back in Phoenix again, I will definitely come back to the Welcome Diner!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beignets
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko Chicken Biscuit

G35PPzvEK4tL0BdlJB-OqQ.text: Careful, you will find yourself addicted to this place! I can never decide between the Big Jim and the Honey Bee. So I get the Big Jim with a side of honey! TOO GOOD! And they are open until 2! it's well worth the drive :D  Just don't crave it on a Monday ;) because they aren't open. I've also had the mac and cheese, and fries. Thumbs up The burgers are DELICIOUS! Every time I have been they've had some time of chef special, that always sounds so tasty. And a couple times i've been they have had $1 Big PBR's. Nice outdoor seating, atmosphere is pretty chill, along with the people who work there!  It's a must go.

yN7YMI_wKnTx_70ETaHqMg.text: This place is really good. Everything I have had which is a huge variety of things has honestly been delicious and amazing. Their jackfruit is especially good. But really all of it is good. The catfish, the chicken, anything. Super good!! Their drinks are on point too.

SZDUaypjjTfOUcNSLOzBSQ.text: Welcome diner is so cute and quirky. They have very limited indoor seating but have plenty of space on their patio. Try the mac'n'cheese or a burger. They also have a great selection of craft beer. It feels like you're at a picnic.

7dO9jcqtgGWQE-dDKLHXOg.text: Seriously my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! This place is beyond incredible!!  I cannot say enough about the food! The Chipotle Alison donut is my favorite of all time. The chicken is ALWAYS amazing. And the ramen, nothing short of amazing! The staff is super friendly. This place is a True gem.

uybd4sDt0M0R_LSr5xkjGQ.text: Great cozy intimate spot. Outdoor setting, feels like your out front your relatives home having brunch.. staff very outgoing and sincere

KT2m3vJopD9INkv2x1XxzA.text: Delicious! Their jackfruit po' boy was amazing. It can be really hard to find good vegan food in the valley but this was a pleasant surprise and also my first time trying bbq jackfruit. The Welcome Diner is a new favorite!

U1YYcOXRa2LkTRhiA_b88g.text: This small mom&pop style restaurant has great food and an awesome atmosphere. It's very casual and friendly. It's usually pretty busy and has a small kitchen so you can't be in a huge hurry to leave but as long as you're aware of that, you'll love it.

kGgWBNBrU4pu0HzYanRJhQ.text: Not too many diners get good reviews but this was a well deserved. Happy friendly staff.   Locale is not the best but the food makes up for it.   This was right of the plane and hungry place- good choice. They have a bloody merryish beer drink. Interesting!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken

vwAuJqZgN6saAdsnzg_ajA.text: In the din of a South Central Phoenix neighborhood lies a throwback gem serving up some of the most creatively constructed southern comfort dishes this side of Paula Deen's mint julep soaked dreams. Run by a bunch lads that seem to be the progeny of a hipster-hippy relationship gone incredibly right the place has a great atmosphere and spot on service to match their menu.  A definite must stop when you make your many forays in the increasingly attractive downtown corridor.

aHECXKfL-w-rGq3453Xatg.text: Cute little diner right in the middle of the neighborhood. Stopped here real quick before taking my sister to the airport. We each had a biscuit sandwich: she had the chicken and biscuit with bacon, cheese, and gravy and it was great and I had the one with chicken, honey, mustard, and pickles and it was excellent.  2 sandwiches and a coke to split was $21.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lAcKD2IYzY4Xr2lDbZG_QA.text: We just had a wonderful diner at our new favorite local place. The food was very good, I had the welcome burger and my wife had the chicken on a biscuit that had aioli sauce on it. We shared a pulled pork fries that was delicious. My burger was one of the better ones that I have had. My wife had a Ginger Beer (NA) that was so good she had another. Friendly staff and great service. Seating is outside a diner with a walk up window. We had a great time and will be back.

lD_kTjXbuIOnN2fEw2Ozyw.text: Had a lovely lunch with my friends in this place. Very cool and nice place to eat. It has a bar open all day,and that what I liked the most. The food is good and the service is good as well.

es11OxpDoHd2-HowUayjMQ.text: This place is great! Great vibe and food. Had a burger with a jalepeno jam. Wife had a chicken biscuit. Both great. Sat inside at the counter by the swamp cooler and made friendly conversation with the bartender. Nice service. The Last Word cocktail was spot on. Had a delicious custard pie for dessert with an apricot compote. Will be back.

7vREpfPDWz7w1d9oRdU-BA.text: We hadn't been to Welcome Diner since they stopped being a breakfast/lunch spot...so who knows how long ago that was!  I enjoyed the second generation cocktail - vodka, fresh grapefruit and lime juice, passion fruit and mint...well mixed and so tasty!  I also had a little birdy biscuit with fried chicken and cheddar and a side of roasted brussels sprouts...the serving size was so large I ended up taking half of my meal home.  Definitely get their early so you can get a seat at the counter inside...it is totally worth it!

9C0nulg8JI3CoJ2-tbBtNg.text: Ahhh, I read the reviews from "New-times the best of," and had a high expectation to eat. My veggie burger was bitter because it was burned on one side and I asked them, "is it normal burning bitter like this?" They said YES. (Only one side?? ). Really? I had better veggie burger even at Fat burger or even at Na mi.  The flavor was nice actually on the first bite before I bite the burned side :(. I am little bit disappointed.  The prices for 2 burgers (veggie and peanut butter burger) and 1 lemon pie homemade (with over-dozed sugar flavor in one side and strong lemon taste at the center) total $20-ish.  Peanut butter burger was good especially for them who love peanut butter in their burger.

uEcN4oFghlvT1gpiAimNVQ.text: I once thought of this place as far inferior to many restaurant chains such as IHOP, but after my recent travels here, I feel as if I have discovered one of Phoenix's True hidden gems. The service was excellent and the store had a very welcoming vibe. Staff is really kind and friendly to everyone! Great food as well!

N26gFfZvbyYwKs8nzxnIcA.text: I would be lying if I said this diner didn't influence me to move to the Garfield district. This is my absolute favorite place. I used to drive all over the valley depending on what mood I was in, and now I pretty much just go to the Welcome Diner. They have about 9 seats inside and quite a bit of patio seating. They have a few nice big outdoor heaters too.  Some things I love  -Excellent quality food sourced from local vendors -Amazing amazing drinks. They make their own bitters, grenadine, squeeze their own lime juice  and even have fresh herbs to put in. Each one I've seen made is with love. -Good service, fun atmosphere -Almost everything is made from scratch -Specials that are (always delicious) experiments, not leftovers. -Catfish Fridays (Try the sampler!)  I would say price wise it's not necessarily cheap, but not expensive. Average plate will run you about $10, but considering the quality and atmosphere I have no problem paying it!   Favorite dishes- PB&B burger Bacon Blue burger Veggie Stallion (housemade edamame and mushroom veggie burger with housemade ricotta) Red beans and rice with sausage Grilled cheese on a housemade biscuit. Try the holy puerco!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DhO5eusUA0G6PGbqOHhWfg.text: The Jackfruit BBQ sandwich is the absolute best! I will travel just to eat that again!

rIJ-A_gIVQC__kXNkFFlpA.text: The world needs more places like this. Honest yummy creative food in a casual chill environment. Definitely coming back for more!

UCrNGtwjPwWYC4aw0yfDUQ.text: Get the Little Birdy, only $6 on HH! I have got it the last few times cause the Poutine was starting to get too filling for me as I'd almost pass out while I was still there lol The chicken is the juiciest chicken EVER! And you would think you'd need more than just a biscuit, chicken, and cheese to make a sandwich but thanks to this place you don't! It's so simple & perfect and pairs real nice with their $6 Old fashioned during Happy Hour!  An awesome (filling) meal and a fantastic drink for only $12 total, uh yeah I think that sounds good!! Always me to give them a much better tip, which they deserve and you should too!  Do It! Do it now! or wait until HH either way, either way!

0PkdBr7Vi74N-q5I0pKvXg.text: I live one block away. I've been going there for years now. There's a reason why they are always busy. The food is always delicious the wait staff is courteous and everything you would expect them to be. I would recommend this hidden gem to anyone.

WQckUdE0wyY3htFl4TuH8A.text: Meh.  This place is more funky cool than good food.  I went there for late happy hour with a friend.   The first thing to know is the inside seating is limited to the bar, maybe 6 seats.  You order outside and sit at patio tables.   The staff is super friendly.   The drinks are great.   Everything is expensive.  We ordered 2 hurricanes, poutine, brussel sprouts & mac & cheese appetizers  $42.00 plus feeding the tip jar.  The drinks were fantastic.  There was nothing good about the poutine; super skinny fries with 2 slices of cheddar cheese and a heap of lukewarm, flavorless,  really heavy sausage gravy.   Brussel sprouts were ok; roasted with what seemed like no seasoning.  Mac & cheese was a heavy glob without a lot of flavor.  Best advice, stick to the drinks.

xuWlsdpgWvy0VnP3Q5F1Jw.text: The Korean BBQ sauce chicken, always get the breast and whatever bacon donut is available, paired with a cold brew for an amazing lunch! It's been quite a while since I've been, will have to come back and make sure everything is as it was; delicious.

wz5BUsPm-5CbnSduug2DkQ.text: Man oh Man!!! What a GEM!!! Found this spot about a 1 1/2 years ago...L O V E their fried green tomato sandwich! Have taken my friends and foodie, adult children (runs honest in the family) And everything we've had has been fabulous.   How can you not enjoy such a unique spot - a 1945 Diner with 8 stools and fantastic outdoor seating?!!

mW_nbsLglIbtDAb7xXxg4w.text: I will start out by saying the food was good. The drinks and the rest of the experience with the staff and the manager was enough for me to got to jail if I didn't have enough control not to hit them.  The old fashion was one of the worst I've ever had. I took the drink back to the bar, the bartender ask me what was wrong? I told him a old fashion shouldn't be red, to much bitters and to many mashed up cherries. He I formed me that's how he makes them. Ok great but it tased awful, he did pour me a straight bourbon, that wasn't to hard to make. At this point I was annoyed. Then the waiter told us our outside drinks could be inside the white fence area, because it was a health code violation I was Irritating due to the limited selection of coke, products.  Was going to leave at this point asked for boxes to take food home at this point. Decided to Take the drinks to the car. Ten minutes later a cat jumps on to the table. I told the waiter that it happened his smart ass remark was he didn't see it. This was the point I lost it, went in ask for the manager. The manager was standing right there, but walked outside as I demanded to see him another employee went and got him. I met him outside and the waiter. At this point I was really pissed off and lost my temper. They told me that can't control the yard, but I have to remove my drink that's controlling the yard but the cat that jumps on to my dinner table isn't their problem. I'm a little confused about that. If it was a rat or a mouse or other bugs it be their problem to control.   I will be calling the health department on Monday and hopefully the owner or real manger of this restaurant will respond so we can talk about how unprofessional their staff was. I admit I lost my temper, but the waiter reply to the cat being on the table after talking to me about health code violation pissed me off.    Real irritating after sending $72.00 on a decent meal to have a bad experience with the staff.

3YeSd4ldKt-dTSaW9nr2bg.text: I have had friends telling me about Welcome Diner for years. It is a fantastic and quaint dining spot. The biscuits are delicious and the drinks are tasty. I will be returning again soon!

g3c3IKjlaL2weeh3ds92sQ.text: I was SO, SO very excited to try this place. I had been asking my husband to try this spot for months. We finally had dinner here over the weekend and that's the last time I get excited over an eatery again. I ordered the Big Jim and my husband had the Grilled Cheese with extra bacon, we shared mac and cheese and "poutine". I had a beer and he had a Coke. The Big Jim was basically slop on a plate. I have never seen something that looked so messy and that was so difficult to eat! I tried to eat the thing and it just wasn't gonna happen. I didn't want to further embarrass myself and I was so over trying to eat it, that I decided to take it home. My husband's grilled cheese DIDN'T come with the extra bacon he ordered. Instead it was served to him on a little plate. Really? The "poutine"? Try sausage gravy over fries. Where were the cheese curds and the delicious light brown gravy?! No cheese of any sort. What a joke! Totally NOT poutine. Stars for the Mac and Cheese and beer because that was the only enjoyable thing in front of my face.  In closing - We spent around $60.00 on overpriced bland food. The tip is automatically added to your bill at check out which pissed me off. I'll tip what I WANT to tip, not what you're TELLING me to tip. Patrons also taxed for beer, non alcoholic beverage and food. Charge after charge on the receipt that's sent via text. I realize we all pay for it one way or another, but seeing all those little charges annoyed the crap out of. Especially because my food sucked.   What an underwhelming, expensive experience!

gUg-TJx2ymOeBOrOVbkUWw.text: Visiting Phx from SD. Found this small diner on a yelp search. We are heading to east phx for a concert. Wanted something close by but not too pricey.  Nestled in a historic district surrounded by many original cottage homes this little walk up diner has some tasty eats. My sone went for the pb&b burger peanut butter and bacon. Came with fries. He says 5 stars. My husband got the fish po boy. A big piece of seasoned grilled fish with coleslaw on a bun. Nice and meaty flavorful fish. I got tge fried green tomato sammie with roasted brussel sprouts side. The sandwich was spicey but flavorful. Only miss here were the roasted sprouts. Too much overdark roasted sprouts. The ones not too browned were good in their simplicity. A thumbs up all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomato sammi with house ginger beer and roasted brussel sprouts
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish po boy with slaw
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pb&amp;b with fries

GEoz5dz-qt3LD1tAkc8UJw.text: I have been wanting to check this place out for a while and was finally able to make it in.  It was a Saturday night and my friends and I were exploring Roosevelt Row when we decided to look for food. We came in around 1a and although it was closing soon, they took our order and said it would take an hour for the food to come out. We ordered drinks and sat down at one of the tables. There were 4 in my group so seating wasn't a problem. The table we sat at was more of a communal table. If we came earlier, I'm sure there'd be a few different groups sitting at our table. The weather is just cooling down so it was nice to actually sit outside and enjoy the fresh air. We were literally the last ones there as our food arrived. I ordered the fried green tomato sandwich and was very happy with my choice. The breading was crispy and the tomato itself kept it's shape. The chipotle ranch sauce complimented the flavors and the sourdough was toasted. I love trying different items so if I'm with a group, I sample a bit of everyone's plate. The poutine fries were very hearty. Even though it was smothered in gravy, the fries were crunchy and not soggy. I was also very impressed by the grilled cheese. On my next trip, this would be what I order.

giXLpIcUlFnR52fadAxzag.text: The food was not exceptional more average and limited menu and the staff could have been more attentive.

GOwATyqvfYGMfQXc3NtoVQ.text: The people here are very nice. Excellent customer service. The Welcome Diner is one really awesome place. The food was SO GOOD! I forgot the name of what I ordered, but it was essentially a pulled pork sandwich...I loved it. Their ginger beer is amazing, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome to the Welcome Diner.

2XaqlXsX4kpVU_Bp6SwPyQ.text: BEST BURGER SPOT I'VE COME ACROSS!! I was out one night craving a burger and jumped on yelp and happened to be driving down roosevelt. This was the first place that came up. I drove down and stopped by. This place is really cool. I like the open setup outside. There's benches for you and your friends to chill on while u enjoy your meal.  There's a dinner car that seats about nine people that's cool to sit in.  The service is GREAT!!! All the people there are super cool. A very friendly atmosphere that anyone can enjoy. When your foods ready they always check to make sure everything's right before giving it to you.  Now.... The burgers and catfish sandwiches are AMAZING!!! I have had the welcome burger, the peanut butter burger and the Friday night catfish poor boy!!! All left smiles on my face wanting more. You have to try this place out!!! IT'S A DEFINITE MUST!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Always a good time!!!!

jvNqRHkGmvH-47DdL2wqXQ.text: Had dinner here last night. Really interesting menu.  I had the Koko, a biscuit with fried chicken with a great chipotle ranch sauce. I loved it and would defiantly get it again. My husband had the burger with bleu cheese and bacon, it was a bit overdone and the bun was burned but he's willing to give it another try.  Shared an order of Mac and cheese...definitely a winner with that recipe, it was delicious.  Ordered the beignets for dessert. They may have been the best I've ever had and that includes the originals from Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.  It's defiantly a young crowd and it gets busy but it was nice to just hang out and enjoy a beautiful warm night. The cocktail list is innovative and they know what they're doing.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese...Delish!
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VrUYG0j2mW2cUKTQBL6TYQ.text: Finally got to try this place and it did not disappoint. Amazing burgers...   The PB&B (peanut butter) was insane. The special was the champion burger with caramelized onions and it was great too, but I would definitely go with the peanut butter one again..and again.   Also had a a homemade biscuit with honey and it was crazy good. Prob try a fried chicken biscuit sandwich next time.   Place has a lot of character. Old RV converted into a restaurant. Minimal indoor seating but not a bid deal. Wish I lived closer... Great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m5QnCFKgwPiosCEr5D2uPg.text: Extremely limited menu, extremely limited parking and you must eat outside in 100+ degree weather. We left without ordering.

X0aPvu9Eb3NMmK0QJI123w.text: Incredible flavors! I'm usually one to avoid the hipster hot spots, but this place cannot be passed up. The burgers are just straight up impressive. Even my partner, who orders his plain, ketchup only, raves about them. Unfortunately for the burgers, the fried chicken is even better. The Koko is to die for! Perfectly fried, crispy chicken with a perfectly spiced chipotle ranch, served on a biscuit with arugula and a tomato slice.  While the food is great, what really has me coming back is the home brewed ginger beer. It's spicy and biting but all around refreshing. So unique and flavorful! Made of the exact stuff that makes this place so special.

DPK2qtrHprpU_YFo1TqAIw.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said? The only thing that comes to mind is PLEASE, for the LOVE of everything good and holy, open a location in the Bay Area...or give me the rights and I'll do it myself. =) Really love everything the Diner stands for - local, fresh, well thought out food that helps others understand the True passion that goes into each dish. The story behind both Welcome Diner and Chicken + Donuts will make you appreciate these places even more.  Go for the food, stay for a cocktail and leave with a smile....I always do! Thank you WD staff for being so bad @$$ - continue to kill it!

LlaV8yqCtaeCBf4Ls-6k0w.text: To whoever established this place: thank you.  The food is amazing.  And not just for food that is available late at night or compared to other "diner-type" establishments, but truly high-quality dishes that stand on their own.   The outside setup is perfect.   The lighting creates a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere.  This is not a fast food place.  You will have to wait for your order, so don't expect miracles.  Because food this good requires love and attention, which the Welcome Diner provides in abundance.

SWFqArlMPxKZlP4Qqnyb5A.text: The food is PHENOMENAL. My wife and I STILL talk about our amazing brunch. The Welcome Diner is an adorable renovated trailer tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. Outdoor seating (bring sunscreen, it can get hot). Customer service is fantastic, these guys have no qualms about discussing their food and fav dishes in depth if you're feeling torn between dishes.  Hands down the best brunch I've ever had. Inventive, powerful flavors, generous portions!

qhCjhDDiJgyM8xnX1uMZCg.text: Classic diner food and drinks with a twist. We came here on First Friday to try out something new as we're typically inclined to hit Angel's Trumpet. This place is a True diamond in the rough that you would end up passing by if you didn't know what you were looking for. I got the Chicken Philly which was on special that night. The chicken was perfectly seasoned, the bread was toasty, the peppers and onions were super tasty, and the cheese sauce was on point. Everyone else loved their food as well, apparently the No Way Jose burger is a must order. I had a great cocktail as well to top everything else and 4 others split 2 bottles of wine. Line to get food and to be served was a little slow, but expected on a busier night. And if the prices were a tad cheaper I'd rate this place 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Philly special

zkQ7mD9Xb8tr4VVMpfkjdA.text: This place is SO rad. My crew and I were in town working an event and couldn't find anything open for dinner and drinks after 10pm. Found this place on yelp and was so so so happy about it. Looks like something you would find in Austin, TX. The no way jose was insane. The big Jim was heaven. Staff was awesome. American hipster vibe. Great music. I wish i could eat here everyday!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The inside is a little tight but everyone was so friendly it didn&#39;t matter. Lots of outside seating.

85QXGUjRqnuthsm8iAhIDw.text: Amazing service, food and drinks! My friends and I had a great time, they were playing great music and we had good conversation with the bartenders and even the cook. Will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

raGY7l0n2KzjNTP6P9jnNg.text: So excited this diner opened. It's a neighborhood diner in a historic district.  Awesome food and great service. Small bar seating inside and patio outside. Had the catfish on Friday for like $12 with a little bit of watermelon pieces on the side.  Catfish was a great portion well worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catfish Friday&#39;s, yum

SumYYbV9yxK4av_cQKmR8Q.text: The food is amazing.  My favorite dish is the Bumble bee, delicious fried chicken on a biscuit with honey and honey mustard.  I dream about that chicken.  The location is quirky, in the middle of a residential neighborhood. Almost entirely outdoor seating, stand in line to order at the window and then find a seat.  Expect a decent wait both to order and to get food (approx 30 min each).  Staff is friendly and helpful.

k00XWZIubfE2zCiHPYNiDQ.text: I wasn't keen on the idea of eating at a hipster dinner know for its alcohol, but I was proved wrong for sure when we sat down. First of all the vibe here is what is (hipster) but very happy friendly people both behind the counter and what I would suspect are regulars. The employees were very helpful and patient with me taking my time to order, as you have to walk up to one window to do so, and there was a line. So I took a chance on their recommendation and tried the fake pulled pork sandwich. I never even had jackfruit before, so I knew even if it tasted bad it would be a new experience. Wrong again, it was amazing, the flavor the texture all on point. Just wow it almost makes me want to go back to eating pork to try the real one. I mean I've never tasted anything like this before. A must try if you visit

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hipster ice for your drink, melts slow.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jackfruit vegan pulled pork sandwich

4MCzkhMq3LPttNkGwf12cw.text: I absolutely love this place and I have such a great time when I done here with my friends :) we've had the privilege of eating both inside and outside. Indoors, our friend group basically took up all of the barstools, but the environment was fun because you get to have the bartender right in front of you, see the meals being prepared, and be right in the middle of all the action! Outdoors, it is easier to talk to all of the people in your group and when the weather is beautiful outside why not  :) I've only ordered the Big Jim and it's hard to venture away from a dish you already love! There's just something about fried chicken and gravy in-between 2 biscuits that make the perfect combination! The Poutine is delicious and there is definitely enough of it to share! My friends ordered the PB Burger, The Koko, and the No Way Jose which they were very thrilled about! Cocktails are wonderful as well! I recommend this place to everyone I know and I'm always looking forward to coming back!

YA8U652waCZ7sWpQIyFl6g.text: I got on a plane in Boston, landed in Phoenix, and went to the Welcome Diner.   There were a few other reasons for my visit, but retrospectively, there didn't necessarily need to have been. I'm not going to get into the particulars [see all other 5 star reviews], let me just contribute my humble "YEEEUP" to this wonderful little joints' reviews and be on my way.  Summation: Do you like food? GO HERE.

QHG6HSiEP3FuPVRnvS8VJw.text: The guy who served us here was so kind and attentive to us.  They have homemade ginger beer which, IF you like that kind of thing, is very good!  The menu is pretty limited because it's a VERY small space but we all had some biscuit sandwiches and they were really nice!  Hot and fresh!

hhLLWtQqhw5xiHdBDsS96Q.text: I recently moved to downtown and this was a spot that all my friends said to check out. It did not disappoint. I got the big Jim biscuit for dinner which came with a generously sized portion of fried chicken and plenty of gravy. I also ordered the Mac n cheese. I do not advise you should order both if you are eating alone. Simply not enough space in a human stomach.  The staff was very friendly and while they were only moderately busy service was very prompt. There is plenty of parking on the street. I will definitely be back.

zKrLAdq_URkRVDRDNzOwgA.text: Delicious food, good service, and reasonable prices - especially for happy hour. Only complaint is the atmosphere - being right by a street with cars whizzing by isn't the ideal vibe. Overall though, great place! Will definitely return.

bCjyUon4TQgHHdkblBl7bw.text: This is probably my favorite place to grab a casual dinner in Phoenix.  It is usually pretty busy on the weekends so be prepared to wait a while unless you can find a spot at the 8-10 seats inside.  Unless you are a veg I expect you to try the fries smothered in pork and slaw.  Hands down the best thing I've had there to date.  The PB&B burger is great and so is the Bumble Bee biscuit.  If you live in the downtown area or you hit up RoRo often, stop into this gem of a diner.  The staff is really hip and really friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carol Fries  (bbq pulled pork and slaw)

IYzXb0kYbhZUzBgZWSQoNA.text: I hate to give this a bad review because i honestly was hoping to love this place. I was expecting to give it 5 stars along with the rest of the reviews.. But of course that wasnt the case. Its cute and small but great for spending time with friends. I love the fact that its open till 2am. The only issue i had is their food is not that good i felt. To start before i even got to order and was looking at the menu i had a friend with me that had takeout from another place. We were approached by a young lady named Christina who told him he couldnt bring in the food because of the liquor license and that he needed to "get out". I could understand a beverage from somewhere else but a liquor license has nothing to do with food. The thing was she had a bit of an attitude which really turned me off to not even order anymore, but i still did regardless because i wanted to try this place.  I ordered the poutine fries which i was really hoping to be good seeing all the pictures and reviews for it. Like everyone said the wait time for your food is truly ridiculous. I ordered my food take out only to watch others that came after me be served their take out.. All in all it took 56 minutes for french fries and a side of gravy.  For $9 french fries i expected them to be good.. maybe i came too late or on an off day for the cooks but i feel i could have honestly ate better fries at a McDonalds.. A young guy i believe to be the manager came out and apologized for the misunderstanding of Christina shooing us out. He let us know that she was confused on the liquor license that it was only for outside beverages not food. Props to him for being kind enough to do that. But on the other hand the employees should ask questions if they are unsure on something before jumping on someone. Its common respect for the employees and customers.  Would i be back? Unlikely.

9Cttdy54tutAxGot-LYpwQ.text: Lots of vegan and vegetarian options. The fried green tomato sandwich was tasty but very messy, and made the bread quite soggy. The chess pie was delicious. The outdoor space was fun to hang out in after hours. Friendly staff.

pX5ee3jIy5KMipfBsxAZNQ.text: Walk up window to order, patio tables to eat.  Service was great, the guy at the window introduced himself, welcomed us and then made some great recommendations both on and off the menu.  Food came out quickly and was delicious!  -PB&B Burger Med-rare was fantastic (tip: you can upgrade the side to poutine for $3(off menu))  -Big Jim was Very Good, gravy was great but the biscuit was a little dry. Still very good though. -Poutine was fantastic!! Hands down Fantastic!! -Mac & Cheese side was good, but I feel like it really could have been better. It was a very classic dish and didn't have the flair of the rest of their menu. -Ginger Beer is homemade and is VERY GOOD, strong, tart, good.  A few reasons for the missing star: 1 the chairs, I had to swap out a broken chair and then sat in another one that had a bent leg that almost broke before I traded it in too. 2 the dry biscuit on the Big Jim.

aVkAgNrzll1Gx_Zy3HzJyw.text: Solid neighborhood spot in downtown Phoenix, I've lived close to it for years. Rotating daily specials, decent happy hour and super good burgers. If you're into good, hip spots definitely check this place out.

tV3-K8ecoV1BNyI2iG6CGg.text: What a fun spot! Love the late night eats option. Inside the establishment you've got a True diner feel. Vibrant blue colored - cushion-y booths and a bar top that extends across the narrow restaurant. The courtyard area has plenty of seating for those that wish to enjoy the fresh air in our perfect fall/winter/spring weather.  We appreciated the menu spin - not the same old boring burger turkey sandwich kind of joint. Though our food was on the verge of being too salty (hoping this was just an off night), everything we tried was enjoyable. Both hubby and I got variations of the chicken biscuit sandos. The housemade biscuits were hearty, but not too dense. Loved having the watermelon on the side - a refreshing taste after the heavier meal items. The arugula and tomato on my sandwich added a nice freshness to the fried chicken. The hurricane was excellent - not too sweet with a balanced amount of tart. BUT the real stars of the show!? The fried chicken was fantastic - so tender and flavorful, I could immediately tell at first bite that it had been brined (server confirmed for at least 24 hours). The amount of breading was perfect - not dense and very light, crispy and you could see the herb flecks within the breading. A hearty portion too! AND the (housemade) pimento cheese - bomb! They need to sell this in a to-go case!!  We sat inside and the service was great - perfectly attentive!  We'll be back to try the pie and another one of the menu favorites.

QsZMmPGDHhPLxjW4TRawSA.text: Everything about this place was fantastic.  The food and drinks were great and the service was fast and friendly.  I recommend the chorizo meatloaf.

iO_X9mGHU_njflp2a3GdAQ.text: Perfect weather this time of year to enjoy this unique little outdoor diner. Good spot for late night eats if you get hungry. As much as I like this little restaurant the food wasn't amazing. With all the great reviews I had higher expectations. Maybe after you've had a few drinks it would be amazing. Completely sober, it would not be something I would go out of my way to visit! Still like this place though.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_CL22-XE-lZezCzYM56aXQ.text: For some reason in this past visit I feel like the quality has gone down. We used to come so much. We were here last on June 29th this was a day when my husband was not fond of the service at the bar in the back left corner. They were told there is a wait to sit at the bar(so if there was not a whole lot of people occupying seats there was a supposed wait list you had to be on in order to sit there) where the drinks are made and then later on that night they were told there isn't a wait for the bar. It was super confusing. I've tried almost everything on the menu before they switched to a new location and raised their prices it feels like. A few friends of  mine and myself agreed  that their prices are not worth the food quality anymore. I used to love the gravy and yesterdayI  didn't even want to keep the leftovers. I tossed it as soon as I  got home. The no way Jose is my usual go to and I'm so disappointed I chose to try new things. Both things the shrimp toast and poutine didn't do it for me the other day. Stick to the burgers and regular fries. Trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp toast
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese

ROe6miTHcbMHsD3cYcdSWQ.text: Order one of everything, I insist. Worry about the pocket change later. You're welcome, in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crunchy peanut butter, cheddar bacon and pickle cheeseburger
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PB&amp;B burger with brusselsprouts, jackfruit fries and the fish po&#39;boy

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. When u NEVER know what to order &amp; just order the entire menu. Biscuit with whipped goat cheese &amp; jam  then beignets for desserts are a must!

4_f_FufFjTucZP71gLu33w.text: A little bit to pricy for some alright food and was a little confused with the scheme of the place but really nice people

UqZtcjCwlNmQXkgIa7FrMg.text: Easily a solid 4.5. I continue to be impressed by Phoenix area venues. There is a level of creativity/uniqueness seen here that seems to be matched. A boxed car diner with outdoor picnic tables sitting in the middle of a residential neighborhood? Sign me up!   Welcome diner is the rare combination of good food, low prices, and perfect portion sizes. The fried green tomato sandwich is a must, while the Mac and cheese is among the best I've had. The torched crust takes the dish to a whole new place. The only knock on my one-man feast was the beignets, which were a little on the dense side(eats more like a cake).    To top it all off, they are open till 2am! Welcome diner, you have made a fan out of me.   Now does one want to sit outside in the Arizona heat? that's a separate issue altogether.....

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Highlight of the night - Mac and cheese

13oWeJpfGy-XspxjnZ3X9g.text: We can't say enough good things about this place. The food was amazing. Honestly, they know what they're doing. There is a difference between a restaurant that just pushes a meal out and one that works to make the whole experience of that meal memorable. Welcome Diner does that. Staff was incredibly friendly. Every dish is unique and delicious. All and all a perfect night out.

4kSk6XYXBTYjvFV3Oh3xzA.text: Yum! Ordered the welcome burger and fries both were delicious. Seating is outside which was fine. The mixed drinks were really good. Also ordered the beignets & we loved those as well. Service was prompt, & very friendly. Would recommend going now while the weather is nice since seating is outdoors the Summer months may be uncomfortable outside.

Mwkbu2eh0vrjeDBAU9T7eQ.text: My mom and I love coming here for brunch the people are friendly and super welcoming! The food is great and done to perfection along with cocktails everything is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RAjP_93j6BjnsIbyRyPHdw.text: Right in downtown phoenix, a semi small Diner turned outside patio dining southern foodie haven.. Did someone say biscuits and gravy with fried chicken? How about you add some bacon too and then top it off with some beignets? Legit fried chicken and the biscuits are yummy. Great friendly service behind the small counter where you can see the cooking and the bartending happening. Or walk up outside and order and find your own table. Gotta try the Big Jim or the Bumblebee. Definitely will be back to try the Po'Boys and the poutine fries. Love that they are right down the road from us and I can go satisfy my southern cravings.   Beignets are 3 to an order and not Cafe DuMonde but the honey drizzle s fantastic! They have a liquor license and the drinks were pouring...street parking or across the street, there is a lot.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bumblebee $10 fried chicken honey biscuit and b&amp;b pickles

f7dD_FuohxYcTbts9QFN7A.text: Super fun and retro diner setting with a great outdoor patio. Service was friendly and quick, with generous coffee refills and plates cleared in a timely manner. The food is PHENOMENAL! We were able to seat a big party of 8, make substitutions for dietary restrictions and overall everyone was full and very happy. Highly recommend the fried green tomato sandwich, fries for the table and DEFINITELY the ginger beer (would be perfect with a shot or two of vodka). My dining companions enjoyed the fried chicken Sandos, burgers and Cobb salad. Will be coming back the next time we are in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic and coconut donut. House ginger beer.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomato sando

r_32WU8iUa16eS2Qffrwuw.text: Wow!! Just discovered this place near downtown Phoenix. What a great place for brunch. Awesome food, try their " "Big Jim" with an egg and Sunrise and you will be pleasantly surprised!! Fresh squeezed orange juice to top it all off! Great service and the food is great! Definitely will be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_d3oGCstNrMNJwHWjV151A.text: We had just left the Arizona Science Center and were starving and looking for a nearby place to eat.  Welllll...my friend had this place bookmarked for some time and it was only about 5-7 mins down the street so we said hey why not  The restaurant itself is literally a little van of a diner with patio table benches set up. The line was pretty long to order and there are menus at the front to look at.   The food was different from what I normally am used to but I am open to new things so my friend and I shared two dishes. We had the sunrise and also the fried green tomato sandwich. We wanted some poutine fries but they were out of fries for the night.   What I highly enjoyed was their house made ginger beer! Honestly the best ginger beer I've had by far!
