0yNHWGfYUQujFTNNiRtGVw.text: Excellent service, beer, food and atmosphere. Terrific accommodations for vegetarians. I am not vegetarian and very much enjoy the jack fruit fries.

tRjTFE5LcwnLmhr5CKtKrA.text: Was in Phoenix to meet up with some friends and we settled on this place for our Friday evening dinner plans.  Location & Aesthetics -- Located just on the corner of E Roosevelt & N 10th St. in Phoenix. Parking is limited to the street or in the small area behind the diner though I think the diner staff park there. Seating is mostly outdoors.  There is seating within the diner but it's small so if you're coming with a crowd, then I'd recommend dining outside.   There are string bulb lights outside with powerful misters, and large tables and chairs.  It is sandy outside so you may want to wear shoes versus flip flops.   Outside area was very clean and well kept.  Tables were clean as well. Noise level is nonexistent except for the passing vehicle or two from the street.    Service -- Staff are very friendly and helpful explaining items from the menu including drinks.  Upon arriving, you order at the little window at the side of the diner.  Provide then with your order, pay, then go sit.  Your drinks and food will be brought out to you.  Menu -- Lots of available menus right next to the order window - drinks and meal menus.  Menus were easy to understand with small descriptions of the dishes or drinks.    Food -- I had the Welcome burger which didn't disappoint.  Made to my liking as requested and to cooked to perfection, it was mouthwatering, flavorful, well seasoned, and juicy. I had a side of fries with fresh cut, cooked well, hot, and slightly drizzled with salt along with a chopped seasoning (don't know the name) on it but it certainly added extra flavor. For my drink, I order a couple of Hurricanes which also was made to perfection -- not too sweet and not too tart with accurate proportions of rum and other integral ingredients.  Overall, very happy with the place, staff and terrific food.  Will definitely recommend and would love to return to try their fried chicken with biscuits plus their poutine fries which I spied other folks eating!

etxXHUqpu8SvbjdRbbQUDg.text: I would like to tell you how terrible the food is here... that way you'll stay the hell away and leave it all to me.   Seriously though, I don't even know how to explain how amazing the food is here. Best biscuit, best gravy, best mac & cheese.  After the person sitting next to me at the counter left, I ate his leftovers right off that dirty plate (not kidding). That's how good it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine fries, mac &amp; cheese, big Jim(?) bisquit

zwCXHWdO4k2QVNRaDxHYaw.text: Definitely one of the best places to eat in Phoenix. Food is always solid and atmosphere is laid back. Our favorite place to take people

QQUtqHh8HAfY4LZQchcCLQ.text: I love this place! The food is so good. The chicken is so moist and have no bleaching, and fillers..a must try!

ypAPQ8WyjME0Om0CztzfcQ.text: I was brought here by some friends who highly recommended this joint. I always down for a hole in the wall style place and it was nothing but that. Service was great and so was the HURRRRICANNEEs.   The food, is blissful and heavenly. The kind of food I cook at home with fresh produce and meat. It hasn't even been 24hrs and Im dying to go back. Everything is top notch and words can't describe this place; you just have to go!!  Sat down and talked with Michael (owner) about meat smoking, cooking and everything culinary. Great guy who knows his s*(&t. Overall, im very glad we were brought here and will be back in the near future!

53WyZLZNUiHc6WIFCOvZhg.text: Proof that art can come from a two burner kitchen. Laughably small kitchen creates some very big tastes. Plan to go on a cool night and enjoy the great patio. Not an indoor diner, it's soul food and stars. Big Jim, Cannibal fries and Coke in a bottle. Great experience, I'll be back.

UdIBdZhO17kVefyUr4OEqA.text: Tucked away into an old central (and scary) neighbourhood, it was a bit hard  to find in the dark. Glad we did, though! Got a lemonade (made with fresh lemon juice), the fried chicken with cheese biscuit sandwich and split an order of bacon cheddar fries. The chicken was perfectly cooked with a crispy outer breading, thick and juicy meat inside. The biscuit was really tasty and flaky. It came with a few cubes of watermelon but I don't like melon so those went untouched.  We sat inside at the bar and everyone working inside was super nice and friendly. They have quite a few regulars and I could see why. The prices were a bit higher than I expected but they use totally local sourced ingredients and everything is prepared fresh so you're paying for the quality just as much as the quantity.  An order of cheddar bacon fries, a biscuit chicken sandwich with watermelon side, lemonade, and tip totalled to just over $21.

PwCHLw-LMCqqBSmaff4xkw.text: Great late night hang! The food is great and it's always a good time. The bartenders are attentive and social! Fun for me

485R2_bY9F9g5HXoFa200A.text: Fun local place to hang out and grab a bite when it's a reasonable temperature outside. My bumblebee was excellent. They definitely have the fried chicken and biscuits down.  My friends' three burgers were all overcooked to well-done without the any hint of pink. They're not burger snobs like I am and had no complaints but i probably would have. I also felt the drinks were weak or watered down for $10 a pop. I'll probably be back to try some other food, but it wasn't a home-run as I had hoped.

J1Z2FZ7CIdhCx5jcqB-nnQ.text: Welcome Diner, talk about fantastic! Browsed around and found this diner, in a neighborhood many would consider not welcoming, they could not be more wrong. The homemade biscuit, made with love and of course incredible honey, just delicious down to the last crumb. A welcoming staff and food that can leave you stuffed! Will definitely keep coming back and invite all who will join. If you your a local you need to eat here, if your visiting phoenix, you need to eat here! As always my yelpers, eat, drink, explore, and buy local!

N8BwP1IcnbpzCzIPIEV5YQ.text: Great food. Great little whole in the neighborhood.  Great people.  Recommend to anyone looking for good food in Phoenix.

GfpKA5ru-tacXynsJXMjlQ.text: I'm only in Phoenix for a few days but I'm tellin ya I will be coming back here before I leave. Hospitality: the best. Ever. Food: I tried the welcome burger medium rare AND IT WAS SO GOOD. Definitely gonna try the Mac and cheese with chorizo next time. The people that work here might as well be family; they're a really tight knit group and we had two of the employees come talk to us--Mike and Wayne: really cool chill guys. You might at first be weirded out by the location (it's in the middle of a bunch of houses) but it adds to the homely feeling that I experienced while at the welcome diner.

f1TxXbDxsT7bY_Agx8O9Zw.text: It's an old train car style diner. The food is amazing, as are the drinks(they make their own tonic and other cocktail ingredients). I am pretty sure that all or most of the food ingredients are bought locally. The wait staff are almost all local artists and musicians(as are a lot of the customers), interesting and friendly people, who are great for striking up a conversation with. The secret ingredient in Welcome Diner is love. Also, children's cough syrup. Anyways, it's an amazing place, get off your duff and go.

9fxAopzUCV5XqYfOp9GNgA.text: Cool diner, poutine is good but shredded cheese and white gravy is very non traditional.

BYLtUZzYqlzButeNtww9Vw.text: This was an excellent adventure. The service is super friendly and the food is unique and deserves more praise. I ordered the fried chicken biscuit with gravy and cheese and bacon. That was the best choice of all the meals I tried and will be what I order when I return. We started with pulled pork fries that were BBQ flavored with a mustard twist. It was bold but I would try something else next time. The burgers were great and the fries were too. Great late night food, I would suggest this to my yelper friends.

wWauqx2Otvg2EB07mSS9yA.text: I love this place! Bad for my cholesterol but who gives a damn! The proprietors are very cool, great ambience in "the hood." It puts the soul in soul food; can't wait to hang out there again soon as my Lipitor digests; just cool as it gets in Phoenix

hYf2p5Tz41-vr0WTuHo4kA.text: Amazing Food! Amazing staff! Amazing owners! Support this local diner, you will never be disappointed!

kTvxvy2BF-lNqUOj_DeyJQ.text: I am going to hold total  judgement on this hippy hangout but be warned: check the prices BEFORE you go.  Two tiny  biscuit orders and gravy fries will set you back $30 and then add a drink with tip and tax you will be out $40.  I mean really.  Nice  place for skinny females who eat like a bird but if you are a construction worker who wolfs down 3 Big Macks, fries, and jumbo  soda at the burger stand, eating like that here will cost you a weeks pay.

64i-0nW6Vzf5Z_zbtzNszw.text: Had the Mac and Cheese with Chicken and the Biscuits and Gravy with fried chicken. Both were hands down the amazing!! The restaurant is unique looking and has mainly outdoor seating. A great place with character and its open late. A MUST TRY while you are in the Phoenix Downtown Area.

DFnW8Wndk_zk3-SZhiAh-A.text: I am so glad I decided to take a chance on this little place. Great food at a fair price. And, great service to boot. I had their chicken and cheddar biscuit called the Little Birdy and was in heaven. The chicken was moist with great flavor, not greasy, and not doughy. The biscuit it was on was perfection. Crispy and fluffy where it needed to be with a well balanced butteryness. To make things even better the biscuit did not fall apart after the first bite :). Loved the relaxed atmosphere and music selection outside. The dudes that were working were very courteous and answered questions without eye rolling like you may get at other downtown establishments.

ywARW2C3QtnXFjg0Nzq8Wg.text: Love this place. Awesome eats. Kick ass staff. Late night hours. Fabulous Tuesday night.

17ukX4KsrZelJpJX_iyMGw.text: Okay so I went to Welcome Diner this morning after seeing my friends IG post of his food a week ago. Met a friend and we sat inside was greeted by the entire staff including Wayne and Justin the Cook, our server was super cool too. Ordered the Sunrise Sandwich- A Biscuit for a bun with scrambled eggs, Cheese, Arugala and per the recommendation of our server added Chorizo....BOMB DOT COM I can't wait to go back and try some of the other things on the menu...just go and eat it's worth it!.

qIDdb8qteICNnvtENpQ62A.text: Hidden gem!!! We love this place!!!! everything on the menu is awesome!!!

4RPkoR4hUZPcJcQGgn2NuQ.text: Dear fucking lord I am not going to eat again until next Thursday.  A friend took me here for lunch today, in exchange for a little 'puter help. The cook is a friend of hers, he just said, don't worry I'll make something you like.  Next thing I knew I had a Scheiners freshly made hot dog, grilled, split open, on a bun... with a fried egg an some of their pepper concoction on top. One of the best things I have ever ever eaten.   As others mentioned, the fries are sliced to order and fried to a super crisp.  The eggs are organic. The menu is tiny, it's diner food, but the food quality is very, very high.   Has a few bites of a freshly made pear pie.... oh my.  I will be back, but not that often, otherwise I'll be a lardass. (again)

lY9jFjGtOFPsyWxfgpUH_g.text: This place couldn't be any cooler if it was renamed "Jules Winfield's Welcome Diner"  People.  Just take a gander at the picture offered here on this page and tell me what would stop you from going there to eat an unbelievably delicious basket of fries and burger, each such perfectly seasoned to compliment one another, its as if this stuff was made from the craftsmanship of a gastronomic grill master.  The burger easily beats out even cult-status places like Delux or In n Out, and their handcut fries are subtly crunchy and salty.  Their salsa burger topping absolutely rocks the block.  And I don't know if their ketchup is made by the Magical Man from Happy Land who lives in a gumdrop house on Lollipop Lane, but something about it slaps a toothy grin on my head.  The picnic tables outside make you feel like you are doing something productive while you gorge yourself.  Like its okay to ingest a thousand calories as long as you are given the impression that you are on a hike or something.  But whatever.  Its all class.  My only beef (Heh.  Pardon the pun.)  is that Welcome Diner is closed on Sundays and that they force me to battle the tweakers at the 7th and Roosevelt Circle K as I spring for a pack of P-funks and a $20 bill due to their 'no cards' policy.  It would also be in my best interest if they started serving micro-brews from Oregon or Happy Land.  That would be right good.

3YFcSlgyu6pVrFFtQdlHsQ.text: The Welcome Diner is, in a word, welcoming! The folks who work there are super friendly and great to talk to. It's a small and intimate little place so expect to have some cool conversations with other patrons.   Be prepared with cash and a sweatband (or five!). In the summer heat, it's a bit hot in there, but everyone looks a little sexier with a bead or two of sweat on their forehead, no?   I got a grilled cheese (made with lettuce, tomato & bread n butter pickles) and fresh cut fries that are to die for. Way better than In N' Out's just so you know. And the chocolate chip cookie. Oh how its nutmeg danced on my taste buds! I liked it. A lot a lot.  They get everything they can from local & organic growers, have phenomenally yummilicious bread and even Mexican Coca-Cola. Hooray for real sugar cane! Too bad I realized this after I ordered a diet coke. I'll splurge on some calories if it means I get to drink from a glass bottle any day.  I'm so glad my friend showed me this place. It is a definite gem and I will definitely be back. When it cools down, I may even bring the pooch along and sit outside near the kiddie pool. Fun!   If you haven't yet, grab a friend and try this joint out pronto.

3pOJ33NGshfiyz2LRy-Hug.text: Make sure not to zone out while you're driving to the Welcome Diner or you'll zip right past it (as my friend and I did).  It's right on the corner of 10th Street & Roosevelt in a cute little red and white dining car.  There are a few parking spaces behind the diner on 10th Street.  I would check the hours, as I think I was told differently than the hours posted in the other review.  My friend and I went to the diner on a Saturday afternoon and were able to get seats inside at the tiny counter.  I'm sure as it gets warmer, those will be harder to come by and that when the weather is nice, most people sit outside.  It is indeed a tiny space on the inside and half the seats have a direct view into the kitchen area, which is kind of homey.  I'm pretty small, so the size inside wasn't an issue for me, but claustrophobes and bigger people might feel squished.  I ordered a hamburger and fries and my friend got an egg sandwich.  The burger was pretty good, but relatively small in comparison to what's generally served at restaurants.  If you're really hungry or a big eater, you'll probably want to go for the double burger.  The fries were good - nice and crisp.  My friend was pretty happy with her egg sandwich but unhappy with her cup of water, which was apparently pretty bad even for tap water.  They have a bunch of organic sodas, along with Coke and Diet Coke, if you're like me and can't wash down a burger and fries with anything but a carbonated beverage.  Overall, I thought it was a pretty cool place and will definitely return with more friends in tow.  (Possibly for one of their movie nights...movies + tasty food = a good time).  Bonus points for their helping with the downtown rejuvenation while also supporting local businesses (Schreiner's, Mary Coyle's).

zZwHfe_B8jLuH2_5OrUbCg.text: Okay...I have been going here for a while and I love the place and the food!  I am surprise it hasn't had as many reviews as it should.  The truth is I come back to support local businesses in my neighborhood...I would come here anyday than go to a Fast Food burger joint..  The trailor that the restaurant is in is the cutest thing you will ever see...straight out of a 50's picture!  Its small but fitting...  The food is very fresh..I love their cheeseburgers and hotdogs..I sometimes even get some of their mango salsa/chutney on the side..they get it from this lady that homemakes it.. Not the cleanliness place but I guess thats what makes it tastes so great!!:)  Its the extra grease...I know that just sounds horrible, but True!  Anyways, support locals and their businesses...go go go!!!

YvLnpbjWIb73HVHYpR-Imw.text: Maaaan, this place is tiny. Once you get past the fact that there's nine seats, and the griddle takes up about 30% of the building, you realize that this is one of those special little haunts that makes cities cool. It's totally off the beaten path, but just three blocks from First Friday mayhem. You could drive right by and never even notice it (I had about 15 times).   Inside it's surprisingly sparce, considering it's about 75 square feet. There's no AC, just a few well-placed fans on full blast. I went in the middle of the afternoon in July and felt pretty comfortable, especially considering the kitchen IS the place.   And the food... you want greasy, delicious, messy, rich, heavenly sinful pig-out fare? What's that? You want it at dirt cheap prices and with friendly service? It's perfect. The cheeseburger is oozing cheddar, the fries are sliced about four seconds before they go into the fryer and they have french toast in a cup. Need I say more?

zpyzB4l6E2DVpWFy0kpR6w.text: Super cozy diner.  It's small and doesn't have much of a street presence so it's fairly easy to miss if you aren't paying attention.  The diner is a classic boxcar that stays True to it's roots.  The outdoor seating area looks quite enjoyable for a late night snack, though I'm not sure if they are open that late.  Gotta love the outdoor ordering window.  You're best best inside is if you can catch a seat at the corner of the counter.  You not only get a great view of the chef doing the cooking but have a nice fat fan behind you to cool you off.    We arrived shortly after it opened and chatted with the cook to get his suggestions on what to order.  Very friendly and funny.  The counter's got various coffee table books full of quotes and handy worst case scenario answers.    I had the Garfield which was a fried egg sandwich specialty.  I can't really recall all the ingredients but the salsa in the sandwich was amazing.  My girlfriend ordered the grilled cheese and it was knock out.  Prepared with olive oil, it was by far one of the best grilled cheeses I've ever had.  The french fries were done just right and the seasoning on them really hit the spot.  The total for both of us including a couple of ice teas was under twenty dollars.  A great deal anywhere.  Just a friendly reminder that it is CASH ONLY!  I had to run to a couple of nearby gas station ATMs since the first was out of order.  Pretty embarrassing but the chef didn't seem to mind and trusted us to return.  Can't complain about any part of the meal and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Phoenix or any locals that have been snoozing on this gem.

LVEJCYKm_LzQtKNeiFMVqQ.text: If you're looking for the unique, quirky, off the beaten path side of Phoenix, come to the Welcome Diner.  With 9 stools around a bar near a hot kitchen, it is a small place with a lot to see.  The cooks are very friendly and talkative, and will give you their opinion on their dishes if prompted.  Try the classic cheeseburger, fries, and soda - it's definitely a favorite.  The Welcome Diner is definitely small, but worth the wait (if there even is one.)  It is truly a treasure to the historic Garfield district.

TolI46famuR-mgGY7SAjCA.text: I can't stand 50's retro but this place is the cuteness. Well...I haven't technically been inside. Now, I knew this was a hipster hangout, but I wasn't expecting the cute girl in the apron or the boy with tattoos to actually be working on the other side of that window. They didn't seem to mind that I was slightly drenched in sweat having walked there under the sun of a blazing March afternoon. They were quite nice and gave my sister and I a bowl of water for our doggies. Tattoo boy said he would even make us more fries if we wanted. The fries ($2) were not the best  and neither was my grilled cheese ($4) with tomato (yum!) and pickles (?). However, the food had a nice home-made quality to it and was all ready in about a minute. Peeps are right about the high-quality ingredients and the food is inexpensive. Holler.  P.S. Don't forget the Ca$hM0nayyy or to borrow from a sibling!

yr8CdAbxp6BDfRh01Qkj5w.text: The next Nobuo Fukuda event will be at Restaurant Noca on 8/27. Warning -- link to PDF. restaurantnoca.com/Menu/...

OazUKzpXitaNhnQLO7EyQw.text: Quaint little diner - a great example of kitschy 50s Americana. It's the sort of thing 5 & Diner tries to be, only more authentic. The menu is very simple and it's nothing you couldn't get elsewhere, but the food is very good. You didn't really come here for the food though, did you... no, you came here for the atmosphere...  I went during the summer and it was pretty hot inside the little box. There were some fans working overtime to help compensate, but with the cramped quarters, the dining area is pretty close to the stove.   You can tell that for the people that own and operate this joint, it's definitely a labor of love. It's such a warm and inviting place to go. I can see eating here once in awhile for the experience, but it's not the kind of place I could see myself eating regularly... maybe it's because I don't live in the neighborhood. People in walking distance would definitely become addicted to the place.   I really enjoyed the food here. There were funny little books available for us to read and there was a notebook where customers could draw in. The whole thing was something I'll always remember... fondly. You owe it to yourself to at least check this place out once.

tHL4z-uzK934HSQoX_Kdog.text: I brought my dad here a couple of weeks ago, just on a whim. I'd been once before when the previous owners still had the place, and I had been itching to go back.   We went for an early lunch so we were able to sit inside. The staff is friendly, and I think my dad enjoyed the fact that every time the waitress turned around, her rear end was right in his face. Dirty old men in close quarters. What can you do?   The food was great- I had the grilled cheese (minus pickles), he had a burger and we both had fries. I loved the grilled cheese- it was perfectly charred- and he had no complaints about the burger, which is a rare thing. The fries were perfection and I may have even dreamed about them that night.   I can't imagine eating here would be too fun in the middle of the summer, as most of the seating is outside, but it's a great little lunch spot, and they're also open late on First Fridays. Good to know, since getting food anywhere else downtown on a First Friday is next to impossible.   I'll definitely be back.

zq4LTV2OCERGAZz1LgJFHg.text: Absolutely loved our food and the atmosphere. The service was amazing as well. Also loved fact they buy their food locally.  I got the champion burger and it was the best burger I've ever had anywhere. The bacon jam is really a hidden treasure. We'll be coming back hopefully every weekend. Thanks welcome diner for providing an awesome experience.

9CRZ8lIjsNAhC_1oqR9xPA.text: Favorite new spot: 1. Best biscuits in Phoenix. 2. Amazing food. 3. Delicious libations. 4. Great staff. 5. Reasonable prices. 6. Crystal's Hot Sauce.

x2rx_IUgEOWkHXnndn0qJg.text: This place is amazing and worth the drive if you're not from the area. Everything we ordered was delicious and cooked perfectly. Fresh, local ingredients which makes this place even more awesome!!! Service is super friendly and the ambiance is very chill-like you're in an old friends back yard! We ordered the big Jim, fish po boy, and the poutine...if we weren't so full we would have ordered seconds!!! Definitely going back!

leKt8V13L0AvIkbnmSXnyA.text: Update:   After reading the talk thread on yelp about the welcome diner I am so happy that they are not closing!  Turns out they decided not to and now are going to open a second one in the not too distant future.  I am so sad that I came here on the last day that this little diner will be open.  I was introduced to this place by a friend of mine who is a regular patron.  It was a nice Saturday afternoon so we ate outside and I think the little diner (with 8 seats) was full.  I had a single patty cheeseburger and the favorite and a coke.  The favorite is fresh cut fries with peppers, onions and a few other things that made this a delicious side dish.  It was all soooo good... I am glad I had the opportunity to try it.

oXO4cox3073lV62szb72cA.text: If know about the Welcome Diner, chances are you've heard about it by word of mouth or just stumbled across it by chance. Regardless, this place is one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix. Everything in the place feel like you stepped into David Lynch's mind while having happy thoughts. The place is super small (8 seats) but that just adds to the authenticity of eating in what might one day be a museum piece of 1950's culture.  The food is incredibly good and surprisingly cheap. If it's the right day, be sure to see if they're making veggie burgers and ask for a float too. The staff is also really chill and make sure that you're satisfied. They offer everything: good food, good atmosphere, and a good experience.  I just wish they had later hours....

nAeReoC9qF5PEAcWt1zCuQ.text: Welcome Diner is perfect, their staff is perfect, slurricanes are perfect. The end.

ZV8XtE3k8p-P95LdJqxfIg.text: We ate lunch there on a weekday in early 10/04.  The Welcome is a restored 1930s diner and seating consists of just nine (counter) seats.  It's definitely cramped, but that means you'll get to converse with your neighbors.  The menu is quite limited, although the food was good.  However, they don't give you plates and the food was *very* greasy (our sandwiches came on a piece of waxed paper and the grease quickly soaked through the paper onto the counter).  The other thing I didn't like, was that you had to *buy* (bottled) water if that was your drink of choice.  They had a cook, a helper and a waitress working in a VERY tiny space....the waitress was o.k., but the cook and helper were pretty friendly.  It seemed that everyone but us was a "regular", which was kind of fun; we had an amusing conversation with the three guys (co-workers) who sat nearest us.

6c-vn2RGzfSyy1CZ7FrxOg.text: The vibe of this place is a very relax feel but the seating arrangement is kind of uncomfortable. Inside on the bar I found to be the most comfortable but is very tight and  tight. Outside, there is a variety of seating but most of the chairs are not dining type of chairs, good for laying out, but not for eating. It is very much like a picnic feel is what they are probably going for with it.   Well onto more important things is the food. Now I admit, I am not a fan of their type of food, so I mostly ate breakfast dishes. Their signature dish is the big Jim. It is a huge, messy, and not the healthiest of dishes but is fairly tasty. The Chicken breast is well done, but the biscuit was kind of dry and the gravy was kind of cold. I have been to so many places and tried so many biscuit and gravy, and no one ever heats up the gravy beside a luke warm temperature. I just don't get it, but anyways, it was luke warm and kind of bland. Most of the taste came from the chicken and bacon really, rest was kind of there.   I also had their welcome breakfast with sausage. Again the biscuit was not flaky or tender in the middle but dry which was a disappointment. Sausage was one of the best I have tasted even though it was swimming in grease. Eggs and potatoes were okay, nothing really inspiring but very greasy also. So this is their basic breakfast dish which I try at different places to see if there is truly something different about the place. Nothing stood out, but the sausage.   All in all I have to give them a 3 star, the quality and execution of the food does not deserve a 4 star and definitely they are not that creative or their food is so much different  and outstanding that it deserve a 5 star. They are definitely a high 3 star, and I would go back, would unlikely right away or on a consistent basis, but once in a while is definitely in the cards.

hazxwnf83Ns-xme1mE1CIg.text: Amazing little neon diner with counter with stools inside and a large comfortable patio out, with umbrellas and heaters.  Sitting at the counter is the best, as its fun to chat with the bartender and watch the food being prepared in the tiny kitchen.  Best Old Fashioned ever and burger was specially good as well.  Beignets? Yes! Very fun place to go late night too.

E60mft_fRMr1eci3WJwpKA.text: After a big night during First Friday, tired and slightly hungover, I needed some comfort food.  Outside of the Five & Diner franchise, I hadn't been to anything resembling an authentic diner in the Phoenix area.  Ever.  So what a surprise to find an old diner transplanted from back east into the downtown Phoenix area.  It's a little on the fringes as the immediate neighborhood is a little sketchy, but we were going for a late breakfast on a Saturday so I didn't worry too much about my car.  The diner itself truly is a timewarp.  The interior is a simple 9 stool diner with a cooking area just as tiny.  You can't help but converse with the waitress and the cooking staff since they're basically right in front of your face.  If you're looking for more room (and want to keep an eye on your ride), there's picnic tables with umbrellas outside.  We got here around 11am so my girlfriend and I didn't feel too self conscious ordering drinks.  I got the mimosa while she got the bloody mary.  I'm not sure what they put in those drinks, but they had some kick!  They weren't overtly alcoholic, but just spicier than other mimosas or bloody marys I've had.  As for the food, I came here for one thing.  A biscuit sandwich.  More specifically, the Big Jim.  Fried chicken, country gravy, bacon, and cheddar on a homemade biscuit.  Unreal.  The biscuit was flaky, buttery heaven.  The batter on the fried chicken was delicious and the gravy wonderfully hearty.  Easily the best biscuit sandwich I've had in the Phoenix area.  My girlfriend got the Andouille Scramble which was basically an omelette with andouille sausage, peppers and onions with a side of potatoes.  She saw how much I loved my biscuit so she added a biscuit with honey to her order and was equally impressed.  We so wanted to save room for the beignets, but we were stuffed.  Total for the two drinks, two entrees, the add-on biscuit, and tip came to about $40.  Had we done non-alcoholic drinks it would've been a little under $30.  Their ingredients are locally sourced so you pay a little bit of a premium for that.  But considering the quality of the food and the unique experience, it was money well spent.  Whatever you do, find a way somehow to include a biscuit in your meal here.

E6OihiZrMN0h64-8j7LdRA.text: There aren't words... Just go. Like... Stop what you're doing and get here. Get chicken or burgers or pork fries... WHO CARES?! It's all so f*ing good!!!!

GdyF2fL0l4y1ZDJGSc3d7A.text: Welcome diner has been on my bookmarks for a long time. After such long anticipation and procrastination my boyfriend and I went to grab a bite. Unfortunately i wish I would have waited ... I am the type of person that sees Mac and Cheese and I MUST order. I ordered the M&C ($8) and additionally added tomatoes and jalapeno ($2). My boyfriend ordered the Big Jim and the fries and gravy. I tried everything we that my bf and I ordered and nothing blew me away. The m&c was just okay, possibly not worth the $2 extra dollars i paid to ad so little vegetables. The big Jim was not the best, maybe a factor to that was that my bf ordered the patty medium well and it was not to my tasting. The fries and gravy were not bad, but i would not reorder.  The ambiance is very relax but very crowded. I was with a group of 5 and we had difficulty finding where to sit, so if you would like to dine there keep your eyes peeled for a good table. Also keep in mind I went on a Saturday night , so it may be busier compared to weekdays.

a6mlqPiVtVx_c-HqLAqGyA.text: This place is amazing. Food is next level and so is the service. Rob was awesome. That is all

PtBg_f_08elVTC1DqqTl9A.text: Biscuits,  pbr tall boys, craft beers on draft... need I say more? I always end up here as an attempt to sober up after hitting up the bars off of Roosevelt. Long story short it never happens because they sell beer and I just end up getting extra wasted. But, it's okay! Their food is a great hangover cure, so I just come back the next morning and stuff myself with the best biscuits EVER. Hangover situation averted.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Attn ballerzzz

XzsSWPOSZeuT0bcFpnAF2A.text: What I love most about Welcome Diner is that when you are there, it doesn't feel as though you are in Phoenix.  The menu is good ol' Southern comfort food with a twist; they have Deep Eddy alcohol's and they make amazing homemade lemonade...well it's a little page right out of the South (Austin, TX to be exact).  We need more places like this.    They have a vegan po-boy sandwich with fried avocado that I could eat everyday, it's just that good.  They use the freshest veggies, no really, so fresh that it was probably picked that very day from the Garfield community garden.  That's right, fresh AND local.  I also can't get enough of those delicious collard greens!  I was impressed with the staff because they knew exactly what was vegan (right down to which bread I could eat).  Any time I find a staff educated about ingredients, it's a win.  And anytime I have gone with my non-veg friends they rave about the menu as well, so I think it is safe to say that it is all yummy.  All in all, this place is simply adorable, quaint, fun and delicious.  It is small inside so if you can get in there, I highly recommend it.  The staff is very friendly and attentive which makes for an even better dinning experience.  There are also plenty of seats outside and a to-go window which makes it even easier.  Great place to hang out, meet new people and eat good food!

yG2bx2aAZur9tTAHq-y93g.text: Best ginger beer in town!!! Food is all incredible.  Try the whole menu. Always fun to sit inside.  Hurricanes are delicious and I vote it best place to be on new year's eve!

_pKAV7IWFYFl7glFznAK-g.text: Was my first time there...I loved it! ! I got the big jim I think..it was biscuits and gravy bacon and fried chicken! !! Mmmm delicious! ! Also ordered the hurricane drink during happy hour it was 6$ such a summer refreshing drink! !

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim I think

bTfjjDRhgFXfztVu1t9PQw.text: This place is so unassuming but it will punch you in the life with deliciousness! I just think about the biscuits and the gravy and the chicken! I have only gotten my food to go because we have several kids and it looks like a cool place for date night. The hours are hard to remember. But it's yum!

WIIEeyYi84d3Xn5jpweTbw.text: So loved this quirky little diner.  Ate here last night and everything was DELISH!    I had the fried chicken sandwich , man oh man chicken doesn't get crunchier than that!  Also had a gin tonic made with their small batch tonic syrup.  My boyfriend had an amazing burger and as thought that wasn't enough we shared the Mac & cheese, so light and airy, wonderful.  If you are on a diet his is not the place to visit lol. But, if you want amazing comfort food at a great price you've found your spot.

GYAFBsS5xz33dFN9d9JVYg.text: I had the pleasure of (finally) eating at Welcome Diner today and it was amazing! I can't wait to go back.   I had the fried chicken biscuit sandwich and a side of fried avocado, both of which were great. Fried chicken was juicy and biscuit was flaky and tasted fresh. The fried avocado was awesome and like nothing I have had before.   My friend got a collard green sandwich with a fried egg on top. She smashed it and then raved about how great it was. Each sandwich came with a side of fruit which was the perfect side for the heavy sandwiches.   Like I said before I can't wait to go back!! Highly recommend, this is a local gem that I would love to see thrive.

vUPFN9wKGV9OtyXAw4ELwg.text: Great food! Had the Big Jim and it lived up to the BIG part, bacony and gravy-y and delicious. The coffee was good too. This is a great brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Jim

D0vhDLw8KaumAt38UhdzFg.text: Welcome Diner is a good place to go when the weather is nice and you've got lots of time on your hands. It's in kind of a strange neighborhood (you may see stray dogs running around) but the outside dining area is welcoming and cute. I don't like coming in here any kind of inclement weather because pretty much all of the seating is outside, which is a bummer at night or during the summer. Also, because the kitchen is so small and Welcome Diner is so popular, you may end up waiting 40 minutes for your food.  But....what saves Welcome Diner for me is the food. I love the fried chicken and the sausage biscuits and gravy. The sandwiches are also excellent! The orange juice is fresh-squeezed and refreshing, but the lemonade is on the bitter side and leaves something to be desired. I'd recommend the food at Welcome Diner to anyone, but the atmosphere isn't always a crowd-pleaser. I would love to see them in a brick and mortar, full-service restaurant! Maybe someday.

XqwPvBDS95r7xylpfFqpOQ.text: Decided to try this place out after reading the review here. My Wife and I are glad we did.   This place was sooo good. A True diamond in the rough.   The food was perfect. My Wife had the welcome burger and fries. It came out cook exactly the way she asked. I tried the big jim and the cannibal fries. I was only able to eat mine with a fork and knife. It hit the spot. The fires we excellent!!.   We each had a drink with our meal, they did not disappoint either.   I would eat here all the time if I lived closer, so maybe that is a good thing. I would weight about 500lbs.   If you are even remotely close, check this place out!!!

557g-FoB-6fnZrkToWoWAA.text: Such a fun place to eat and good food to boot!  Grilled biscuits and great chicken.  Try the fried green tomato sandwich.

4TjqAXlmMcVmGSAFZRNuow.text: Just awesome. The biscuits are buttery, the chicken is juicy. The food is simple, done well, and delicious; plus it's minutes from our house.  Can't wait to come back to try something else!

Q1cFZtMX0IMhEB1uCHHJIg.text: This place is AWESOME... I had their  Green Fried Tomato sandwich...it is sooooo good..wanted to go back for dinner....we are from Queen Creek , AZ   .. we had a party of 15 ....service was fantastic and personable...everything was fresh ....will go back.. Thank you Welcome Diner for making our visit very enjoyable..

8NkagompguRx9EHDqhP9CA.text: Breakfast here is awesome. Who cares if it is hot outside, you won't be able to focus on anything else besides the incredible food.

MZhrYmC45qoEeA0ZJ1dz3Q.text: First time in Phoenix so relying on Yelp.  Welcome diner seemed liked a good spot, and maybe on any other night it is but took us over an hour to get our food.  Kitchen seemed small to handle the volume, but mostly frustrated seeing others who ordered same dish after us get served before us.  Some food may be worth +hour wait but not this food - chicken biscuit, Mac and cheese, Brussel sprouts... Nothing to write home about, think you'll say the same if you've had any standouts of the dishes mentioned above. Can't give more than 2 stars for an overrated place that made me wait over an hour for food that didn't taste exceptional.

AU9W7MPE5N1NnrbMOaaaJQ.text: I tried this place for the first time this weekend and I'm so glad I did! I stumbled there with my bf after a house party in the neighborhood and we decided to eat and sober up before we left. I had the sunrise breakfast sandwich with sourdough (they were out of biscuits) and bacon mac & cheese. The sandwich was surprisingly really good without the biscuit I think I'll get it with bread everytime! The mac & cheese is heavenly!! The only gripe I had was that took a while for food to get to us. But I understand since we came right before closing they were a good amount people there already. So if you're ever drunk I'm the area and need some sobering up food I highly recommend!!

by7juv6zfjlDsqHzGKm6aA.text: We went to Welcome Diner for Easter brunch and it was remarkable...   There are two things in that sentence for which I am grateful.   Thing 1: Thank you WD for being open on Easter. I'm not a religious man. Easter is just another day of the week for me, however I am a man who can appreciate a day off work. That said, I am grateful that you were open so that I and my degenerate crew could enjoy your establishment.   Thing 2: Thank you for having delicious food. That is all.  This was our first time trying Welcome Diner. We pretty much almost tried one of everything... because why not.   The Fried Green Tomato Sandwich and the Biscuits and Gravy were my top two items. As I've declared unabashedly in the past, I'm from the south and these two items brought me back home. Very well done in their own unique way.   I think the thing that was most surprising about WD is that they were churning out this great food from such an unassuming place. It looks like they just dropped a little ol' diner right in a residential neighborhood. The location is also just east of Roosevelt Row, in a slightly more rough area. Not bad, but some people might shy away.   The only issue I see, particularly with summer coming up is that, if I'm not mistaken (which I could be), majority of the seating is outside. There are sun shades, but from our experience, even with said shades, if you're sitting in the wrong spot, you could still get pretty toasty from the sun.   We sat outside on our visit because it was beautiful. Although as the morning moved along it did get uncomfortable at times when the sun would be at just the right angle to blast you for just long enough you could feel the sunburn happening.   All that said, get there while the weather is good! And if you do get warm, they make some refreshing mixed drinks (I had the Hurricane) and they also have a nice little beer selection as well. I almost forgot about that... I probably need to drink less of them next time.

bSGMIYl0aQVORpDR607AGQ.text: Super cute place, mostly outdoor seating, really quality, tasty food - awesome mac-n-chz especially. Also had Pulled pork biscuit sandwich and we had the whitefish po'boy.  All delish and look foward to trying the burgers and fries....  Just wished it was a teeny bit less expensive on certain things. Otherwise yummy and would definately recommend

ZO5aXEM_SWACdq9vi-qVVA.text: What a little gem this place is. I really loved the cozy feel of the place. Mostly outdoor seating or you can eat inside at the bar. The food was amazing and the staff was super friendly! I got the PB & B which turned out to be really good. Who would have thought peanut butter on a burger would taste good , but with the bacon and pickles it all came together very nicely . My fiance got the  Koko which was a fried chicken a homemade biscuit with chipotle sauce and that was also delicious! I definitely will be coming back .

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PB hamburger

BBq83nLkU2dfcU1dMolN2Q.text: Thank you to Yelp for leading me to Welcome Diner! I drove out here after work on a Friday, by myself, and knew as soon as I could see it that this place was a gem. It's tucked in a neighborhood, with a red and white trailer, neon lights, and string lights over wooden tables. It's so perfect that I wish I thought of it myself.   You order at a little window and can see three guys all crammed inside, cooking up amazing food. They had happy hour specials while I was there, and I got a local draft beer that was delicious. After much debate, I settled on the North Carolina pulled pork biscuit and a special side salad with a shallot vinaigrette (although it was hard not to order skinny fries and Brussels too!). I was worried it would be packed, but there were just enough people to comfortably eavesdrop and still have some elbow-room.   The food was amazing. You can tell everything is made in small batches, with love and attention to detail. Someone came out and checked on me while I was eating, offered to grab me another drink, and whisked away my dishes as soon as I was finished. Overall, it was a perfect dining experience, and I only wish I could pick this place up and plant it down on the East Coast!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qIFUMaRS1z1iayDKFZ-pCQ.text: Loved my first time here ! Got here by 6pm which was perfect because we beat the rush. I would not want to be here when there is a line, but if you have the time and want a leisurely night out a line is worth the wait even so. However, with that being said do not.come here starving because you do have a bit of a wait for your food, understandable though the place is tiny and the food comes out incredibly fresh !!   We got the fried green tomato sandwich with bacon added it was so good with great textures and flavors..bread a bit too crisp (blackened) at some points but a unique and yummy dish. We also had the bumblebee biscuit sandwich which was really good, the chicken was moist, crunchy , but not filling enough despite it being heavy. We also got the happy hour pork fries, prettty good, but I'll get plain fries next time, liked the slaw and the sauce on top.  Food good, staff was very helpful, local beer, and cool atmosphere.   I would come here again for sure.  I had to deduct one star only because of the bathroom situation ...I'm borderline germaphobe and I almost couldn't stand the bathroom. It's a unisex , airline bathroom size stall with a sliding/folding door, that is right off the kitchen line !! Eek, kinda crazy, just avoid needing a restroom if you are a germaphobe, and even more so if you're extreme about it.   Welcome Diner ,you're great I hope to visit in the summer to keep the spirit alive !

rRtlA4B73WXUFaGUrD8s7Q.text: What a gem of a restaurant.  Found this on yelp after a concert down town and I'm not sure what I enjoyed more, John mayor or the biscuits and gravy.  Do yourself a favor and grab a group of friends, some drinks, and amazing food.

7fTU4b2DDUGA9xOSLK95oA.text: I love this place!  I just wish it was closer to this Tempe resident.  We both had a WHISKEY SOUR!!!!  We are not cocktail folks but we LOVED it!!  When ordering a second round, I innocently asked for an extra cherry.  For $1 you can get an extra cherry.  I'm new to the world of cocktail cherries, but these apparently are very special Luxarno cherries!  AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!  The people here are so nice.  Food was good - he had burger, I had chicken on a biscuit (chicken a little too thick) but so good.  Just wish we were closer. Love love love!

gMYvPxa5l2R1uBsD3vQN1g.text: If you just landed in PHX and this place came up, just go.  Stop reading and get fed right.  Fried chicken on a fresh biscuit with a refreshing salad, served outdoors in what looks like someone's front yard.  Heck, I pulled up and almost pulled away but something told me to stop, give it a chance and boy am I glad I did.  Great service, to die for food.  You can really tell the chef loves what he does.

35Tr6pRZrvANmCQhp4ZArQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere.  Relaxed.  Burger was super.  Fries could have used a bit more crispiness.  The ginger beer is made in house and is sweet, sharp, and very gingery, one of the best I've ever had.

NR2_RlqwnLToXoljC_taHA.text: I had always heard of this place and finally decided to come and check it out. I had a busser greet me and welcome me in because I was a dinner. I had a cashier give me a quick run down on how the restaurant works, the chefs finished my meal in a timely manner, and the dish washer did a great job on cleaning my plate and utensils. If there's something that can make me loose my appetite and make me not even bother touching the my food is seeing old food from a previous customer still on my plate and silverware.   I got the No Way Jose burger which was delicious but small.  I finished it in 5 bites.

fChokd02D3lNNPSVONqNNA.text: So I was downtown today doing some charity work with friends. One of them mentioned that we had to try out "Welcome Diner". So we did. OMG!!! Found my new favorite Burger spot. Everything was amazing. Literally the BEST fries I've ever had. Plus they have a full bar and ice cold beer. I highly recommend it and will be back soon. Manager Zach is really nice too!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My new favorite spot in Phoenix!

pnAcVbsCfFKVkLd39d-XTA.text: Honest comfort food in a sweet ass, remodeled RV and plenty of outdoor seating. Wayne (owner/manager?) said "thanks, we try really hard" when I complimented them on the food and experience. Yet, one of the greatest things about this place is they don't inundate you with being those people that try too hard. They don't force their efforts unto you, it just happens organically. Watching them work behind the bar and in the kitchen was a thing of beauty... so fluid, every movement and each interaction is performed with meaning and genuine care. It makes you feel at home while also being right in the middle of the action. Food and drink were fantastic and well priced ($6 old fashioned at happy hour??). Got the No Way Jose burger and fries, girlfriend got the same but with Brussels sprouts. The biscuit sandwiches and the poutine made my mouth water watching them pass by, but I didn't try them on this trip. Pecan pie . Recommend eating inside at the bar if there is seating, so you get the full on experience of the hustle and bustle behind the counter. Then, grab another drink and head outside if it's not 120 out. This place is a great way to start your evening. Compliments to Wayne and the rest of the staff!

tH5Hl9Gc_pkw3dFL1GzQMQ.text: Delicious food, unique setting, and completely chill staff. I had the fried green tomato po'boy. It was so tasty and the tomato had an excellent crunch. My husband had a chicken biscuit which he loved. We split the mac and cheese.The mac and cheese is in my top 5 for Phoenix.  The outside seating area is a great place to relax and eat delicious grub. My only complaint is there was an excessive amount of aggressive flies. Probably something they can't help but it was still annoying.   I can't wait to go back and sample more delicious comfort food!

e8OXhMgWq9vXAbrhSnNDJw.text: The atmosphere was amazing here.  We ordered our food from the food stand area, which felt a little weird at first, but we quickly got used to that, as when the food came out it came fast and high quality.  Then we got a free piece of pie! Shit was yummy!!

fjGCe1KKRKlQM2kZQ8OkBg.text: Went on a Saturday night and it was pretty packed. I would recommend visiting through the week if possible.   I ordered the little birdy (chicken,biscuit,cheese) it was good but a little hard to handle. Also had the jambalaya as an appetizer (big enough for 2 to share) I would order it as an entree next time.   The seating arrangements are mostly outdoor, which is fine when the weather is nice like it has been in March but would be a bit much in summer months.   My rating is based on the items I liked, I didn't go 5 star based on the price points of some items and the lack of soft drink options. This wouldn't deter me from returning in the future.

VP1el1xASp305nvcZ-Z0gg.text: Great atmosphere.So relaxed. Burger was super delicious. Fries could have used a bit more crispiness. The ginger beer is made in house and is sweet, sharp, and very gingery, one of the best I've ever had!!

8lfoMIH2NTJMjhNz6hNcIA.text: I'm one of those Yelpers who passively reads reviews but rarely writes one. I only write reviews when A meal is inexcusably terrible, or when a meal ..... Hold on I have to eat these beignets before I finish my review.... Ok I'm back...... Or when a meal is so delicious that it makes me moan with ecstasy . As you may have guessed, this is a  review inspired by the latter.  I'm usually a silent eater , but I was literally moaning and groaning the entire meal.   Generous portions, very friendly (and cute) staff, and ummmmmm. ..... Secret menu desert selections. I won't even attempt to try to put the meal into words because the description wouldn't do it justice. So just check out the pics below. I was almost hesitant to write this review bc I didn't want more people to come to this place, but these guys deserve all the credit ! Good job Welcome Diner! I am a believer !   Pictured: the big Jim, PB burger, poutine (the one Canadian export I enjoy), and super secret beignets with peanut butter, honey, and raspberry pear preserve.

gWSz_RzDK0DKMF_WXVVB6g.text: Omg! Please try their JACKFRUIT FRIES They Are the best I have never had! Vegan on top of it :) So So So Good! I promise you wont be disappointed;) they have the best patio and drink too their homemade ginger beer is so refreshing and unique give both of this thing a try!Will be back for sure!

hjijFmxBzpoC9KUEC85XAA.text: When I got the directions to this place I was certain I had been led astray because I was going into a residential part of the city. Low and behold the diner was there, random in the middle of this Phoenix neighborhood. There are a few seats inside but the real experience is to sit out front. Do not expect to sit down at a normal booth and keep to yourself. The seating is basically lawn furniture and a few picnic tables giving the whole experience a backyard barbeque feel. As far as atmosphere "hipster" would be the greatest understatement of the year. I could have ridden a bicycle made of mustaches wearing the first black rimmed glasses ever made and I would not have been hip enough among the patrons. The menu is small but efficient and the food we received tasted great. I recommend the fried chicken sandwich with bacon and a hurricane to drink.

q5rqIJdwZewYR8sKPz3djg.text: This place is a hidden gem! Love the atmosphere and the staff is always so friendly. It's a small place, but we always seem to find somewhere to sit. The fried green tomato sandwich has to be the best thing on the menu!

mPcolwd9SjHvueu50Wg6xQ.text: They're back as of today, and they're awesome. I was turned on to the Welcome Diner by a classmate at a software training I was attending, I said I was a food nerd and he told me that these guys were reopening today! Solid yelp reviews sold me, and they did NOT disappoint. They opened at 5:00, but I got off of class at about 4:15, so I went down there and hung around for a bit. After unsuccessfully attempting to help out with their square credit card thing (they can take cards, but it'll show up as the food truck because the restaurant account isn't setting up properly), I placed my order. I was the first customer, yay! Amazingly, the only other opening day jitter I saw was the ricecooker being ornery and tripping the circuit breaker repeatedly. In terms of "disasters" that's a pretty minimal one. I chose to wait for the rice to finish and get my meal all together, as I needed to burn time to avoid getting out of central Phoenix back to Tucson at rush hour. I had the port of call burger and a side of red beans and rice (the ricecooker worked in the end). Best burger I've had, I think ever. All the ingredients were high quality, very nice cheddar cheese, mushrooms cooked with port, and garlic aioli. And the bun. Oh damn, the bun. Feathery is the best adjective. No unevenness in texture, light, and just barely strong enough to contain the burger... well maybe not entirely contain. The red beans and rice were good - I'm not well versed in the craft of that dish, but it was tasty. Both the other customers that ordered inside got the fried chicken biscuit sandwich with apple butter made by one of the staff. They seemed very happy with their choices.  They've got beer, wine, and hurricanes. Right now they're open Thursday-Saturday 5:00-10:00pm for dinner, and Saturday and Sunday from 10:00-3:00pm for brunch. I snuck a peek at the brunch menu, and there looked to be some tasty stuff there too. They're going to work on expanding dinner service out over more of the week gradually.  What are you doing? Yeah.  You. Why are you still reading this? Go get a burger or something from here. Blah blah blah it's Tuesday at 9am and they're not open, sure, whatever, maybe that excuse will fly with your family, but not here mister/missy.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu as it currently stands at relaunch

mHQNJRYjDcMLQvyqBqM8yA.text: love that its open so late. the food is really good and the hipster vibe is hilarious...

HfrZh9ZUebzdyH9VBHV9MA.text: I may have to come back a few more times to see why everyone is going bananas for the place. Our food was awesome but the service was reallllly slow. The young lady taking the orders was extremely polite and friendly but it felt like it took forever to first get up to the window and then to receive our food. I ordered the Big Jim which was a biscuit sandwich that was huge with a friend chicken inside covered in gravy, cheese and bacon. I threw on some Louisiana hot sauce and went at it. I had to eat it with a fork and nice because it was such a good hot mess I couldn't pick it up without ruining the layers. My girl ordered the Little Birdy which was a fried chicken piece topped with cheese and sandwiched in between a biscuit, both came with a couple pieces of watermelon and both were satisfying.  The fact that they close pretty late is awesome and its probably one of the main reasons why I would come back here.

vft6xeddvWYIORcS2lk4Sw.text: Loved. Super duper friendly service. The bumble bee was delicious and filling. Chicken was juicy and flavorful. They made me a margarita even though not on the menu. The boyfriend was very pleased they played the pixies. Casual, neighborhood vibe.

RnJy-XBRrqteDVhrNWfYdw.text: For those that haven't heard, Payton Curry has taken over Welcome Diner April through May on Sun, Mon, Tues, and First Fridays. Get there... now. Payton is known for pushing limits and incorporating fresh, local ingredients. The menu will likely change every week, if not every night, so I'm not sure if my recap will help all that much, but here goes.  The neighborhood is sketchy, the place is tiny, and the accommodations are "rustic", so if you're all into the Scottsdale scene or flashing your dough, don't bother. That being said, Shantal mentioned that being there made her feel like she was camping every night, and I have to admit the evening had a vacation feel to it... National Lampoon's style!  You can instantly tell that Payton is having a blast and it shows on his face and in the food. We were seated on a collection of old dining chairs at a makeshift table of 2x8s and construction horses in the middle of the front yard, with a candle to light our way... I knew it was going to be a sweet evening!  We started with the burrata that was lightly seasoned with truffle oil and cracked pepper. Unfortunately a lot of people are adding burrata to their menus and they have no idea that this fresh, creamy, delicate version is how it's truly meant to be. It was served with slices of toast that I expected to be the brick-hard version to which I've become accustomed. Imagine my surprise as I bit into a spongy, buttery slice of bread with just a crunch of the crust! Delicious.  The porcini foie gras terrine will scare those faint of heart, but it's amazing and the pear butter adds this velvety, sweet flavor that just makes it unforgettable. I wasn't a fan of the pate', but it was a combination of pickle, horseradish, and mustard flavors with chunks in the loaf... all things I can personally only handle in moderation individually and generally dislike, so it was exactly as described. The mains arrived and the Sonoma lamb sugo proved to be an interesting choice. It's not something you would eat on a regular basis, but I'm so glad I got to try it. The shreds of lamb meat were piled on top of a bowl of hearty fettuccine with perfectly cooked chickpeas and dollops of cream that muted any gaminess of the meat. Then you would get a bite of golden raisin to kick in a touch of sweetness; pretty cool combination of flavors and textures without being over the top.  Perhaps the biggest surprise of the night was the bowl of Bolognese that was planted in front of us, it blew me away and I have no idea why!! Payton, what's your secret with something so simple? Dessert followed with apple pie that could've been much tastier if it were warmed with a scoop of ice cream, but all was rescued with a huge chunk of bread pudding that puts my mother's recipe to shame (and it was served warmed with a scoop of ice cream :).   All in all, we had a wonderful night with fabulous food and fun friends and we didn't want the night to end. If you want a hint of adventure, get to Welcome Diner before the end of May... seriously... National Lampoon's style.  ps: It's BYOB!

Mw6iHoDhVitbWqtC2Qnv9w.text: Great spot. I would def recommend this spot for comfort food. The fried chicken sandwich is not to be missed & the fries are amazing! Just ask for extra crispy. Can't wait to go back & try a burger they looked amazing!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese fries with bacon

_71kqMwx-Vck3NljGLsHqg.text: Overcharged drinks. Specifically asked if a whiskey and soda would be the same price as a gin and tonic... ended up 4 dollars more. 8 dollar whiskey and soda the whiskey and sour ended up being 18 dollars. Total should have been  14 bucks. After asking the mgr what had happened, he explained that since it was house made ginger soda, it's a 4 dollar extra charge. Ended up just settling the tab and then my girlfriend ordered me a drink. Half a hour later and everyone at the table has their drink... Except me. Asked the manager again what was going on and it ended up in a verbal altercation with him. The summary of the argument was that I asked for my drink, then the whiskey and soda was brought up by him again. Eventually just let him know that I will be posting a review on google due to his behavior. Quote unquote response from the manager "Google? Never heard of it.". Keep in mind this is with a whole line of guests behind me and they're listening pretty intently by this point.  Waited a couple more mins, my girlfriend at this point just goes to get the money back. Guests behind definitely took note as their first question "was the service that bad?" Yes. Yes, it was.   Childish at best. Will not frequent this location again. What sucks is that I've been going here since they were running out of the food truck years and years ago.

Vnt5jSwLuooEu1sJ91Tfcw.text: It was a really cool environment and unique from the vast majority of the Phoenix area. We enjoyed their commitment to fresh and quality ingredients. Everything we ordered was delicious and reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly and prompt.   HIghly recommend to come after dark in the summer because it is so blazing hot (mostly outdoor seating). We will definitely be returning for more pulled pork fries!

t_vQ6VeHbUMlv2jSc9exNA.text: YOU.MUST.EAT.HERE! Everything is to delish but the burgers are to die for. The blue cheese burger is by far my fave but on our last visit we found it had been removed from the menu because they rotate the burgers out. Hesitantly, I tried the peanut butter burger....and oh.my.god! The oddest concoction, but delicious! Ps....please bring back ol' blue!!

mn3TFWOrywI_Ih1lW5JO9w.text: This is a long overdue update. I don't think it gets much better than the Welcome diner. This place is legit delicious, I would struggle to find a meal I have had here that was sub par.... And I've been here many times (more than my check ins reflect). I try to bring people here as often as possible, family, friends... Because it is just that good. My favorite time to come is brunch..... One of the guys who works behind the counter gave me official credit for ordering the sunrise sandwich with egg over medium add tomato confit.... Add the confit... You will not be sorry. This thing is better than the lux egg sandwich (and if you know me, you know that's a big deal). The egg is always cooked perfectly, the biscuits are always buttery, flaky, and wonderful. The sandwich is the right mix of decadent and fresh.... Oh and if the husband gets the biscuits and gravy.... Put a little gravy on that sandwich and it's heavenly. Plus, they give you real cream for your coffee... Did you hear me? Heavy fricken cream!!! So good. Make sure you follow these guys on facebook for their beautiful daily specials that you wouldn't find in any other diner in the world (fresh made chicken and dumplings with butter poached chanterelle mushrooms for example). Have the pb and bacon burger... So yummy. Drinks? Forget about it, they are fantastic and happy hour has great specials. Sit inside the diner for great conversation and a bit of a show during your meal. Don't hesitate in trying this place out.

_RX8dzc3BzPwphOOy0SP1A.text: I heard a lot of great things about this place and was super excited to check it out. I ordered the Bumblebee (fried chicken, biscuit, honey, mustard) and my husband ordered the  PB&B burger (burger with peanut butter and bacon).  My dish came with a few pieces of sweet watermelon and his came with a side of slaw. We first experienced a peanut butter burger at rehab where they also add grape jelly and sriracha and my husband has been on a PB burger roll ever since. He thought his burger was very tasty and ate his whole plate. I liked my biscuit dish but I think I was expecting something a little more....substantial? The chicken was really great and moist but it felt like there was something missing. I think I was expecting it to be slathered in honey/sauces but it was certainly worth the price ($8.50). I'd definitely come again but I think I'll try another dish next time.

WNreICV6vjusFm-fFQp4zg.text: Here's the deal. I want to totally love this, but frankly, Phoenix is still missing the traditional diner, even when it's housed in an authentic diner. I was hoping this would be the epic college hang-out, but it's too expensive for that. An 8 buck burger is three dollars away from a night out for a collegiate. 5 bucks for a 12 oz plastic cup pour, even a good draft, is still not in that ballpark. Actually, it's close to ballpark pricing. Knock off at least a buck.  And 4 dollars for a very small portion of collard greens will not bring me back to eat it.  I ordered the most expensive meal because I wanted the food experience. Their PB and B burger is exceptional, peanut butter with burger sounds weird, but it's damn tasty and good Schrieber's bacon(also used at Bill Johnsons Big Apple for less dinero). It's the highest price burger at $12.50. I also had the previously mentioned collard greens and a 7 buck Hurricane, tasty and well-mixed, almost at price point correctly with such good ingredients.  Three items and with tip, over $28.00.  This falls into the realm of special event for me, and that's a shame as the folks running the kitchen, taking orders, owners are ALL great and the service was really casual yet efficient.  I would love to see something like a whiskey and soda for $4.00, discounted pitchers of beer, maybe even a discount for bringing in your own coffee cup or dishes as there really is a lot of plastic waste coming out of there.  Sure, I'll be back, and for what it is(an amazing restoration of a wonderful place with a killer patio)I'm glad it's here. I'll have whatever is on special now, and skip the sides, though the fries with gravy could be killer with cheese curds a la  poutine.   Yet still I wait for the college hang-out.

QQT2rBSnjCfJnJSHMAljxw.text: Ummm BOMB! I had the Big jim? Hopefully thats what it's called it was a biscuit, with fried chicken, and gravy with syrup. The chicken was so awesome so tender! The wait staff was awesome as well!!!! Thanks for a great time!!

X77aqBH10sdBctV7f7mlOg.text: This is my absolute favorite place downtown..maybe in all of Phoenix. I have eaten their pork fries, big jim, pb&b, and the poutine and I've got to say that everything is beyond incredible. Their Hurricanes are the best drinks! Staff is always friendly and the food is so worth the price. Love it!

8DfPbSJWXpnd2em5YysH9A.text: Wow.  So I've been hearing about this place for a while.  I always looked for it when I passed it on my way down Roosevelt but always seemed to miss it.  I practically smacked myself in the forehead when we arrived today.  I felt stupid, but then again, there are some places I just can't see until I plan to stop there.  It took some convincing to get my husband to give a place other than his favourite Joe's Diner a chance for a delicious (post hangover) brunch/breakfast a chance.  We got there a little early due to it being their last brunch weekend before summer and I am paranoid of crowds and hipsters.  We arrived and found ourselves seats under an umbrella in the shade.  We got some water from the cooler and perused the menu and specials.  After some deliberating (sunrise sandwich or holy puerco?) and discussion (welcome breakfast has no meat -- I need my protein at breakfast), he went with the special boudin breakfast and I got the holy puerco.  We both had fresh squeezed ojs and beignets.  It was worth it.  Dear goodness I have not tasted pork jowl cruncy bits like those ever (and their meat is provided by meat shop and shreiners!).  The combination of flavors on the puerco thing was just delicious.  And the hashbrowns were fresh and not too crispy and not overpowering and flavorful.  I kind of wanted some sour cream to go with the flavors and make them like a crunchy baked potato.  The beignets are not as fluffy as the ones I remember in New Orleans but definitely will satisfy this girls desire for fried dough.  They are yummy and powdered and you must be careful or the sugar will make you cough.  The honey is also oh so good.  The husband very much enjoyed his boudin special and it was gone very quickly.  He said it was all very tasty and he was glad we braved the heat for the opportunity to try the breakfast before it is gone.  We also got a hurricane to share at the very end.  It tastes like juice, or sunshine in a cup.  But it does pack a punch.  I felt that drink (the few sips I had) by the time we got back home.  And then I crashed in a delicious food coma.

K5O1R9BuCisUDLlyLbAk8Q.text: The food was better than acceptable and it was hilarious to see the expression on the window clerk's face when I ordered a Coke and no booze.  She was quite friendly though and the server also was for the most part.  The crowd seemed laid back and content to mind there own beeswax.  I'll definitely hit this joint up again at a later date.

6NIEq65Ke0RBFLF0B2qImg.text: This place is fantastic!  Stumbled upon it on Yelp.    Very small, intimate indoor seating and plenty of outdoor seating.    The juice was fresh, the coffee fair trade, the Big Jim, a mountain of fried chicken and gravy.    Plus all the dudes that worked there were super friendly.

LmOmqvZjXk-6PwWhHYNULg.text: It's kinda southern comfort food with a hipster twist.  I'm a fan.  I hear they have an awesome "after-hours" scene on weekends.  When I'm in that kinda mood I will try it.

9fbxMXgG9rZqgEDV1aeC_w.text: I went on a late night Thursday and ordered the poutine fries. This has been on my list of places to try for some time. The food was great, huge plate and a good price point. I didn't have a drink. I had to use the restroom and it was teeeeny tiny and kind of dirty, not a fan of that. Other than that it's a good place to chat with friends, we sat outside and it was really cold but the heaters were not on.

2tgywg_A7K-fimIULxqxWg.text: Surprisingly not bad, had distinct flavors and portion was sufficient(big Jim and roasted spouts).   Only complaint is it should be accompanied with a more hearty side then three small watermelon squares !

eTbODoa2ptBBiy9_EJCKxg.text: Had the No Way Jose medium rare and it was unbelievably delicious- Gouda, beef, arugula, muenster, and some 'charred jalapeno relish'. Could've easily devoured a second one, it was that good.    Liked the chill atmosphere and the staff were all super friendly.  When I next pass through Phoenix you better believe I'm hitting this place up again!

9mkeVn_OS11xSaN3kHABWg.text: Yummy! I got the fried chicken macaron & no way Jose burger. To drink I got the Hurricane. Everything so good!!!

bebKG-Dh4x9yDl8ve_fEIg.text: The Fried Mother F***ing Chicken. Damn. DAMN! Nice crisp crust with a juicy a** center. Damn. And that's where it starts.   Shut up because I'm going to talk about the biscuits. One: bread is amazing, but this bread. Damn. It has a soft crunch when you bite then a moist center.   So you have the juicy a** chicken and this bomb a** bread put that together and you know what you get... F***ING-OMG-SHUT UP I just had the best fried chicken sandwich in Phoenix. This is there speciality, so just order one. There are different variations of this sandwich. Doesn't matter which one you get they're all amazing!!!   The Must Eats:  Fries. Bomb. Burgers. Bomb.   If you get there for Happy Hour get the pork fries... PORK FRIES!!! I don't need to explain how good these fries are. Just shut up then unshut up and order them.

FaWRWrwdJ6J2SIGsdpt4wg.text: The welcome diner is such a cool dive! I love that it's one of the few places serving awesome food at night. The outdoor seating and lighting is perfect to come hang out with a bunch of friends. One time I accidentally tipped them $100, which was TOTALLY embarrassing, because my card company texted me asking if it was a fraudulent transaction. They were cool and we laughed about it, but if I was wealthier I would definitely have tipped them $100 because it's a great place. :) Their mac n' cheese is bomb. Check this fine establishment out.

_rbV83dQItFsaUwLWLygdA.text: I have never had better chicken. I have rarely had such a good donut. The people are really cool, and the food is far beyond awesome.

xRTWoTps3bU-u3oL_-HZ1g.text: The Big Jim is right! I was recommended by the staff and the locals. Specially made biscuit, smothered cheddar cheese, lots of crunchy bacon and a big slab of fried chicken with lots of gravy!!! To top it off with refreshing watermelon to cleanse your palate!

We had the Koko, Fried Green Tomato sandwich with bacon and the pountine fries!  Yum, Yum and Yum!  Not to mention the awesome crafted cocktails!  We will be back!

ovS0py9ePQL0AxhKa5IWaA.text: I'm not a hipster but I still fell in love with ambience of this place. They have a bigger outside dining area than the inside. My go to is pulled pork fries and chicken and biscuit. They have a sweet HH deal too!

vEvDxg_BOgCIiYGvS5cxVg.text: This place is wonderful. Very unique diner with a variety of different salads. The ingredients are always fresh, and the quality is apparent from the first bite.

kcroC-5ktXLAwGvBlWqxFA.text: The fried green tomato sandwich is amazing! I had one last night for dinner, and it's the first thing I thought about when I woke up this morning. And the whiskey sour was delicious, too. Super friendly and helpful staff, to boot. I look forward to returning.
