moHGHj-PAotUGG8aAxNGAQ.text: I met my friend here for dinner and hadn't really head of this place even though I don't work too far away from the Garfield location. To be honest I'm not too keen on eating outdoors, especially when it's so hot outside. They do have limited seating inside but they were all occupied.  It took me a while to decide what I wanted to try and I ended up selecting the jambalaya. This version did not have shrimp, which is something I can eat my weight in, but it was still excellent. The portion was larger than it appeared and I didn't even come close to finishing it.  When I got there, there was maybe one other customer outside. After the sun set, this place was very busy. In fact, I've never seen a crowd like this. This place must be extremely popular.  I'd like to go back, but I think I'll wait until the summer heat subsides a bit.

XyRTpuo9gkrXOPP_wlYW-A.text: My fish po'boy ain't so bad. My husband's PB&B was worthy of a recounting of the crunchy peanut butter anytime someone says something related to burgers. The poutine was tasty. But the one item that made us say "We must come back." was the mac and cheese. Not greasy, not disgustingly cheesy (he loves cheese. He likes to quote a commercial routinely: Great love needs more cheese.), and perfectly done.   I enjoyed sitting outside in this fairly quiet neighborhood at 8 on a Saturday evening. The employees were friendly and engaged in our playful banter. One very kindly spent way too long trying to light a heating lamp for us until we all agreed it must be broken. Warning: their bathroom is a tiny little square with a folding door directly next to the kitchen. Hold your pee until the next location, ladies who are wearing tights under your dresses/skirts.

tB4gExrirtyyxPyxc7cWsg.text: All you need to know about coming here: GET THE BEIGNET This is such a great casual place to go for dinner! The atmosphere is nice because it feels super casual, yet at the same time can be romantic (just depends on who you go with I suppose). All the workers are so kind here and the comfort-style-food they sell is so seriously bomb! Parking can be a pain, and yes you'll probably have to wait a good half hour to an hour to eat, but it will all be worth it because you have to wait to get a good seat anyway.

w-FS06rP90nGr5SCcJ4oNA.text: Magnificent food , love the Plant based options ! Great service and an even better atmosphere , lots of history in this kitchen and it continues to produce amazing exsperiences and amazing food !

-sV0V-pWCEQKO3XIVgvlHw.text: I had a burger and collard greens for a side. it was $17.   It was ok, but I expected better. Outdoor seating was nice. Too bougee imo

Dj7A2xxwEhoK_2CvrAFsOA.text: The welcome dinner was the first places my friend brought me. That was a few years ago and I went again recently. Still an amazing place.  It's a small kitchen, and very popular, so expect a bit of a wait. The seating is relaxed and inviting. The din of the eating area is perfect, as it is outside. Great place to come and lay back for awhile or before going into first Friday that is just down the street.   I suggest the ginger beer, it's house brewed and delicious! Any drink with it was not a let down (I had a few) I also had the honey biscuit sandwich and tried the free tomato also. Everything I've tried here is tasty.

b4BJ_cRw01PkBf8-mWFMuA.text: Food was great. Nice chill location, unpretentious with food and alcohol, I'm there! It was around midnight that we decided to go and plus we've always wanted to try this place. I heard it gets really busy on the weekends so thurs was the perfect time to try it out. It's strange how the diner sits in the middle of a quiet neighborhood but whatever, I'm here for the food. We got the poutine fries, fried chicken biscuit sandwich, a side salad, and beignets to top it off. Everything was so delicious even down to the salad.  I would definitely come here again. The beignets are a little more dense than the ones in New Orleans and I've never had it with honey before but nonetheless it was still pretty yummy.

3zLo1Ff7PGOYuKm2O9hXfw.text: Welcome Diner Crew Great! The food was also very tasty and will be a go back to place in the near future.

bGvmJ1JfuxBk6v3c_s2lNA.text: It's always a great experience at the Welcome Diner. The food the drinks the atmosphere the whole damn thang... Thank you guys!

_qv_DEeKPBp8f_-vcnh8zg.text: Went to this place on a whim after a show and was not disappointed! Started with the mac n' cheese and added bacon. Then chowed down on the big Jim biscuit. Everything was delicious and satisfying. Staff was very friendly. Will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The big Jim biscuit

IBEm50romYmU4HEoQ27KMA.text: Hipster AF!!!! Which I normally like... but our waitress was both high and drunk.. which I don't mind ... but when you're getting our order wrong three times to be exact  ... and my mom can smell the liquor and weed on you not cool! This nice waiter kinda noticed and he put her to the side and took care of us he sorta kinda saved the night.  We had the fries that we didn't order thanks waitress we paid for them anyway... we had the chicken biscuit sandwich with watermelon lol!!! It was ehhh edible lacked seasoning ..perhaps leave the frying of chicken to people who actually know what they are doing....we also had the Mac n cheese! Try that, the portion was huge and it was so yummy. Honestly forget everything else on the menu try the Mac and cheese the combination of flavors was just wow! Anyway They ran out of sourdough so couldn't have the grilled cheese... and I didn't want to have it on any other kind of bread... the pork sandwich could have had better seasoning it was bland just bland... I'm a New Yorker and a huge foodie so coming here I was expecting spectacular food especially due to the great reviews on yelp.... but yeah maybe they had an off night... I will admit the place is well decorated looks like a fancy cafeteria. The drinks are cool... prices are not bad..I'll try it again next time I am in the area.   Don't bring your parents

HlC7iD9LCqWoE9ZJsTPrVQ.text: Great food  Great drinks  Great vibe Great place! Recommend the biscuits & gravy  Also the grilled cheese sandwich  The Hurricane cocktail is also well worth it!

T9Cfx-qnKfGeJ_pQYio74g.text: In a sea of almost everything that is developing & brand new in Phoenix, this diner gives you a feel of being in ones backyard shindig.   It's simple comfort food & though I used to love eating here when I was non V, their jackfruit sandwich as a vegan option is still the shit.   Late night eats 8.5/10.  Keep em coming with more plant based options please!

0VZaXNwbZiT9IxUAufRpiA.text: Well.... to begin the lasagna was very displeasing to me and my special guests. I really didn't understand the hype for this down right disrespectful menu options. My buddy ordered the gumbo and had irresistible ecstasy episodes. I am out of words. Next time ill be picking del taco over this jaggy joint

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tWKpukCuaQgrPM4ikE1fog.text: If you like quality food, but have a taste for the classics, this is a place to try. Even better after the reopening! Also great cocktails!

2KGm14ZVKbwdD7jz0rudLQ.text: This place is amazing!! The food and the look of this diner are both on point. I love the booths, the Disco ball inside, and the entire aesthetic of this place. They did such a great job decorating. More importantly, the food here never disappoints!! Their fried green tomato sandwich is literally the best vegetarian friendly dish I've ever had at a restaurant in Arizona! All of the flavors go together so well and are still so unique!

MZP31kYMA1e5lTGgdNh6Dg.text: Welcome Diner is a favorite of ours for late night eats in the downtown area, so of course we had to stop by to check out the new location. What an upgrade from their old one, they still have a patio for outdoor seating but a more spacious interior as well as 2 bathrooms. The inside is a cute diner them, obvi, and we ended up sitting at the bar. It was a lot of fun to watch them cook the food and see what all the food looked like. We ended up ordering the koko biscuit sandwich, bumblebee biscuit sandwich, a side of fries and an order of poutine. The koko and bumblebee were very good, I'm not usually a fan of fried chicken but this check was cooked perfectly and so flavorful. The biscuits themselves were nice, but I would prefer they be a little more buttery, melt in your mouth. They were on the drier side. The fries were perfectly seasoned and crispy. The poutine was also good, but a little on the saltier side for me. My friends also ordered some drinks, the old fashion was SO STRONG, sure to put some hair on your chest. Apparently they make their own ginger beer in house so we had to try their mule and the ginger beer gave it an intense kick, a little too much for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Koko biscuit sandwich
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old fashion
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of fries

FgkczkX0Ll4TJwcoeEya6A.text: Chicken and biscuit were phenomenal. i plan on eating here more that's for sure. Thank you for the great experience.

VvFvY-EzdQsS1DshLmFYAw.text: Open late until 2pm if you're hankering for some southern diner food. Grits, biscuits, jambalaya, etc.  There's plenty of seating outside with some quirky decor.   Mac & cheese, grilled cheese, and the chicken biscuit are my recommendations. The poutine was average.

mwJqER5nKIVgjvdfGxjIcA.text: We had burgers, fries, and a salad and everything was perfect and delicious. This is a thick burger with fresh toppings. Really yummy fresh salad with an amazing cheese on top -feta? Better than any feta I've ever had. But the real show-stopper for us was the fries. Very likely the best french fries we've ever had. They're not fancy, not dressed up, just perfection. The service was also fantastic. This is an order at the window mostly outdoor diner, but there was a guy who kept coming out and checking with each table, so it felt like sit-down service. We loved the friendly, casual vibe. Made for a very relaxing evening. I'll go out of my way to go back again. *My only wish is that they'd serve milk shakes. :)  Update 3/18- We've been back a few times and every time has been fantastic. This last time we tried the mac & cheese and now understand what everyone raves about! Yum! My husband says it's the best he's ever had, but that's the way with everything here.. best burgers, best fries, best service. I have no debate on this anymore, this is the best burger in the valley. Crazy good. And when's the last time you went to a order at the counter place where they introduced themselves, the cook, and assured you they'd be taking care of anything you need? And they do! Really wish I lived closer!

mXcp_Rh5hdBThhntr8DeZQ.text: Man, to be brutally honest, I was a bit disappointed!  I had heard about this place for about 1.5 years now.  My buddy at work told me about it, as well as a couple of my Yelp friends have reviewed it.  It sounded like a cool concept, it was open late, and some of the food items sounded fantastic.  Me and my buddy had some time to kill before picking up a friend at the airport, so we decided to stop by for some late night grub.  I browsed the menu for a bit and decided to go with an order of poutine, and a Bumblebee sandwich.  Total for those 2 things was a little over 20 bucks!  STEEP!  Anyways, here is how they were.............  Poutine-  These were some fries topped with sausage gravy and cheddar cheese.  A bit different than a "traditional poutine", but close enough?  The fries themselves seemed a bit overcooked, like they were left in the fryer an extra 20 seconds or so.  They were a bit brown, but not really "crispy".  The sausage gravy tasted ok, and the melted cheddar was kind of "meh".  It wasn't a horrible plate of fries, but no way in hell does it justify the $9.00 price tag.   There were actually fries left on the plate (That rarely happens!) when we were done!  I would not get them again.  Bumblebee-  This was a biscuit sandwich which came with chicken, mustard, honey and pickles.  The chicken was fried proper and tasted alright, but the portion was skimp and the texture of the chicken was just a bit "off".  The biscuit itself was incredibly large, but a bit dry.  I had a similar experience up in Portland at Pine State Biscuits.  Rave reviews, but when it came to the biscuit, the biscuit was sub par.  What's up with that?  It's your signature item, but unless you drown it with gravy/sauce/mustard/something else, the biscuit just isn't that great!   The pickles may have been the best part of the sandwich.  Lame, right?  I ate the whole thing, but was not truly satisfied.  For $10.00, I wouldn't buy it again.  Overall, not that impressed!  Service was friendly, and the joint is a cool little spot, but the food is just ok and the price is really expensive (IMO).  Once was enough and I highly doubt that I will be back.  There are just so many other places I would rather drop $20.00 at for a meal.  Exactly what 2 stars is..."Meh...I've experienced better!"

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bumblebee Biscuit Sandwich-  Eh.  Decent, but not worth the $10.00.
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine.  Eh..just ok.

oqzZePW4v5SGPwnDCFaUDw.text: I love the vibe and location of this place!  Nestled within a neighborhood in downtown Phoenix, outside patio dining (there's never any room in the small trailer, whenever I've eaten here), and a great view of the stars are just some of the great aspects of this particular diner.  It's definitely a departure from the typical dingy diner, that has mostly artificial lighting; and is surrounded by hipster patrons.  No, wait! Hold on a sec!   Except of the latter comment; it truly is a breath of fresh air - literally!  The food isn't spectacular, but that isn't the allure of this place. It's just an awesome place to hangout, and enjoy a decent meal. This particular time, we had the Welcome Burger and Fries; as well as, Grilled Cheese and Watermelon with a side of Jackfruit fries.  Definitely a unique meal with an allure all its own. Particular notables were the juicy hamburger, crispy bacon, yummy jackfruit fries, and the sweet watermelon!  The weather outside was just perfect, and everyone working here were so friendly and chill.  The place is definitely "on fleek!"   There, that's my first and final homage to the urban hipsters that were seated next to us that basically used nothing but words found in the hipster vernacular dictionary.  Nonetheless, I love this place!

rydDmm-bidVyWnVWLIOkIw.text: If I'm right I'm going to be the 1000 review for welcome diner so congrats to me. welcome diner is a location which has switched locations recently but a location that I love quite a lot. I don't know if it's the amazing drinks that they serve there which will run you upwards of $10 per drink but I have to admit it's worth it they're tasty cocktails tasty mixed drinks that I have come to like so much that even if I'm just ordering one with their fried chicken sandwiches I have to order a drink because oh my God it's good. Now the food a slight addiction I kind of feel like if I live downtown I'll go there all the time once again you know it'll run you upwards of $10 per menu item but they're little bird every I don't know just everything fries they come with it when it comes to ordering food. friendly time they had a nice little atmosphere to it of course the diner lolcow but always so clean that's one of the things I love most about it indoor outdoor no matter what you're seating more sitting outside obviously but the location is just always clean it's open up pretty late so if you're a late night snack or past midnight they are open don't be don't get there too late because they might run out of what you need on menu. That's a good thing so they keep food pretty fresh and for each menu item I don't know what it is but it's a great amount of food. Breakfast is there is also good there till like to just throw out you'll probably eat your sandwiches with a knife and fork depending on what you're getting unless you are liking a little messy but at the same time another thing that I strange Life is I like the people that go there there are this mixture of a tattooed hipster / a mixture of other people coming from clubs and bars but obviously local folk who support the welcome diner and I was great to see everyone's friendly and they're probably friendly because they're being filled with amazing food so credit to them there. Also I like that they have kind of like it's open kitchen thing which is always a bonus love seeing that people are wearing gloves and hairnets and so far and following regulations unlike certain pretty much franchised Mexican food locations where they do not wear gloves half the time if you would pay attention but anyway back to it welcome diner 1000 review on Yelp so I think I deserve for that

4W5GBj2VUIoi3i3PRVG3RA.text: This was my boyfriend and i's go to spot after I picked him up from the airport. But now that they moved locations and changed up their menu, they took a lot of our faves off of it! I loved their beignets, luxardo (I think that was the name) salad, and a few more I can't remember the names of. Still a good place, but it would be better with the old menu!

HNOcQrM0qy1Gt6XatcRxJw.text: Awesome little diner.  After a long day traveling a group of us wandered from our hotel to this non descript diner in a neighborhood.  It was an awesome surprise. Food was good and service was just as well. Dessert was the highlight.

bTq0rS5mmrJHYmPR9u5FQQ.text: I had the chance to get into Welcome Diners new spot on opening night-- Wow! I could not believe how inviting and "Welcome" the new place is! The patio is still comfortable and inviting with that order at the window vibe! I cannot wait to bring my dog to the new place!! Inside they kept the same vibe at the trailer just bigger! The open kitchen concept is fun to sit at the bar and be a part of the action! The low booths are super comfortable and allow you to take it all in-- not to mention a Disco Ball!!! What?!?! So fun!!  On to the best part of 2.0-- THE FOOD!! YUM!! There are still my favorites from 1.0 (the amazing No Way Jose Burger and the Bumblebee!!) BUT NOW There are some new dishes that are too good to pass up: The Pickled Shrimp Toast is a must try!! Light and airy foam on toasted Noble bread-- ummm yes please!!! Seafood etouffee-- the rice was perfectly cooked and had the right amount of acid to balance the whole dish!! Chorizo Meatloaf: if my Nana made meatloaf--this would be it but better! The sauce on this dish is the right balance of flavors to leave an empty plate!! (I would have licked my plate, but people were watching!!) The desserts are just as tasty as before!!  The last mentionable is the cocktail menu!! The classics are still there - Hurricane!! (cheers from across the room) and then there are some new amazing drinks to help you settle into the comfy booths!!  Kudos to the whole Welcome Crew on the new spot!! I am craving another Welcome Diner fix!!!

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Chocolate Pie
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nothing left of the Chorizo Meatloaf

0VVx7uUKDvHsy_uupTzaLw.text: The food was really good and the prices were decent. The service was very odd and hard to explain. I have been here 2 times and both servers have been not really straight out rude but extremely sarcastic and had a slight attitude. They almost acted as if they were forced to be working there. I was afraid to be a smart a** back because I did not know what they would do to my food. But just their attitudes alone will keep me away from this place because there are many better places around.

WClNubgRl2UcMG_xaUp-zQ.text: First off Jose and Danny (making all the maxing food and having great communication) and Jesse was our server at the bar top and he was so quick and knowledgeable. This place is bomb af and the happy hour was amazing. We got the vodka tonic 929 and the old fashioned and already made plans to bring our friends next week !!!  Def make this one of your casual stops !!!

piWGL9fcvE5LQgnmYC857g.text: We arrived around 1900. We didnt want tp wait so we sat outside...light rain but we didnt get wet due to umbrellas over the tables and we didnt get too cold due to giant heaters. There is a wheelchair access.  Servers were overall nice. The food was great!

K45FCBTuwMMlL3HGf6Gftw.text: Great food, great drinks, even better staff.   Also a pretty great parking lot out back, that's usually miraculously empty.  The neighbors would really appreciate it if y'all utilized that beautiful slab of concrete.   Order the peanut butter burger. It's as strangely awesome and just as lesser known as the idea of that sweet ass parking lot.

GGjLZr4diRkj0s2YDVSqJw.text: Welcome diner is one of my favorite spots. I love the creative menu for both food and cocktails. I love the place even more after they have moved, there is much more space both inside and outside. They usually have some pretty good vegetarian options (special jackfruit taquitos). I love this place, it's a great place to go with friends and enjoy time together.

IgPvU4mjpd9P5A8ZoWXRhw.text: Have you ever thought to yourself, "if only there were a few more hipsters in this restaurant, my meal would be complete?" Well, then this is the place for you!   A hipster will seat you, another will wait on you, a third will cook your food. There will be so many ironic t-shirts and tattoos you will feel like you have been invited to the cool kid's table in art school. Groovy!  This place is awesome. It's super small, so if you want to sit inside at a table, you need to time it right. I think the bar is the best place to sit. You get to watch the geniuses in the kitchen crafting beautiful delicious food in a culinary rhythm that pumps out consistent perfection. You can also grab a table on the patio which provides views of the goings on in this artsy neighborhood that is undergoing a socioeconomic transformation. Smarties like to call it gentrification. Hipsters hate that term. They also hate the term hipster, but I digress.  They serve classic diner titles in a way that will blow you away. Meatloaf that doesn't need ketchup. Like at all! Fried chicken and biscuits that are pure mouth joy. And then there's the fried green tomato sandwich. It is one of the most glorious things I have ever consumed whilst sitting on a barstool. And that's saying something! (I am no stranger to the bar stool.)  Their mixologist (AKA hipster bartender) is an angel sent to earth by the Jesus that loves gin. If you want to stick with beer, their list is perfect for those that like great local brews. Can I get an amen for Mother Road's Tower Station IPA?  If you are on some kind of fad diet or any diet at all, this is the place you will want to cheat. It's worth it. I promise. They open at 5:00 PM so don't show up for lunch. Get there right at 5:00 on a weekday, and you can sit at the bar. Get there at 7:00 or 8:00, you'll be ordering at the outside window and hipster watching on a picnic table. If you're lucky.

ZM1mUl9H27rv7p2er8fa_g.text: A great place for tasty fried chicken sandwiched between two scrummy biscuits.  We started with the poutine app followed by our two sandwiches, the Koko and Bumblebee.  Each were met with high praise for both taste and portion size.  If I'm ever near the location again around meal time, I wouldn't hesitate visiting once more to try more menu items.

KQx4uy9_4Y120pXHLel27Q.text: The food is not bad, but the service is definitely bad! They are not rude but definitely not "welcoming" as their name says, I was expecting a level above fast food but it's as though you are going into a KFC in Phoenix, will not be recommending to my customers

WEo7SEP36mqkh7bw-5V5Sg.text: It pains me to say this but since the move to this new location, the food tastes different. I got the no way jose burger tonight and the burger lacked flavor. Only flavor I got from it was the heavy butter taste. It looked great, was on a nice bun, well put together like how I view myself. But it tasted empty. I'm disappointed because I've had food from here before (at the OG location) and it was amazing, the koko, big jim, pb burger, welcome burger and they were all great. I hope tonight was just an off night.

LGth7hlj902ffoPC21QyWw.text: Great late night Mac n cheese and hamburger. Staff was friendly, especially being 12:30 am.

BVXnw-Cfpl0au_Bg4rSMcA.text: Food is nowhere near the ratings it's been given. Just like the name, it's diner quality. Nothing bad but nothing special. My biggest complaint is the incredibly weird staff. A bunch of hippies that give extremely awkward and weird service. I've never felt more uncomfortable.

H6P9JToJ_3yWiQx6KiGcwA.text: I had fun visiting welcome diner! Open super late and some amazing unique options. I think it's cool how they have mostly outdoor seating, makes this place unique. There were a few vegetarian options which looked amazing but I went for the jackfruit sandwich, my boyfriend and I also shared Mac n cheese. My boyfriend got a biscuit with fried chicken and he thought it was awesome!  My sandwich was incredible, a crunchy baguette with perfectly spiced jackfruit! I had grabbed ketchup just in case but didn't even need it. My boyfriend didn't like the charred top of the mac n cheese but I thought it was good. He did like the underneath part of it. We also tried the home-brewed ginger beer and it was tasty! The ginger was extremely strong but very good. Took a while to get our food but this was a fun place to just hang out so it was not a problem. We both can't wait to come back!

zCxmnb3yZpyWLLBADjGRnQ.text: I was really excited to eat here because of all of the great reviews but I thought the food was just ok. We got the fried chicken and pork and grits. The service was excellent but I wouldn't go back.

9xDjKLp1lr6Zmh_xGJZd4A.text: Bienvenidos! Always wanting to try new places, my brother and I came here for dinner one evening for their happy hour. It was too humid outside so we snagged two seats at the bar inside. It's a small trailer-like spot with a bathroom reminiscent of one in an airplane. It was cooler inside but a bit cramped of course, and I didn't appreciate being around alcohol and the smell but it was worth it being indoors.  We ordered the jackfruit fries from their HH menu to start and I got the Bumblebee biscuit. My brother got the Koko biscuit, which he enjoyed. I thought the fries were great, shoestring topped with purple slaw and jackfruit, such an interesting and tasty food. I loved my biscuit, the fried chicken was done right and the sweet and savory flavors of honey and mustard worked really well. Topped with pickles for a nice crunch and change of texture.   There are several vegan options as noted by the V on the menu. Definitely a great spot for dinner and open late.

0_WgKHYIapjIlMeuDZxEhw.text: This diner is beautifully located in a neighborhood. We thought our Lyft driver had pulled into the wrong street but there it was, brightly lit and so very welcoming. We sat at the bar and got to watch the cooks make our food in front of us. They were a great team and sparked small conversation. I got the Mac n Cheese with andouille which was delightful.  A great find for an out of towner!

WEXGoyhipaDT1sV3Z9srnA.text: Food was okay. Very small portions and limited selection. Wasn't really much else open so it was good for the occasion. Also was expensive for what we got.

-DPAfVWVbxNUc4sRpschuw.text: Everything was great from when you walk into the door . The service was amazing and the food and drinks were great ! I will definitely comeback and taste other items on the menu

2EK7RrUsFfQX7EGPEHI4RQ.text: Food is ok..Great for late nite snacks..Very expensive .better bring alot of bread..Drinks are just ok..Not worth taking a date on..

JoiSoxyD-harS3tDwuK2XQ.text: This is my 4th visit, 1st time eating there.  Went on Sept 25th around 630pm.  It was alittle warm and surprised there was no misters on.  My wife came with.  We ordered 2 mix drinks, shared the Champion Burger and fries(very good) and shared the macaroni and cheese with tomato confiti.  It came out to 36$ plus 5$ tip.  My wife loved the macaroni, I thought it was alittle bland, maybe it was the confiti.  So far on my visits, I've had the hamburgers and chicken biscuit with gravy, all very good.  We both love the ambiance, the outdoor seating and the friendlyness of the staff and customers.  It's only 5 blocks from our house so it's very close.

I4xO3M2pQ8u8OWvGYd1lgw.text: Awesome atmosphere! This place has such a weird/ funky vibe with its red and white diner, mismatched patio furniture, and staff running around yelling out customer names. Each time I have come the food has been great but the wait is usually long. As expected, I stood in line for a while last night to place my order. Occasionally, the person taking orders will slide the window closed and the line will have to wait. While this seems a bit annoying, it gives the cooks time to catch up and the staff time to get hot food delivered to tables.  Upon his return, the guy at the window was upbeat, kind, and open to offer suggestions. The food took a bit under 10 minutes to come out but was VERY good and obviously fresh. We had a salad and the Koko chicken sandwich with a side of brussel sprouts. I would definitely recommend this place as long as you have time to hang out!

J2byJZZ3SpjgmBHDhaDtGw.text: What's better than a night of drinking than jackfruit fries and peanut butter on your burger? But for real, late night or even just a casual evening, welcome diner delivers amazing burgers and fried chicken sandwiches with a chill and cozy outdoor patio or a small diner feel inside. A favorite spot for sure

78j7P0wYIreOcw-5y63Lhg.text: So happy we drove far to come here. We wanted someplace new and unique and this place has it all. It's unique, adorable and the food is amazing! The location is what makes this unique. It's a hidden gem. The fries were so good, a heart attack on a plate that's so worth it. I got the sunrise and it was fantastic the flavors went so well together. My husband got the bumble bee and the flavors went well together. The honey was delicious with the fried chicken. Overall I would recommend this place for the atmosphere and the food. Well earned 5 stars.

lmVWoBbj5xGfT7FDjLLuUg.text: I was in Phoenix last week looking for a cool place to eat and decided to try Welcome Diner based on the other reviews.  I was not disappointed!  It was an amazing experience!  It is in the middle of a residential area but they have a lot of property and plenty of seating for guests outdoors.  We were fortunate to be able to sit inside.  They have 9 bar seats inside the "trailer".    The menu offers lots of delicious options - Waldorf Salad, Poutine, Fried Chicken on a biscuit, Fried Green tomato sandwich, fish, burgers, etc. and during happy hour, they offer reduced prices on some menu items!  Everything is made-to-order and if you are inside, you can see your meal being made.  They also have unique drink options and they are very tasty!!    The staff are really upbeat and friendly.  We got to chat with one of the guys who worked there.  He seemed really nice and genuinely cared about each guest's experience.  It is a really cool place.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pTbFqyzgkbBJb5a8I9okJw.text: I love the Welcome Diner. It's my favorite spot for late night eats in Phoenix (opens till 2am). It's such a cool concept and they serve up some pretty good-sized portions of food. Welcome Diner operates out of a Valentine Diner (a mobile pop-up restaurant from the 40's) and is located in the historic Garfield neighborhood (they have a second location in Tucson). They have both outdoor and limited indoor seating and serve up Southern-inspired American dishes made from scratch. You'll find huge buttermilk biscuit sandwiches, burgers, po' boy sandwiches, fried chicken and jambalaya on their menu along with a variety of delicious cocktails to choose from. In fact, Connor Mansager of the Welcome Diner was recently declared the 2017 Arizona Star Bartender at the Devour Phoenix Bartending Competition a couple weeks ago. I pulled a late nighter here with some buddies and we tore up a Big Jim (fried chicken, gravy, bacon and an egg on a biscuit), No Way Jose (a burger with jalapeno relish, smoked Gouda and chipotle ranch) and the Carol (braised pork and BBQ sauce on a biscuit). Another favorite of mine is the Peanut Butter burger. Our food definitely hit the spot after a fun night of boozing. Btw... share a side of fries with someone as they are pretty generous with their portions. I love the throwback ambiance of this place to old school diners of the past. My only knock is we had some smokers next to us as we ate our food on the patio. But overall a great experience as always and the staff is usually pretty friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chipotle Mac and Cheese
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jarritos

ObjVPNF7cs9BfXkZg12E9w.text: LOVE THIS PLACE MAN.   Such a unique menu and drink selection.   The vibes are strong. I got the PB and B Burger and it was heavenly. I also tried my buddy's biscuit with chicken and gravy and that was divine.   This is a great place to hang with friends and eat delicious food.   BB's Rating: Rooseveltastic!

qhOfm8SGJlcD-qLxB_80JQ.text: I love their new space! Excellent design and their restroom was pretty cool too! It's a mix of vintage and modern which I loved. We got the Mac + Cheese, Smoked tomatoes and OKRA! YES OKRA! That was my favorite. Of course their drinks were so good and the service was excellent. Congratulations once again on the opening and we look forward to coming in again!

DtZTY8B6UG5Mqfu9yKDAuA.text: These guys definitely colored outside the line on this place. You order at a walk up window and find somewhere to sit. Seating is open and you'll like be sharing you table with strangers. Which is cool. You get to meet new folks and swap foodie stories if you're lucky.  The food here is terrific. I had the grilled cheese sandwich. This was really good. It wasn't an over the top massive gob of gooey cheese. This sandwich was a savory treat on rustic sourdough bread. Very well prepared. My wife had the Koko. A biscuit sandwich with fried chicken breast & arugula topped with a creamy sauce with a little snap. We got a side of Bignets and a side of roasted Brussels sprouts. Both worth the price of admission.  If you like a good Bloody Mary, you have to try the WD version.  This place rocks. Once again, my fellow yelpers were spot on.

Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The WD Bloody Mary. Tomato creole instead of tomato juice. Excellent!

xaLWGZ6k6gol58wCT8ImWA.text: What a great local spot! Off the beaten path amongst single family homes you would most likely not find if you didn't search it out. It's a mostly outdoor venue so in the Arizona summers, beware. There is a small seating area inside, about 7 seats.  My favorite food option is the bumblebee!! Fried chicken with honey smack dab in the middle of two yummy biscuits. Yum!!  I haven't tried a drink here yet but hear they are delicious! That's next on the list.

3juE0B0NBoQ2qENTShqPbw.text: Ordered a po boy sandwich and a pie and they forgot the blue berry sauce that goes on it. If you're going to blow the order at least try or want to fix the problem not say my bad. After coming back twice on the phone and not being able to resolve the issue you've lost a customer especially if I'm going to spend 20.00 plus and even tip on a to go order. Next time attempt to replace and coach your staff.

nyy_qnwDpmjhCw8yaQDC4Q.text: Going over the reviews I'm beginning to think that I'm either crazy or just show up on off nights. The food is alright but the service is so bad that if you told me it was a gimmick I would not be surprised. Rude self righteous hipsters who treat people like idiots. I would bet money that they are the slowest restaurant in Phoenix. The slow service and the bad attitudes are the only things consistent about welcome dinner. They are constantly running out of menu items. Again I feel that this is a hipster gimmick but who knows.   If you like to sit outside and enjoy being treated like "you don't get it" while you wait 45 minutes for your food then hop on your fixy and head on down to Welcome Diner. Where food and service come second to how cool they are.

su0V9e-l3whtedRYQDYvVQ.text: I forgot to review this little diamond in the rough when I was there in August, but I LOVED it! Super fun atmosphere inside and out, deLUSCIOUS comfort food, and great drinks made by happy staff make this a sweet stop! I'm originally from Alabama. Let me tell you; I had the Fried Chicken Mac n Cheese, and it is Deep South approved!

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken Mac &amp; Cheese! Talk about &#34;winner winner chicken dinner!&#34;

g6brF1J0oG5Marc_xXlmiw.text: This place is the best!! A favorite neighborhood go to with a good happy hour! Their biscuits are made in house and the chicken is always fried perfectly! We got the little birdy (chicken, cheese, biscuit) simple and delicious! They use country gravy on their poutine which is different but still tasty. We also got the champion burger. The meat was cooked perfect and bacon jam is one of the toppings. Where has this been all my life?! On happy hour whiskey sours are only 4$ and its one of the best around.  They are also open late and have happy hour all day on Tuesdays. It's a hidden gem that everyone should know about!

6UGbA9FS4YAPKMIEB3mQPw.text: I saw this place a few times passing by, but never thought to stop by until I saw it on Check, Please Arizona. I went out with family to give it a taste. We shared a No Way Jose burger, beignets with local honey and powdered sugar, and a biscuit with preserves and goat cheese.  Let me tell you first of all: if you come here complaining about the wait, just remember that good food AIN'T fast food. Be patient and your patience will be rewarded! Every morsel of that food was delicious. The biscuit reminded me of breakfast at Grandma's house. That burger was juicy and full of flavor; even the bread was good. The beignets were warm,  crispy, chewy, and paired well with the local honey; finger-lickin good.  That was a good little taste, but I definitely wanna come back and try some more.  Get the ginger beer, you won't be sorry!

O_g_36s6g7K1lAu7NcX36A.text: Thank you again fellow Yelpers! I tried this place based on your reviews and I am happy that I did! Tonight I had the PB&B burger. Crunchy peanut butter, B&B pickles, bacon and cheddar. I selected fries over coleslaw. I also upgraded for $3 to Poutine fries. Add on tasty beignets dusted in local honey and powdered sugar for desert. What are Poutine fries you ask? They are the staple food in the Toronto area. French fries smothered in country gravy and melted cheese. A little to crazy for your taste buds? No worries. They have normal food too. Welcomediner.net

WvMyWFq7AH0a0lJYoWSjOw.text: I am from out of town, but one place the locals recommended consistently was Welcome Diner so I figured I'd give it a try.  The ambiance and decor are very warm and inviting- lots of outdoor seating and strung lights. Tables were clean and kept, but we ended up sitting inside at the bar for the air conditioning. Staff is incredibly friendly! We went earlier in the night and it was a bit slow- so we were able to talk to the staff and ask for favorites and specials. The cook named Ryne was very helpful and had a great knowledge of the menu! I am a vegetarian and there were quite a few unique options for me. I ended up getting the fried tomato sandwich with a side of jackfruit fries. Both were excellently prepared and the service was great.  Thank you Ryne and the rest of Welcome diner for a great meal! I will be coming back every time I am in Phoenix!

XedmtnwH0U8bVOYAhaXg9w.text: Nice find. About a mile's walk from the downtown convention center, if you are looking for something different from the usual assortment of restaurants that cater to that crowd. This place seems to cater more to the university population nearby - it's situated right next to a residential neighborhood that seemed an unlikely spot for a restaurant but there it was. The cuisine is loosely organized around southern "comfort food", like jambalaya, fried chicken, and po' boys, but (as my waiter explained it) with a southwestern angle to it. There are vegetarian offerings, including jackfruit as a meat substitute (which I tried and liked a lot). I didn't order a drink, and came away for $20 including a 20% tip. I need to go back and try some more of their offerings, on a night when I'm in the market for a meat dish. It checks all the boxes for me, and so receives full marks.

kfedsF9O9fgIEEGdKPdjbQ.text: Nice place. Possibly fun. Terrible service and lack of food. Sunday morning at 10:52 AM they were OUT of BISCUITS, which is pretty much the staple of their menu. Line up and wait to order, while just standing there.  And wait. And wait. Several times the place was not taking orders because "we are backed up". Here's a hint. Take the order immediately and I can go sit down and wait. It beasts standing and waiting.

aSBi6nMQUKNn2eL255PCuA.text: Welcome Diner was a welcome distraction in an otherwise very busy day. We had heard it was one of the best places to eat in Phoenix, and I can see why. Delicious, home style, southern food.   I ordered the bumblebee chicken biscuit sandwich. It was a little sweet for my taste, but that's understandable as honey is the star ingredient, but after some hot sauce all the flavors balanced out nicely.    My wife ordered the fried green tomato sandwich and she loved it. We also ordered poutine fries--I loved the gravy--and beignets for dessert.   Now I'm a little picky about my beignets, as I moved from Houston and visited NOLA often,  and these don't match up to Cafe Du Monde or other NOLA spots, but they were still finger licking good. Literally, the woman next to me was scraping the last of the honey out of her beignet bowl with her fingers and licking it off. And I could sympathize. I didn't want my meal to end after my last bite either.   The restaurant is very small. A handful of indoor seats and a small outdoor, community picnic style eating area. It took about fourty minutes for us to get our meal after we ordered, and that was with only 2 people in front of us at the order window. This felt like ages, but I forgot about all that when I took the first bite of my biscuit. We will be back. If you haven't been here yet, just go, so worth it!  Edit 2/26/16 Take out is definitely the way to do it!! Placed our order on the phone and was able to pick it up about 20 minutes later on a Friday night!!  The Champion Burger- Mmm, This is a tasty burger (Samuel L. Jackson Pulp Fiction voice).  If you're in the mood for a hamburger just order this!  You can't go wrong with The Champion Burger, it's a winner!!  The Mac & Cheese was yummy, adding Tomato Confit and Jalapeno Relish made it extravagant!

_upxDVDP93DCuG2Z23Va3A.text: The Blue sky burger is delicious (Even without the bun as I requested) The guys there are super cute, sweet and courteous. I'm visiting from Cali and I most definitely will try to come back before leaving.

2LeDZeiqPGRX7Z4xTxHJAg.text: Well, it finally got rented out again - to a troupe of really enthusiastic chefs and they're growing their hours. Worthy successors to the chefs who came before them, another tribe of locavores. Unbelievable that they seem to have a full beer/wine/liquor license.   GO NOW before everyone figures it out! However, be warned it is no longer "cheap, under $10" - but not by much - excluding our wine our shared meal clocked in at $15 each.  We each had a glass of Arizona wine labeled, merely, "red". Went wonderfully with our shared Roosevelt Growhouse salad [the beets, my gawd], cheeseburger [the mushrooms ...] and fries. Good decision, to share - we couldn't

Love the chicken/gravy/biscuit sandwich.  Just be ready to be very very full and very satisfied after you're done eating.  Get the Kentucky Thoroughbred drink...so delish and I have the Welcome Diner to thank for turning me onto Four Roses Bourbon again!

VEpvEuRGfcFi1EJ0obPOWQ.text: This is my favorite place to eat when I'm in AZ. I travel all over the west and this place makes me smile every time. Great local food and the Beers are always legit. A must visit !  Cheers.

1NGmefWuyhu3-jM5jQqB1Q.text: Out freaking standing.  Great food.  Good service...VERY TIGHT INSIDE...but eh, I like the diner feel.  I had the welcome burger and he cooked it perfectly.  The poutine was delicious.  Very very good find for us.  Burger, Pabst, poutine and beignets.  Wow.

RabbBDz7a8BTrIqm70idLQ.text: I live for their jackfruit fries. A little pricy but worth it, especially if you can make happy hour.

nQ5bChOwCzEy8NN6R9UBKQ.text: Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The Food was Great, my fiance had a welcome burger and the just custom made me a breakfast burger. The chef came in and made a burger he had just created and gave us a taste. Would totally drive down from LA again for another bite

aIQ3g30SgLVQZ5fRlSIr-w.text: Found this AMAZING little Gem while looking for some street art in the Phoenix Art District. A MUST try and MUST visit for good home cooking, we had the Big Jim. Went on Saturday the vibe was super chill , they had a DJ playing a dope mix and all the people super nice. Would come back here for sure my next visit back to PHX

QbSL2Zi6YBDnUiW6CKk8hA.text: This is a place I check out most First Fridays. I like that it's open late, so after walking around and working up an appetite, it's great to find a place with great food. Seating is outdoors. The food itself is awesome. I usually get a chicken biscuit. The biscuit is great and so was the chicken. They have gravy fries (putain), but I would get those only if you have someone to split them with.

nsUIx6IAwkr_A6r2EYZbcg.text: There are some good things about this place and definitely some bad things. The poutine fries where really good. The fried chicken biscuit was good but only after I pulled the chicken out of it. The chicken itself was really tough and disgusting, luckily it slid out of the breading really easily. It would be nice if they used some sort of number system instead of screaming names every time they come outside with food or drinks, that would also eliminate the borderline awkwardness of the guy at the counter who asks for names. Last but not least of things I didn't like about this place which I know they cannot help is the other customers!!! One guy had an aggressive dog that almost bit some kid, there was another group of young 20 somethings that took out table even though we had full waters and napkins on it and there where 7 other open spots, then the other group on the other side of the family style table that was making some borderline offensive comments..... so needless to say after being around rude undesirable hipsters of all ages I probably won't be coming back. The staff was pretty friendly though and I really do love like 75% of their concept.

FguTdSQdiaKIH_LkLp113Q.text: This is my favorite eatery! End of the review.  Ok starting with the food: The salads are awesome, although a bit pricey but the owners explained that they grow most everything themselves or source it from small organic farms. They are worth every penny.  The sandwiches are some of the best I ever had. Jambalaya is amazing. The list goes on and on.  I've been here a couple dozen times and never had a bad experience. Yes this place gets busy at times but for a reason.  The happy hour drinks are a great deal too. Only the best ingredients for a more than fair price. Same for the food.  It's always a homey and welcoming and there are some great and very passionate and authentic people working here which truly reflects in the food.  If you haven't done so please come here and check it out. By now they have legendary status in the area already anyways.  Thanks for all the good moments I had there.

--dnRd0TXRc_PPih0tFR8Q.text: I saved my 400th Yelp review for this Phoenix gem. This is one of the first places I drag out-of-towners... usually for brunch. And when I have brunch at Welcome Diner, I usually cannot resist ordering the same thing, the Holy Puerco. Pulled pork, cheesy grit cake, pure heaven.  The best thing about this place, especially if you get one of the rare seats inside the luncheonette, is that it feels like you own the place. The staff cooking and carrying on are an arm's length away. I love the communal "Hurricane!" cheer that resounds whenever somebody orders one of these fresh-squeezed fruit cocktails. Welcome Diner is one of those places that the ambiance overwhelms you so suddenly that you are drawn in to the fun atmosphere... and though you may not be a morning drinker, you can easily be convinced that it's time for a beer or cocktail with breakfast.  I can't say enough about the wonderful poutine here. Other places may just smother their fries in brown gravy, but this place used the white breakfast sausage gravy. Although the cheese curds get a little lost, this is a great way to eat poutine! I also like their choice of either sausage gravy or mushroom gravy if you order the biscuits and gravy (or, do half-and-half, if you must).  The crowd that dines here is cool, the staff is righteous, and the food is spot on. If you want something funky and delicious and scratch-made, you would do well to pound a path to this wiggity-wack little diner in the middle of a dusty old Phoenix neighborhood. Off the beaten path, as it were...

mv-f7IDGVciPljJmwsx8fg.text: The wait it a little much, but the location, food and the weather when we went made for a perfect evening. Everything about this location is bomb. The diner area is a little small but the outside seating is fine as long as the weather permits.  Everything I've ever ordered off their menu has been excellent. Chicken sandwich is my favorite.  The staff all seem to really enjoy being there and take their time to make the experience special. The kitchen area seems cramped but the guys working the grill had a practiced hand and the food came out quicker than I would expect (although slower than most places with a full kitchen staff)  If you are looking to a unique date spot or a nice evening hangout with friends this is the spot.

3o1uwq2WXt-lDSofMo6Phw.text: Go here if you're consistently somewhat neurotic about your dining experiences but want to give the impression to everyone that you're trendy and adventurous.  They have a burger with peanut butter on it that's pretty good.

eMBYaI5kIBdCpAxMilr74g.text: I looked up a list of the best burgers in Phoenix  before our trip to Arizona and the peanut butter and bacon number at Welcome Diner caught my eye. We managed to make it there after a concert, around 1am on Halloween. They were busy, but we managed to get a seat inside.   The diner is in an actual diner car, so it's tiny with a large, cute patio area. The cooks were churning out orders quickly. My boyfriend ordered a delicious White Russian stout and the blue sky burger, and I got my peanut butter burger with fries. The fries were great, the burgers were flavorful, unique and perfectly cooked. The bartender was great, and we very much enjoyed the experience. Cute, quirky little place. I'd definitely come back when I'm back in town.

u3_z9Vw7x6c9JGrAukQlcQ.text: Staff were super friendly, the decor was kitsch & cute but the rest of the experience was underwhelming. I don't understand the hype.  Drinks were standard but the food was bland. Deeply offended that their idea of poutine includes melted cheddar over fries - nope... Just nope. Curds or bust. The watermelon in my salad was unripe and left much to be desired. Burger fell apart and was an absolute mess.  Gave this place a second shot and it fell short again. Disappointing.

zVmG3aBUAjQrk4wWzFSaJQ.text: They have limited non alcoholic beverages. So if you want a Diet Coke, best bring your own.  The food took awhile. If it wasn't so dang good, I would have been mad. Lol. We ordered the bumble bee with the mustard on the side. Omg!!! It was actually delicious!! The chicken was crispy the biscuit was soaked in honey. It was awesome. The Brussels sprouts were crispy and yummy. The poutine was good (nothing out of this world but good). The big Jim was delicious and savory but not as delicious as the bumblebee. The beignets were thicker than what I'm accustomed to but so so good. I'd get everything I ordered again. It was all superb.   As soon as I burn off these calories, I'm coming back! It just might take me a couple of weeks

Le9QoVno-8hLZ3Jp30quqQ.text: What a perfect rescue for the social late night meal. My wife and I sat at the bar tonight and were greeted by Chadwick, a friendly bartender who offered us beer tastings and walked us through the menu in great detail. You could tell he really knew and loved the food they had to offer. The cocktail list was creative and had me wishing I had ordered one too! The poutine was the best I've ever had and we had this open-faced sandwich that I'm still dreaming about. Very friendly place, great vibes, and great atmosphere. We'll be back soon!

H4mxtc54tNdYtwSVmFK3eg.text: Writing this while we're still at Welcome Diner, because it is THAT good. We're traveling through Phoenix and found this place just a few miles from our Airbnb. After a long day of traveling, this place was everything. We loved the community feel, the twinkly lights, and the locally sourced ingredients. We split two burgers--the Welcome burger and the Blue Sky burger. Both were delicious and came with a side (we tried the cole slaw and the side salad). They have a cool retro bar and solid beer list, but we opted for the homemade fruit punch (which was so good). I wish we were in Phoenix longer so we could come back again!

uXocbGo8P0hEGTR0I_0Avg.text: YUMMMMMMMMMOOOOOO! I've been wanting to go for a while.  I wasn't disappointed at all with my Big Jim ~ fried chicken, sausage gravy, cheddar & bacon! foNmlgTc0VvPyelXhhIZiA.text: Getting to Welcome Diner during rush hour traffic (5:30pm) was a bit of a hassle but was worth it. Upon arrival, situated randomly in a quiet little neighborhood on the edge of downtown, there was the most legit old school diner. With plenty of seating all out front and outdoors (avoid during the summer) the atmosphere was very hip and trendy.  The food was not that of the typical diner but had a nice menu with salads, vegetarian items (fried green tomato sandwich), burgers, and their signature fried chicken and biscuit sandwiches (the bumblebee was delicious). The price was pretty high but can't complain about anything else. Can't wait to come back!

EccAFJYv4pXXdjFoNJr61A.text: Great food at OK prices, with a laid-back al fresco slash in-your-own-backyard set up. Even during the peak of summer, the outdoor misters make it a comfy spot to grub and hang.   Only reason why I'm not giving it another star is because the two very separate occasions that I phoned in a pick-up order, this girl would take my order - and I don't know if it's just how her voice sounds (???) - but she just makes you feel like you shouldn't be asking questions. Mega rude, that one.

JQem5P8Yto0ljbXv64JXng.text: Outdoor fun!!!! This little place knows comfort food BIGTIME!!!! Its a laid back atmosphere so if your looking for something fancy this maybe not for you but if you can humble yourself into appreciating good comfort food and a backyard setting then this is the place for you! Also, a great spot to stroll into in the morning after a huge night out on the town their Bloody Marys will make you feel just right again!!!

RzTh6hsIhk_Pgsupcv9-Pw.text: Wow .... wow... We moved to the Garfield Neighborhood about a month ago and have been putting off going here, first because I was never sure when it was open and next because it looked incredibly small and over crowded every time I drove by. Turns out they're open fairly normal hours and the patio is pretty big..... my fault.   My wife and I both ordered burgers I just got the normal welcome burger (I think that's the name) and my wife got a peanut butter topped burger. The food got to us fast and my burger was the best I'm had in months! my only real complaint is that I didn't order the same burger as my wife because her burger was way better than mine! oh and also if you get fries you get about 10 ... A really tasty 10 but not enough or maybe it was an illusion and they just need smaller plates.   I'll be going back soon for burgers and probably to try a few other menu items as well!

VQqWLfzZ30xsOziujVH2jQ.text: We LOVE Welcome Diner! The dishes never disappoint, whether you opt for a biscuit sandwich, a burger, or a daily special. Definitely check the seasonal hours just to ensure you're going for the right meal. While we love the burgers, we prefer winter hours with breakfast and the killer coffee!!!

N4QJ6lGJIuVKW8f6o1jHPQ.text: I'm kind of a big deal around here...lol The fried green tomato on a biscuit with an egg....what....that's right...go there....orgasmic flavor explosions....everybody here is like family...great concept great people and amazing food. Just reminds me of a queens New York diner with way better food. Chef Michael Babcock is nothing short of genius. Ask for the "David" and your life will be changed...open til 2...get your fix. See you there. Big up to Wayne, matt, peter, rob, kyle, and the rest of my FAM...

FPuetznZDbtxV62xYyO95A.text: Strongly recommend the cheese sandwich.  Love the heavy cream with smooth Blue House coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional breakfast.  But nothing is traditional at Welcome Diner.

Wu3ocvUKQEVBuNH2h1Qcfg.text: After years of being vacant, it's nice to see the Welcome Diner property revived. I'm impressed by the caliber of the menu that Michael has put together. And I love how there is Southern and Cajun style food. But even I couldn't have imagined something like the Holy Puerco--cheddar grit cake with cracklins and pulled pork. I also like the kale sandwich with the fried avocado. If you're getting the avocado, split it with a friend. Five pieces of that is a lot, in my opinion.  The biscuits are really unique. You can taste a difference from theirs and what you may get at another restaurant. The biscuit sandwich with the fried chicken and honey will hit just the right spot. I also like the biscuit with goat cheese and jam. And we can't forget about the peanut butter + bacon burger with fries. You may get some clogged arteries from sampling everything but it may just be worth it. I urge people to try this place. I'm sure it's only a matter of time before Guy Fieri parachutes in.   I ended up writing about this place for an article on restaurants worth highlighting in Phoenix. Besides the food, I think this has a terrific location to build on being the "Cheers" of the Garfield neighborhood. The patio is really inviting and you can watch residents coming and going since it's in a residential area. It is quite hipster-dominated but that's just what a lot of Garfield and the Roosevelt Row area are. Hopefully there will be people to welcome this place for a long time to come.

ak22kJb8AQhB0y3_3Glxuw.text: A True hidden gem , in the middle of a neighborhood in downtown Phoenix . My boyfriend and I have been here now let's say 7xs and I'm shame to say I'm finally writing a quick review. There food is delicious and fresh. Check out my pictures I definitely recommend this outdoor diner to everyone you won't regret it. My favorite is the koko; crispy moist fried chicken in between delicious biscuits with a spicy cream sauce and fresh tomato and arugula with a side of sweet watermelon !

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside the welcome diner , order at the window
Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green tomato sandwich and a side (entree) of pulled pork fries, far back is my fav drink blueberry jack !

VVPs779YyOl3u2XdRMapsg.text: This is my new favorite joint.  It is becoming quite the neighborhood favorite and I think it's because they just do it right. The setting is so...welcoming. With the lawn chairs and variety of mostly outdoor seating this is the perfect spot for a beautiful day or night. The staff is a bunch of characters who are very genuine and helpful. The food has clever names like "Holy Puerco and Captain Fantasy") oh and it is freaking amazing. Even the menu's artwork looks awesome (done by a local artist/cartoonist.)  I've been here three weekends in a row. The first time I had the Captain Fantasy which was endlessly delicious. Barbecued chicken on a fresh homemade biscuit with bacon, cheese and greens. I also had fries, wow a lot of food! The other two times I've had the Sunrise Sandwich with sausage and an egg over easy. It is also placed between a tasty biscuit along with some arugula. Yum! My boyfriend has had the welcome breakfast with chorizo and the Little Birdy. I had bites! I also tried their fried avocado, genius.  They serve drinks. Apparently on Tuesdays they have Hurricane Tuesdays, $5 for their famous hurricanes. I've also heard their Bloody Mary's are brilliant.  Well done Welcome Diner well done. See you all next weekend!

18H65XqTA02y3KQmJ4sN8w.text: Really 4.5 stars.   I love riding my bike here and I love devouring their share fries.....I NEVER SHARE!!!!!   Awesome neighborhood place!

NK1C5akgWEHPzdJ9eiN3HA.text: This diner came well recommended by the nice folks at the Phoenix hostel just a few blocks away. Easy walking distance in this cool little neighborhood from the hostel and the fun stuff to do on 5th street.   The old diner still has the 50's vibe with classic neon, but the food is non-classical diner fare (in a great way), is healthy and satisfying, and the folks working there are legit - down to earth and friendly. Just chill folks, no pretense, great food.   It's awesome to be back in the "south" and see iced tea on the menu. I kept requesting more, and the cool tattooed chick just brought me out a pitcher, a whole bowl of lemon slices and a smile.  That's hospitality.   I had the "KOKO", a hand breaded, fried chicken breast in a homemade biscuit with some kind of homemade remoulade, baby greens, tomato and a side of vinegar-based red coleslaw. Awesome. Friends had a deep fried avocado (vegan) po-boy and the other gad the fish po-boy, both of which looked great.   Definitely coming back.  Edit:  BTW, just saw on their online menu that they have a beer terrine salad, don't know how I overlooked that last night, but I'm kicking myself. Any place that has beets on the menu gets an automatic A++.

COEvuyWCV1uNMqZiWEzvfQ.text: One of the best spots to go after a night of dancing/drinking. Food is good! I've had a few burgers and they all were awesome, even the peanut butter pickle burger lol. Wanna come back to try their drinks.

48vTA9F8kcR06M99ypZYyA.text: I've never felt so compelled to use expletives in a review, but I feel like I could cuss up a storm and still not quite convey how much I'm digging Welcome Diner.   I've been here three times, twice in the past week, and I can't wait to go again. I had the holy puerco on my first visit, the big Jim on my second, and today I had the Carol with cheese, bacon, and egg added at the suggestion of the guy taking our order. Everything has been utterly impeccable. It's comfort food at its absolute finest. I can't wait to make it through their entire menu and I have absolute confidence that I'll find many more delicious gems just waiting to be devoured.   The atmosphere and location couldn't be any better either. Sitting outside on a nice wintry Phoenix day in Garfield will no doubt yield some good people watching and you'll be thankful to just be where you are.   In closing, I want to thank these folks for doing what they're doing. If you haven't been here yet, or if you're for some silly reason on the fence about giving it a shot, stop deliberating and get your tail over there. You'll be happy you did.

XXkSZwGqA6gA5Pb5k-QeoA.text: Delicious food. Small and casually intimate atmosphere with friendly cooks.  Really loved the beet salad!

AEHq-Ad5fpiTwpfOGciHIg.text: My friend and I landed in Phoenix and came here for our first dinner. We loved everything from the outdoor seating, the food, and the drinks. My friend had the Welcome Burger and really enjoyed it. I ordered the brussel sprouts, jackfruit fries, and beignets to share. The brussel sprouts plate was large and filling and delicious. While the idea of jackfruit fries sounded appealing, I thought the taste got drowned out a bit by the barbecue sauce. We shared the beignets, and throughly enjoyed it. Overall a good meal at a super chill diner!

KPZ-Rj5twL876ycgsdzXDA.text: Who doesn't love this place?! Try the ginger beer. I wish they would bottle that stuff so I can start hoarding it.

wqExgJqOKdmyLDWkZoN8LQ.text: This place is incredibly overrated. The service is exceptionally slow, the food is bland, the biscuits are dry, the portions are small, the seating is limited, and the prices are high for what you get. I've been here on multiple occasions each time hoping the prior experience was a one off, but with no different outcome. I wanted to be a fan of this place after hearing the hype and reading the reviews but it really doesn't cut it. I'd highly recommend tempering your expectations as this place is memorable for all of the wrong reasons.

j5-Hm-EgsIYKNfISSK0eyg.text: Fantastic hole in the wall (hole in the trailer?) restaurant. Great relaxed vibe, with good old bluesy southern music as a backdrop to the even better tunes of familiar conversation. I loved how hometown it felt. This is definitely a place where strangers become friends.  Fantastic service! Our server was Brandon, who was so helpful in making sure my meal was vegan and describing every delicious detail to us. Upon leaving, every employee waved and thanked us for dining. So nice!  On to the food...fantastic. I had a veggie burger with fried avocado on the side. Life changing. My boyfriend had the classic burger and fries, and loved it. I can't wait to come back and try the vegan po'boy.  I'm really excited to be a frequent patron of the Welcome Diner. So happy we found it!

UKkaWdOyldH-cYtq0Hgzcg.text: Tried Welcome Diner for the first time tonight.  We did only try the Hurricanes but will definitely be back to try the biscuits. The place is very unique.  We sat outside and it was kind of like sitting in someone's backyard.  They have a walk up window if you chose to sit outside or you can sit inside at the small counter. It was happy hour all day since it was Tuesday.  Awesome!! Service as polite and quick. The Hurricanes were refreshing but not strong. Don't let the neighborhood or decor scared tour away. Can't wait to come back and try the food and other cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Welcome Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very cute and cozy counter.

QKQIOnO0axnkOisnBxzuGA.text: Let's just say that if this place had a basement I'd live there. the food is amazing and the service is friendly and prompt. it has a well established reputation of excellence. Thanks Yelp for this hidden gem.

ktQRgU07l86SCy0QSi2rHw.text: Delish, but overpriced for a burger joint.
